wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Snache''' (にょろ, ''Ni ~yoro'', '''Nyoro''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Snache |image = Snache.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Mongolia (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Mongolia/Saga]]
'''ItF''': [[Japan (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Japan]]
'''CotC''': [[Mars (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Mars]]
'''SoL''': [[Earthshaker|Sub-chapter 1 - Earthshaker]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Infernal Forces|Sub-chapter 38 - Infernal Forces]] |money drop = 30¢ - 119¢ }} ==Enemy== The second enemy introduced, Snache is almost as harmless as a [[Doge]]. It has slightly more health and almost twice the attack power, but considering Doge deals 8 damage, this is barely an improvement. Like Doge and [[Those Guys]], in almost all stages it appears in it is used as a meatshield for stronger enemies of all sorts. ==Strategy== Almost anything can kill a Snache. Be wary of the 120,000% Snaches in [[The Noble Tribe]], but treat them as a free source of money anywhere else. In later encounters, the use of [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] like [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross]] is recommended to clear waves of Snaches, in aid of [[:Category:Single Target Cats|Single Target Cats]] or others who may miss because of a Snache getting in the way, although this is far from necessary. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 001 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Snache |image1 = Enemy icon 001.png |enemy_endesc1 = Uses watercolours for body paint.
So… naturally weak against water.
This information has nothing to do
with the game content whatsoever. |Enemy name (JP) = にょろ (Niyoro, Nyoro) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ヘビのような形をしたヘビ。体の模様は
水彩絵の具でペイントしている。つまり
水には弱い。だが、この情報はゲームに
関係無いので注意が必要である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Snake shaped like a snake. Its bodily patterns are
painted with watercolor. In other words,
it is weak to water. However, this information has nothing to do with the game,
and caution is advised. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Ecto Snache |A [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy introduced in the [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]] event. |Ginger Snache |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy commonly seen in Legend Stages. It has much higher health, movement speed, attack power and knockbacks. |Znache |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Snache. Revives once, stats are increased greatly, and has Area Attacks. |Steel Snake |A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[Silver Week (Celebration Event)|Silver Week]] and the [[Heavenly Tower]]. |Sinner Snache |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Snache. Deals high damage and has a 50% chance to create a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack|Surge]] upon death. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} {{:Snache/Encounters}} ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Snache |Health = 100 HP |Attack Power = 15 damage
(12 DPS) |Attack Range = 110
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 37f 1.23 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 8f 0.27s
(8f 0.27s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Traitless }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Kumanchu Royale=== Snache was one of the many returning enemies in [[Kumanchu Royale]]. ===Nyanko Daibōsō=== Snache appeared as a regular enemy in [[Nyanko Daibōsō]]. ===Nyanko Defence Force=== Bomb Snaches were a common enemy in [[Nyanko Defence Force]]. If defeated, they would explode the current row of spaceships they were in. Some units had an ability unofficially known as Bomb Snache Charmer, which increased Bomb Snache's spawn rate by 60%. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:Snachebvobm.png|center|100px]] |style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;"|[[File:Skill 25.jpg|center|100px]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-right:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" |Bomb Snache
(ボムにょろ ''Bomu Nyoro'') |style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center"|Bomb Snache Charmer skill
(ボムにょろホイホイ ''Bomu Nyoro Hoihoi'') |} ==Gallery== Snache(bcp).png|Snache's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Snachespritesheet.png|Snache's spritesheet Snatch.gif|Snache's animations Main img022022.png|The [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cats]], [[Nekoluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Unknown Cat]], [[Doge]] and Snache featured on the main article in the 2022 [[April Fools' Jokes]] article Bn022022.jpg|[[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Brave Cat]], Doge, Snache and [[Those Guys]] as an advertisement in the 2022 April Fools' Jokes article ==Trivia== *Snache is shaped like its Japanese namesake, ''Nyoro'', another name for a wave dash (〜) or tilde (~). In fact, this wave dash appears depending on which version of Romaji is used to transliterate this Japanese name. *Snache and some of its variants possess fourth-wall-breaking descriptions with emphasis on their use of watercolor paint or possible weakness to water attacks. However, only [[Steel Snake (Event Enemy)|Steel Snake]] is actually weak to [[Ototo Development Team#Waterblast|water]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/003.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Those Guys''' (例のヤツ, ''Rei no Yatsu'', "'''Those Guys'''") are a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Those Guys |image = Those Guys.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Thailand (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Thailand/Kumamoto]]
'''ItF''': [[Japan (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Japan]]
'''CotC''': [[Mars (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Mars]]
'''SoL''': [[Earthshaker|Sub-chapter 1 - Earthshaker]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Rest Stop Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 45 - Rest Stop Sacrifice]] |money drop = 75¢ - 297¢ }} ==Enemy== They have high health but low attack damage, kind of like a twisted counterpart of [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]], but have a quick attack speed, resulting in higher DPS than [[Snache]] and [[Doge]]. However, they still get demoted to a minor annoyance in later stages. ==Strategy== Those Guys can be somewhat hard for newer players because they have above-average health and only one knockback. However, one set of Those Guys is easily killable with an [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]] or even multiple [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Basic Cats]]. Without sufficient [[Treasure]]s or Cat Cannon Power upgrades, Those Guys can survive one hit from the [[Cat Cannon]]. When there are multiple clumps of them, they quickly turn into a nuisance, like in [[Denmark (Empire of Cats)|Denmark/Shizuoka]]. In these cases, [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] or any other unit with [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attack]] can take care of them. Later on, though, they will turn into meatshields for harder enemies, like [[Le'boin]], [[Master A.]] or [[Camelle]]. To clear out a group of them, [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]] or other [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] can be used. In [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]], Those Guys are typically buffed to 4,000%. Having all Cannon damage [[Treasure]]s is not enough; make sure that the Cat Cannon Power is at least level 11 so that this enemy doesn't start being a problem again. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 002 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Those Guys |image1 = Enemy icon 002.png |enemy_endesc1 = A bunch of wusses who like to gang up.
Found each other on the internet.
Surprisingly,
all of them are quite rich. |Enemy name (JP) = 例のヤツ (Rei no Yatsu, Those Guys) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 一人だと心細いので、トリオで参戦。
一人目が「にゃんこ大戦争」への参加を
インターネットで募集して集まった。
三人ともけっこうお金持ち。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Because apart they are too weak, they fight in a trio.
One made a recruitment page online to fight in the war, two others answered.
All are quite rich. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Firework Guys 1 |A harmless pair of stick figures with a firework cannon. Can be found in many events. |Firework Guys 2 |The same as Firework Guys 1, but with double the range. |Trolly Blogger |An enemy commonly seen in later [[Legend Stages]]. Moves faster, with high range for a peon and the ability to push back Cat Units with his weak Area Attacks. |Mr. Angel |An [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of Trolly Blogger. Moves even faster than Trolly Blogger, gets knocked back more times and has a chance to weaken cats. |Penlight Guys |A much weaker variant of Those Guys wearing neon colored bandanas and holding glowsticks with the same color. Found in the [[Crazed Moneko Stages]] and [[Hatsune Miku Collaboration Event#Hatsune Miku|Hatsune Miku]] Stages. |The Thrillerz |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Those Guys, introduced in [[Into the Future]] Chapter 2's [[Zombie Outbreaks]]. They have higher health, damage and speed, revive once with 100% health and can burrow twice. |Cerberus Kids |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Those Guys. They have a chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] units they hit for 4 seconds, but are still [[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]] and have short range. |Miz Devil |An Aku variant of Mr. Angel. Has shorter range to allow for easier pushing, has one knockback as opposed to eight, and most of her health comes in the form of a [[Shield]]. |Archangel Exiel |A much larger variant of Mr. Angel that appears in the [[Divine Archangel Strikes]] gauntlet. It has amazing stats across the board as well as [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]], [[Special Abilities#Warp|Warp]], and [[Special Abilities#Weaken|Weaken]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} {{:Those Guys/Encounters}} ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Those Guys |Health = 200 HP |Attack Power = 20 damage
(20 DPS) |Attack Range = 110
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 30f 1 second |Movement Speed = 10 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 10f 0.33s
(20f 0.67s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Traitless }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Kumanchu Royale=== Those Guys were one of the many returning enemies in [[Kumanchu Royale]]. ===Nyanko Daibōsō=== Those Guys appeared as a regular enemy in [[Nyanko Daibōsō]]. ===Nyanko Defence Force=== In [[Nyanko Defence Force]], Those Guys made a cameo appearance as a small statue on a floating island in one the backgrounds, and [[Mr. Angel (Angel)|Mr. Angel]] could be seen on a stone carving in another. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:StoneGuys.png|center|125px]] | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;" | [[File:StoneMrAngel.png|center|125]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;border-right:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:Kyotothoseguys.png|center|200px]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | Those Guys as an enemy in Kyoutou Project |} ==Gallery== Stick guys.png|Those Guys' Enemy Guide entry in [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|Battle Cats]] Those Guys(bcp).png|Those Guys' Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] ThoseGuysspritesheet.png|Those Guys' spritesheet IdleThoseGuys.gif|Those Guys' moving animation Bn022022.jpg|[[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Brave Cat]], [[Doge]], [[Snache]] and Those Guys as an advertisement in the 2022 [[April Fools' Jokes]] article ==Trivia== *They appear in the most levels throughout the game, even more than [[Doge]]. *Those Guys placed #1 in [[Most Defeated 2019]], [[Most Appearances 2020]] and [[Top 5 Most Seen Enemies, 2021!]] ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/004.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Hippoe''' (カバちゃん ''Kaba-chan'', '''Hippo-chan''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Hippoe |image = [[File:Hippoe.jpg]] |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Japan (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Japan/Fukuoka]]
'''ItF''': [[Korea (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Korea]]
'''SoL''': [[Sleeping Lion|Sub-chapter 1 - Sleeping Lion]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Stars in the Sewers|Sub-chapter 21 - Stars in the Sewers]] |money drop = 400¢ - 1,580¢ }} ==Enemy== Hippoe is the first "boss" enemy the player will encounter. It is similar to a 500% [[Those Guys]] with area attack, having one knockback, five times the health and damage of Those Guys, but has a slower attack rate and speed. ==Strategy== Hippoe is a very strong enemy early on, being able to withstand multiple hits from Gross Cat. It will take about 10 hits from Gross Cat to just destroy Hippoe. Most of the time, you need to abuse its short range by stalling it with meatshields while your ranged attackers whittle it down, and optionally clear any peons near it. In later stages, Hippoe is essentially a money bag that dies in very few hits to your attackers, unless it is insanely buffed, as in [[The Noble Tribe]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 003 |enemy category = White |Enemy name = Hippoe |image1 = Enemy icon 003.png |enemy_endesc1 = This dangerous hippo has
confidence in its stamina and power.
(S)he? has a multi attack skill.
We don't know if it is a he or a she. |Enemy name (JP) = 力バちゃん (Kaba-chan, Hippo-chan) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 力持ちで体力にも自信があるカバ。
一度に複数体をまとめて攻撃してくる危険なやつ。
ちなみに、お姉キャラかどうかは不明。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Hippopotamus who is both strong and confident in its physical strength.
A dangerous guy who attacks multiple bodies at once.
By the way, it is unknown whether it is an older sister character. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Metal Hippoe |Hippoe's [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant, and the first Metal enemy encountered in the game. It has very low health and attack power, but its Metal trait allows it to take only 1 damage from all attacks except [[Critical Hit]]s. |Super Metal Hippoe |A much faster and stronger version of Metal Hippoe that only appears in [[Legend Stages]]. Knocks back cats on every hit. |Lione Hippoe |An enemy introduced in the [[Happy New Year? (Monthly Event)|Happy New Year?]] event (January event). |Heavenly Hippoe |Hippoe's [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant. He has a faster attack rate and far more health and attack power. |Hyppoh |[[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] version of Hippoe. She is much stronger, can knockback cats, and has longer range than Hippoe |Zomboe |[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Hippoe. It has 40x as much health and damage as Hippoe, slightly longer range, and a chance to slow down cats. Like most Zombies, it can also burrow under cats and revive once with 50% HP. |Sir Hippoe |An enemy that originates in [[Golden Week Event|The Midas Touch]], with increased health, damage, range, and movement speed. He can slow down cats, and drops a lot of money when killed. |Super Hyppoh |Supersized variant of Hyppoh. Weaker than Hyppoh when first encountered in [[Horrorpotamus]], but receives massive buffs in later stages and has more knockbacks, longer reach, and a 100% chance to slow cats. }} ==Encounters== (10f 0.33s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Traitless }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Daibōsō=== Hippoe appeared as a regular enemy in [[Nyanko Daibōsō]]. ==Gallery== Hippo.png|Hippoe's Enemy Guide entry in [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|Battle Cats]] Hippoe(bcp).png|Hippoe's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Hippoespritesheet.png|Hippoe's spritesheet IdleHippoe.gif|Hippoe's moving animation Bn032019.jpg|Hippoe as an advertisement in the 2019 [[April Fools' Jokes]] article ==Trivia== *It is the first enemy to appear as a boss and the first enemy to have [[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]. *Its Japanese name, Kaba-chan, has a double meaning: while ''kaba'' (カバ) is Japanese for "hippopotamus", Kaba-chan is also the name of a [[wikipedia:Kaba-chan|transgender actress and choreographer]]. *Although Hippoe's gender is unknown in [[The Battle Cats]], its description in the original [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|Battle Cats]] game was: "This dangerous Bi-sexual hippo has confidence in stamina and power. She has multi-attack skill." ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/005.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Pigge''' (ブタヤロウ ''Buta Yarō'', lit. "'''Jerkish Pig'''" or "'''Bastard Pig'''") is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Pigge |image = PiggeBattle.JPG |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Maldives (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Maldives/Tokushima]]
'''ItF''': [[China (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - China]]
'''CotC''': [[Saturn (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Saturn]]
'''SoL''': [[Gazpacho Highland|Sub-chapter 2 - Gazpacho Highland]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Magma Pillar|Sub Chapter 41 - Magma Pillar]] |money drop = 400¢ - 1580¢ }} ==Enemy== Pigge has similar attributes to [[Hippoe]], but with 50% more health. She is quicker in both speed and attack than previously encountered enemies. ==Strategy== This is the second "boss enemy" fought in the game, similar to Hippoe. However, this early in the game, Red enemies are nothing more but opponents with a huge disadvantage. To kill her easily, focus on [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red Cats]] like [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]] or [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Cat]]. [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] and/or [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat]] also work well against Pigge, as they can deal a lot of damage and have long range. Later in the game, Pigge is nothing more than a meatshield for stronger enemies, like in [[Boiling Spring]] or [[Fainting Porch]], or even a free source of money, so she can be taken out easily by almost any attacker. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 004 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Pigge |image1 = Enemy icon 004.png |enemy_endesc1 = Loves going to the tanning salon,
that's why her skin is red.
Born in an organic free range farm.
Did you know that pigs like to clean? |Enemy name (JP) = ブタヤロウ (Buta Yarō, Bastard Pig) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = あだ名を命名してもらったブタ（メス）
だが本人はこの名前に納得はしていない。
体の赤い色は日焼けである。
本名はエリザベス。イギリス生まれ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A pig (female) that has been given a nickname,
but she herself doesn't admit that name.
Her red body was caused by sunburn.
Real name is Elizabeth. Born in England.}} ==Variants== {{Variant |St. Pigge the 2nd |A much bigger version of Pigge which usually replaces Pigge in [[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]. Attacks faster, has high health and double the KB count. |Pigge Back |Appears to be 3 [[Doge]]s holding up a Pigge, first appearing in the [[Autumn = Sports Day! (Monthly Event)|Autumn = Sports Day!]] event. |Elizabeth the LVIth |[[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] version of St. Pigge the 2nd. She has much higher health, and 100% chance to create a level 3 wave attack. |Zigge |[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Pigge. Has higher health and damage, is a little bit faster, and can knockback units. Like most Zombies, she can burrow past cats and revive once with 50% HP. |Winged Pigge |[[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of St. Pigge the 2nd. Has much higher health and damage, [[Special Abilities|Omni Strike]] that reaches 340 range, moves faster, and weakens cats by 90% for 5 seconds. |Pigge Victorious |A variant of Pigge Back, the Pigge is now flipped upwards and she has a school jacket. text-align:center" | Pigge and [[Tin Cat (Rare Cat)|Tin Cat]] toys on a shelf |} ==Gallery== Pigge(bcp).png|Pigge's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Piggespritesheet.png|Pigge's spritesheet IdlePigge.gif|Pigge's moving animation ==Trivia== *Pigge's name in the [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|original English version]] was "Elizabitch". This is referenced by her Japanese description which states her real name is Elizabeth and that she was given a nickname that she doesn't admit. This theme is later carried on with [[St. Pigge the 2nd (Red)|St. Pigge the 2nd]]'s royal motif, [[Zigge (Zombie)|Zigge]]'s description's references to her being a past monarch, and in [[Elizabeth the LVIth (Alien)|Elizabeth the LVIth]], who not only has the royal motif of St. Pigge the 2nd, but is even named Elizabeth. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/006.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Jackie Peng''' (ジャッキー・ペン ''Jakkī Pen'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Jackie Peng |image = JackiePengBattle.JPG |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Dubai (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Dubai/Hiroshima]]
'''ItF''': [[China (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - China]]
'''CotC''': [[Eskimo Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Eskimo Nebula]]
'''SoL''': [[Bouncy Park|Sub-chapter 1 - Bouncy Park]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's All-Stars|Sub-chapter 38 - Hell's All-Stars]] |money drop = 450¢ - 1,778¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy attacks and walks quite fast. Like most other [[Empire of Cats]] enemies, he has low range but a rapid attack rate. His DPS is quite high compared to previously encountered enemies, so be wary of him early on. ==Strategy== When first encountered, Jackie Peng can be rather difficult to defeat since he has decent health, attack power and strikes quickly. Evolving [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]] into Macho Cat is a good idea, but that can only handle one Jackie Peng. Using [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]] paired with [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]] is an effective way to beat them due to Bird Cat's Area Attack. Either way, if you have trouble in Dubai even with various guides, just upgrade your cats and take them down individually. Use his single-target attacks to your advantage and block him out with a steady line of Cats and Tank Cats, while using [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] to deal fair damage to him. If you're unable to stall him, try gaining [[Treasure]]s to activate the [[Energy Drink]] and upgrade Tank Cat as well as Research. Any [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attacker]] could be helpful if he comes in swarms, like in [[Ghana (Empire of Cats)|Ghana/Wakayama]]. After [[Dubai (Empire of Cats)|Dubai/Hiroshima]], a squad of [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cats]] should be able to hold him off until the [[Cat Cannon]] or some other high-power cat finishes him off. Another simple way of dealing with Jackie Peng would be to use fast-attacking cats and defensive cats, for example, [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Giraffe Cats]] coupled with [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cats]]. Later on, Jackie Peng is just a minor threat or even free money as he can be easily taken out by most attackers. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 005 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Jackie Peng |image1 = Enemy icon 005.png |enemy_endesc1 = Loves watching Kung Fu movies,
and aiming to get into Hollywood.
Uses self-taught Kung Fu. |Enemy name (JP) = ジヤツキー・ペン (Jakkī Pen) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = カンフー映画にあこがれて、
我流でカンフーを始めたペンギン。
ハリウッドデビューを目指して
日々修行に明け暮れる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Yearning for a kung-fu movie,
this penguin started his own style of kung-fu.
Spends every day training for his Hollywood debut.}} ==Variants== {{Variant |Chief Peng |An event-exclusive enemy introduced in [[Loving Labour (Monthly Event)|Loving Labor]]. |Hermit Peng |An event-exclusive enemy introduced in [[Old Guys About Town (Monthly Event)|Old Guys About Town]]. |Zackie Peng |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Jackie Peng, with much more health and attack power. Like most Zombies, he can burrow past cats and revives once with 50% HP. |Star Peng |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of Jackie Peng. It has significantly increased stats and a 100% chance to warp cats backward. |Condemned Peng |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Jackie Peng. It has much higher stats, higher range, and Area Attack. It also has 50% chance to slow cat units and a guranteed chance to create a Lv.3 [[Surge Attack]] upon death. |Big Peng Z |A supersized version of Zackie Peng. It does surprisingly low damage, with a 50% toxic effect and an omni strike that reaches up to 500 range.}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]]=== Strength magnifications are 100% in https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Gory''' (ゴリさん, ''Gori-san'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gory |image = Gory.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Madagascar (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Madagascar/Tottori]]
'''SoL''': [[Gentle Smile|Sub-chapter 1 - Gentle Smile]]
'''ItF''': [[China (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - China]]
'''CotC''': [[Deneb (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Deneb]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Meteor Disco|Sub-chapter 26 - Meteor Disco]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,173¢ }} ==Enemy== Gory has high speed, attack rate and DPS, along with Area Attack, making him essentially an upgraded [[Jackie Peng]]. ==Strategy== Groups of Gories can be deadly without a proper strategy. Fragile cats such as [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]] should not fight Gories without some help from [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]]. Gory is basically a faster, [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attack]] version of Jackie Peng. Just like in [[Dubai (Empire of Cats)|Dubai/Hiroshima]], you face two of them in one battle. To deal with them, you may need the [[Energy Drink]] so you can get money faster. The best way to kill a Gory quickly is to use 1-3 [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cats/Sexy Legs Cats]] and many [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cats/Macho Cats]] and [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cats/Brave Cats]] as meatshields or attackers that can knock the Gory back in 1 hit, e.g. [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat/Dragon Cat]]. Be sure to protect your longer-ranged cats like Lizard Cats/Dragon Cats and Gross Cats/Sexy Legs Cats with cheap cats like [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat/Wall Cat]] and [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Boogie Cat/Samba Cat]]. Later on, Gory's threat level decreases drastically and becomes a giant money bag, as he isn't that dangerous compared to his other variants. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 006 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Gory |image1 = Enemy icon 006.png |enemy_endesc1 = Managed to get kicked out of the zoo

so turned to alcohol and gambling. |Enemy name (JP) = ゴリさん (Gori-san) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 顔がコワイ。という理由で動物園を

ニートになってからはお酒とギャンブル
におぼれる日々が続く。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Has a scary face.

days of drowning in alcohol and gambling ensued. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Gory Black |Gory's first [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy variant. He has much more health, knockbacks and damage, and twice the movement speed. |Gory Groom |A bigger variant of Gory Black. He is one of the strongest Gory variants in terms of stats, but is also the slowest. First appears in [[The Forbidden Bride (Monthly Event)|The Forbidden Bride]]. |Angelic Gory |Gory's [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant, with even more health, damage and speed than Gory Black. |Zory |Gory's [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant. He has much more health and damage, and also less knockbacks. Can burrow under cats once, and revives with full health after being killed. |General GreGory |Gory's [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant. He has a weak [[Barrier]] with a breaking point of 6,000. He also has more knockbacks, health, damage and range. |Gorilliam |Gory Groom's Alien variant, with less knockbacks, higher health and range, and a high chance of warping cats back by 500. First appears in [[Forbidden Bride Pt II (Monthly Event)|Forbidden Bride Pt II]]. |Gory Junior |An enemy from the [[Summer Festival (Celebration Event)#Summer Lesson|Summer Lesson]] event, he has moderate health and high damage, more range, faster attacks and faster movement than the original Gory. He also strengthens by 100% at 50% health. |Shakurel Gory |A variant of Gory from the [[Shakurel Planet Collaboration Event]]. Has double the health and attack power but isn't too difficult otherwise. |MikuGory |A variant of Gory from the [[Hatsune Miku Collaboration Event]]. Has much higher stats and a chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] cats. |Ragin' Gory |A Black/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of Gory, with more health, damage and range than Gory Black as well as immunity to freeze. |Aku Gory |Gory's [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant. Slower than Gory Black or Angelic Gory, but has even higher DPS, less knockbacks, and a chance to perform a [[Savage Blow]] which deals triple damage. |Angelic Beast Rajakong |The strongest variant of Gory in terms of health, this Angel/Behemoth enemy's attacks has an omni strike that reaches 50 ahead of his standing range, and has 10% chance to create a level 2 [[Wave Attack|Waves]]. https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Baa Baa''' (メェメェ ''Me~eme~e'', '''Mee Mee''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Baa Baa |image = BaaBaaBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EN''': [[Sahara (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Sahara/Osaka]]
'''ItF''': [[Mongolia (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Mongolia]]
'''CotC''': [[Jupiter (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Jupiter]]
'''SoL''': [[Melancholy Damp|Sub-chapter 1 - Melancholy Damp]] |money drop = 150¢ - 593¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Mandatory Fun|Sub-chapter 21 - Mandatory Fun]] }} ==Enemy== Baa Baa is a standard peon. It may look powerful, but it only has 500 HP and 50 attack power at 100% strength magnification, and drops a fair amount of money to boot. It does not have Area Attack, but its attack rate is quick. Baa Baas are usually spawned in groups as support for much tougher opponents. ==Strategy== Baa Baa may look menacing, but in reality, it is half as strong as [[Hippoe]]. It also has single-targets attack, but its fast attack rate somewhat makes up for it. With proper meatshielding, it can never hit your attackers. [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat/UFO Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat/Mythical Titan Cat]] can make quick work of Baa Baas. They can be defeated by almost anything as long as they are not buffed to an extreme extent. Since they drop quite a bit of money when defeated, they are a welcome money source in any stage when they appear. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 007 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Baa Baa |image1 = Enemy icon 007.png |enemy_endesc1 = Corny name. Corny looks.
Has a complex about being too ordinary.
Trying to fix this by taking comedy lessons
at acting school. |Enemy name (JP) = メエメエ (Me~eme~e, Mee Mee) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ベタな名前にベタな姿。
普通すぎることがコンプレックスな羊。
いつか個性的なキャラになってやるんだと
意気込んでお笑いスクールに通っている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Corny looks, corny name.
A sheep with a complex about being too ordinary.
Enthusiastically goes to a comedian school
to someday become a unique character. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Ecto Baa Baa |Baa Baa's [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant. Appears in [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]] and [[The Haunted 1LDK]]. |UltraBaaBaa |Baa Baa's [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant, with increased movement speed and higher damage, but more importantly, a Barrier with 266,000 HP. Still has single-target attacks. |HaterBaa 2.0 |Baa Baa's [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant, with less health but much more damage. Luckily, it still only has single-target attacks. description:
Corny name. Corny looks.
Has a complex about being too ordinary.
Trying to fix this by taking comedy lessons
at acting school.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sir Seal''' (ゴマさま ''Goma-sama'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sir Seal |image = SirSealBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Greece (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Greece/Shiga]]
'''ItF''': [[Russia (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Russia]]
'''CotC''': [[Sun (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Sun]]
'''SoL''': [[Gazpacho Highland|Sub-chapter 2 - Gazpacho Highland]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 650¢ - 2,568¢ }} ==Enemy== A classy seal who attacks quickly, endures attacks without flinching and deals decent damage. It is recommended to use defensive Cats in tandem with fast-hitting ranged units to defeat this enemy. ==Strategy== Sir Seal could be very difficult or very easy depending on how you use your cats. The first time you meet Sir Seal is in [[Greece (Empire of Cats)|Greece/Shiga]], where [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]] will come in handy ([[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Cat]] is even better!). Also use [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Fish Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat]] to make quick work of Sir Seal. You should summon lots of [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cats]] and [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cats]], so that Sir Seal doesn't get to your attackers. Don't use [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]], as he gets outranged and can't take many hits. Some time later on in [[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]], Sir Seal's strength magnification will fluctuate a lot and give him generally higher strength magnifications than the other enemies from Empire of Cats (i.e. [[Angry Fighting]]), so use strong anti-Reds such as Island Cat, [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] and [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Sexy Bathtub Cat]]. Sir Seal is especially vulnerable to the Freeze effect because with one knockback he can't actually escape stunlock, and the slow-hitting but powerful characteristic of a typical [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend]], [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare]] or [[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rare]] unit comes in handy against Sir Seal too. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 008 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Sir Seal |image1 = Enemy icon 008.png |enemy_endesc1 = Came to the big city from
the quiet seaside.
Wanted more attention so
dyed his body red. |Enemy name (JP) = ゴマさま (Goma-sama) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ちまたでウワサのアザラシに憧れて
上京してきたアザラシ。
チヤホヤされたいのになかなか
注目されないので体を赤く染めてみた。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A seal that came to Tokyo,
hoping to become the subject of some rumors in the streets.
Tried to dye its body red because it wasn't getting much attention
even though it wanted to be pampered. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Sir Metal Seal |Sir Seal's [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant, with a higher attack rate, damage and health, as well as having the usual attributes of a Metal enemy. |Imperator Sael |Sir Seal's [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant. He is much stronger and can slow the movement of Cat Units. However, he is slower in terms of speed and attack speed, and has more knockbacks. |Zir Zeal |Sir Seal's [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant. He has much higher stats in all areas than Sir Seal, combined with a Freeze ability and the regular [[Special Abilities#Burrow|Zombie]]-[[Special Abilities#Revive|type]] abilities. |Baron Seal |A [[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of Sir Seal appearing in [[Baron Seal Strikes]]. This seal appears with a large variety of buffs in the stages he appears in, and can also weaken and freeze Cat Units. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]]=== Strength They had the ability to split into two smaller seals, which would then split into two even smaller seals. Some units had an ability called Sir Seal Killer, which increased damage against all seal variants by 50%. {{Gallery|Enemy icon 008}} ==Trivia== *He was known as "Sir Baby Seal" in [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|the old English version]]. *His Japanese description's mention of his coming to Tokyo references the famous seal [[wikipedia:Tama-chan|Tama-chan]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/010.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Le'boin''' (パオン ''Paon'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]], [[Legend Stages]] and the [[Catclaw Dojo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Le'boin |image = Le'boin.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Denmark (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Denmark/Shizuoka]]
'''ItF''': [[Italy (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Italy]]
'''SoL''': [[Guardian of the Ranch|Sub-chapter 1 - Guardian of the Ranch]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Love Refinery|Sub-chapter 33 - Love Refinery]] |money drop = 1,300¢ - 5,135¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has high health, range and attack power, allowing him to easily destroy many units within his expansive reach. However, the major downside to this tank is his slowish attack rate and movement speed. Even with his weaknesses, this enemy is a major threat early on as he outranges every [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cat]] and purchasable [[:Category:Special Cats|Special Cat]]. In levels like [[Liar's Fate]] and [[Celestial Seas]], he acts as a weaker but faster-attacking [[THE SLOTH]] as he has only one knockback and attacks quicker, making him more of a support-type enemy. ==Strategy== Le'boin is a very dangerous enemy early on in the game. When you first meet him in [[Denmark (Empire of Cats)|Denmark/Shizuoka]], prepare for a long and painful battle, because [[Those Guys]] are constantly being spawned. To kill him, you will need to let him and the peons come within range of the [[Cat Cannon]], then fire it and whale on him with [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cats]], [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cats]] and meatshields. It is recommended to use tanky cats, like Titan Cat, to defeat this enemy. Uber long-ranged attackers also work. Stall until you can send out powerful or fast-attacking cats. Later in the game, Le'boin becomes much less dangerous due to the player having [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]], [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Wolf]] and potentially many units that outrange him or able to hit him witn indirect fire, becoming more of a giant money bag than a huge threat, as his health also pales when compared to enemies accompanying him. However, keep him away from your main attackers as he still does enough damage to one shot your attackers in [[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends Stages|Uncanny Legends]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 009 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Le'boin |enemy_endesc1 = Has ridiculously long reach.
Likes his women curvy. Very curvy.
Collects lots of magazines... don't ask what type. |image1 = Enemy icon 009.png |Enemy name (JP) = パオン (Paon) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 長いリーチを生かした攻撃が特徴的な象。
好きなタイプはぽっちゃりめの巨乳。
グラビアの写真集を集めるのが趣味。
秘蔵のコレクションは数知れず。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An elephant characterized by an attack that takes advantage of his long reach.
Favorite type is chubby with big tits.
Hobby is collecting gravure photos.
Has countless treasured collections. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Lord Enma |This [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy first seen in [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]] is a combination of [[Doge]] and Le'boin. |Le'noir |A [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of Le'boin. Has far higher health and damage, and slightly more range. |Mammothe |An event variant of Le'boin introduced in the [[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]] event, with the ability to create [[Wave Attack]]s. |Le'Solar |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of Le'boin. She has a 40,000 HP Barrier as well as increased health, damage and attack speed. |Le'saint |An [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of Lord Enma. He has a faster attack rate and gets stronger at 50% HP, but has the shortest range of all Le'boin variants. |Le'Grim |A bigger variant of Le'noir that appears in the [[Le'Grim Strikes]] gauntlet. He has higher range and the ability to slow cats for 6.67 seconds. Though weak initially, he receives insane strength magnifications in the later stages of Le'Grim Strikes. |Le'Behemoth |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Le'Boin with blue skin, yellow eyes, black tusks, and a pentagram on his forehead. This variant is protected by a durable [[Shield]] and pushes with [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]]=== Strength magnifications are https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Kang Roo''' (カ・ンガリュ ''Ka Ngaryu'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Kang Roo |image = KangRooBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Bermuda (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Bermuda/Tokyo]]
'''ItF''': [[Spain (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Spain]]
'''CotC''': [[Mercury (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Mercury]]
'''SoL''': [[Churros Night|Sub-chapter 2 - Churros Night]] |money drop = 1,400¢ - 5,530¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Burning Blue|Sub-chapter 28 - Burning Blue]] }} ==Enemy== A strong, heavy-hitting enemy that does a significant amount of damage to a single [[Cat Units|Cat Unit]] quickly. Due to the speed at which they attack, multiple Kang Roos can knock your cats back continually, before they're able to attack in return, proving to be quite formidable. Kang Roos give up to 5,530¢ when defeated, making them a good source of income in later stages. ==Strategy== Even though this enemy looks formidable, it is actually very easy if alone. It has powerful attacks, but they are Single Target, making it easy to deal with when encountered without any support. If you really have trouble with this enemy, use [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] with [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Basic Cats]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cats]] and [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cats]]. If you have a problem in Chapter 3, use [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]]. Later on, Kang Roo is easier to deal with and becomes a source of large amounts of money. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 010 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Kang Roo |enemy_endesc1 = Always dreamed to be a boxer.
Couldn't really get there because it is... well, a kangaroo.
Sad, sad truth. |image1 = Enemy icon 010.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 昔読んだマンガがきっかけでボクシングを
始める。ライセンス試験でカンガルーと

いう理由だけで落とされ、人生が真っ白に
燃え尽きた悲劇のカンガルー。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Started boxing because of a manga it read some time ago.
A tragic kangaroo who burned out in white,
dropped from the licensing test just for being a kangaroo. |Enemy name (JP) = カ・ンガリュ (Ka Ngaryu) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Shadow Boxer K |Kang Roo's [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant, with much higher stats, Area Attack, more knockbacks and a faster attack rate. |Scissoroo |Kang Roo's [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant, with Area Attack, longer range, no multi-hit and a chance to knockback cats. |Zang Roo |Kang Roo's [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant, with much higher stats and Area Attack. Burrows under cats and revives once with 100% HP. |Ms. Madonna |First seen in the [[Spring for Sensei (Monthly Event)|Spring for Sensei]] event. description: Always dreamed to be a boxer.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''One Horn''' (一角くん ''Ikkaku-kun'', '''One Horn-kun''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = One Horn |image = One Horn.png |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Easter Island (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Easter Island/Miyagi]]
'''ItF''': [[Denmark (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Denmark]]
'''CotC''': [[Saturn (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Saturn]]
'''SoL''': [[Playing Pirates|Sub-chapter 4 - Playing Pirates]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Reincarnation Ring|Sub-chapter 36 - Reincarnation Ring]] |money drop = 2,500¢ - 9,875¢ }} ==Enemy== An odd enemy that can serve as either free money or the main threat depending on the stage. One Horn sports high damage output and a gigantic health pool, similarly to [[Bore (Red)|Bore]]. However, his movement speed and range are ''very'' lacking. ==Strategy== To defeat him early on, use [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cats]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cats]] and [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cats]] with [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red units]] like [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Fish Cat]] and [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]]. If you are a new player, don't let One Horn get too close to the [[Cat Base]], since he'll easily be able to destroy it. This enemy becomes less and less threatening as you progress through the game due to the wide abundance of Anti-Red units. However, keep in mind that his DPS stays consistently high, allowing him to slowly but surely plow through your defenses if you don't have any unit that can hold him back like [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Onmyoji Cat]] or [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Apple Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 011 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = One Horn |enemy_endesc1 = Loves to help people.
Works part time at a fire station.
However, as he is so slow on his feet,
he never makes it to the fire on time. |image1 = Enemy icon 011.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 人を助ける仕事をしたくて消防署で
働いている。消防車のかわりに人を乗せて
出動することもあるが、足が遅いので
到着する頃には家がほぼ燃え尽きている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Works at a fire station because he wanted a job to help people.
In some cases, people are dispatched instead of a fire truck,
but because he's so slow on his feet,
the house has nearly burned down by the time he arrives . |Enemy name (JP) = 一角くん (Ikkaku-kun, One Horn-kun) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Metal One Horn |A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of One Horn. In the Korean version; however, his name translates to '''Two-Horn'''. *While his Japanese name, Ikkaku(-kun), literally translates to "One Horn", it also sounds similar to ''ikaku'' (威嚇), meaning "threat", "threaten", or "intimidate". *One Horn and all his variants are constantly mocked for their extremely slow speed in their descriptions. **Ironically, in real life, rhinos are quite fast. *One Horn has the shortest range of any enemy, standing at a mere 40. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/013.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Teacher Bear''' (クマ先生 ''Kuma-sensei'', '''Teacher Bear''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Teacher Bear |image = TeacherBearBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Las Vegas (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Las Vegas/Akita]]
'''ItF''': [[Spain (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Spain]]
'''SoL''': [[Seaweed Shallows|Sub-chapter 4 - Seaweed Shallows]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Panic Tower|Sub-chapter 8 - Panic Tower]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== A decently-rounded, high-damaging enemy with fairly long range, almost like an enemy counter to the player's [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]]. High damage for his health, anyway, considering how he has a 1:3 attack power to health ratio. ==Strategy== Teacher Bear is weaker than [[Le'boin]] due to his inferior health and higher knockback count, making him vulnerable to a large stack of [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cats]] or any other fast attacker like [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Cat]]. He can also be easily defeated by [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]], who has enough health to tank his attacks, or by a stack of [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cats]], as they outrange him and deal good damage. However, beware of the peons,as his 10 knockbacks can allow him to reposition himself due to his range. Teacher Bear isn't very strong - as long as something is around to hit him, he can't push much. In fact, many of his [[Ursamajor (Alien)|colored]] [[Cadaver Bear (Zombie)|variants]] are more threatening than himself. Overall, he should be treated like a glass-cannon ranged attacker. However, unlike [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]] and [[Le'boin]], his multiple knockbacks allow him to reposition himself behind peons. Later in the game, stacks of ([[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed]]) Dragon Cats, [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]], [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Wolf]], or any Backliner-class and higher ranged Midranger-class Units that outrange him as they can easily defeat him. If he is shielded by other enemies in front of him, [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] will also be effective, with examples ranging from [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Macho Legs]] to [[Hermit Cat (Special Cat)|Masked Grandmaster Hermit]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 012 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Teacher Bear |image1 = Enemy icon 012.png |enemy_endesc1 = A kindergarten teacher. He LOVES children.
His sharp claws are not suited for the job.
Not related to a certain other bear.
No one knows his real name. |Enemy name (JP) = クマ先生 (Kuma-sensei, Teacher Bear) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 幼稚園の先生。笑顔で振り下ろされる
コブシはめっちゃ痛い。
怒ると怖いが温厚なその性格で園児たちに
クマ先生の愛称で慕われている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A kindergarten teacher. He smiles while swinging down his fist,
which hurts like hell.
He's scary when he's angry, but his mild-mannered personality
has earned him the nickname "Mr. Bear" among the children. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Assassin Bear |Teacher Bear's [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant. He possesses extreme speed, DPS and range yet has less money drop and health. He is usually placed in various stages as a makeshift time limit as he guarantees the player's loss upon appearing. |Audience Bears |A group of bears sitting together on a bleacher introduced in the [[Bears be Bare (Monthly Event)|Bears be Bare]] event. |Bearkini |A much faster variant of Teacher Bear wearing a bikini. First encountered in the [[Never Summer! (Monthly Event)|Never Summer!]] event. |Mighty Gui Zuli |A buffer variant of Teacher Bear introduced in the [[Old Guys About Town (Monthly Event)|Old Guys About Town]] event. |Ursamajor |An [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant of Teacher Bear. Possesses superior overall stats and strengthens by 50% once below 50% health. |The Red Malice |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of Mighty Gui Zuli. Compared to Zuli, The Red Malice is much faster and attacks more often, but has more knockbacks, less damage, less range, and a 100% chance to knockback Cat Units. |Cadaver Bear |[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Teacher Bear. Attacks faster, can burrow under Cat Units and revives once with 100% HP. |Teacher Cybear |[[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of Teacher Bear. Has single-target attacks with extreme damage, range and attack rate. |Variety Bears |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]/[[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]]/[[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]]/[[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]]/[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Audience Bears introduced in the [[Bears Be Back (Monthly Event)|Bears Be Back]] event. Compared to the Audience Bears, they have the same health, higher range, slower movement speed, a multi-hit attack, and the ability to afflict cats with a wide range of debuffs. They have the most traits out of every enemy in the game. |MikuBear |A slightly colorful variant of Teacher Bear that appears in the [[Hatsune Miku Collaboration Event]]. It has higher stats, but is Single Target. |Fallen Bear |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Teacher Bear. Has low base health but a strong [[Shield]] and the ability to create a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] upon death. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]]=== Strength magnifications are 100% in https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''B.B.Bunny''' (ウサ銀 ''Usagin'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = B.B.Bunny |image = B B Bunny.png |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Greenland (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Greenland/Niigata]]
'''ItF''': [[China (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - China]]
'''CotC''': [[Sun (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Sun]]
'''SoL''': [[Catechin Hill|Sub-chapter 3 - Catechin Hill]] |latest appearance ='''UL''': [[Infinity Ridge|Sub-chapter 47 - Infinity Ridge]] |money drop = 180¢ - 711¢ }} ==Enemy== A quick enemy that can easily be dispatched with the use of [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]] or similar [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red]] units. It is recommended to kill this enemy quickly as it gives a fair amount of money to the player. Larger groups of B.B.Bunnies can cause quick, repeating damage that can cripple larger, slower units. ==Strategies== B.B.Bunny is generally a very easy enemy to deal with, as it is basically a Red version of [[Baa Baa]]. You can usually dispatch a [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Cat]], Axe Cat or any other anti-Red unit. It is recommended to use [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Cats with Area Attack]], such as [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]] or another spammable attacker like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]], as they can easily pick off groups of B.B.Bunnies. Since Bird Cat has low health, use [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]] or other defensive cats to protect it. After the first few encounters, B.B.Bunny does not pose a real, serious challenge, and offers cash more than anything. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 014 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = B.B.Bunny |enemy_endesc1 = Quit a major company

independent. Now manages four companies. Aiming for
the position of mayor in the future. }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Easter Bunny |A [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of B.B.Bunny that first appears in [[Cats Abloom! Squire Rel is a very weak enemy overall, due to her low health and attack power. Her short range makes her vulnerable to attack by almost any unit, and she usually appears in clusters as easily defeatable peons throughout the entire game. ==Strategy== She can be quickly killed with one [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]] if she's all alone. Groups of Squire Rels can be killed by a [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]], [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Rocker Cat]] or an [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attacker]] like [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]] or [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]]. [[Wave Attack]]s from the [[Cat Cannon]] or any [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attack Cat]] can clear out a horde of Squire Rels in one shot. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 015 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Squire Rel |enemy_endesc1 = She speaks an old English dialect (?)

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Assassin Bear''' (ブラックマ ''Burakkuma'', "'''Black Bear'''") is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of [[Teacher Bear]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. He first appears in [[Higher Score|Challenge Battle]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Assassin Bear |image = Assassin Bear.png |first appearance = [[Higher Score|Challenge Battle]]
'''SoL''': [[Chubby B. Goode|Sub-chapter 9 - Chubby B. Goode]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Shinobi Showdown|Sub-chapter 44 - Shinobi Showdown]] |money drop = 1¢ - 4¢ }} ==Enemy== Assassin Bear is the fastest-moving and one of the fastest-attacking enemies in the game. At 100% strength magnification, he deals 3,000 area damage per hit, which might not seem like much, yet he keeps himself very safe at 800 range, almost ''double'' that of [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]] (500). This enemy is usually used as a means of guaranteeing defeat, by spawning en masse and/or at extremely high buffs once a time limit or condition is reached, sometimes pre-announced by a [[Ms. Sign]], making him a makeshift time limit. However, this does not happen in every stage. There are also stages in which he is actually meant to be defeated, such as [[Twilight Poachers]], [[Littering Coast]] and [[False Resurrection]]. In stages like [[Merciless Onslaught]], [[Ashen Rain]] and [[Veggie Friends]], he is used as a gimmick, in which he spawns as soon as an enemy perishes, due to the enemy limit, leading into an instant defeat. This means you need to use the enemy limit to your advantage and keep the enemies alive. ==Strategy== The default [[Cat Cannon]] can kill an Assassin Bear easily, however at higher magnifications it cannot deal enough damage, meaning a certain defeat in most cases. Thankfully, these overbuffed Assassin Bears are always easy to avoid fighting in the first place, except in [[Surrealist Sins]] if you're not careful. Another way to beat him is to use a [[Cat Units|Cat Unit]] that can reach and kill the Assassin Bear without dying; options include cats with very few knockbacks and either fast speed or high health (at least against [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black Enemies]]). The faster the speed, the lower the heath needed. [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Glass Cat]], [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Express Cat]], [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Sanada Yukimura]], [[Stone Cat (Rare Cat)|Stone Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Jamiera Cat]] are some examples. Using [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attack Cats]]/[[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge Attack Cats]] works too, as long as he isn't too buffed. If the Assassin Bear comes out when the base receives enough damage and the Wave/Surge spawns, he will likely step into the attack and die instantly. In other scenarios, it's still possible to hit the bear by using a peon as a "stepping stone" and long enough Waves. Outranging him is another option. It is rare, but there are some cats that can do it. One common option is [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], provided if you're able to somehow stall him. The last option is using a unit to clip through the Assassin Bear after being knocked back. The best choice for this would be [[Crazed Cow Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Lion Cat]], as although other options can still work, they have to be ultra fast in order to instantly rebound after being knocked back and have a fast attack rate to kill the Assassin Bear after getting knocked back. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 016 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Assassin Bear |enemy_endesc1 = Licensed to kill.
The global financial crisis isn't helping
him much though.
Please check the flyers.
He's offering one million per kill now. |image1 = Enemy icon 016.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 闇の世界で生きてきた暗殺熊。この不況で
殺しの依頼も激減。１殺、１億で依頼を
募集中。と、今朝の折り込みチラシに
書いてあった。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Assassin bear from the darkness of the world.
The number of assassination requests has plummeted in this recession.
Offering 100 million per kill.
Wrote a request in the flyers this morning. |Enemy name (JP) = ブラックマ (Burakkuma, "Black Bear") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 9-8: [[Chubby B. Goode]] (800%) *Stage 18-5: [[Pitfall Zone]] (100%) *Stage 18-6: [[The Great Escaper]] (100%) *Stage 19-2: [[Last Gang]] (100%) *Stage 22-4: [[Torture Room]] (400%) *Stage 25-3: [[Kugel Schreiber]] (200%) *Stage 25-6: [[Sunset Soldier]] (100%) *Stage 26-5: [[Littering Coast]] (500%) *Stage 28-6: [[Learned to Love]] (100%) *Stage 31-2: [[Twilight Poachers]] (100%) *Stage 33-3: [[Merciless Onslaught]] (4,000%) *Stage 40-2: [[Romantic Highway]] (600%) *Stage 42-2: [[Surrealist Sins]] (4,500%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (600%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 6-5: [[Murmuring Evil]] (800%) *Stage 10-3: [[Veggie Friends]] (5,000%) *Stage 11-3: [[Ashen Rain]] (1,000%) *Stage 19-2: [[Forever Fishing]] (10,000%) *Stage 21-1: [[Furry Cavern]] (10,000%) *Stage 25-2: [[Vengeful Sandbag]] (800%) *Stage 36-1: [[The Ivy-Sealed Door]] (400%) *Stage 37-6: [[Hall of the Four Kings]] (5,000%) *Stage 38-1: [[The Great Sufferer]] (100%) *Stage 38-3: [[Learned to Hate]] (200%) *Stage 42-3: [[Ashes Just Ahead]] (800%) *Stage 44-5: [[Shinobi Showdown]] (5,000%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Challenge Battle: [[Higher Score]] (100%) *[[Bears be Bare (Monthly Event)|Bears be Bare]]: [[Arming Bears]] (100%) *The Crazed Fish: [[Fish Hell (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Autumn = Sports Day! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Shy Boy''' (赤羅我王 ''Akara Gaō'', '''Gaō Akara''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Shy Boy |image = Shy Boy.png |first appearance = [[Higher Score|Challenge Battle]]
'''ItF''': [[Singapore (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Singapore]]
'''SoL''': [[Twin Peaks|Sub-chapter 5 - Twin Peaks]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Patient Red Fox|Sub-chapter 35 - Patient Red Fox]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== Despite looking similar, Shy Boy is almost entirely different from the [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]]. He moves at '''forty''' times the speed and attacks rapidly, but with less than half the range. He is only around 1/3 as tough compared to The Face, yet dishes out more DPS. Furthermore, his high strength magnifications make him an annoying enemy later in the game. When defeated, he drops a good amount of cash. ==Strategy== You can exploit his dual-trait weakness with [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red]] or [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating]] attackers that are well rounded in health and attack power. Examples are [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Fish Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] and [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Swimmer Cat]]. Due to his high money drop, you shouldn't hesitate spending a lot of your budget to defeat him. Shy Boy is also very vulnerable to status effects like [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] and freeze, as due to his short range, he barely does anything without his speed advantage. This means that [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hip Hop Cat]] and [[Witch Cat (Rare Cat)|Witch Cat]] can get the job done just fine. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 017 |enemy category = Red/Floating |Enemy name = Shy Boy |enemy_endesc1 = Ridiculously shy.

They were indestructible and could not be harmed in any way. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- |style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;"|[[File:Flamingshyboy.png|center|125px]] |- |style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center"|Flaming Shy Boy |} ==Gallery== Shy Boy(bcp).png|Shy Boy's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] ShyBoyspritesheet.png|Shy Boy's spritesheet IdleShyBoy.gif|Shy Boy's moving animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Gaō Akara (赤羅我王) or Akara Gaō as it would be in Japan, consists of the kanji for "red" (赤), "lightweight fabric" (羅), "ego" or "self-assertion" (我) and "king" (王). Akara is derived from ''akaramu'' (赤らむ), meaning "to redden" or "to blush", while Gaō is a pun on ''kao'' (顔), meaning "face"; neither of his names mean anything on their own. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/019.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''The Face''' (カオル君, '''''Kaoru-kun''''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy first seen as the boss of the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon]] in [[Empire of Cats]] Chapter 1. {{Enemy Info |name = The Face |image = AngryFace.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Moon]]
'''ItF''': [[Easter Island (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Easter Island]]
'''SoL''': [[Twin Peaks|Sub-chapter 5 - Twin Peaks]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Night of the Hustler|Sub-chapter 44 - Night of the Hustler]] |money drop = 4,000¢ - 15,800¢ }} ==Enemy== The boss of the first Chapter's final stage, The Face has extremely high health and attack but is the slowest enemy in the game. Additionally, he attacks very infrequently, rendering his highly devastating attacks useless in the presence of meatshields and 350+ range cats. Later on in the game, this enemy becomes more defensively-focused, as his 1 speed keeps him from straying too far away from the enemy base, along with late-game buffs making his high health and high attack power skyrocket to where he can destroy most of your units with a single chomp. ==Strategy== Use units such as [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat]] and/or [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] to outrange him, while dealing constant damage. It is recommended to only use [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|Crowd-controllers]] that can outrange him, but even then, because of his 1 movement speed, there is not much reason to use any effect other than [[Weaken]] or [[Freeze]]. [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare Cats]] that work especially well against The Face include, but are not limited to: [[Saber (Uber Rare Cat)|Saber]], [[The Grateful Crane (Uber Rare Cat)|Super Galaxy Cosmo]], [[Empress Chronos (Uber Rare Cat)|Empress Chronos]], [[Megidora (Uber Rare Cat)|Megidora]], [[M. Bison (Uber Rare Cat)|M. Bison]], [[Madoka Kaname (Uber Rare Cat)|Madoka Kaname]], [[Shining Amaterasu (Uber Rare Cat)|Shining Amaterasu]], [[Catman (Uber Rare Cat)|Catman]], and virtually any other generalist or [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating]] Uber. You can also take advantage of his long interval between attacks by using units such as [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Swimmer Cat]], [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Express Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hip Hop Cat]] and/or [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] to get some quick damage off. Otherwise, he should not be the main focus for your lineup in many of the stages he appears in. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 018 |enemy category = [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] |Enemy name = The Face |enemy_endesc1 = Too strict a diet resulted in no body.
No one knows why he is floating.
Seriously, anyone?
(Don't try this at home) |image1 = Enemy icon 018.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ダイエットのしすぎで顔だけになって
しまったカオル君。体が無くなったせいで
顔が肥大化し、ダイエット前よりも体重が
重くなった。なので浮いてみた。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Kaoru-kun became only a face after dieting too much.
His face became bloated because his body is gone,
and he weighs more than he did before dieting.
So he tried to float. |Enemy name (JP) = カオル君 (Kaoru-kun) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Shy Boy |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of The Face. Attacks and moves much faster, but has much less health and deals less damage per attack. Has well-rounded stats when buffed and can destroy your front lines considerably fast if not stalled correctly. |Leggsy |A [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of The Face with feet and thus no Floating trait. Considerably faster than The Face (has half of Shy Boy's speed) and has a much faster attack speed, but has about half of The Face's health. |Princess Head |A variant of The Face with [[Kerihime (Special Cat)|Princess Punt]] hair. 1/3 as fast as [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]]. Attacks about as fast as Shy Boy and does 2,400 damage at 100% strength magnification. |I.M. Phace |An [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] version of The Face. Much faster and has a chance to freeze Cat Units. To add insult to injury, he has longer range, making him very hard for [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] and [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Psychocat]] to survive long against him. He gets knocked back twice as much as The Face. |CyberFace |A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of The Face. Has very low health but compensates for it with extreme damage, high speed, Base Destroyer and an incredibly powerful [[Wave Attack]] that can one-shot almost every unit in the game, with a chance to knockback [[Cat Units]] if they aren't killed by the Wave or initial hit. However, it dies to any [[Critical Hit]] due to its terrible health. |Hannya |A red variant that moves slowly, but with exceptional range, damage, health, and 100% chance to weaken cats to 25% for 5 seconds. Introduced appears as the boss of [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|River Styx]]. |Lowkey |A [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of The Face, with far more range, rapid attacks, 100% chance to curse cats for 10 seconds and only one knockback. |Dead Donny Dash |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Leggsy. Has Long Distance attacks, burrows 750 towards the [[Cat Base]] and revives once at 100% HP. |Shakurel Face |A variant of The Face that only appears in the [[Shakurel Planet Collaboration Event|Shakurel Planet]] stages. Has quadruple the health and damage of a normal Face. |Black Okame |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of Hannya, with freeze immunity, much more HP, only one knockback, less damage and faster attacks, as well as 100% chance to knockback cats. Though its standing range is subpar, its Omni Strike gives it extreme reach. |Yakisoba Face |A variant of The Face that appears in the [[Nissin U.F.O. Collaboration Event]]. Has high range, one knockback, low movement speed and can [[warp]] Cat Units for 1,000 range. |Wicked Face |An Aku variant of The Face. Has a very long range with an even longer [[Mini-Wave]] attack, as well as freeze and a shield. |Sathankhamun VIII |An Aku variant of Hannya. Has slightly varied stats, but also has an Omni Strike and a 100% chance to slow every cat within its range. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]]=== Strength magnifications are 100% in Chapter 1, 150% in Chapter 2, and 400% in Chapter 3. *Stage 1-48: [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon]] ===[[Into the Future]]=== Strength magnifications are 300% in Chapter 1, 600% in Chapter 2, and 800% in Chapter 3. *Stage 33: [[Easter Island (Into the Future)|Easter Island]] ===[[Into the Future]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== Strength magnifications are 600% in Chapter 1, 800% in Chapter 2, and 1,000% in Chapter 3. *Stage 3-4: [[Mongolia (Into the Future)|Mongolia]] *Stage 33: [[Easter Island (Into the Future)|Easter Island]] ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 10: [[Maldives (Aku Realm)|Maldives]] (600%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 5-5: [[Twin Peaks]] (400%) *Stage 14-5: [[Crunchy Pillar]] (1,200%) *Stage 17-5: [[Chicken Game]] (1,000%) *Stage 18-5: [[Pitfall Zone]] (2,000%) *Stage 20-3: [[Godiego Pass]] (1,000%) *Stage 21-2: [[Claustronyctophobia]] (1,000%) *Stage 22-6: [[Satan's Bedroom]] (800%) *Stage 23-5: [[Agape's Cage]] (600%) *Stage 26-6: [[Benzene Field]] (200%) *Stage 28-2: [[Knights of the Round]] (1,600%) *Stage 35-1: [[Virus Smugglers]] (1,600%) *Stage 41-6: [[Broadband Omens]] (2,000%) *Stage 45-4: [[Toasty Turnpike]] (2,000%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 10-5: [[Shocking Exile]] (500%) *Stage 13-3: [[Lost Sailors]] (1,000%) *Stage 15-4: [[Cracked Column]] (2,000%) *Stage 19-4: [[Nighttime Lure]] (1,600%) *Stage 44-2: [[Night of the Hustler]] (500%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Challenge Battle: [[Higher Score]] (100%) *[[Friday Stage]]: [[Helpful Cat (Hard)]] (200%) *[[Loving Labour (Monthly Event)|Loving Labour]]: [[Pay without Leave]] (100%) *[[Jingle Cat Bell (Monthly Event)|Jingle Cat Bell]]: [[Happy Merry X-mas]] (100%) *[[Happy New Year? (10f 0.33s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Defense Force=== In [[Nyanko Daibōsō]], The Face made a cameo appearance as a bust sculpted into the side of a mountain in one of the backgrounds. [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]] had a more prominent role: every so often, flaming Shy Boys would appear from the top of the screen and descend to the bottom with a warning. They were indestructible and could not be harmed in any way. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:StoneFace.png|center|125px]] | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;" | [[File:Flamingshyboy.png|center|125px]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;border-right:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | Bust of The Face | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | Flaming Shy Boy |} ===Heads Off=== In Heads Off, The Face is one of the larger playable characters in the game and makes a lower-pitched screaming sound compared to the other characters. ==Gallery== Big face.png|The Face's Enemy Guide entry in [[Battle Cats (Removed Game)|Battle Cats]] The Face(bcp).png|The Face's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] TheFacespritesheet.png|The Face's spritesheet IdleTheFace.gif|The Face's moving animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Kaoru-kun, contains the word ''kao'', meaning "face". *He has a higher ID than Shy Boy and [[Assassin Bear (Black)|Assassin Bear]] despite appearing earlier. *The Face, [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]] and [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]] all share the same amount of health: 99,999. However, Nyandam only has [[Soul Leasing|one unbuffed appearance]], and Teacher Bun Bun is always fought at 400% or more. *He is the slowest non-stationary enemy in the game. *The game "Heads Off" may be based entirely off of him, since it features floating heads. He even makes an appearance in it as one of the unlockable characters. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/020.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mooth''' (ガガガガ ''Gagagaga'' [''ga = moth'']) is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in the [[Main Chapters Levels|Main Chapters]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mooth |image = MoothBattle.png |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Brazil (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 1 - Brazil/Tochigi]]
'''ItF''': [[Germany (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Germany]]
'''CotC''': [[Catseye Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Catseye Nebula]]
'''SoL''': [[Flamenco Hole|Sub-chapter 2 - Flamenco Hole]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 7,110¢ }} ==Enemy== In addition to his serviceable attack pool and movement speed, Mooth has a repetitive but unorthodox attacking technique where he winds up, rams your cats, and lowers down, all taking a little over a second to execute. In [[Legend Stages]], Mooth's position as a backline enemy is quickly stolen by [[Owlbrow (Floating)|Owlbrow]], an enemy who behaves similarly to Mooth but moves slower and has more attack power in proportion to his health. You'll still be seeing plenty of Mooths in your adventures, because this enemy drops a large amount of money when defeated, and many stages later in the game still use it as a money provider. ==Strategy== If you have trouble with Mooth, use [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]] and [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]] to stall him, then use strong attackers like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] or long-ranged cats like [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat]]. A good method to defeat Mooth is to overwhelm him with fast-hitting units, like [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] or [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Swimmer Cat]]. This enemy is Floating, so ranged [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating Cats]] can be useful against him. Later in the game, Mooth mainly acts as a bag of cash or a wall to not let your meatshields pass, more than an attacker. Beyond that, he's only relevant when paired with [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal Enemies]], as in [[Blockchain Twilight]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 022 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Mooth |enemy_endesc1 = He dreamed he will become
a beautiful butterfly in the future.
Found out the truth and now
rebelling against nature. |image1 = Enemy icon 022.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 自分は将来美しいチョウになるんだと
期待してサナギから出てきたら、
「ガ」だったことにショックを受ける。
ぐれた時期もあったが現在は更生している。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Came out of the pupa expecting
to become a beautiful butterfly in the future,
so he was shocked when he was a "moth".
There was also a time when he was stray, but now he is rehabilitating. |Enemy name (JP) = ガガガガ (Gagagaga) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Maawth |[[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] version of Mooth. He is stronger, has longer range and can [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units. |Othom |[[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] version of Mooth. Far stronger, with attacks that extend past his range and a guaranteed chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units. |Sister Lione |An enemy first seen in [[Another New Year (Monthly Event)|Another New Year]]. Has more health and range plus a guaranteed chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units' attack power to 50%, with many knockbacks, but slower. |Mega-Mooth |An enemy only found in [[Mega Menace]]. Similar to Othom, but has more knockbacks, 30 more standing and 130 more effective range, and [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] instead of curse. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire (54f 1.8s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Daibōsō=== Mooth appeared as a regular enemy in [[Nyanko Daibōsō]]. ==Gallery== Mooth(bcp).png|Mooth's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Moothspritesheet.png|Mooth's spritesheet IdleMooth.gif|Mooth's moving animation ==Trivia== *''Ga'' (ガ) can mean "moth", so his Japanese name, Gagagaga (ガガガガ), would literally translate to "Mothmothmothmoth". **[[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]]'s Japanese name, Chō Chōchō (超町長), is a similar joke that doesn't translate well to English: ''chō'' (蝶) can mean "butterfly", but the way Othom's name is spelled literally translates to "Super Mayor". **[[Sister Lione (Event Enemy)|Sister Lione]]'s Japanese name, Shishi Shimai (獅子姉妹), repeats the syllable "shi" three times but uses a different kanji for each one, literally translating to "Sister Lion". *He is the first [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy encountered. *All Mooth variants have the exact same delay between attacks, foreswing, and backswing. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/024.html ----
