wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dark Emperor Nyandam''' (悪の帝王ニャンダム ''Aku no Teiou Nyandamu'', '''Evil Emperor Nyandam''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy first seen as the boss of the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon/Iriomote]] in [[Empire of Cats]] Chapter 2. {{Enemy Info |name = Dark Emperor Nyandam |image = DarkEmperorNyandam.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 2 - Moon/Iriomote]]
'''SoL''': [[Red Tuna Coast|Sub-chapter 7 - Red Tuna Coast]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Fire Kingdom Dynamite|Sub-chapter 41 - Fire Kingdom Dynamite]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== He lacks speed in both movement and attack rate, but he boasts immense health and attack power. He has lower attack than [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] at 100% strength magnification, but his buff is 150% in his first appearance, giving him 149,998 health and 2,700 damage. Even though he has a very slow attack rate, he has insane range as a trade-off. It's important to note that Dark Emperor Nyandam's [[Hitbox]] is closer to the front of the sprite compared to [[Director Kurosawah (Black)|Director Kurosawah]] and [[Galactic Overseer Nyandam (Alien)|Galactic Overseer Nyandam]]. ==Strategy== When you first encounter him, prepare for a close fight, as he is protected by [[One Horn (Red)|One Horns]] and a constant spam of [[Squire Rel]]s and [[Those Guys]] (see [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon]] for strategies). Since few cats can outrange him, focus on units that can survive his attacks, like [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Fish Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]]. Even later on, it's important to be wary of this enemy, as his strong, ranged attacks can put a dent in many cat armies, posing a huge danger especially to units with low health and not enough range to stay safe, like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]]. Nyandam's long attack animation can be exploited: use the [[Cat Cannon]] when his attack animation is about to finish to interrupt it and force Nyandam to restart the attack. A stack of [[Pirate Cat (Rare Cat)|Pirate Cats]] or [[Bean Cats (Special Cat)|Bean Cats]] in early-game can be used to stunlock him provided he's by himself, which can be used to cheese [[Last Gang]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 023 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Dark Emperor Nyandam |enemy_endesc1 = Angry that he isn't allowed to
drink anything alcoholic.
Shows off by pretending to drink.
The glass is filled with coffee jelly. |image1 = Enemy icon 023.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 悪の帝王なのにお酒が飲めない自分に
いらだちを覚え、酔った気分になる為に
全身を赤く染めたニャンダム。もちろん、
グラスの中身はコーヒーゼリーである。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Angry that he can't drink alcohol in spite of being an evil emperor,
so he dyed his whole body red
in order to feel drunk.
Of course, the contents of the glass are coffee jelly. |Enemy name (JP) = 悪の帝王ニャンダム (Aku no Teiou Nyandamu, Evil Emperor Nyandam)}} ==Variants== {{Variant |Director Kurosawah |Dark Emperor Nyandam's [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant, with better attack damage and range. |Li'l Nyandam |Has a bit more range and less time between his attacks than his older self. Appears at the end of [[Stories of Legend]] sub-chapter 23, [[Dead End Night]], from which he can be unlocked as a [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Cat Unit]]. |Dark Emperor Santa |A Christmas version of Nyandam with less health but more attack power, no delay between attacks and the ability to [[freeze]] the movement of [[Cat Units]]. Traited as [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]]. |Galactic Overseer Nyandam |An [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] version of Nyandam that has a chance to [[slow]] Cat Units. He also has longer range and more damage. |Satan Claus |Another Alien variant, with health on par with normal Nyandam variants but much less range, a significantly shorter delay between attacks, faster movement speed and the ability to [[warp]] back Cat Units. |Evil Emperor Cat |The enemy version of [[Emperor Cat (Legend Rare Cat)|Emperor Cat]], a Nyandam-like [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy found in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)|Prelude to Ruin]]. Deals relatively low damage but has an [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] reaching up to 620 range, while also being able to do powerful [[Surge Attack]]s with both curse and freeze effects. |Possessed Empress |The [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy version of [[Princess Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Empress Cat]], with an extremely strong [[Shield]], piercing range and guaranteed [[Mini-Wave]]s and slow. text-align:center" |Dark Emperor Nyandam in Princess Punt Sweets | style="width:20%;padding:2px; text-align:center" |Dark Emperor Nyandam, [[Princess Head (Enemy)|Princess Head]], [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]] and [[J.K Bun Bun (Red/Floating)|J.K Bun Bun]] on the boss rush sign |} {{Gallery|Enemy icon 023}} ==Trivia== *He is based on Satan, who is the "Emperor of Darkness". *Despite sharing no visual similarities, Nyandam is quite possibly a reference to Bibendum, mascot of the Michelin tyre company. ''Bibendum'' is pronounced ''Bibandamu'' (ビバンダム) in Japanese, while ''Nyandam'' is ''Ni~yandamu'' (ニャンダム). Furthermore, Bibendum was initially conceived as a regal figure holding a glass of beer and exclaiming the Latin phrase ''Nunc est bibendum'' ("Now is the time to drink"), while Nyandam ironically cannot drink. *His name was changed from "Nyandum" to "Nyandam" between the two English versions. *He appears during [[Benevolent Souma (Uber Rare Cat)|Souma & Cat]]'s attack animation. *In [[Yuru-i GeGeGe no Kitarou: Youkai Dotabata Daisensou]], [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Kagami-Jijii|Kagami-Jijii]] uses an attack strikingly similar to Dark Emperor Nyandam's. *[[The Face (Floating)|The Face]], Dark Emperor Nyandam and [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]] all share the same amount of health: 99,999. However, Nyandam only has [[Soul Leasing|one unbuffed appearance]], and Teacher Bun Bun is always fought at 400% or more. *He is the first enemy to appear above 100% strength magnification in his debut. *[[Sathankhamun VIII (Aku)|Sathankhamun VIII]]'s mask looks exactly like Dark Emperor Nyandam's face. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/025.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Teacher Bun Bun''' (ぶんぶん先生 ''Bun Bun-sensei'', '''Teacher Bun Bun''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy first seen as the boss of the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon/Iriomote]] stage in [[Empire of Cats]] Chapter 3. {{Enemy Info |name = Teacher Bun Bun |image = TeacherBunBunbattlecats.png |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Chapter 3 - Moon/Iriomote]]
'''SoL''': [[Cave Fillet|Sub-chapter 7 - Cave Fillet]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Rest Stop Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 45 - Rest Stop Sacrifice]] |money drop = 8,000¢ - 31,600¢ }} ==Enemy== Teacher Bun Bun is by far the toughest opponent faced in Empire of Cats, with much higher health and pushing power than any previously encountered enemy due to his rapid, short-ranged area attacks and high speed. He can and will destroy anything that enters his range (200) - that includes [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|UFO Cat]], [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]]. He may seem an impenetrable opponent, but he '''can''' be defeated with the proper strategy, an example being [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cats]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cats]] stacked in tandem with a continuous spam of "[[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]]" (e.g., [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]], [[Coin Cat (Special Cat)|Coin Cat]], [[Catburger (Special Cat)|Catburger]], [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Samba Cat]], etc) to delay and absorb his hits. ==Strategy== *It is highly recommended if not required to get all Superior [[Treasure]]s in all Empire of Cats Chapters (prioritize the [[Energy Drink]], [[Giant Safe]], [[Relativity Clock]], [[Super Register]], [[Legendary Cat Shield]], and [[Legendary Cat Sword]]) to make him manageable, along with upgrading every cat you're using to level 20. *Take advantage of his short reach and prioritize long-ranged attackers over tanks; Mythical Titan Cat can only take so many hits from him, but a gang of Dragon Cats and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cats]] can deal massive damage given enough time at a range advantage. *[[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Anti-Floating units]] with slow or freeze abilities like [[Delinquent Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Delinquent Cat]] and [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kotatsu Cat]] are quite helpful, provided they have enough range to land a hit on him. Even so, he is beatable without their assistance. *Later in the game, Teacher Bun Bun and most of his variants' pushing power decreases drastically despite their bulk and brute strength, due to the player having faster meatshields, like [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Tank Cat]], and powerful anti-floating [[True Form]]s such as [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cat]] and [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] to cripple them. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 024 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Teacher Bun Bun |enemy_endesc1 = Former Master of Teacher Bear.
His physical punishment is love.
Don't think. FEEL! |image1 = Enemy icon 024.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = クマ先生の恩師。体罰は愛情だ！と
叫びながら、すれ違うだけで殴ってくる
危険な先生。容赦ない拳はモンスター
ペアレントキラーとして期待されている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Former teacher of Teacher Bear. A dangerous teacher who
screams, "My physical punishment is love!"
while punching you. His merciless fist
is expected as a monster parent killer. |Enemy name (JP) = ぶんぶん先生 (Bun Bun-Sensei, Teacher Bun Bun)}} ==Variants== {{Variant |J.K Bun Bun |Teacher Bun Bun's [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant. Slightly smaller in aesthetic size. Stats are only slightly more than a 400% Teacher Bun Bun, but he has half the number of knockbacks. |Bun Bun Black |Teacher Bun Bun's [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant. Bigger in aesthetic size. Superior health, but has less speed and attack power than a 400% Bun Bun, as well as the same number of knockbacks. |Bun Bun Symbiote |Teacher Bun Bun's [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant. Biggest in aesthetic size. Has superior health & attack power, with half as many knockbacks and a 5% chance to create a Lv. 1 [[Wave Attack]]. |Li'l Bun Bun |A smaller variant of Teacher Bun Bun. Has lower health, attack power and range, but is much faster and appears in swarms along with extreme buffs. Has half the number of knockbacks. |Mecha-Bun |A visually mechanical variant of Teacher Bun Bun that serves as the final boss of [[Stories of Legend]]. Has a gigantic amount of health and damage, a faster attack rate, and piercing Omni Strikes. Despite having Mecha in its name, it's not considered a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy and keeps the floating trait. After clearing its debut stage, Mecha-Bun can be unlocked as a [[Mecha-Bun (Special Cat)|Legend Cat]]. |Relic Bun-Bun |Mecha-Bun's [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant. Attacks even faster, gets knocked back half as many times, has even longer reach, deals half as much damage, moves slower, and is guaranteed to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 10 seconds. (11f 0.37s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} :''*Note that these are Teacher Bun Bun's stats at 100% strength magnification; he does not appear at magnifications under 400% in any stage.'' ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Daibōsō=== Teacher Bun Bun was the main antagonist of [[Nyanko Daibōsō]], where he would periodically appear in front of the player's cat for a few seconds and drop coins every time he took damage. ===Nyanko Defense Force=== In [[Nyanko Defence Force]], Teacher Bun Bun and Relic Bun-Bun had several new variants that could be fought as bosses or Raid Bosses. They would constantly shoot large plasma balls from their mouths or their fists. Li'l Bun Bun was also present as a regular enemy, and would appear every now and then to create a barricade from attacking the enemy ships; if defeated, he would drop a plethora of rewards. Teacher Bun Bun's head could also be seen on the icons of two abilities: Boss Killer simply increased damage against all bosses by 50%, while Boss-chasing Shots allowed all shots to home in on bosses. ===Kyoutou Project=== During the game's collab with [[Kyoutou Project]], Teacher Bun Bun appeared in it as both an enemy and an obtainable collaboration unit. {| class="article-table" style="width: 500px;" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="1" border="0" |- ! colspan="2" scope="row" style="text-align:center;" | ぶんぶん先生 (Teacher Bun Bun) |- ! colspan="2" scope="row" style="text-align:center;" |Basic Stats |- ! scope="row" |Rarity | EX |- ! scope="row" |Cost |5,000 |- ! scope="row" |Health |6,700 |- ! scope="row" |Number of Attackers |1 |- ! scope="row" |Range | 60 |- ! scope="row" |Style |Proximity |- ! scope="row" |Attribute | Cat / Floating |- ! scope="row" |Damage |4,200 |- ! scope="row" |Number of Attacks |1 |- ! scope="row" |Speed |552 |} ===Mr.Ninja Fever!!=== He appeared as a Super Rare familiar obtainable via the gacha system. ===Princess Punt Sweets=== He appears as a boss enemy, along with [[J.K Bun Bun (Red/Floating)|J.K Bun Bun]]. ===Merc Storia=== He appears as a boss enemy (and possible 'drop' monster) in the collaboration quest. ===Metal Slug Defense=== He appears as a collaboration enemy and unit, along with [[Bun Bun Black (Black/Floating)|Bun Bun Black]]. {{Gallery|Enemy icon 024}} ==Trivia== *Teacher Bun Bun appears in [[Mystery Girl Yuki (Uber Rare Cat)|Mystery Girl Yuki]]'s attack animation; [[Bun Bun Black (Black/Floating)|Bun Bun Black]] appears in [[Crazed Yuki (Uber Rare Cat)|Crazed Yuki]]'s attack animation; [[J.K Bun Bun (Red/Floating)|J.K Bun Bun]] appears in [[Lost World Yuki (Uber Rare Cat)|Lost World Yuki]]'s attack animation. *He is the only Empire of Cats Moon boss without an event-exclusive variant (like [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] - [[Princess Head (Enemy)|Princess Head]]). *[[The Face (Floating)|The Face]], [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]] and Teacher Bun Bun all share the same amount of health: 99,999. However, Nyandam only has [[Soul Leasing|one unbuffed appearance]], and Teacher Bun Bun is always fought at 400% or more. *[[Crustaceous Scissorex (Alien / Behemoth)|Crustaceous Scissorex]]'s shell appears to be a Teacher Bun Bun's skull. This is further confirmed by the former's description mentioning his acquisition of Teacher Bun Bun's violent tendencies. *In [[The Battle Cats POP!]], Teacher Bun Bun is heavily nerfed as the attack frequency has been set to roughly 5 seconds. However, its other variants remain unchanged. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/026.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Master A.''' (師匠 ''Shishō'', '''Master''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Master A. |image = Master A.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Tapas Desert|Sub-chapter 2 - Tapas Desert]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Roast Meat, Not Cities|Sub-chapter 42 - Roast Meat, Not Cities]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Master A. has rapid area attacks at a great range. Although his damage per hit tends to be relatively low, he can often stunlock units he outranges by continually knocking them back before they can reach him, while eating through meatshields with ease. However, this leaves him open to attack from units that aren't knocked back easily. In later stages, he will be magnified heavily and will mostly be used as support instead of the main threat. ==Strategy== Master A. is protected by a legion of [[Those Guys]] and [[Croco]]s in his first appearance, [[Tapas Desert]]. While this may sound counterproductive, it is recommended to let him get close to the [[Cat Base]] so your attackers can reach him before the peons get in the way. If you don't have units that outrange him, use bulky cats such as [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]], or [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Titan Cat]] to deal chip damage, [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]]/[[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] such as [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Polevaulter Cat]] or [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Sexy Legs Cat]] to snipe him if there are other enemies to snipe him with, or use fast units such as [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Giraffe Cat]] and [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Butterfly Cat]] when there are fewer peons. In later stages, Long Distance and Waves will be your primary means of defeating him. Cats with very high range like [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]] and [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Dark Emperor Catdam]] can attack with impunity and will easily take down Master A. given enough time. [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Crazed Bahamut Cat]] will do no good, since Master A. has more range than him by just a fraction. Awakened Bahamut Cat fares better, as he can quickly rush in and inflict massive damage. This is also a better option because Master A. deals constant, fairly low damage, and will trigger Awakened Bahamut's many knockbacks, which will result in an immediate counter attack, but will also be his downfall if the Master A. in question is buffed enough to knockback Awakened Bahamut with each attack, rendering him useless unless aided by anti-traitless crowd-controlling units. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 031 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Master A. |enemy_endesc1 = Knows all the dirty stuff.

admire him and call him Master.

ひとつもないエロ博士。中学の友達には
師匠と呼ばれ尊敬されている。しかし、
女性とお付き合いした経験はまだ無い。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = There is nothing naughty that
this dirty professor does not know. Although he was
regarded as 'Master' by his middle school friends,
he still has no experience dating women. |Enemy name (JP) = 師匠 (Shishō, Master) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Teacher A. |An event enemy first seen in the [[Teacher! It's Spring! He has even longer range, higher damage and very high health. Just like Teacher A., he has a chance to slow your cats. |Project A |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of Master A. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''R.Ost''' (ダチョウ同好会 ''Dachō Dōkō-kai'', '''Ostrich Club''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = R.Ost |image = R.Ost.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Villains Jungle|Sub-chapter 17 - Villains Jungle]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Roast Meat, Not Cities|Sub-chapter 42 - Roast Meat, Not Cities]] |money drop = 1,080¢ - 4,270¢ }} ==Enemy== R.Ost is among the most well-equipped pushers in the game. He has fast movement speed, high health, enough range to hide behind most peons, and rapid Area Attacks that will shred your cats. The icing on the cake is his 10% [[Critical Hit]] chance which makes fighting him much more inconsistent. Fortunately, he has five knockbacks which reduces his heavy pushing power. At high strength magnifications (200% or above) R.Ost will out-perform similar bosses like Bores and Bun Buns, as as there are very few consistent traitless counters working against them. On mixed stages he will disrupt whatever strategy you are using to take down the traited enemies. The bottom line is that if there is a R.Ost on a stage, you need to account for it. ==Strategy== Long-ranged attackers such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Crazed Bahamut Cat]], ([[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed]]) [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and/or [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]] will do fine against R.Ost in earlier stages. However, in much later encounters, you may need the use of more [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|crowd-control]] against R.Ost. [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Tourist Cat]] and/or [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Glass Cat]] can be good at this, as long as using crowd-control is not exploitable by the other enemies in the stage. Another, less applicable strategy for R.Ost is to use Awakened Bahamut Cat. When used correctly, he can chip off an R.Ost by being timed to strike during R.Ost's backswing animation (the second peck), then let the R.Ost be finished by the rest of your attackers if Awakened Bahamut Cat did not kill said R.Ost. For this to work, Awakened Bahamut Cat must approach while R.Ost is frozen or during R.Ost's backswing and there can't be any other enemies in front of R.Ost. Freeze effects, such as the [[Ototo Development Team#Thunderbolt|Thunderbolt Cannon]] and [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Tourist Cat]], can make this easier to time and give more chances. Unfortunately, this tactic becomes less and less viable at higher magnifications where R.Ost could destroy Bahamut in two hits (or instantly on a critical hit) and has enough health to avoid being knocked back in even one, so you should mostly rely on your usual counters. Any unit exclusive to the [[EPICFEST (Gacha Event)|EPICFEST]] event will do very well against this avian atrocity. The [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] effect helps a lot too, so don't be afraid to save an extra slot for [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]]. Overall, this enemy is easy to counter on his own but can be a real pain when spawned in groups (e.g. in [[The Bathroom]], [[Procrastinator Parade]], and [[Caliban's Keeper]]) or with enemies that take advantage of his many knockbacks, such as [[Hannya (Red)|Hannya]] in [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|River Styx]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 032 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = R.Ost |enemy_endesc1 = Stressed about recent hair loss.
Yes, his last name is actually Ost.
His first name is Rich.
Can critical sometimes. |image1 = Enemy icon 032.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 最近、抜け毛が気になりはじめた
ダチョウ同好会。ちなみにダチョウ同
までが名字で、好会が名前である。
たまにクリティカルを放つ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Has recently started to worry about hair loss.
By the way, the ostriches are all identical
even up to their last name, and that name is Club.
Occasionally releases a Critical. |Enemy name (JP) = ダチョウ同好会 (Dachō Dōkō-kai, Ostrich Club) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Golden R.Ost |A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that only appears in the [[Golden Week Event|Golden Week]] and [[Silver Week (Celebration Event)|Silver Week]] events. It has the usual Metal ability of only taking 1 damage except for Critical Hits, but it has much lower stats all across the board and cannot perform Critical Hits itself. |M. Ost |The [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] version of R.Ost, with even higher health, damage, range and speed, but double the knockbacks. It has an unusually low money drop, so using a lot of your budget to kill it can be risky, especially if spawned in groups. ==Strategy== Large amounts of [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cats]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cats]] are good counters. Later on, when this enemy is buffed heavily, if it is not with a lot of support, you can use [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Flying Cat]] to inflict heavy damage, as the latter's short range is not much of a concern then. [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|Crowd-controllers]] like [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Lone Cat and Kitten]] and/or [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Onmyoji Cat]] are good at halting it, and units like [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]] or a stack of [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cats]] can also cripple them greatly. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 033 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Otta-smack-u |enemy_endesc1 = Earned the nickname by ganging up

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Kory''' (コアラッキョ, ''Koarakkyo'', '''Koalacchio''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Kory |image = Kory.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Flame Caldera|Sub-chapter 10 - Flame Caldera]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Three Evil Brothers|Sub-chapter 37 - Three Evil Brothers]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== Kory is first encountered in [[Stories of Legend]], having the ability to create a Level 4 [[Wave Attack]] that reaches up to 1067.5 range. Despite Kory having low speed and even damage, his wave attacks are very deadly to the point that even tanky cats like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] can be easily demolished. It's also needed to know the fact that he has base destroyer. ==Strategy== Like most [[:Category:Wave Attack Enemies|Wave Attackers]], Kory uses tanky but weak attacking Cats (e.g., [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]], [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Tank Cat]], [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Sushi Cat]]) to his advantage—they allow him to create more waves—so it's not recommended to use them at all unless there are other non-wave enemies supporting him. [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] is an obvious exception since it cancels Kory's waves and protects all Cats behind. To defeat Kory, it is recommended that the player tackles him with very strong and tanky cats such as [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]] and [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]]. Another option is using powerful midrangers such as [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] that also double as the only meatshields, thus preventing Kory from landing hits. [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] will usually not help much as he is easily knocked back (except for Awakened Bahamut, and it depends on the peons in the stage); however, with luck, Bahamut might land a hit and severely damage Kory. Decent ranged attackers such as [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] also help, especially when stacked, but beware of his waves as they can destroy your stack in no time. For this reason, [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] are recommended to keep your units safe wherever usable. Additionally, any [[:Category:Cats with Wave Immunity|Wave-Immune Cats]] are also recommended where using Wave Shields is not a viable idea so that they can still have a fighting chance even with a wayward Wave. It is recommended to beat Kory with Dragon Cat stacking when first encountered in [[Flame Caldera]], but he becomes increasingly deadly when backed up by other strong enemies such as the [[Bun Bun Black (Black/Floating)|Bun Bun Black]] in [[Labyrinth of Hades]]. The [[Moby Dick (Combo)|Moby Dick]] [[Cat Combo]] can be a great help because Island Cat and Crazed Whale Cat can tank many hits while dealing fine damage to Kory. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 034 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Kory |enemy_endesc1 = A really eccentric koala.
He was kicked out from zoo because of
food bills so is freeloading at Gory's house.
Gory is going to kick him out soon too. |image1 = Enemy icon 034.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 「波動」を放つ、エキセントリックコアラ。
半端無く高いエサ代で動物園を追放された。
しばらくゴリさんの家に居候していたが
やっぱりエサ代のせいで再び追い出された。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An eccentric koala that emits waves.
Was kicked out from the zoo because of an extremely high food bill.
He freeloaded at Gory's house for a while,
but was later kicked out again for the food bills. |Enemy name (JP) = コアラッキョ (Koarakkyo, Koalacchio) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Martin |A boss enemy found in the [[Sweetest Sorrow (Celebration Event)|Sweetest Sorrow]] Event. He has improved health, damage and speed, but is the only variant to lack wave attacks.|Berserkory |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of Kory. He is much more durable, with only one knockback and fires off level 12 wave attacks, but doesn't have base destroyer.|Koronium |A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of Kory. He only has a pathetic 150 health, but his high range and extreme damage remains threatening with his level 4 wave attacks. |Deathkory |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Kory. When first encountered in [[Flame Caldera]], he has 240,000 HP and deals 2,800 damage.'' ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Defense Force=== In [[Nyanko Defence Force]], Kory had many new variants that could be fought as Raid Bosses. They had two attacks: they could summon a cascade of falling icicles from the top of the screen, and they could shoot giant icicles from their hatchets, which would then split into six smaller projectiles. Some units had an ability called Kory Killer, which increased damage against all Kory variants by 50%. {{Gallery|Enemy icon 034}} ==Trivia== *He was the first character to have [[Wave Attack]]s. **In terms of ID, Kory is also the first character to have Base Destroyer, but not the first to appear in-game: [[Camelle]] is encountered earlier and was added in the same update in spite of having a higher ID. *In [[Nyanko Defence Force]], he was the only boss to lack a non-Raid variant. **Since the Frozen Kory Raid Boss was the first Kory added to the game, he was used as the base for all the others, hence why even the fire variants used icicles to attack. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/036.html ----

Goode]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Boiling Blood|Sub-chapter 41 - Boiling Blood]] }} ==Enemy== With 550 standing range, Camelle outranges an overwhelming majority of non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare]] Cat Units in the game. On top of that, Camelle has constant and devastating attacks, the Base Destroyer ability, and only 2 knockbacks. ==Strategy== Similarly to [[Master A.]], Camelle will usually kill units such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] and [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Wolf]] before they can do much to him. Also like Master A., he's protected by an endless stream of peons in his [[Chubby B. Goode|debut stage]], so let him get close to the [[Cat Base]] and fire the [[Cat Cannon]] to create an opening. Use tanky and semi-spammable units like [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]] to best deal with Camelle, and speedy units like [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Giraffe Cat]], [[Crazed Cow Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Giraffe Cat]] and [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|True Valkyrie Cat]]. If you have [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]] or [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]], their [[Wave Attack]]s/Long Distance attacks can easily wear him down given enough time. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 035 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Camelle |enemy_endesc1 = Born in Arabia and loves to go to the sauna.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Owlbrow''' (まゆげどり ''Mayu-ge Dori'') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Owlbrow |image = OwlbrowBattle.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[The Wind Blows|Sub-chapter 9 - The Wind Blows]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Immortal Zenith|Sub-chapter 43 - Immortal Zenith]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== Owlbrow is similar to [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]] but with a much lower money drop, and hits much heavier in exchange for reduced attack rate and movement speed. His long backswing allows him to hide behind enemies that have a higher range than him, such as [[Li'l Eraser Cat (Enemy)|Li'l Eraser Cat]] in [[Tiny Will (Deadly)|Tiny Will]], because units tend to walk back into his range during his backswing, causing him to stay in place during the next attack. Fortunately, Owlbrowl's health isn't too high for the threat it poses. ==Strategy== The main feature of Owlbrow is the ability to obliterate close/mid-ranged attackers such as [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hip Hop Cat]], [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Swimmer Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Mer-Cat]] and many crowd controllers like [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]], because they get outranged. Of course, this is not always the case, provided your levels. Still, stalling him is pretty easy, and this allows attackers that outrange him to safely attack. The most effective counter to him is hands down [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]], since this enemy is often encountered in groups and protected by peons, but [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard]]/[[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Lizard Cat]] or [[Archer Cat (Rare Cat)|Cataur]] could also be used to pick them off one by one. Another option is to snipe them using [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave]] or [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]] attackers like [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]] or [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Vaulter Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 037 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Owlbrow |enemy_endesc1 = Doesn't look his age. He's 78.
The doctor told him to walk more.
Complains a lot because he is treated as
a Floating enemy when he's just walking. |image1 = Enemy icon 037.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = こう見えて実は78歳の老人である。
健康のためにいつも歩いて移動しているが
ややこしいので浮いてる敵扱いに
されたことを毎日グチっている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Is 78 years old despite his looks.
He complains a lot every day because he's treated
as a Floating enemy due to complications
despite always moving on foot to stay healthy. |Enemy name (JP) = まゆげどり (Mayu-ge Dori)}} ==Variants== {{Variant |Drac-owl-la |A larger variant introduced in [[All Hallows Road (Celebration Event)|All Hallows Road]]. Can knockback [[Cat Units]] and has more health, damage and range, but moves slower and has an additional knockback. |Pterowl Hazuku |A [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant that has way better stats overall besides speed and attack rate while also packing many new abilities like [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] and a 20% chance to create a Lv.1 [[Special Abilities#Surge Attacks|Surge Attack]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 10: [[Maldives (Aku Realm)|Maldives]] (200%) *Stage 18: [[Ghana (Aku Realm)|Ghana]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 9-4: [[The Wind Blows]] (100%) *Stage 10-3: [[Thick Magma]] (100%) *Stage 17-3: [[Underground Base]] (400%) *Stage 18-3: [[Harry Tunnel]] (400%) *Stage 19-3: [[Prison Destruction]] (200%) *Stage 20-5: [[Outsider's Gate]] (400%) *Stage 24-2: [[Angry Fighting]] (800%) *Stage 28-4: [[Beautiful Finale]] (1,000%) *Stage 29-2: [[Mysterious Order]] (1,000%) *Stage 30-2: [[Overachiever Central]] (800%) *Stage 31-5: [[Heavenly Creatures]] (800%) *Stage 32-5: [[Leadfoot Drive]] (1,000%) *Stage 47-4: [[Last Labyrinth]] (1,000%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 14-6: [[Wonders of Nature]] (1,200%) *Stage 18-2: [[The Night of Claws]] (1,200%) *Stage 20-5: [[Bell Collector]] (1,200%) *Stage 21-3: [[Gas-Powered Birds]] (1,200%) *Stage 23-3: [[Poison Bog Cure]] (1,200%) *Stage 24-4: [[Despotism at Home]] (1,200%) *Stage 27-1: [[The Prince's Woods]] (1,200%) *Stage 36-6: [[The Face of God]] (1,200%) *Stage 40-2: [[Breathtaking Waves]] (1,200%) *Stage 43-6: [[Immortal Zenith]] (1,200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Tank: [[Absolute Defence (Insane)]] (300%) *[[Teacher! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Bore''' (イノシャシ, ''Inoshashi'', "'''Shy Bore'''") is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Bore |image = Bore.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Carapaccio Waters|Sub-chapter 7 - Carapaccio Waters]]
'''ItF''': [[Mexico (Into the Future)|Chapter 2 - Mexico]]
'''CotC''': [[Plumpit (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Plumpit]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[The Great Sufferer|Sub-chapter 38 - The Great Sufferer]] |money drop = 2,100¢ - 8,295¢ }} ==Enemy== Bore has considerably high health and moderate attack damage which is coupled with a quick attack animation and rate. All in all, he's basically a powerful successor of [[One Horn (Red)|One Horn]] with more range and much more movement speed. ==Strategy== Bore is able to push easily, so a strong front line is necessary. Use three or four meatshields and hold the front line while your other cats destroy him. In his first few appearances, this enemy can be somewhat difficult to stall without [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red units]] who inflict status effects. These include but are not limited to: [[Pirate Cat (Rare Cat)|Pirate Cat]] for knockback, [[Witch Cat (Rare Cat)|Witch Cat]] for slowing and [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Apple Cat]] or [[Evil Cat (Rare Cat)|Evil Cat]] for freezing. The use of such units, alongside proper meatshields, will make Bore manageable. Later on, a way of beating him without any [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|crowd-controllers]] is to spam anti-Red attackers such as talented [[Dom Cat (Special Cat)|Dark Lazer]], [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]], preferably with [[Cat Combo]]s like [[Seasons of Love (Combo)|Seasons of Love]] and [[Three Kings (Combo)|Three Kings]]. Provided your cats are sufficiently leveled and Bore isn't too buffed, this will quickly diminish his health down to nothing. That being said, this strategy becomes less and less effective in later Bore appearances, where his magnification can reach or exceed 400%, dealing too much damage for said attackers to handle. As with the majority of red enemies, if you spawn two iCats in such a way that they alternate their attacks, Bore can be completely paralyzed, allowing you to whittle him down easily. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 038 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Bore |enemy_endesc1 = Always thought his name was the
correct way to spell what he is.
Turned really red after introducing himself.
"I am a bore" |image1 = Enemy icon 038.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = イノシシのシシはライオンの獅子だと
ずっと思いこんでいたが違うことを
同僚に知らされ、あまりの恥ずかしさに
赤くなったイノシシ。根はマジメ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Always thought "boar meat" meant he was a lion*
and turned red with embarrassment
when a colleague corrected him.
His nature is serious.
* The joke relies on 'meat' and 'lion' being homophones in Japanese. |Enemy name (JP) = イノシャシ (Inoshashi, Shy Bore)}} ==Variants== {{Variant |Nimoy Bore |[[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant of Bore. Inferior speed and attack rate, but has more health and 50% chance to knockback [[Cat Units]]. |Boraphim |[[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of Bore. Much stronger and moves significantly faster, but has 5 knockbacks as opposed to the usual 2 on most others. |Razorback |[[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of Bore. Has extremely high health, speed and DPS, while strengthening by 50% at 50% health|Dread Bore |[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of Bore. Stats are similar to Bore's except for speed, which is slightly lower than Boraphim's. It has a long burrow distance among Zombies, and revives once with 50% HP. |Li'l Bore |A smaller, much weaker variant of Bore found in [[Year's First Dawn|You Nears! 2019]] and [[Most Appearances 2020]]. Can be easily defeated. |Bore Jr. |[[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of Bore. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''THE SLOTH''' (ナマルケモルル ''Namarukemoruru'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = THE SLOTH |image = THESLOTHBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Salty is Seawater|Sub-chapter 4 - Salty is Seawater]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[The Face of God|Sub-chapter 36 - The Face of God]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== THE SLOTH is one of the slowest enemy units in the game in terms of speed and attack rate, but he can inflict upwards of 8,000 damage on multiple Cat Units. He can stall your Cats for a remarkably long time, making him extremely deadly, especially when used as support instead of the main threat in stages like [[Honey Trap (Deadly)|Honey Trap]], [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)|Attack on W-Cyclone]] and [[Pitfall Zone]], where he easily wipes out your Cats while being protected by either peon spam or other powerful enemies, like White Cyclone, Queen B, and Director Kurosawah. In later stages however, THE SLOTH usually just becomes a wall with high health that doesn't attack often enough to be a major threat since he's so easy to stall. ==Strategy== THE SLOTH is usually being defended by peons in the stages that he appears in. As such, a good strategy is to lure him as close to the [[Cat Base]] as possible, delaying support from other enemies. [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed M. Titan Cat]] can then be used to deal heavy damage, while usually being able to survive at least one attack. Do note that while THE SLOTH can easily stall your Cats, your Cats can also stall him, using his advantage to yours. When there is little to no support, simply throwing in periodic [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Cats]] can help stall him while you build up cash for your onslaught. Alternatively, units with over 450 range, such as [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Li'l Nyandam]], will be able to deal damage to THE SLOTH without being hit by his attack. After completing (and if you have completed) all 3 chapters of [[Into the Future]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] can be used to deal massive amounts of damage during his long attack interval, but be sure to time Bahamut well to maximize damage. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 039 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = THE SLOTH |enemy_endesc1 = The scariest of all animals
manages to get off the tree... Unfortunately, moving is too much
so he says he wants to go home now. |image1 = Enemy icon 039.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 木の上から降臨した最強の猛獣。
…のはずだったが、地面に降りると移動が
しんどすぎて早く木の上に帰りたがっている
やる気の無いナマケモノ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The ultimate beast, crawling down from the treetops
to exterminate the Cats. ...That was his plan. However, moving on the ground was too much for him,
and he now wants to climb back up to his house in the trees. |Enemy name (JP) = ナマルケモルル (Namarukemoruru) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Lucky Sloth |An enemy from the [[Ritual Happiness (Monthly Event)|Ritual Happiness]] event. Attacks faster, but has a lower attack range. |Elder Sloth |An [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant of THE SLOTH, with increased speed, range, and 100% chance to knockback Cat Units. |Mercury Sloth|A [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of THE SLOTH. Has a faster attack rate, but lower range and damage. |THE FOLIVOREAN|An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of THE SLOTH with much higher stats, a [[Shield]] and a [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] attack that has different effective ranges. It also has a 40% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cats for 3 seconds and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Wave Immunity]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 4-8: [[Salty is Seawater]] (100%) *Stage 5-3: [[Enticing Tunnels]] (100%) *Stage 5-6: [[Thriller Bridge]] (100%) *Stage 7-6: [[Tactical War Tuna]] (100%) *Stage 8-5: [[Dumpy Cave]] (200%) *Stage 14-3: [[Crunchy Wall]] (200%) *Stage 14-6: [[Disapproving Giant]] (200%) *Stage 16-6: [[Ancient One-Piece]] (100%) *Stage 18-5: [[Pitfall Zone]] (100%) *Stage 20-1: [[Gandara's Rest]] (300%) *Stage 22-1: [[The Red Carpet]] (400%) *Stage 24-6: [[Scent of Gore & Fish]] (200%) *Stage 25-3: [[Kugel Schreiber]] (200%) *Stage 27-4: [[Cursed Blizzards]] (400%) *Stage 34-2: [[Swamp of Sacrifice]] (400%) *Stage 44-4: [[Dry Season]] (400%) *Stage 47-2: [[Valley of the End]] (500%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 4-5: [[Frontier Dawn]] (600%) *Stage 14-1: [[Holiday Atonement]] (400%) *Stage 17-4: [[Chilly Pool]] (300%) *Stage 24-2: [[Slave to Energy]] (400%) *Stage 26-5: [[Meteor Disco]] (400%) *Stage 32-6: [[A Pile of Guts]] (400%) *Stage 36-6: [[The Face of God]] (500%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Bears be Bare (Monthly Event)|Bears be Bare]]: [[Can't Bear Anymore]] (100%) *Peerless: [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)]] (150%) *[[Teacher! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Rain D.''' (ナカイくん ''Nakai-kun'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Rain D. |image = RainDBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Frontier Spirit|Sub-chapter 8 - Frontier Spirit]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Reincarnation Ring|Sub-chapter 36 - Reincarnation Ring]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== Rain D. is a large, fast-moving enemy with moderately high health. At 100% strength magnification, his headbutt attacks deal about 5,000 damage each. Rain D. also notoriously has an extremely high knockback count and deceptively long range (300) along with a fast attack rate, making him quite the threat when guarded by and supporting enemies with few to no knockbacks. Although intimidating when buffed, this enemy becomes somewhat easier to deal with later on in the game, due to an abundance of [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]]/[[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attack units]] such as [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Vaulter Cat]] and [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]]. ==Strategy== To stall Rain D, use a few units that deal enough damage to knock him back while outranging him, such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cat]], or [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], so that he doesn't quickly shred your defenses before you store up enough cash to deploy heavier hitters such as [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|True Valkyrie Cat]] or [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Cat]]. Sending [[Cat (Normal Cat)|the]] [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|cheapest]] [[Gold Cat (Super Rare Cat)|meatshields]] (75¢) on different intervals can help to effectively stall Rain D. while accumulating cash. His knockback count can be annoying or helpful in the right situation. If constant damage is dealt to him, he can be kept in a knockback cycle until he's defeated. A good example of units that can do this are [[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge Attackers]], such as [[Kasli the Scourge (Uber Rare Cat)|Ritual Saint Kasli]] and [[Kasli the Bane (Uber Rare Cat)|Kasli the Bane]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 040 |enemy category = White |Enemy name = Rain D. |enemy_endesc1 = Gets really depressed when Christmas
comes around. Also hates Red.
Don't ask why.
Give the poor guy a break. |image1 = Enemy icon 040.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 歌唱力にはとっても自信のあるナカイくん。

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dagshund''' (だっふんど ''Daffundo'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dagshund |image = DagshundBattle.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Hyaluronan Mountain|Sub-chapter 3 - Hyaluronan Mountain]]
'''CotC''': [[Earth (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Earth]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Lonely Goldfish|Sub-chapter 20 - Lonely Goldfish]] |money drop = 700¢ - 2,765¢ }} ==Enemy== Dagshund has slow movement speed but attacks quickly with high area damage; yet his slow animation and low range balances this out. He isn't intimidating alone, but he is usually spawned in groups or rapidly when included in a level. However, in later stages, due to his singular knockback, this enemy will often be used as a wall with high HP, like in [[Pecking Order]] and [[Ultimate Shrine]]. ==Strategy== Dagshund, despite his sheer offense, is somewhat easy to stall consistently. The best thing to do would be to spam defensive units ([[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]], etc...) while having [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] take him out. Stacking [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cats]] or [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cats]] can also work if you have enough meatshields to stall the Dagshund. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 041 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Dagshund |enemy_endesc1 = Tries really hard to be human.

turn around in circles and speak.

したくて二足歩行までは何とかマスター。
あとは手を突き出して、くるくる回して
最後に自分の名前を言えば完成である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Saw an impression of [Ken Shimura's] weird uncle on TV.

description:
Tries really hard to be human.
All he needs to do now is stick out his arms,
turn around in circles and speak.
Please feed him when he does this.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Celeboodle''' (セレブ ''Serebu'', '''Celeb''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]] and the [[Catclaw Dojo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Celeboodle |image = Celeboodle.png |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[France (Into the Future)|Chapter 3 - France]]
'''SoL''': [[Isoflavone Cave|Sub-chapter 3 - Isoflavone Cave]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 700¢ - 2,765¢ }} ==Enemy== One Celeboodle has power to destroy your cats easily, but fortunately, she is a single-target attacker, so spamming meatshields can easily stall her. This enemy is usually spawned in groups, but it rarely makes too much of a difference. ==Strategy== Though she deals a lot of damage and has a moderate attack rate, Celeboodle is not an Area Attack enemy. She has rather low health and is considered a glass cannon. The best strategy is to spam [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshield-class cats]] ([[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]], etc.) to protect any powerful cats, such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] or any other long-ranged [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attacker]]. Again, one strike from a Bahamut Cat can usually put a stop to these these pesky poodles, while giving a fair amount of money back. In mid-game, this enemy becomes as threatening as a giant money bag. Even large groups (such as the ones present in [[Sweet XP (Insane)]]) can be controlled by Area Attackers like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] or [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]]. However, in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]], she becomes more threatening again, due to the intense buffs and the fact that she is combined with stronger enemies. It will take high-damage units such as [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Teacher BearCat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]], [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] and [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] a few hits to dispatch this enemy. Additionally, she will kill [[:Category:Tanker-class Cats|tankers]] very quickly, so they are ineffective. If you are using [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rushers]], like Awakened Bahamut Cat, make sure there are enough meatshields to stall Celeboodle before sending them out. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 042 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Celeboodle |enemy_endesc1 = Female college student
who enjoys chit-chat with her girls
every afternoon at high end cafes.
Her friends secretly hate her. |image1 = Enemy icon 042.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 現役女子大生の彼女の午後はいつもの
カフェでティータイム。友人たちと
他愛の無い話で楽しむその時間は、
正直みんなうんざりしている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Female college student
whose typical afternoon is tea time with her girls
at the cafe. To be honest, everyone is sick of the
time they enjoy talking to their friends with no other love. |Enemy name (JP) = セレブ (Serebu, Celeb) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Sunny Celeboodle |Celeboodle takes her [[Never Summer! (Monthly Event)|summer]] vacation! Her sunshade hits multiple units and gives her even more range, while she knocks smoother so as not to break a nail. |Mistress Celeboodle |An [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant of Celeboodle, with much more damage, and an ability to gain attack at 75% health. |Selena |Sunny Celeboodle's [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant. description:
Female college student
who enjoys chit-chat with her girls
every afternoon at high end cafes.
Her friends secretly hate her.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''H. Nah ''' (ハイ・エナジー, ''Hai Enajī'', '''High Energy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = H.Nah |image = HNahBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Star Ocean|Sub-chapter 16 - Star Ocean]] |money drop = 1,101¢ - 4,349¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Learned to Hate|Sub-chapter 38 - Learned to Hate]] }} ==Enemy== At first sight he may seem like a [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]] with buffed stats. Similar range to Mooth too, at 344. While decently fast, his pushing power is tremendously reduced when you are meatshielding against him. He also has high health and knockback count. Along with a 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] all [[Cat Units]], you can pretty much guaranteed that almost any unit below 350 range won't stand a chance against any quantity of H. Nahs. ==Strategy== Because of his 100% chance to knockback, 350+ range units are basically required unless it is a [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rusher]]. Pile up ranged cats such as [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]] or [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|King Dragon Cat]] while spamming [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]] ([[Cat (Normal Cat)|Mohawk Cat]], [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]], etc.). [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]] are especially good here, since they have Area Attack. To make the knockbacks less constant, it's recommended to use the default [[Cat Cannon]] to sync them up in a pinch. Out of all the "big units" you could throw out against a pack of H. Nahs, one of the best choices is someone any player can recruit two chapters away from H. Nah's debut stage: [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Wolf]]. With a knockback effect of her own, she has a chance to sync up the H. Nahs every time she attacks, and she attacks quite often. [[:Category:Cats with Knockback Immunity|Knockback-immune cats]] are also heavy units that you can use against H. Nah, such as [[Sodom (Uber Rare Cat)|God-Emperor Sodom]] or [[Kai (Uber Rare Cat)|Divine Kai]], if they can also outrange H. Nah, then they will be much more helpful. Units with long backswing and no time between attacks have a rebound attack which will also work in favor with H. Nah's knockback, but if they don't then that is fine to. Some examples are [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] and [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Sanada Yukimura]], although this is less viable later on the game where buffs can escalate his damage to the point where he kills most rusher units outright or inflict enough damage to stagger the unit. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 043 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = H. Nah |image1 = Enemy icon 043.png |enemy_endesc1 = His first name is Hy-ee (Hi E)
Always says No. Works food disposal.
Forever alone. Says no to everyone.
Everyone stays away from him. |Enemy name (JP) = ハイ・エナジー (Hai Enajī) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 俺は孤独な一匹オオカミさ・・・と
ハイエナのくせに語る、残飯処理係。
孤独を好み、近づく奴らを
100％ふっとばす嫌なヤツ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This hyena is in charge of disposing of leftover food
and has a habit of saying, "I'm a lonely little wolf..."
A nasty guy who prefers to be alone
and has a 100% chance to knockback those who approach him. }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Red EnerG |The [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of H. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dober P.D''' (ダディ ''Dadi'', '''Daddy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dober P.D |image = PD.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Jailer in the Morgue|Sub-chapter 17 - Jailer in the Morgue]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Chiefs' Smoking Area|Sub-chapter 45 - Chiefs' Smoking Area]] |money drop = 1,600¢ - 6,320¢ }} ==Enemy== Dober P.D. is essentially a stronger [[Kory]], filling the niche of a tanky [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] [[:Category:Wave Attack Enemies|wave attacker]]. He moves quite slowly but sports a massive health pool (800,000 at 100% strength magnification) and only two knockbacks. Dober's attacks are close-ranged Area Attacks, and whenever he successfully hits a cat he has a 33% chance to do a powerful Lv.3 [[Wave Attack]]. Overall, Dober P.D is a challenging enemy to defeat due to the lack of units specialized to deal with [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemies. ==Strategy== A good way to deal with him and his wave attacks is to stack many ranged units with '''no meatshields''' so as not to trigger his waves (namely [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]], [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|King Dragon Cat]], [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Dragon Cat]] and [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]]). When supporting enemies are present, release only 1 type of meatshield, preferably one that is slow ([[Cat (Normal Cat)|Mohawk]] or [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]], ''maybe'' [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Cats]]) so that they won't plow through your stack and that Dober P.D will occasionally miss. Since Dober P.D is naturally slow, freeze and knockback effects are effective against him. [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]] may help with her occasional knockbacks, and [[Sniper the Cat]] item is recommended against him too. Later in the game, [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Macho Crystal Cat]] and [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Tourist Cat]] are extremely effective, as Dober will barely even more in their resence. [[:Category:Cats with Wave Immunity|Cats that are immune to waves]] ([[Anubis the Protector (Uber Rare Cat)|Anubis the Protector]], [[Togeluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Togelan Pasalan]]), especially those that are also [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|anti-Traitless]]) (such as [[EPICFEST (Gacha Event)|EPICFEST]] exclusives [[Shadow Gao (Uber Rare Cat)|Shadow Gao]], [[Dark Mitama (Uber Rare Cat)|Dark Mitama]] and [[D'arktanyan (Uber Rare Cat)|D'arktanyan]]) are particularly useful against Dober P.D. With the help of [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]], there can always be an [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]], provided it is sufficiently leveled. With Octopus Cat's Wave Shield, units like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]] can get lots of free damage on Dober P.D, but be careful; because of Octopus Cat's low range, it will eventually die, leaving them unprotected. A [[Eva Unit-00 (Uber Rare Cat)|ranged]] [[Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo (Uber Rare Cat)|Wave]] [[Cat Machine (Uber Rare Cat)|Shield]] is even more useful. [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] with a level 10 Survive [[Talents|Talent]] can prove very effective against him, even more with her Resist Wave Talent, provided she is used in the same way you would fight against [[Kappy Jr.]] (no meatshielding combined with crowd-control units). This strategy becomes even more effective if you have "Research" Effect UP [[Cat Combo|Combos]], such as [[Biohazard (Combo)|Biohazard]], [[Bony Bone (Combo)|Bony Bone]], [[Cheating Heart? (Combo)|Cheating Heart?]], and [[Kimono Champs (Combo)|Kimono Champs]]. This works because Cameraman Cat outranges Dober P.D, and her Survive ability as well as, if desired, Wave Resist Talent allows her to take a wave attack to the face. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 044 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Dober P.D |enemy_endesc1 = Can use wave attacks.
Recently retired from the Police Dept.
(Actually lost his job to German Shepherds)
Seen with Celeboodle... a lot. |image1 = Enemy icon 044.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 波動を放つ、13匹のお父さん。
いつでもダンディなそのいでたちで
7回の結婚と52回の浮気暦を持つ。
黒に近いグレーだが黒くは無い。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Father of 13, creates waves.
Is dressed like a dandy at all times
and has had 7 marriages and 52 affair calendars.
His color is gray, close to black, but he isn't a Black enemy. |Enemy name (JP) = ダディ (Dadi, Daddy) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |St. Dober |An [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angelic]] variant of Dober P.D. Has very high stats overall, with [[Surge Attack]]s instead of waves, and has piercing Omni Strikes past his low standing range.}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 17-8: [[Jailer in the Morgue]] (100%) *Stage 19-6: [[Pigpen Taboo]] (100%) *Stage 20-3: [[Godiego Pass]] (100%) *Stage 22-3: [[The VIP Room]] (100%) *Stage 23-5: [[Agape's Cage]] (100%) *Stage 25-3: [[Kugel Schreiber]] (100%) *Stage 29-5: [[Darkweb]] (150%) *Stage 31-2: [[Twilight Poachers]] (150%) *Stage 36-2: [[Rickety Coaster]] (150%) *Stage 40-4: [[Gulag of Love]] (150%) *Stage 47-5: [[Cave Conclusion]] (150%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 8-6: [[Revolver Ridge]] (200%) *Stage 18-6: [[Slave to Instinct]] (200%) *Stage 21-4: [[Stars in the Sewers]] (200%) *Stage 28-2: [[Anatomy Forest]] (200%) *Stage 37-2: [[Disaster Cycle]] (200%) *Stage 45-4: [[Chiefs' Smoking Area]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[The Dom Awakens! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Doge Dark''' (殺意のわんこ ''Satsui no Wanko'', '''Killer Doggy''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]] and the [[Catclaw Dojo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Doge Dark |image = DogeDarkBattle2.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Sleeping Lion|Sub-chapter 1 - Sleeping Lion]]
'''ItF''': [[Thailand (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Thailand]]
'''CotC''': [[Uranus (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Uranus]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Shinobi Showdown|Sub-chapter 44 - Shinobi Showdown]] |money drop = 400¢ - 1,580¢ }} ==Enemy== Doge Dark is far stronger and faster compared to Doge, though still pales in comparison to other Black enemies. Doge Darks can appear in swarms and are very dangerous in later levels when their stats are multiplied, especially with 2-crown, 3-crown or 4-crown stages, where their damage can exceed '''75,000 each'''. Doge Dark is not too much of a threat alone, but they become increasingly annoying throughout [[Legend Stages]] with high magnifications and spam. In [[Star Ocean]], [[Marco Po Road]] and [[Umibozu's House]], Doge Dark is given a progressive strength buff. Doge Dark drops a high amount of money for how easy it is to kill. ==Strategy== Doge Dark is rather easy to kill in small numbers, but they can quickly kill off a horde of [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]] in larger groups, and even a few can cause some trouble at higher buffs. Cheap [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] with high attack power (like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ring Girl Cat]] or [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cats]]) can make quick work of a group of them, but Doge Dark can kill them easily if unprotected, so be sure to back them up with meatshields. [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] can instantly kill them and get extra money, though it may require [[Catseye]]s to beat stronger Doge Darks, until they're buffed to a point where you'd rather chip one down a little before sending Maglev. Can Can also works well for the same purpose. Later on, Doge Dark becomes a peon for stronger Black enemies, like [[Shadow Boxer K (Black)|Shadow Boxer K]], [[Director Kurosawah (Black)|Director Kurosawah]], or [[Bun Bun Black (Black/Floating)|Bun Bun Black]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 046 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Doge Dark |enemy_endesc1 = One day Doge picked up a flyer
and found work as a part time killer.
Works hard everyday to make
money to get into prep school. |image1 = Enemy icon 046.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ある日の折り込みチラシに書いてあった
アルバイト募集で殺し屋のバイトを始めた
黒いわんこ。日々、まじめに働いて
予備校の学費を稼いでいる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A black dog who started working as a part-time hitman
after picking up a recruitment flyer one day.
Studying with diligence every day,
it earns money for prep school. |Enemy name (JP) = 殺意のわんこ (Satsui no Wanko, Killer Doggy)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} {{:Doge Dark (Black)/Encounters}} ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Doge Dark |Health = 5,000 HP |Attack Power = 2,000 damage
(1,463 DPS) |Attack Range = 110
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 41f 1.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 30 |Knockback = 8 times |Occurrence = 4f 0.13s
(37f 1.23s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Black }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Defence Force=== UFO Doge Darks were the third most common class of UFO Doge in [[Nyanko Defence Force]]. Like most normal enemies, they could rarely appear as sparking, which would drop either an item or a type of gem. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:Darkdogeship.png|center|100px]] | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:Glowingdark.png|center|100px]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-right:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | UFO Doge Dark | style="width:20%;padding:2px; text-align:center" | Shiny UFO Doge Dark |} ==Gallery== Doge Dark(bcp).png|Doge Dark's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] 46 e.png|Doge Dark's spritesheet IdleDogeDark.gif|Doge Dark's moving animation ==Trivia== *It can be presumed that Doge Dark came to be after finding one of Assassin Bear's distributed flyers. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/048.html ----

description:
One day Doge picked up a flyer
and found work as a part time killer.
Works hard everyday to make
money to get into prep school.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Metal Hippoe''' (メタルカバちゃん ''Metarukaba-chan'', '''Metal Hippo-chan''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Metal Hippoe |image = [[File:MetalHippoeBattle.jpg]] |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Return of Terror|Sub-chapter 1 - Return of Terror]]
'''ItF''': [[Greece (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Greece]]
'''CotC''': [[Triton (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Triton]] |money drop = 400¢ - 1580¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Cloak of Hiding|Sub-chapter 42 - Cloak of Hiding]] }} ==Enemy== Metal Hippoe is a stronger version of the regular [[Hippoe]]. Its attack rate is faster, and it only takes one damage from non-critical hits. At 100% strength magnification, it has 80 health and two knockbacks. Depending on the stage, it can be either annoying or helpful, which is expanded upon in the lower paragraph. In some stages, Metal Hippoe can act as an annoying tank, such as in [[Chubby B. Goode]] and [[Prison Destruction]], and other times it can be a help for stalling as you build up long-ranged cats, like in [[Tunafish Trenches]] or [[Church of Mercator (Merciless)|Church of Mercator]]. ==Strategy== While it may seem tough when you first encounter it, quick attackers, such as [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]], [[Mr. (Special Cat)|Mr.]] and [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Rocker Cat]], are able to easily defeat it due to their quick attack speed. Alternatively, you can use [[Moneko (Special Cat)|Moneko]], [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Cat]] or [[Jurassic Cat (Rare Cat)|Jurassic Cat]] and hope for a [[Critical Hit]]. [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Catornado]] absolutely destroys Metal Hippoe due to his very high attack rate. Units with guaranteed critical chance can help at destroying it quickly, though this may not be necessary given its somewhat weak offense.. Another way is to use it’s mediocre stats to your advantage. Using slow-attacking units to slowly whittle its health down while you build up a stack of [[Special Abilities|Long-Distance]] units to use for later. This technique is call “Long-Distance step stone” or “LD step stone” for short. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 047 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Metal Hippoe |enemy_endesc1 = A certain organization decided to
experiment and make Hippoe's body metal.
Appears to be weak to critical attacks. |image1 = Enemy icon 047.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 連邦政府の改造手術により生まれ変わった
ハガネの肉体を持った改造カバ。
クリティカルな攻撃が弱点らしい。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A remodeled hippopotamus with a body of steel,
reborn via the remodeling surgery of the federal government.

"'''Elizabeth II'''") is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]], and the [[Catclaw Dojo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = St. Pigge the 2nd |image = StPiggethe2ndBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Melancholy Damp|Sub-chapter 1 - Melancholy Damp]]
'''CotC''': [[Crimson Star (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 2 - Crimson Star]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Spiralling Ring|Sub-chapter 32 - Spiralling Ring]] }} ==Enemy== St. Pigge the 2nd is a supersized version of the original [[Pigge (Red)|Pigge]] that wears a fancy crown on her head. She has more knockbacks, faster attacks and high health. This enemy sometimes arrives in squadrons with a high strength magnification, so stay alert. Later in the game, she is often countered at a strength magnification of 2,000% in 1-crown, making her an annoying and tanky foe to fight, especially when in squadrons like mentioned previously. ==Strategy== She can be slightly difficult without [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]] or [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red Cats]]. She can easily destroy [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]] if they are underleveled. However, her main weakness is that she is Red. She can easily be killed by anti-Red [[:Category:Gacha Cats|gacha]] units, [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Brave Cats]], or [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]]. After her first appearance, she becomes laughably easy most of the time and is usually only support for stronger enemies. However, there are some stages where she is buffed to an extent and becomes extremely annoying (e.g. [[Leadfoot Drive]] where she is backed by Le'noir, Chickful A and Owlbrowl). ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 048 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = St. Pigge the 2nd |image1 = Enemy icon 048.png |enemy_endesc1 = Ancestor of Pigge.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''J.K Bun Bun''' (赤井ブン太郎, ''Akai Buntarō'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = J.K Bun Bun |image = JKBunBunBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Rodeo Night|Sub-chapter 6 - Rodeo Night]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Don't Rush Love|Sub-chapter 44 - Don't Rush Love]] }} ==Enemy== The Red variant of [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]]. He has 400,000 HP and an attack power of 9,287, making him just barely stronger than the 400% Teacher Bun Bun in the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon/Iriomote]] stage of [[Empire of Cats]] Chapter 3 (399,996/9,000). He is knocked back only half as many times as his floating-only counterpart. ==Strategy== Because he is a Red enemy, any ranged [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red units]] can take him out in a short time. He is still Floating, so you can also use [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating units]] for him as well. If you have many anti-Red Cats, defeating him may be easier than defeating his original variant. If you don't, it will be harder, for he has half as many knockbacks as Teacher Bun Bun. The strategy for defeating the regular Teacher Bun Bun of mainly ranged attackers and crowd-controllers like [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Fortune Teller Cat]], [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cat]] (must be in [[True Form]]) or [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Apple Cat]] are good against him, however the latter gets outranged, so you will have to time it precisely for him to be frozen. Because he has almost the same stats as Teacher Bun Bun's, most cats will be just as effective against him, but [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bath Cat]] works much better than [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] when facing him. Strong cats such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] or [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Super Rare Cats]] such as [[Momotaro (Uber Rare Cat)|Momotaro]] work just as well against him, too. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 049 |enemy category = Red/Floating |Enemy name = J.K Bun Bun |enemy_endesc1 = A very famous author. Influential figure for
Bun Bun Teacher. His major works are Punishment and Prejudice (1868),
Les Pénitents (1875). |image1 = Enemy icon 049.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ぶんぶん先生の人生に多大な影響を与えた
日本を代表する文豪。代表作は
「体罰と散髪」(1868年)
「パニッシュメンタル」(1875年)など |enemy_jpdesc1 = An author who represents Japan.
A massive inspiration for Teacher Bun Bun.
His famous works include "Cutting and Chastizing" (1868)
and "Punishmental" (1875). |Enemy name (JP) = 赤井ブン太郎 (Akai Buntarō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 6-8: [[Rodeo Night]] (100%) *Stage 9-3: [[Mural of the Devil]] (100%) *Stage 10-2: [[Gentle Geyser]] (100%) *Stage 16-2: [[Beached Mammals]] (200%) *Stage 21-6: [[Underground]] (400%) *Stage 24-5: [[Dark Nemesis]] (300%) *Stage 25-5: [[Sniper Jungle]] (200%) *Stage 26-1: [[Oil Platform]] (400%) *Stage 28-5: [[No More Bad Dreams]] (300%) *Stage 30-2: [[Overachiever Central]] (300%) *Stage 33-2: [[Technocracy]] (300%) *Stage 38-3: [[Deep Sea Dying]] (300%) *Stage 39-2: [[Boiling Spring]] (400%) *Stage 46-3: [[Wearable Homes]] (400%) *Stage 47-2: [[Valley of the End]] (500%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 6-2: [[Inspirational Mural]] (500%) *Stage 20-4: [[Principal's Rebellion]] (500%) *Stage 24-4: [[Despotism at Home]] (500%) *Stage 37-4: [[Pulled Punch Bout]] (500%) *Stage 44-3: [[Don't Rush Love]] (500%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ritual Happiness (Monthly Event)|Ritual Happiness]]: **[[Zombies being Healthy]] (100%) **[[Humans are Scarier]] (100%) *[[Vacation Awakes! Bun Bun Spritesheet.png|J.K Bun Bun's spritesheet IdleJKBunBun.gif|J.K Bun Bun's moving animation ==Trivia== *His English name is a reference to [[wikipedia:J.K. Rowling|J.K. Rowling]], the famous author of the ''[[wikipedia:Harry Potter|Harry Potter]]'' series. *His Japanese name, Buntaro Akai (赤井ブン太郎), is a reference to [[:ja:wikipedia:黒井文太郎|Buntaro Kuroi]] (黒井文太郎), a military journalist. **Note that ''akai'' means "red" while ''kuroi'' means "black". *The major works credited to this enemy seem to be parodies of ''[[wikipedia:Pride and Prejudice|Pride and Prejudice]]'' (1813), and ''[[wikipedia:Les Misérables|Les Misérables]]'' (1862) respectively. *J.K. Bun Bun is slightly smaller than most other Bun Bun variants. You can see the first four side-by-side in [[Underground]], and again in [[No More Bad Dreams]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/051.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|Not to be confused with [[Ragin' Gory (Black / Behemoth)|Ragin' Gory]].}} '''Gory Black''' (ブラッゴリ ''Buraggori'', "'''Black Gory'''") is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gory Black |image = Gory Black.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Milky Tunnel|Sub-chapter 9 - Milky Tunnel]]
'''ItF''': [[Kenya (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Kenya]]
'''CotC''': [[Gorigori (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Gorigori]] |money drop = 500¢ - 1,975¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Ironsand Beach|Sub-chapter 33 - Ironsand Beach]] }} ==Enemy== The Black version of [[Gory]]. He is much faster, with more HP and higher attack power, making him extremely difficult to stall before setting up a proper defense. Can easily break through your frontlines if not defeated quickly, hence strong decent-range attacker cats should be constantly sent out to deal with him. His biggest weakness is that he has five times as many knockbacks as Gory, making him quite vulnerable to fast/spammable attackers. ==Strategy== Spam lots of cheap DPS units such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]] or [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]] to keep knocking him back and prevent him from pushing too much. If you have [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ring Girl Cat]], she can kill him in only a few hits, but don't rely on her as your only attacker. As with most Black enemies, one [[Oda Nobunaga (Uber Rare Cat)|Oda Nobunaga]] or two [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercats]] are enough to perma-[[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] this enemy and completely stop him from pushing. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 051 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Gory Black |enemy_endesc1 = Gory finally found a job!
Leaving behind his old life,
he is looking forward to seeing his
