wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Shadow Boxer K''' (シャドウボクサー ''Shadou Bokusā'', lit. "'''Shadow Boxer'''") is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Shadow Boxer K |image = SBK.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Disgusting Swamp|Sub-chapter 8 - Disgusting Swamp]]
'''ItF''': [[Argentina (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Argentina]]
'''CotC''': [[Vega (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Vega]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Fullstop Valley|Sub-chapter 47 - Fullstop Valley]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== A tougher version of [[Kang Roo]], Shadow Boxer K attacks non-stop at a faster pace and has more health, attack power and knockbacks. She also has Area Attack, giving her the devastating power to plow through your defense if your damage isn't enough to knock her back. She is slightly faster than the original [[Kang Roo]], but is slower compared to the likes of [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] and [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Black]], who share a movement speed of 30. ==Strategy== Like most Blacks, Shadow Boxer K is best countered by abusing her high KB count. A good way to deal with this enemy is to constantly spawn mid-ranged [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]], such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]], [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ring Girl Cat]], [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]] or [[Catway (Super Rare Cat)|Drone Cat]]; stacking a few [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cats]] will kill her faster than you can say "You are already dead". Any Area Attacker with a range over 250 should be fine. '''''Always''''' bring some cheap attackers when facing Shadow Boxer K. You wouldn't want her to power through all your [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] and leave you defenseless. You can use [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] or similar Uber Rares if you like, but Shadow Boxer K's tendency to get knocked back (which causes him to miss often) and the fact that Bahamut Cat gets overwhelmed easily is why he should only be used as a "big red button" against numerous Shadow Boxer Ks when their pushing power overwhelms your defense capability. [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] murders Shadow Boxer K like there's nothing to it, but be careful to protect him with meatshields because he only has 200 range, which is fairly low even compared to Shadow Boxer K's range of 158. As with most [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black enemies]], one [[Oda Nobunaga (Uber Rare Cat)|Wargod Nobunaga]] or two [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercats]] are enough to permafreeze this enemy and completely stop her from pushing. While she's frozen, you can safely deploy Awakened Bahamut and deal massive damage to her if there are no non-Black enemies supporting her. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 052 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Shadow Boxer K |enemy_endesc1 = "You are already dead" - S.B.K
Spits out cheesy lines all the time.
Kind of feel sorry for the joey
in the pouch that always has put up with it. |image1 = Enemy icon 052.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 「闇の世界ではライセンスなんかいらねぇ、
殺しでさえも正当化されるのがこの世界さ」
というセリフがお気に入りのカンガルー。
袋の中の息子にとってはいい迷惑である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = "I do not need a license in a world of darkness;
it is this world that justifies even killing,"
is this kangaroo's favorite line.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Director Kurosawah''' (クロサワ監督 ''Kurosawa Kantoku'', '''Director Kurosawa''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Director Kurosawah (Black) |image = Kurosawah.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Shrimp Frontier|Sub-chapter 13 - Shrimp Frontier]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Fire Kingdom Dynamite|Sub-chapter 41 - Fire Kingdom Dynamite]] }} ==Enemy== The Black variant of [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]]. He has 200 more range, attack power, health and a faster attack rate. He also has a smaller [[hitbox]] than Dark Emperor Nyandam, making it harder for short-ranged units like [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]] or [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]] to get an attack off. Due to his high damage even at 100% strength magnification, he can usually destroy an entire stack of cats in a single hit, sometimes even your [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Ubers]]. This makes him a formidable threat if you aren't able to knock him back in time or push too far into his range, leaving you to rebuild the stack you just created. ==Strategy== Kurosawah is similar to the original Nyandam with his long attack animation. He can now kill [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cats]] in one hit and has more range, so he might take longer to beat. You can abuse his attack delay by sending [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] to deal a lot of damage to him if timed properly. [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Sanada Yukimura]] is even more effective, especially with his [[True Form]] and [[Talents]] unlocked. Bringing along [[Battle Items#Sniper the Cat|Sniper the Cat]] (or [[Sniper the Recruit (Super Rare Cat)|Sniper the Recruit]] if you don't have a Sniper the Cat) can occasionally interrupt his long-cooldown attacks and get free hits on him. An effective strategy in some stages is to spam [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cats]] and other meatshields to keep him back and then summoning [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] to move in and put out damage. This works for a while until his magnification becomes greater than 300%. After that, your Jamiera Cat needs to be higher level. Pizza Cat and Bombercat can be particularly effective against Kurosawah, but as he's usually backed by frontliners, try to use [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Macho Legs]] or other [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] to snipe him and wear him down over time. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 053 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Director Kurosawah |enemy_endesc1 = A washed up director known for
copying the very famous movie director.
His works are all flops but
he is famous for his raunchy scenes. |image1 = Enemy icon 053.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 世界的に有名な映画の巨匠
を意識した泣かず飛ばずの映画監督
いつも売れない作品ばかりを作るが
作中のお色気要素には定評がある |enemy_jpdesc1 = A world-renowned film master
A non-crying filmmaker who is aware of the fact
he always makes unsuccessful films, but
has a reputation for the sexy elements in his films |Enemy name (JP) = クロサワ監督 (Kurosawa Kantoku, Director Kurosawa)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 13-8: [[Shrimp Frontier]] (100%) *Stage 16-6: [[Ancient One-Piece]] (100%) *Stage 18-5: [[Pitfall Zone]] (200%) *Stage 20-4: [[Monkey Magic]] (200%) *Stage 22-6: [[Satan's Bedroom]] (100%) *Stage 24-5: [[Dark Nemesis]] (300%) *Stage 28-3: [[Cat Catharsis]] (150%) *Stage 31-5: [[Heavenly Creatures]] (150%) *Stage 33-2: [[Technocracy]] (300%) *Stage 38-5: [[Grand Exhibition]] (300%) *Stage 39-4: [[Soap Scum]] (300%) *Stage 46-4: [[8K Fertilizer]] (300%) *Stage 47-3: [[Final Tower]] (400%) *Stage 48-7: [[Twilight Zephyr]] (300%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 5-4: [[On the Rocks]] (400%) *Stage 14-5: [[Spa of Ascension]] (400%) *Stage 17-4: [[Chilly Pool]] (300%) *Stage 19-1: [[Beachhead Invasion]] (100%) *Stage 33-5: [[Overnight Overtime]] (400%) *Stage 41-5: [[Fire Kingdom Dynamite]] (400%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[XP Stage|XP Stage/Weekend Stage]]: [[Sweet XP (Expert)]] (100%) *XP Megablitz!: [[Refined Palate (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Bad to Worse]]: [[Doom Paradise (Insane)]] (200%) *XP Colosseum: [[Tempered in Flame (Deadly)]] (200%) *Merciless XP!: [[Taste of Success (Merciless)]] (400%) *[[Never Not Summer! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the stage of the same name, see [[Super Metal Hippoe (Expert)]].}} '''Super Metal Hippoe''' (超メタルカバちゃん, ''Chō Metaru Kaba-chan'', '''Super Metal Hippo-chan''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Super Metal Hippoe |image = Super Metal Hippoe.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Utopia is Over There|Sub-chapter 20 - Utopia is Over There]] |money drop = 999¢ - 3,946¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Re-Leaf Towers|Sub-chapter 36 - Re-Leaf Towers]] }} ==Enemy== Super Metal Hippoe is a larger, stronger and faster version of [[Metal Hippoe (Metal)|Metal Hippoe]]. With his guaranteed [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] ability, quick movement speed, and high health, he can be a very annoying enemy to fight. This Metal enemy, unlike [[Sir Metal Seal (Metal)|Sir Metal Seal]], tends to appear in non-Metal stages like [[Saucy Scandals]] or [[Oil Spill Rainbow]]. Super Metal Hippoe also tends to appear in groups of two or three in some stages, such as [[Total Myopia]] and [[March to Death (Merciless)|March to Death]]. ==Strategy== It is important to note that like all other Metal enemies, Super Metal Hippoe takes only one damage from any attack, unless it is a [[Critical Hit]]. As such, [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]] are almost mandatory, unless you want an extremely long, drawn-out battle. [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Cat]] is a great choice for beginners as he outranges Super Metal Hippoe, allowing him to be stacked to increase the chance of a Critical Hit. Likewise, nearly any [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare]] or [[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rare]] with Criticals has potential to be extremely effective against him, with [[Marauder Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Berserker Cat]], [[Hayabusa (Uber Rare Cat)|Hayabusa]] and [[Kyosaka Nanaho (Legend Rare Cat)|Kyosaka Nanaho]] being some of the most reliable options overall. Since this enemy has Area Attack, you may want to bring less weak meatshields, so [[Primordial Cat (Rare Cat)|Primordial Cat]], or in rarer cases, [[Rope Jump Cat (Rare Cat)|Noodle Cats]] can fill this role. Notably, a talented [[Sumo Cat (Special Cat)|Riceball Cat]] can absorb several hits and prevent Super Metal Hippoe from pushing, thanks to his knockback immunity. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 054 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Super Metal Hippoe |enemy_endesc1 = Metal Hippoe who abused file sharing
software and came down with the
Trojan virus, now he's out of control.
Appears to be weak to critical attacks. |image1 = Enemy icon 054.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 覚えたてのファイル共有ソフトで、トロイの
木馬とかいう謎の病原菌に侵されて暴走
したカバちゃん。立ちふさがる敵はすべて
ふっとばす。クリティカルな攻撃が弱点。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Got a Trojan Virus from file
sharing software and went berserk.
Knocks back all enemies who stand in his way.
Vulnerable to Critical Hits. |Enemy name (JP) = 超メタルカバちゃん (Chō Metaru Kaba-chan, Super Metal Hippo-chan) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 37: [[Jamaica (Aku Realm)|Jamaica]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 20-2: [[Utopia is Over There]] (100%) *Stage 31-4: [[Alien Ecology]] (100%) *Stage 35-2: [[Bionic Seaweed]] (200%) *Stage 37-5: [[Saucy Scandals]] (200%) *Stage 39-1: [[Electric Bath]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 2-2: [[Nyandaria]] (300%) *Stage 5-1: [[Crowded Surf]] (300%) *Stage 7-1: [[Midnight Lycopene]] (300%) *Stage 9-5: [[Roe Row]] (300%) *Stage 12-4: [[Woods of Resentment]] (300%) *Stage 15-6: [[Total Myopia]] (300%) *Stage 31-1: [[Pilgrim Agitators]] (300%) *Stage 33-3: [[Oil Spill Rainbow]] (300%) *Stage 36-3: [[Re-Leaf Towers]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Siege of Hippoe!: [[Super Metal Hippoe (Expert)]] (100%) *The Crazed Fish: [[Fish Hell (Insane)]] (100%) *Monthly Event All-Stars Miracle Celebration!: [[Miracle Tactics! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|Not to be confused with [[Cyberhorn (Alien)|Cyberhorn]].}} '''Metal One Horn ''' (メタルサイボーグ ''Metaru Saibōgu'', '''Metal Cyborg''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[One Horn (Red)|One Horn]] found in [[Legend Stages]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Metal One Horn |image = Metal One Horn.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Dawn of Gaia|Sub-chapter 15 - Dawn of Gaia]]
'''CotC''': [[N77 Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - N77 Nebula]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Diversity, Alkilinity|Sub-chapter 33 - Diversity, Alkilinity]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== Metal One Horn has one of the fastest attack rates in the game, but has very slow movement speed and pitiful range. He is a mid-tier Metal enemy; while his sizable bulk and rapid attack rate makes him a tough foe for players without any reliable [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]], his low range, speed and health allow most Critical Hitters to make quick work of him. ==Strategy== Metal One Horn has much higher HP compared to [[Metal Hippoe (Metal)|Metal Hippoe]] and [[Metal Doge (Metal)|Metal Doge]], so [[Critical Hit]]s are a must. Since he's outranged by all cats, any Critical Hitter could work in his first appearance, whether it be [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Cat]], [[Jurassic Cat (Rare Cat)|Jurassic Cat]] or even [[Moneko (Special Cat)|Moneko]]. Metal One Horn can demolish your units with his extremely high DPS. If he gets too close for comfort, it is recommended to send out [[Clockwork Cat (Rare Cat)|Puppetmaster Cat]] and [[Hoop Cat (Rare Cat)|Showoff Cat]], which can [[slow]] and [[Freeze|stop]] his movement, respectively. [[Drumcorps Cat (Rare Cat)|Banner Cat]] won't help that much, as his DPS is incredibly high even when [[weaken|weakened]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 056 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Metal One Horn |enemy_endesc1 = A One Horn who underwent cybernetic
enhancement. He can intercept radio waves
and dispatches almost instantly.
Still never makes it in time. |image1 = Enemy icon 056.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = もっと人助けをしたくて改造手術を
施した一角くん。通報前に電話回線を
傍受して出動できるが、足が遅いので
現場にはやっぱり間に合わない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = One Horn-kun underwent remodeling surgery
in order to help more people. He can intercept telephone
lines and dispatch before reporting, but he still never
makes it on time because he's so slow on his feet. |Enemy name (JP) = 'メタルサイボーグ (Metaru Saibōgu, Metal Cyborg) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]]=== *Stage 1-45: [[N77 Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|N77 Nebula]] (100%) *Stage 2-45: [[N77 Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|N77 Nebula]] (200%) ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== *Stage 1-45: [[N77 Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|N77 Nebula]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 15-4: [[Dawn of Gaia]] (100%) *Stage 19-3: [[Prison Destruction]] (200%) *Stage 24-3: [[The Horrible Song]] (300%) *Stage 26-2: [[Sweat and Aldehyde]] (200%) *Stage 28-1: [[At Least I'm a Cat]] (100%) *Stage 35-2: [[Bionic Seaweed]] (200%) *Stage 39-1: [[Electric Bath]] (200%) *Stage 47-3: [[Final Tower]] (200%) *Stage 48-7: [[Twilight Zephyr]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 5-4: [[On the Rocks]] (300%) *Stage 10-2: [[Gutter Lord]] (300%) *Stage 19-3: [[Triton's Cave]] (300%) *Stage 21-3: [[Gas-Powered Birds]] (300%) *Stage 26-4: [[Planetarium Love]] (300%) *Stage 28-6: [[Burning Blue]] (300%) *Stage 33-1: [[Diversity, Alkilinity]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Sweet Irony: [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Cat Kart Awakens! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Teacher Cybear''' (メタックマ ''Metakkuma'', '''Metabear''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[Teacher Bear]] that only appears in [[Forged to Kill (Deadly)|Cybear's Vengeance]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Teacher Cybear |image = Teachercybear.PNG |appearance = [[Forged to Kill (Deadly)]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,172¢ }} ==Enemy== Teacher Cybear's extremely fast, single target attacks do 999,999 damage along with his 600 range, though he only has a measly 50 health and just 3 speed to go with. ==Strategy== Bring lots of meatshields, at the price of 150¢ or less, such as [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]], [[Li'l Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Cat]], [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Cat]], [[Pumpcat (Rare Cat)|Pumpcat]], [[Awa-Odori Cat (Rare Cat)|Awa-Odori Cat]], [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Boogie Cat]], or [[Catburger (Special Cat)|Catburger]]. Because almost every unit you send will die in one hit, it doesn't matter what level your cats are. When spamming enough of them, your meatshields will eventually reach Cybear and chip him down. Otherwise, [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Cat]] can be used to sponge up to 12 hits from Cybear and kill him quicker than you would trying to defeat him using only meatshields. [[Kyubey Cat (Rare Cat)|Kyubey Cat]] and [[Pogo Cat (Rare Cat)|Pogo Cat]] can serve a similar role of being a better meatshield than most others, but be wary of Pogo's high cost. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 057 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Teacher Cybear |enemy_endesc1 = Teacher Bear received experimental cybernetic
implants for more powerful, efficient education.
His lessons are now too intense for children
and he had to find work at a trade college. |image1 = Enemy icon 057.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = カオル君の家に居候してはや6年の
着ぐるみクマ。ようやく重い腰を
上げて外の世界へ出てきた。
中身はサイボーグ化したクマ先生。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A mascot costume that's been living rent-free
at Kaoru-kun's [The Face's] house for 6 years.
Finally lifted his heavy waist and left to see the outside world.
The [costume's] contents are a cyborgized Teacher Bear. |Enemy name (JP) = メタックマ (Metakkuma, Metabear) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Cybear's Vengeance: [[Forged to Kill (Deadly)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Teacher Cybear |Health = 50 HP |Attack Power = 999,999 damage
(1,578,945 DPS) |Attack Range = 600
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 19f (0.63 seconds) |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 8f 0.27s
(8f 0.27s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== TCybearspritesheet.png|Teacher Cybear's spritesheet (post-8.0) I057 e.png|Teacher Cybear's spritesheet (pre-8.0) METALBEARATACKWALK.gif|Teacher Cybear's animations (pre-8.0) IdleTeacherCybear.gif|Teacher Cybear's moving animation metal bear BCCN.jpg|Teacher Cybear in the knock-off Battle Cats Chinese version, before the Version 8.0 Update ==Trivia== *He has the highest DPS of any character. *He is tied with the [[Scarecrow (Enemy Base)|Scarecrow]] for the second-highest attack power of any character, the first being [[Filibuster Obstructa (Alien/Floating)|Filibuster Obstructa]], who does 1,000,000 damage. *This enemy has some interesting history, as he was one of the few enemies (besides [[Metal Cyclone (Metal)|Metal Cyclone]], [[CyberFace (Metal)|CyberFace]] and [[Professor A. (Red)|Professor A.]]) to actually be unimplemented for a certain amount of time. After years of rotting away in the game data, Teacher Cybear finally got his due in the [[Version 8.0 Update]]. **Before he was implemented, Teacher Cybear was a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy with 1,000 HP, 80 damage, 150 range, 15 speed, no abilities, no wave effect in his attack animation, and a money drop of 55,000¢, as seen in [https://youtu.be/32j7NzzAoS4 this video]. *His Japanese description mentions that he was freeloading at [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]]'s house for 6 years, which is the length of time between the release of [[Nyanko Daisensou]] and the release of update 8.0. *Prior to the [[Version 11.0 Update]], Teacher Cybear had 800 range instead of 600, and waited 0 frames between attacks instead of 3. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/059.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''CyberFace''' (メタルカオル君 ''Metaru Kaoru-kun'') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = CyberFace |image = Cyberface.PNG |first appearance = [[Steel Visage (Deadly)|Facing Danger]]
'''SoL''': [[Knights of the Round|Sub-chapter 28 - Knights of the Round]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Night of the Hustler|Sub-chapter 44 - Night of the Hustler]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,172¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has insane attack power, a high tolerance for damage, high speed, a 90% chance to create an extremely powerful Lv.8 [[Wave Attack]] reaching to a range of 2,135, a 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] cats, and the [[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]] ability, allowing it to destroy the [[Cat Base]] in a single blow. Its weakness is that it only has 299 health, allowing nearly any [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitter]] to kill it in one hit. While it may look like a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy, it's actually walking - according to its description, its dozen plasma legs are invisible to the player. ==Strategy== Using [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] like [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] will allow your Critical Hitters to stand a chance of defeating it without getting decimated by the wave. [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Hurricat]] completely obliterates CyberFace due to his insanely high probability of [[Critical Hit]]s, but be wary, as he can still be killed if you have bad luck and CyberFace manages to land a hit. [[Rei Uzumasa & Cat (Special Cat)|Rei Uzumasa & Cat]], [[Sunny Neneko (Super Rare Cat)|Sunny Neneko]] or [[Cheerleader Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cheerleader Cat]] can annihilate Cyberface 100% of the time, but be sure to keep them from wasting their attacks on anything else. [[Crazed Moneko (Special Cat)|Crazed Moneko]] can also work, but due to her long foreswing and low range, she won't be as effective as the others. [[Li'l Cow Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Lion Cat]] can keep this enemy far enough away from the Cat Base to prevent a game over if timed well, plus his rapid attacks can deal some good damage. Be wary though, because a poorly timed Li'l Lion can cause a massive gap in the line of defense. [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Macho]] is also very effective against CyberFace, as he requires a set amount of hits to be killed. Get another cat behind him that can deal enough damage to kill the CyberFace, but be wary, as Cyberface's knockback ability can push Metal Cat back if Metal Cat is left unattended to. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 058 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Cyberface |enemy_endesc1 = A relic of humanity's final war, this cyborg
crushes all to dust with enhanced jaw strength.
Seems to float, but actually scampers around
on a dozen plasma legs invisible to the eye. |image1 = Enemy icon 058.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 人類の存亡をかけ開発された顔型決戦兵器。
放たれる「波動」はすべてを無に帰す。
浮いてるように見えるが光学迷彩仕様の
12本の足は肉眼で見ることができない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A face-model battle weapon developed for humanity's survival.
Releases waves that reduce all to naught.
Appears to float, but has 12 legs with optical
camouflage that are invisible to the naked eye. |Enemy name (JP) = メタルカオル君 (Metaru kaoru) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 28-2: [[Knights of the Round]] (100%) *Stage 42-5: [[Baroque Beasts]] (1,000%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 10-5: [[Shocking Exile]] (100%) *Stage 19-4: [[Nighttime Lure]] (100%) *Stage 33-5: [[Overnight Overtime]] (100%) *Stage 44-2: [[Night of the Hustler]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Facing Danger: [[Steel Visage (Deadly)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = CyberFace |Health = 299 HP |Attack Power = 99,999 damage
(12,987 DPS) |Attack Range = 140
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 231f 7.7 seconds |Movement Speed = 32 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 32f 1.07s
(12f 0.4s backswing) |Ability = 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
[[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]] (deals x4 damage to [[Cat Base]])
90% chance to create a Lv.8 [[Wave Attack]] |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== 58 e.png|CyberFace's spritesheet IdleCyberFace.gif|CyberFace's moving animation ==Trivia== *CyberFace was originally exclusive to [[Steel Visage (Deadly)|Facing Danger]], meaning it was technically an event enemy for some time. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/060.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sir Metal Seal''' (メタルゴマさま ''Metaru Goma-sama'', '''Sir Metal Goma''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[Sir Seal (Red)|Sir Seal]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sir Metal Seal |image = Sirmetalseal.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Dead Falls|Sub-chapter 18 - Dead Falls]] |money drop = 1,155¢ - 4,562¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Master of Demon Keep|Sub-chapter 47 - Master of Demon Keep]] }} ==Enemy== Sir Metal Seal has medium movement speed, a faster attack rate than [[Sir Seal (Red)|Sir Seal]], higher attack power and very high health for a Metal enemy (2.75 times that of [[Super Metal Hippoe (Metal)|Super Metal Hippoe]]). Like all Metal enemies, Sir Metal Seal only takes one damage from all attacks except for [[Critical Hit]]s. ==Strategy== This is a Metal enemy, so [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]] are mandatory. Unlike most other Metal enemies, who will fall rather easily to Critical Hits, this enemy generally soaks up several Critical Hits before dying. [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Cat]] works great in earlier encounters because he has decent range and can easily be stacked, but tougher Sir Metal Seals will require more advanced units such as [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Hurricat]], [[Cheerleader Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Waitress Cat]] and [[Volley Cat (Rare Cat)|Ballet Cat]] to take down. As Sir Metal Seal has terrifying stats for a Metal enemy, crowd-controllers such as [[Clockwork Cat (Rare Cat)|Puppetmaster Cat]], [[Drumcorps Cat (Rare Cat)|Banner Cat]] and [[Hoop Cat (Rare Cat)|Showoff Cat]] are well worth it to help keep Sir Metal Seal from advancing forward, thus buying more time and opportunities for your Critical Hitters to attack. Nearly any [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] or [[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rare]] with Critical Hits or [[:Category:Anti-Metal Cats|anti-Metal]] abilities is effective against Sir Metal Seal, but [[Tecoluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Tesalan Pasalan]] is of particular note because his Critical Hit can kill Sir Metal Seal in one strike; though be aware that his Critical Hit chance is only 10% (in [[True Form]], 30% with maxed [[Talents]]). While [[Marauder Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Paladin Cat]] is already good against Sir Metal Seal in his own right, his level 1 Attack Buff Talent gives a level 50 Paladin Cat just enough damage to knockback a 300% Sir Metal Seal with one Crit. Unlock this Talent if you often struggle with Sir Metal Seal in late-game stages, but do not invest more than 1 level into it. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 059 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Sir Metal Seal |enemy_endesc1 = A seal who traveled to the city,
dreaming of superstardom.
Wanted more attention so
he decided to go full cyborg. |image1 = Enemy icon 059.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ちまたでウワサのアザラシに憧れて
上京してきたアザラシ。
なかなかチヤホヤされないので
今度はサイボーグ化してみた。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A seal that came to Tokyo,
hoping to become the subject of some rumors in the streets.
Found it really hard to get pampered,
so this time he became a cyborg. |Enemy name (JP) = メタルゴマさま (Metaru Goma-sama, Sir Metal Goma) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{JPExclusive}} '''Princess Head''' (プリンセスカオル ''Purinsesu Kaoru'', '''Princess Kaoru''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in the [[Princess Punt Sweets Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Princess Head |image = Princesshead.jpg |first appearance = [[Princess Punt Sweets Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 4,000円 - 15,800円 }} ==Enemy== Princess Head supports moderate health, damage and movement speed. It is a slightly more threatening version your average [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]]. Although it attacks slightly less often, has a fourth of the speed and an extra knockback, it also loses the exploitable [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] trait and has more health, range and damage. It normally comes with other enemies like [[Princess Punt (Enemy)|Princess Punt]] and [[Yuurinchii (Enemy)|Yuurinchii]], but otherwise, it is fairly weak. ==Strategy== Send out long-ranged [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|area attackers]] like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] and [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]], but remember to back them up with [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]] and other meatshields if necessary. Since this is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy with almost 50% lower range than the regular Face, cats such as [[Delinquent Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Delinquent Cat]], [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Swimmer Cat]] and [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]] are useful for fighting it. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Princess Punt Sweets Collaboration Event#Enchanted Princess|Enchanted Princess]]: **[[Let's Go To The Egg]] (100%) **[[Princess Battle]] (100%) *[[Kerihime Awakens! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dark Emperor Santa''' (悪魔王サンタ ''Akuma Ō Santa'', '''Devil King Santa''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dark Emperor Santa |image = Dark Emperor Santa.png |first appearance = [[Part Time Santa]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Infernal Tower - Floor 11]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== He is the Christmas spin-off of [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]], made to look like Santa on his sleigh. His sleigh-throne is pulled by dark minions with reindeer antlers and red noses. Rather than a glass of coffee jelly, Dark Emperor Santa holds a turkey leg instead. Santa has the same range as Nyandam, but moves a bit faster and attacks '''much''' faster, along with a guaranteed chance to temporarily freeze the player's units. Luckily, he has less than half of Nyandam's health. ==Strategy== Due to his low health, Dark Emperor Santa can be easily dispatched with strong [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red cats]] like [[Swordsman Cat (Rare Cat)|Swordsman Cat]] or [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bath Cat]]. [[Maiden Cat (Rare Cat)|Wrestling Cat]] is a direct counter due to being strong against Red and immune to freeze. [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Apple Cat]] can fight fire with fire and freeze him if, well timed. While [[:Category:Anti-Aku Cats|anti-Aku Cats]] are far rarer, they also work well due to his [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] trait giving him an additional weakness. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Jingle Cat Bell (Monthly Event)|Jingle Cat Bell]]: **[[Part Time Santa]] (100%) **[[Santa or Satan!?]] (100%) **[[Santa is on Salary]] (100%) **[[Happy Merry X-mas]] (100%) *Monthly Event All-Stars Ultra Celebration!: [[Ultra Stress! (Insane)]] (400%) *[[Christmas in Space (Monthly Event)|Christmas in Space]]: **[[Jingle Hell]] (150%) **[[Cosmic Xmas]] (400%) *[[Total War: Winter Special]]: **[[Dance of Winter: Standard (Deadly)]] (600%) **[[Dance of Winter: Advanced (Merciless)]] (700%) **[[Dance of Winter: Supreme (Merciless)]] (800%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 11|Floor 11]] (200%) *[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 7#Red|Floor 7]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Floor 11]] (600%) *[[December Gauntlet]]: **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.1]] (100%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.2]] (133%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.3]] (166%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.4]] (199%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.5]] (232%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.6]] (265%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.7]] (298%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.8]] (331%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.9]] (364%) **[[December Gauntlet/Jingle Cat Lv.1~10|Jingle Cat Lv.10]] (400%) *[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery]]: **[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery/Delivery Lv.1~10#Delivery Lv.6~10|Delivery Lv.6]] (400%) **[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery/Delivery Lv.1~10#Delivery Lv.6~10|Delivery Lv.7]] (475%) **[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery/Delivery Lv.1~10#Delivery Lv.6~10|Delivery Lv.8]] (550%) **[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery/Delivery Lv.1~10#Delivery Lv.6~10|Delivery Lv.9]] (625%) **[[Night 2: Christmas Eve Delivery/Delivery Lv.1~10#Delivery Lv.6~10|Delivery Lv.MAX]] (700%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Dark Emperor Santa |Health = 45,000 HP |Attack Power = 3,600 damage

(29f 0.97s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds |Element = Red/Aku }} ==Gallery== 63 e.png|Dark Emperor Santa's spritesheet IdleDarkEmperorSanta.gif|Dark Emperor Santa's moving animation Emperor santa attack.gif|Dark Emperor Santa's attack animation DarkEmperorSantaTBCP.png|Dark Emperor Santa's description in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Catsmas 2018.jpg|2018 Christmas Illustration ==Trivia== *Dark Emperor Santa is a regular enemy in [[The Battle Cats POP!]]. His description is: "Created devious magics to break Cats' holiday spirit. Uses cheap materials to keep his Xmas profit margin low." *His [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] trait was given to him in [[Version 11.3 Update|Version 11.3]], before which he was only a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy. This may be because his Japanese name, Akuma Ō Santa (悪魔王サンタ, "Devil King Santa"), contains the word ''Akuma'' (悪魔, meaning "devil"), which is also the Japanese name of the Aku. **Because of this, he is the only Aku enemy whose body is not mainly that of a dark blue color. **He is also the only Aku enemy who had the Aku trait added retroactively instead of being Aku from the start. *He is currently the only Aku enemy to have a secondary trait. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/065.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Red Cyclone''' (レッドサイクロン ''Reddo Saikuron'', '''Red Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy introduced in [[Attack on R-Cyclone (Expert)|Crimson Catastrophe]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Red Cyclone |image = Red Cyclone.jpg |appearance = [[Attack on R-Cyclone (Expert)|Crimson Catastrophe]]
[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival]]
[[Bad to Worse]]
[[Crimson Vengeance Stages|Crimson Vengeance]]
[[Heavenly Tower]]
[[Infernal Tower]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== The Red Cyclone deals absurd damage and attacks non-stop, destroying anything it touches in less than a second. However, it has one of the shortest ranges in the game, somewhat slow speed, and two exploitable traits. ==Strategy== No amount of meatshields or tankers can stop it from pushing, so the only way to defeat it is to not let it move at all. Use [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red]]/[[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating]] units with [[:Category:Cats with Freeze ability|freeze]], [[:Category:Cats with Slow ability|slow]] or [[:Category:Cats with Knockback ability|knockback]] abilities to keep it at bay, like [[Witch Cat (Rare Cat)|Witch Cat]], [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]], [[Pirate Cat (Rare Cat)|Pirate Cat]], [[Bodhisattva Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bodhisattva Cat]], [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Fortune Teller Cat]] are all good choices. Just be warned that if you only use Pirate Cat and/or Fortune Teller Cat, your stack will gradually clip into Red Cyclone as it gets knocked back and potentially die all at once. In [[Heavenly Tower]] [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 21|Floor 21]], things are made slightly more complicated by the addition of [[Blitzen (Event Enemy)|Blitzens]] that can wipe out your stacks, so use [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]] such as [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Vaulter Cat]] and [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Red Riding Mina]] to knock them back behind the frontlines. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 064 |enemy category = Red/Floating |Enemy name = Red Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = The relentless assault of wind
keeps curious gawkers far away.
If only there was some way to stop
or stun it - a counterattack chance? |image1 = Enemy icon 064.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 超高速回転による連続攻撃は
いかなる者もよせつけない。
動きを止めたり、押し返す手段があれば
何とか攻略できるかも！？ |enemy_jpdesc1 = Attacks continuously through ultra high-speed rotation so no one can stop its cyclonic force. Can you stop its movement, be able to somehow push it back!? |Enemy name (JP) = レッドサイクロン (Reddo Saikuron, Red Cyclone) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Black Cyclone |Its damage per hit is quite low, but its 20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units somewhat makes up for it. However, Black Cyclone itself gets knocked back up to 10 times. It appears in [[Attack on B-Cyclone (Expert)|Heaven of Darkness]] and [[NEO Darkness Heaven Stages|NEO Darkness Heaven]]. |White Cyclone |Very similar to Red Cyclone in terms of stats, but with more knockbacks. Its lack of a secondary trait may make it slightly harder to counter than the previous Cyclones. It appears in [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)|Peerless]] and [[Peerless Too Stages|Peerless Too]]. |Divine Cyclone |The first non-[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] Cyclone; units such as [[Stilts Cat (Rare Cat)|Stilts Cat]], [[Cat Toaster (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Toaster]] and [[Juliet Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Juliet Cat]] are needed to keep it at bay. It appears in [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]] and [[Wrath of the Divine Stages|Wrath of the Divine]]. |Metal Cyclone |It has the highest health of any [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy, making [[Critical Hit]]s a necessity to defeat it. Moves very slowly, and has as many knockbacks as the Black Cyclone. It appears in [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)|Sweet Irony]] and [[Bitter Irony Stages|Bitter Irony]]. |Cosmic Cyclone |It has significantly longer range than most Cyclones, though not enough to reach [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Necro-Dancer Cat]] or [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Psychocat]]. It strengthens by 200% at 30% health. It appears in [[Black Hole Rising (Insane)|Dimension of Despair]] and [[Dimension of Delirium Stages|Dimension of Delirium]]. |The Perfect Cyclone |Has extreme range and very high DPS compared to other enemies with similar range. Its weakness is that it can't hit units that are too close to it, making it vulnerable to tanks with enough health and few enough knockbacks to enter its blind spot, like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Titan Cat]] and [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kotatsu Cat]]. It appears in [[Oncoming Storm (Insane)|Red Sky at Morning]] and [[Red Sky at Night Stages|Red Sky at Night]]. |Zyclone |A Cyclone that can revive with 100% health an unlimited number of times. To win against it, the player will need to defeat it with [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]] or sneak units past it before it can revive. Unlike most [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]], it can't burrow past Cat Units. It appears in [[Unholy Tempest (Insane)|The Rolling Dead]] and [[The Dead Keep Rolling Stages|The Dead Keep Rolling]]. |Super Cosmic Cyclone |This Cyclone is a [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]], which means its difficulty will vary depending on one's [[Anti-Starred Alien Treasures]]. Its damage is fairly low no matter how many Treasures the player has, but it Warps cats back with every attack. It has even longer range than Cosmic Cyclone: enough to hit [[Surfer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Surfer Cat]], but still not enough to reach [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Psychocat]]. It appears in [[The Wormhole Opens (Deadly)|The 2nd Dimension]] and [[The 3rd Dimension Stages|The 3rd Dimension]]. |Primeval Cyclone |This Cyclone can only be fought after clearing [[Stories of Legend]]. It has the highest health and movement speed of any Cyclone, and increases its attack power by 200% after reaching 50% health. Given that it is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy, there are very few units that can reliably stall it other than [[Talents|Talented]] [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Rodeo Cat]], Talented [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Doctor Cat]] and [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super Rare Cat)|Freshman Cat Jobs]]. It appears in [[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)|Typhoon Nemo]] and [[Typhoon Nihil Stages|Typhoon Nihil]]. |Mesocosmocyclone |A very strong [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] peon that warps Cat Units ''forward'' with every hit, while also having fast movement speed, short range and non-stop attacks. As such, it can push at terrifying speeds when not met with crowd-controllers or [[:Category:Warp Blocker Cats|Warp Blockers]]. It appears in [[Cats of the Cosmos]] Chapter 3 and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. |Li'l Zyclone |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy that has high health and burrows far but has somewhat low DPS; its main role is to intercept the flow of meatshields. Unlike [[Zyclone (Zombie)|Zyclone]], it can only revive once. It appears in [[Into the Future]] Chapter 3 [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. |Aku Cyclone |Moves very slowly but has 4 knockbacks and a [[Shield]] with as much health as the Cyclone itself, 1,666,666, effectively giving it 8,333,330 HP. Topping this off is its [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] trait, leaving players with few reliable means of stalling it without [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare Cats]]. The only silver lining is that its damage per hit is relatively low compared to other Cyclones. It appears in [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)|The Great Diablo]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Crimson Catastrophe: [[Attack on R-Cyclone (Expert)]] (100%) *[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival!]]: [[Tornado Carnival (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Bad to Worse]]: [[Tragedy in Red (Insane)]] (200%) *[[Crimson Vengeance Stages|Crimson Vengeance]]: **[[Wrath of R-Cyclone (Insane)]] (100%) **[[Revenge of R-Cyclone (Deadly)]] (200%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 21|Floor 21]] (200%) **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Floor 42]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 21|Floor 21]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Red Cyclone |Health = 999,999 HP |Attack Power = 92,000 damage

(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Red/Floating }} ==Gallery== Red cyclone en.jpg|Red Cyclone's original English description Red Cyclone(bcp).png|Red Cyclone's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] Red Cyclone.gif|Red Cyclone's attack animation IdleRedCyclone.gif|Red Cyclone's moving animation RedCycloneSpritesheet.png|Red Cyclone's spritesheet Medal 018.png|Red Cyclone on the ''Red Horizon'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] Metal bear BCCN.jpg|Red Cyclone with [[Teacher Cybear (Metal)|Teacher Cybear]] in the Battle Cats Chinese version ==Trivia== *Before a patch, Red Cyclone was spawned much closer to its base; the cats that attacked the base would not be harmed. As of [[Version 2.0 Update|Version 2.0]], Red Cyclone is spawned further from its base. *Even though they were introduced around the same time, Red Cyclone has several unrelated enemies' IDs between it and [[White Cyclone (Floating)|White Cyclone]]: [[Lione Hippoe (Event Enemy)|Lione Hippoe]], [[Lucky Sloth (Event Enemy)|Lucky Sloth]], [[Audience Bears (Event Enemy)|Audience Bears]] and [[Monkey King (Enemy)|Monkey King]]. **Furthermore, Red Cyclone is the first [[Cyclone]] in the [[Enemy Release Order]], but the first Cyclone Cat in the [[Cat Release Order]] is [[Bronze Cat (Rare Cat)|Bronze Cat]], which unlocks after defeating [[Black Cyclone (Black/Floating)|Black Cyclone]]. *Red Cyclone has: **The highest attack power of all [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red Enemies]] and Cyclones. **The fastest attack rate of all Red enemies. **The second-highest attack power of all [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating Enemies]], with [[Filibuster Obstructa (Alien/Floating)|Filibuster Obstructa]] in first place. **The second-highest DPS of all enemies, beaten only by [[Teacher Cybear (Metal)|Teacher Cybear]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/066.html ----

[[Total War: Spring Special]]
[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]] |money drop = 3000¢ - 11850¢ }} ==Enemy== The bearbershop quintet. They have mediocre health but get knocked back quite often, so be wary when relying on a heavy hitter, as they will likely miss. Their attack is quite slow, long-ranged and has a 100% chance to knockback [[Cat Units]]. They dash forward extremely fast before stopping to attack, similarly to [[Cats in a Box (Special Cat)|Cats in a Box]] or [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]]. Individually not very powerful, they are support troops to push you back so others can advance. ==Strategy== This enemy is not very powerful or difficult. Because they are mainly just a support unit, they do not require much to defeat. Use any decent attackers to knock it back. Be wary, for as soon as they are knocked back, they attack again! Use [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]], or any fair-health attacker to defeat this enemy. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Bears be Bare (Monthly Event)|Bears be Bare]]: **[[Bees with Ears]] (100%) **[[Arming Bears]] (100%) **[[Going Bipolar]] (150%) **[[Fighting Bearhanded]] (150%, 200%) **[[Can't Bear Anymore]] (200%) *Monthly Event All-Stars Miracle Celebration!: [[Miracle Tactics! (831 DPS) |Attack Range = 400
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 101f 3.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 35 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 15f 0.5s
(86f 2.87s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 67 e.png|Audience Bears' spritesheet Audience Bears.gif|Audience Bears' attack animation IdleAudienceBears.gif|Audience Bears' moving animation ==Trivia== *Their Japanese name, "Bears Talk" (クマトーク ''Kumatōku''), is most likely a reference to the comedy-focused talk show ''[[wikipedia:Ametalk!|Ametalk]]'' (アメトーーク ''Ametōku''), as the Japanese names of the [[Bears be Bare (Monthly Event)|Bears be Bare]] and [[Bears Be Back (Monthly Event)|Bears Be Back]] stages also tend to be themed around comedy. *This enemy may also be a pun based on the multiple meanings of the Japanese word ''hinadan''. The most common meaning is a tiered stand used to display ''hina-ningyō'' during ''[[wikipedia:Hinamatsuri|Hinamatsuri]]''—the basis of the Bears be Bare event—but can also refer to tiered seats/platforms for kabuki musicians or ministers in the National Diet, which are similar to the Audience Bears' bleachers. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/069.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''White Cyclone''' (ホワイトサイクロン, ''Howaito Saikuron'', '''White Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = White Cyclone |image = White Cyclone.jpg |appearance = [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)|Peerless]]
[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival]]
[[Day of Judgement]]
[[Peerless Too Stages|Peerless Too]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Heavenly Tower - Floor 42]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Unlike the [[Red Cyclone (Red/Floating)|Red]] and [[Black Cyclone (Black/Floating)|Black]] [[Cyclone]]s, this enemy has only one trait: [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]], making it slightly more difficult to counter. It has all the trademarks of the Cyclones, with extremely high health and attack power, very low range with somewhat low movement speed, but a lightning fast attack rate and attack animation. Unlike some other Cyclones, however, White Cyclone has a forgiving 5 knockbacks. Remember that this isn't a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy, so don't expect most of the [[EPICFEST (Gacha Event)|EPICFEST]] exclusives' abilities to work against it. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Anti-Floating units]] like [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]], [[Bodhisattva Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bodhisattva Cat]], [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Shaman Cat]] and [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Fortune Teller Cat]] help a lot, though White Cyclone is backed up by [[THE SLOTH]] in [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)|Attack on W-Cyclone]] and [[Wrath of W-Cyclone (Insane)|Wrath of W-Cyclone]], making it riskier to rely on knockback rather than freeze/slow. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 069 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = White Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = Attacks continuously while moving
so no one can stop its cyclonic force.
Seems to be getting a lot of attention
probably thanks to certain vacuums. |image1 = Enemy icon 069.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 超高速回転による連続攻撃は
いかなる者もよせつけない。
サイクロン掃除機ブームのおかげで
最近はどこに行っても人気者である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Attacks continuously through ultra high-speed rotation so no one can stop its cyclonic force.
Thanks to the cyclone vacuum cleaner craze,
it's become a popular figure everywhere it goes. |Enemy name (JP) = ホワイトサイクロン (Howaito Saikuron, White Cyclone) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Peerless: [[Attack on W-Cyclone (Expert)]] (100%) *[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival!]]: [[Tornado Carnival (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Day of Judgement]]: [[Explosion in the Sky (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Peerless Too Stages|Peerless Too]]: **[[Wrath of W-Cyclone (Insane)]] (100%) **[[Revenge of W-Cyclone (Deadly)]] (200%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Floor 42]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = White Cyclone |Health = 999,999 HP |Attack Power = 89,000 damage

([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 5f (0.17 seconds) |Movement Speed = 7 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Gallery== White Cyclone(bcp).png|White Cyclone's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] IdleWhiteCyclone.gif|White Cyclone's moving animation Medal 020.png|White Cyclone on the ''White Winds'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] WhiteCycloneSpritesheet.png|White Cyclone's spritesheet ==Trivia== *White Cyclone is usually treated as the third [[Cyclone]], coming after [[Black Cyclone (Black/Floating)|Black Cyclone]], yet in the [[Enemy Release Order]] it is the second. *White Cyclone has the shortest range of all [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating Enemies]] and the second-highest DPS of all Cyclones and Floating enemies, with [[Red Cyclone (Red/Floating)|Red Cyclone]] in first place. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/071.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Black Cyclone '''(ブラックサイクロン, ''Burakku Saikuron'', '''Black Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Black Cyclone |image = Blackcyclone.PNG |latest appearance = |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ |appearance = [[Attack on B-Cyclone (Expert)|Heaven of Darkness]]
[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival!]]
[[Bad to Worse]]
[[NEO Darkness Heaven Stages|NEO Darkness Heaven]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Heavenly Tower - Floor 42]] }} ==Enemy== The Black Cyclone has short range, medium movement speed and extremely high DPS, but its damage per hit is relatively low. Like many Black enemies it also has numerous knockbacks, at 10. ==Strategy== [[Cyclone]]s are notoriously weak to crowd-control, and that goes double for Black Cyclone. With two easily countered traits, any combination of [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating]] and/or [[:Category:Anti-Black Cats|anti-Black]] units with slow or freeze abilities can put an end to Black Cyclone's onslaught, some examples being [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Flower Cat]], [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Cat Gunslinger]], [[Bodhisattva Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bodhisattva Cat]], [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]] and [[Oda Nobunaga (Uber Rare Cat)|Oda Nobunaga]]. Stack cheap attackers like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]] and [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Mer-Cat]] to keep the peons at bay, but do stay mindful of the [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Nyandam]] in [[Attack on B-Cyclone (Expert)|Attack on B-Cyclone]] and [[Wrath of B-Cyclone (Insane)|Wrath of B-Cyclone]] and the [[Director Kurosawah (Black)|Kurosawah]] in [[Doom Paradise (Insane)|Doom Paradise]], for Black Cyclone's knockbacks can easily draw your units into the backliner's range. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 070 |enemy category = Black/Floating |Enemy name = Black Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = Attacks continuously while moving
so no one can stop its cyclonic force.
Has a lot more pushing power.
... or is it suction power? |image1 = Enemy icon 070.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 超高速回転による連続攻撃は
いかなる者もよせつけない。
さらに触れるものをたまに吹き飛ばす
特性を持った恐ろしい敵。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Attacks continuously through ultra high-speed rotation so no one can stop its cyclonic force.
A fearsome enemy who can sometimes knockback anything that touches it. |Enemy name (JP) = ブラックサイクロ (Burakku Saikuron, Black Cyclone)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Heaven of Darkness: [[Attack on B-Cyclone (Expert)]] (100%) *[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival!]]: [[Tornado Carnival (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Bad to Worse]]: [[Doom Paradise (Insane)]] (200%) *[[NEO Darkness Heaven Stages|NEO Darkness Heaven]]: **[[Wrath of B-Cyclone (Insane)]] (100%) **[[Revenge of B-Cyclone (Deadly)]] (200%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Floor 42]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Black Cyclone |Health = 1,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 4,000 damage
(24,000 DPS) |Attack Range = 120
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 5f (0.17 seconds) |Movement Speed = 10 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = 20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|Knockback]] Cat Units |Element = Black/Floating }} ==Gallery== Black Cyclone(bcp).png|Black Cyclone's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] IdleBlackCyclone.gif|Black Cyclone's moving animation Black Cyclone Attack Animation.gif|Black Cyclone's attack animation Medal 019.png|Black Cyclone on the ''Dark Skies'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] BlackCycloneSpritesheet.png|Black Cyclone's spritesheet ==Trivia== *Black Cyclone is one of the few [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black Enemies]] whose eyes are not red. **It is also the only Black enemy to have a blue eye. *Black Cyclone is usually treated as the second [[Cyclone]], coming before [[White Cyclone (Floating)|White Cyclone]], yet in the [[Enemy Release Order]] they are reversed. *Black Cyclone has the fastest attack rate of all Black enemies and is tied with [[Metal Cyclone (Metal)|Metal Cyclone]] for the highest knockback count of all Cyclones. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/072.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Metal Cyclone''' (メタルサイクロン, ''Metaru Saikuron'', '''Metal Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy introduced in [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)|Sweet Irony]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Metal Cyclone |image = Metalcyclone.PNG |appearance = [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)|Sweet Irony]]
[[Techneurosis]]
[[Deadly Carnival II Event|Deadly Carnival II]]
[[Bitter Irony Stages|Bitter Irony]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Similarly to other [[Cyclone]]s, this enemy attacks non-stop and deals extreme damage, but has a very short, easy-to-exploit range. It takes only 1 damage from non-[[Critical Hit|Critical]] attacks like all Metal enemies yet has more than triple the health of [[Sir Metal Seal (Metal)|Sir Metal Seal]], requiring a lot of [[Critical Hit]]s to defeat. It is the slowest Cyclone, but its debut stage's length is much shorter to compensate. ==Strategy== In [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)|Attack on Titanium]] and [[Wrath of Titanium (Deadly)|Wrath of Titanium]], the only real strategy is to stack as many [[:Category:Anti-Metal Cats|anti-Metal cats]] as possible. Since all [[:Category:Cyclone Stages|Cyclone Stages]] drop anti-Metal cats, every Cyclone Stage cleared will make Metal Cyclone a little easier to manage. [[Jurassic Cat (Rare Cat)|Catasaurus]] is extremely helpful against this mechanical monstrosity, especially if [[Talents|Talented]], due to its frequent Critical Hits and the fact you don't have to worry if one dies due to their spammability. It can even work before his [[True Form]] as a matter of fact, except that before it it offers less consistency and worse range. Even with its ridiculous DPS and health (for a Metal enemy), Metal Cyclone suffers from being one of the slowest enemies in the game, with a pitiful 2 movement speed, and is hindered even further by being the enemy with the 4th-shortest range in the game, which makes it relatively easy to hold back. Even the most pathetic of Critters can work against Metal Cyclone, if luck is on your side. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 071 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Metal Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = Attacks continuously while moving
so no one can stop its cyclonic force.
A maelstrom of flying metal shards.
Its heavy body keeps it from floating. |image1 = Enemy icon 071.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 超高速回転による連続攻撃は
いかなる者もよせつけない。
鉄製であるがゆえに浮くことが出来ず
鉄屑をまき散らしながら破壊を続ける。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Attacks continuously through ultra high-speed rotation so no one can stop its cyclonic force. Its iron body prevents it from floating, and dispersing its metal shards everywhere means it is continuously being destroyed. |Enemy name (JP) = メタルサイクロン (Metaru Saikuron, Metal Cyclone}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Sweet Irony: [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Techneurosis]]: [[Nuts 'n' Bolts (Expert)]] (100%) *[[Deadly Carnival II Event|Deadly Carnival II]]: [[Tornado Carnival II (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Bitter Irony Stages|Bitter Irony]]: **[[Wrath of Titanium (Deadly)]] (100%) **[[Revenge of Titanium (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 38|Floor 38]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Metal Cyclone |Health = 77,777 HP |Attack Power = 77,000 damage
(462,000 DPS) |Attack Range = 65
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 5f (0.17 seconds) |Movement Speed = 2 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== Metal Cyclone(bcp).png|Metal Cyclone's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] IdleMetalCyclone.gif|Metal Cyclone's moving animation Ciclone.png|Metal Cyclone before it was implemented Medal 022.png|Metal Cyclone on the ''Storm of Steel'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] MetalCycloneSpritesheet.png|Metal Cyclone's spritesheet ==Trivia== *Metal Cyclone existed in the game data for an indeterminate length of time before it was implemented, hence why it is the fourth [[Cyclone]] in the [[Enemy Release Order]] despite being the fifth released, coming after [[Divine Cyclone (Angel)|Divine Cyclone]], and why [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]]'s ID comes before [[Attack on Titanium (Insane)|Sweet Irony]]'s in spite of that. **Before Metal Cyclone was implemented, it appeared noticeably higher above the ground, floating at the same altitude as the previous Cyclones - as shown in the gallery above. **The Metal Cyclone in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] still has this appearence. *Metal Cyclone is the only Cyclone to close its eye when it is knocked back. *Metal Cyclone has the highest health, shortest range and fastest attack rate of all [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal Enemies]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/073.html ----

For the stronger boss, see [[Manic Mohawk Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Crazed Cat''' (狂乱のネコ ''Kyōran no Neko'', '''Frenzy Cat''') is an enemy that appears in [[Dark Souls (Insane)|The Crazed Cat]], where he can be unlocked as a [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Unit]], as well as [[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]] and [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 31|Floor 31]] of the [[Heavenly Tower]]. {{Enemy_Info |name = Crazed Cat |image = Crazed Cat (Enemy Unit).jpg |first appearance = [[Dark Souls (Insane)]] |latest appearance = [[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] |money drop = 1,980¢ - 7,821¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has massive health, high DPS and non-stop Area Attacks. His only weaknesses are his somewhat low range and movement speed, so try to use those to your advantage. ==Strategy== In [[Dark Souls (Insane)]], the best strategy is to stack [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] and/or similar [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] at the beginning of the level. Cheaper stackable attackers like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] will help greatly against him. Make sure to bring at least three meatshields, such as [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]] and [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Boogie Cat]]. Using [[Battle Items#Sniper the Cat|Sniper the Cat]] is also recommended to keep him at bay if you are struggling. Otherwise, you can also use [[Sniper the Recruit (Super Rare Cat)|Sniper the Recruit]] instead if you have it. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Cat: [[Dark Souls (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]: **[[The Wild Dance (Deadly)]] (100%) **[[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 31|Floor 31]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Cat |Health = 2,400,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,880 damage

For the stronger boss, see [[Manic Eraser Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Crazed Tank Cat''' (狂乱のタンクネコ, ''Kyōran no Tanku Neko'', '''Frenzy Tank Cat''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that first appears in [[Absolute Defence (Insane)|Absolute Defence]], where it can be unlocked as a [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Unit]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crazed Tank Cat |image = Crazed Tank (enemy).png |appearance = [[Absolute Defence (Insane)|The Crazed Tank]]

Crazed Tank attacks quite differently from the [[Crazed Cat (Enemy Unit)|Crazed Cat]]: instead of cranking out rapid, close-quarters DPS, it will occasionally bash its head, dealing heavy damage in a shockingly large area. To compensate an attack of this caliber, Crazed Tank moves extremely slowly (note that it often advance a little due to its short backswing). Its other notable quality is its [[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]], which will allow it to obliterate the [[Cat Base]] in seconds. ==Strategy== {{Disambig|See [[Absolute Defence (Insane)|Absolute Defence]] for strategies.}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Tank: [[Absolute Defence (Insane)]] *[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]: **[[The Wild Dance (Deadly)]] **[[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 32|Floor 32]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Tank Cat |Health = 3,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 30,240 damage

For the stronger boss, see [[Manic Macho Legs Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Crazed Gross Cat''' (狂乱のキモネコ ''Kyōran no Kimo Neko'', '''Frenzy Gross Cat''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that first appears in [[Festival Gross (Insane)|Festival Gross]], where it can be unlocked as a [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Unit]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crazed Gross Cat |image = Crazed Gross (enemy).png |appearance = [[Festival Gross (Insane)|Crazed Gross]] [[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 33|Heavenly Tower - Floor 33]] |money drop = 810¢ - 3,199¢ }} ==Enemy== It has extremely short ranged attacks, but makes up for it with the ability to spawn level 3 [[Wave Attack]] at a 100% chance. Treat him as a stronger [[Kory]] with less standing range that spawns in mass. Do note that the Crazed Gross's Wave Attack reaches a range of 800, meaning only a few cats like [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Nerd Cat]] can avoid the attack. ==Strategy== If you have [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]], this enemy becomes a cakewalk. It can also be made a cakewalk using any [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Blockers]], notably [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]], in combination with tough, durable meatshields such as [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]]. Alternatively, you can avoid meatshields and use plenty of ranged attackers, such as [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] or [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], as these will eventually stack up and knock this enemy back before it can even attack. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Gross: [[Festival Gross (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]: **[[The Wild Dance (Deadly)]] (100%) **[[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 33|Floor 33]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Gross Cat |Health = 120,000 HP |Attack Power = 3,990 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the Cat Unit, see [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)]]. For the stronger boss, see [[Manic Flying Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Crazed Bird Cat''' (狂乱のネコノトリ, ''Kyōran no Neko Notori'', '''Frenzy Bird Cat''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that first appears in [[Flappy Cat (Insane)|Flappy Cat]], where it can be unlocked as a [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Unit]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crazed Bird Cat |image = Crazed Bird (enemy).png |appearance = [[Flappy Cat (Insane)|Crazed Bird]]
[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 33|Heavenly Tower - Floor 33]] |money drop = 1,999¢ - 7,896¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has an exceptionally long ranged Area Attack and high attack power. It possesses a fast attack animation but has a somewhat long attack rate while only having a movement speed of 2. ==Strategy== Crazed Bird Cat's range is quite serious, but the attack frequency and DPS are rather low, with only 2.1k DPS. Adding on, this enemy has a trait, which is [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]. This means you can use [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating]] cats such as [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]], although they can only land in around a single hit, due to their low attack rate and Crazed Bird Cat's high attack power. Regardless, [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] is still useful, dealing more than 7,500 damage per hit. Crazed Bird Cat also has pathetic movement speed, and, combined with the low attack rate, stalling this boss will be a cakewalk. However, on the Crazed Bird stage, [[Flappy Cat (Insane)|Flappy Cat]], there are more deadly enemies to back it up, such as [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] and [[Rain D.]] In fact, those two will provide most of the struggle in the stage, so if you manage to take them out, the worst is over. Do not try to inflict debuffs on this enemy with Cats like [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Shaman Cat]], [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Bishop Cat]], and [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Fortune Teller Cat]], because they will all be outranged and instantly killed. Instead, focus on tanky units that can endure Crazed Bird Cat's attacks and withstand the DPS. [[Cat Units]] with high health and only one knockback such as [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Ramen Cat]], [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Titan Cat]], and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jameira Cat]] can bring some promising guaranteed damage. Beware that this Cat only has one knockback, meaning that you cannot push it back until it dies. Even with the slow movement speed, if you are not careful, Crazed Bird Cat can get to your base and end the stage. For this reason, bringing a [[Battle Items#Sniper the Cat|Sniper the Cat]] will be a great help to keep this enemy at bay from getting to your base. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Bird: [[Flappy Cat (Insane)]] *[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]: **[[The Wild Dance (Deadly)]] **[[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 33|Floor 33]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Bird Cat |Health = 1,180,000 HP |Attack Power = 12,000 damage
(2,130.18 DPS) |Attack Range = 640
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 169f (5.63 seconds) |Movement Speed = 2 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 10f 0.33s
(17f 0.57s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Gallery== CrazedBirdCatspritesheet1.png|Crazed Bird Cat's spritesheet IdleCrazedBird.gif|Crazed Bird Cat's moving animation ==Trivia== *It is considered a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy for all intents and purposes, making it the only Crazed Cat with a trait. *This along with [[Crazed Tank Cat (Enemy Unit)|Crazed Tank Cat]] has the slowest movement speed out of all the Crazed Cats. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/082.html ----

For the stronger boss, see [[Manic Jamiera Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Crazed Titan Cat''' (狂乱の巨神ネコ, ''Kyōran no Kyoshin Neko'', '''Frenzy Titan Cat''', '''''Frenzy Giant Cat''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that first appears in [[Crazy Cats (Insane)|Crazy Cats]], where it can be unlocked as a [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Unit]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crazed Titan Cat |image = Crazed Titan (enemy).png |first appearance = |latest appearance = |money drop = 2,125¢ - 8,394¢ |appearance=[[Crazy Cats (Insane)|Crazed Titan]]
[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 37|Heavenly Tower - Floor 37]] }} ==Enemy== Crazed Titan Cat looks like a regular Titan Cat, but has a blank stare, black fists, a tattoo over its right shoulder, and a purple aura surrounding it. It attacks by charging up a punch, then smashing the ground. Occasionally, his punch creates a level 7 [[Wave Attack]] that spans a little more than 1/3 the battlefield. Due to his high attack power, it will destroy every unit not immune to waves, and those that survive will likely be slowed for a long time. ==Strategy== Crazed Titan Cat has ridiculous amounts of health and attack power, and a dangerously high chance to create a wave. The wave length is level 7, so not even [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]] can outrange it, making him rather useless. High health fighters such as [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Fish Cat]] are recommended due to their outstanding cost efficiency. However, Crazed Titan Cat also has the ability to knockback and slow, which makes it rather risky to confront him in short range melee. Crazed Titan Cat has 320 range, meaning that [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris/Cyborg Cat]] can outrange him, eventually stacking up lots of damage from their low recharge time. However, beware that, when Crazed Titan Cat manages to make a wave, almost all your backliners will die. A good amount of luck is required to survive his waves, but if you have [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] or any other [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Blockers]], most of his waves can be blocked, making this enemy much easier to fight. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Crazed Titan: [[Crazy Cats (Insane)]] *[[Clan of the Maniacs Stages|Clan of the Maniacs]]: **[[The Wild Dance (Deadly)]] **[[Insane Rhythms (Merciless)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Titan Cat |Health = 2,560,000 HP |Attack Power = 17,000 damage

Stages|Cabaret Cat Awakens!]] |money drop = 9,999¢ - 39,496¢ }} ==Enemy== It has extremely long range (longer than [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Nerd Cat]] and even [[Asiluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Assassinlan Pasalan]]) and deals very high damage. However, it has very low health and has slow attack rate and movement speed. Oddly enough, this enemy is [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]], probably to balance out its extremely low health. ==Strategy== Due to its low health and massive damage and range, spawn non-stop fast attackers like [[Mr. (Special Cat)|Mr.]] or [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] and, after multiple attacks, the boss will die and you will win the battle. Alternatively, [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|critical hitters]] can be timed during its time between attacks in order to get some hits off. A good thing to note is that basically any [[Critical Hit]] from any [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|critter]] will kill it instantly, due to its low 99 HP. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Event All-Stars Excellent Celebration!: [[Elite Corps (Insane)]] (250%) ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Final Boss Advent!? https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Gory Groom''' (ゴリ婿 gori muko) is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy introduced in [[The Forbidden Bride (Monthly Event)|The Forbidden Bride]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gory Groom |image = Gory Groom.png |appearance = [[The Forbidden Bride (Monthly Event)|The Forbidden Bride]]
[[Forbidden Bride Pt II (Monthly Event)|Forbidden Bride Pt II]]
[[June Gauntlet]]
[[Special Thanks! (Insane)]]
[[Total War: Fall Special]]
[[Heavenly Tower]]
[[Infernal Tower]] |money drop = 1789¢ - 7067¢ }} ==Enemy== Gory Groom, although not as speedy as his counterpart, [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Black]], shares many similarities with him in both stats and appearance. He has a very fast attack rate, decent range, high DPS, and Area Attack. Unlike his counterpart, he has the [[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]] ability, so he can destroy your base in a couple of hits if you are not careful. ==Strategy== Due to his high knockback count, the simplest way to defeat him is to stack DPS cats with decent range like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], or [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]]. [[:Category:Anti-Black Cats|Anti-Black cats]] like [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Weightlifter Cat]] will make quick work of him as well. Like most [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemies, two de-synced [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercats]] are enough to perma-[[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] him. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[The Forbidden Bride (Monthly Event)|The Forbidden Bride]]: **[[Bouquet Finds Water]] (100%) **[[Family Drama Woes]] (100%) **[[Mistook Bride's Name]] (100%) **[[Ex says I object]] (200%) **[[...No, I Do Not]] (150%) *Monthly Event All-Stars Special Celebration!: [[Special Thanks! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Lord Enma''' (閻魔大王, ''Enma-daiō'', '''The God of Death''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy introduced in [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Lord Enma |image = Lord Enma.png |appearance = [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]]

[[August Gauntlet]]
[[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)]]
[[Heavenly Tower]]
[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]] |money drop = 4,590¢ - 18,131¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy is the Red variant of [[Doge]] and [[Le'boin]], with higher health and attack damage than either. He is slower than Le'boin, takes longer to attack and has slightly less range, so you can safely use [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] against him. ==Strategy== As said before, you can use Dragon Cat and other long-ranged cats like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]], [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Dragon Cat]], or [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bath Cat]] to outrange and deal a lot of damage to Lord Enma. [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fried Shrimp Cat]] can tank many hits from him, allowing ranged attackers shown above and potentially [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Face Cat]] to enter his hitbox, freezing him temporarily or permanently if in [[True Form]]. With only one knockback, he can’t be unfrozen until death. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]]: **[[Hiring fake mourners]] (100%) **[[Grave is just plastic...]] (200%) **[[I'm not here anymore.]] (200%) *[[Ghostly Strangers (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Strangers]]: **[[Long Line at Cerberus]] (400%) **[[Still on Vacation]] (400%) **[[See You Next Year]] (500%) *[[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)|Monthly Event All-Stars Wonderful Celebration]]: [[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)]] (400%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 11|Floor 11]] (100%) *[[Citadel|Red Citadel]]: **[[Citadel/Floor 6|Floor 6]] (100%) **[[Citadel/Floor 8|Floor 8]] (400%) *[[August Gauntlet]]: **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.1]] (100%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.2]] (139%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.3]] (178%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.4]] (217%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.5]] (256%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.6]] (295%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.7]] (334%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.8]] (373%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.9]] (412%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.10]] (450%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Lord Enma |Health = 112,590 HP |Attack Power = 6,000 damage

The beard, eyebrows and headwear are common traits in depictions of Enma Daiō. *Enma is the Japanese name of [[wikipedia:Yama (Buddhism)|Yama]], a deity in East Asian and Buddhist mythology. *This isn't the only time Enma has appeared as an enemy in a [[PONOS Corporation|PONOS]] tower defense game: In [[Yuru-i GeGeGe no Kitarou: Youkai Dotabata Daisensou]], the final boss of [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Jigoku|Jigoku]] Chapter 1 is [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Enma-Daiō|Enma-Daiō]]. *This is the only appearance of a Red Doge in [[The Battle Cats]], which doesn't exist as a standalone unit. **However, in [[Nyanko Defence Force]], one of the UFO Doge variants was completely red.[[File:Reddogeship.png|thumb|right|135px|Red UFO Doge]] *The character on Lord Enma's headwear means "Emperor/King" in Chinese/Kanji dialect. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/103.html ----
