'''[[Bearkini (Event Enemy)|<< Bearkini]] | [[Leggsy (Event Enemy)|Leggsy >>]]'''

---- {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Red Enemies]] [[Category:Event Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Leggsy''' (ハシル君, ''Hashiru-kun'' [''hashiru = run'']) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] introduced in the [[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Leggsy |image = Leggsy.png |first appearance = [[Can't pass thru walls?]] |latest appearance = [[Citadel/Floor 4#Traitless|Traitless Citadel - Floor 4]] |money drop = 4,000¢ - 15,800¢ }} ==Enemy== [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]], but with legs. He has 1/2 the stats The Face has, but much more speed. Leggsy is similar to [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]] due to his nature of attacking continuously and fast speed, but drops as much money as The Face upon death and has one more knockback than Shy Boy. ==Strategy== The best way to defeat Leggsy is to treat him as if it was a Shy Boy, but without any specific [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] weaknesses. Since he is [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]], Leggsy has far fewer [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|crowd-controllers]] and debuffs that can slow his progress. Instead, use plenty of meatshields with general attackers and if that isn't enough, [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] him with [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Magica Cat]]. Attacker-wise, [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] along with their [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed]] [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|variants]] should work well. [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]], [[Surfer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Castaway Cat]] and [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]] are also effective against Leggsy. [[:Category:Nuker-class Cats|Nukers]] will be worth your budget here since one-shotting or crippling him in 1 hit can give you more money than you spent on one unit. When his running and chomping is put to an end, Leggsy will drop as much cash as an ordinary Face does, so don't be afraid to use a lot of your budget to kill it. Although, this is not that possible in [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 18|Floor 18]] of the [[Heavenly Tower]], where you will probably be tight on cash until you kill the first or second Leggsy. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ghostly Houseguests (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Houseguests]]: **[[Can't pass thru walls?]] (100%) **[[Just hit the skies!]] (100%) **[[Wasting inheritance]] (100%) **[[Grave is just plastic...]] (300%) **[[I'm not here anymore.]] (300%) *[[Ghostly Strangers (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Strangers]]: [[Still on Vacation]] (800%) *[[:Category:Monthly Event All-Stars Stages|Monthly Event All-Stars Wonderful Celebration!]]: [[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)]] (300%) *[[Total War: Summer Special]]: **[[Song of Summer: Standard (Insane)]] (500%) **[[Song of Summer: Advanced (Deadly)]] (800%) **[[Song of Summer: Supreme (Merciless)]] (1,000%) *[[Summer Break Cats]]: **[[Late Nite Special]] (100%) **[[A Lost Friend]] (300%) *[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 4#Traitless|Floor 4]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 18|Floor 18]] (900%) *[[August Gauntlet]]: **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.1]] (300%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.2]] (339%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.3]] (378%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.4]] (417%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.5]] (456%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.6]] (495%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.7]] (534%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.8]] (573%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.9]] (612%) **[[August Gauntlet/Houseguests Lv.1~10|Houseguests Lv.10]] (650%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Leggsy |Health = 50,000 HP |Attack Power = 600 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Hermit Peng''' (ペ仙人 pe sennin) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Hermit Peng |image = Hermit Peng.png |first appearance = [[Day Job = Boxers]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 15|Infernal Tower - Floor 15]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== Hermit Peng is basically a [[Jackie Peng]], except it has a lot more attack power + health, and has [[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]. Looks like a bald penguin with a beard and giant eyebrows. Attacks by spinning around in the air, dealing massive damage to all within its range. One thing to note is that he only appears at 100% strength magnification in one stage, [[Day Job = Boxers]]. ==Strategy== A good strategy to defeat the Hermit Peng is to spam meatshields such as [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]] and [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]], while sending cats with high attack power and long range, such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], to damage it while staying out of Hermit Peng's range. https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Master Da Xun''' (マスターダッフン masutaa daffun, ''Lit. '''Master Dagshund''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Master Da Xun |image = Master Da Xun.png |first appearance = [[Escaping the Home]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 15|Infernal Tower - Floor 15]] |money drop = 380¢ - 1,500¢ }} ==Enemy== It has buffer arms and a beard, but don't let that frighten you. It has much more health than [[Dagshund]], but slightly weaker attack power combined with a slower attack rate. It also has three knockbacks instead of Dagshund's one knockback. Due to its health, its usage in most of the stages it appears in is to act as a meatshield for more threatening enemies, such as [[The Red Malice (Event Enemy)|The Red Malice]] or [[Hermit Peng (Event Enemy)|Hermit Peng]]. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Old Guys About Town (Monthly Event)|Old Guys About Town]]: **[[Escaping the Home]] (100%) **[[Bearhanded Brawler]] (200%) **[[Living the Dream]] (300%) **[[Wife Still the Boss]] (400%) *[[Old Guys in the City (Monthly Event)|Old Guys in the City]]: **[[Twilight Wandering]] (450%) **[[The Wife Still Wins]] (600%) *[[Total War: Fall Special]]: **[[Feast of Fall: Advanced (Deadly)]] (400%) **[[Feast of Fall: Exalted (Merciless)]] (500%) **[[Feast of Fall: Supreme (Merciless)]] (600%) *[[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)|Monthly Event All-Stars Wonderful Celebration!]]: [[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)]] (600%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 15|Floor 15]] (300%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 15|Floor 15]] (400%) *[[September Gauntlet]]: **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.1]] (100%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.2]] (133%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.3]] (166%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.4]] (199%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.5]] (232%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.6]] (265%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.7]] (298%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.8]] (331%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.9]] (364%) **[[September Gauntlet/About Town Lv.1~10|About Town Lv.10]] (400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Master Da Xun |Health = 100,000 HP |Attack Power = 2,700 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Pigge Back''' (豚戦わんこ Buta sen Wanko, ''Lit. '''Pigge against Doge''''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Pigge Back |image = Pigge Back.png |first appearance = [[Awkward Entrance]] |latest appearance = [[Feast of Fall: Supreme (Merciless)]] |money drop = 500¢ - 1,975¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy appears to be a [[Pigge (Red)|Pigge]] carried by three [[Doge]]s. The Pigge appears to be wearing a white headband, while the Doges seem to be wearing some sort of white clothing along with a visor. Its attack animation consists of the three Doges jumping up and preparing to bite, throwing Pigge up into the air. Pigge then lands on the Doges and they bite the target. Fortunately, with only 10,000 health and 200 attack power, this enemy is not very threatening, the only other thing it has going for it is its quick attack rate. ==Strategy== This enemy can easily be killed by [[Axe Cat (Normal Cat)|Axe Cat]], [[Swordsman Cat (Rare Cat)|Swordsman Cat]], [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bath Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]], and numerous other [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red]] cats. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Autumn = Sports Day! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Divine Cyclone''' (エンジェルサイクロン ''Enjeru Saikuron'', '''Angel Cyclone''') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy introduced in [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Oncoming Maelstrom]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Divine Cyclone |image = Divine Cyclone.jpg |appearance = [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]]
[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival]]
[[Day of Judgement]]
[[Wrath of the Divine Stages|Wrath of the Divine]]
[[Heavenly Tower]]
[[Infernal Tower]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Divine Cyclone's gimmick is being the first [[Cyclone]] to lack the [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] trait, requiring specialized [[:Category:Anti-Angel Cats|anti-Angel units]] to counter it. Beyond that, it has all the typical attributes of a Cylone: non-stop attacks and extreme health and DPS offset by pitiful range and somewhat low speed. ==Strategy== You can easily take advantage of its short range by using [[:Category:Cats with Knockback ability|cats with knockback]], [[:Category:Cats with Slow ability|slow]] or [[:Category:Cats with Freeze ability|freeze]] abilities against Angels. Examples of these are [[Stilts Cat (Rare Cat)|Stilts Cat]], [[Cat Toaster (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Toaster]] or [[Juliet Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Juliet Cat]], respectively. As for damage dealers, almost anything will work in [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Oncoming Maelstrom]], [[Wrath of A-Cyclone (Insane)|Wrath of A-Cyclone]] and [[Tornado Carnival (Deadly)|Tornado Carnival]] if you can keep it pinned down, while in [[Revenge of A-Cyclone (Deadly)|Revenge of A-Cyclone]] you should focus on units that continually knockback the [[Rain D.|Rain Ds]] from behind the frontlines. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 112 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Divine Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = A wrathful being who cleanses evil
with the force of a typhoon.
Take care: Angels won't be harmed
by anti-Floating attacks! |image1 = Enemy icon 112.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 世の中を変わらない吸引力で
浄化し続ける恐ろしい天使。
また天使は浮いてる敵属性の特殊攻撃を
無効化するので注意が必要。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A terrifying Angel who continues to purify
the world with its relentless suction power.
Also, be aware that Angels are immune to anti-Floating special attacks. |Enemy name (JP) = エンジェルサイクロン (Enjeru Saikuron, Angel Cyclone) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]]: [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)]] *[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival]]: [[Tornado Carnival (Deadly)]] *[[Day of Judgement]]: [[Acts of Cat-God (Insane)]] *[[Wrath of the Divine Stages|Wrath of the Divine]]: **[[Wrath of A-Cyclone (Insane)]] **[[Revenge of A-Cyclone (Deadly)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 26|Floor 26]] **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Floor 42]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 26|Floor 26]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Divine Cyclone |Health = 1,399,999 HP |Attack Power = 76,000 damage

([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 5f 0.17 seconds |Movement Speed = 6 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Angel }} ==Gallery== Divine Cyclone(bcp).png|Divine Cyclone's Enemy Guide entry in [[The Battle Cats POP!]] DivineCycloneSpritesheet.png|Divine Cyclone's spritesheet IdleDivineCyclone.gif|Divine Cyclone's moving animation Medal 021.png|Divine Cyclone on the ''Holy Squall'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Appearance-wise, Divine Cyclone is the most biblically-accurate [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] in [[The Battle Cats]]. **It also has the biggest halo of all Angels. *Divine Cyclone has the highest DPS, shortest range and fastest attack rate of all Angels. *Despite having a name that starts with a "D", Divine Cyclone appears in stages called [[Wrath of A-Cyclone (Insane)|Wrath of A-Cyclone]] and [[Revenge of A-Cyclone (Deadly)|Revenge of A-Cyclone]]. This is likely because of Divine Cyclone's Japanese name, Angel Cyclone, which the translators may have forgotten was different in [[The Battle Cats|BCEN]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/114.html ----

description:
A Hippoe who yearned for a halo.
Styled his hair into wings...
which makes him the next best thing
to a Pegasus. Amirite?

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Gabriel''' (天使ガブリエル, ''Tenshi Gaburieru'', '''Angel Gabriel''') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Doge]] that appears in [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gabriel |image = GabrielBattle2.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[King of Freedom|Sub-chapter 19 - King of Freedom]]
'''ItF''': [[Madagascar (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Madagascar]]
'''CotC''': [[Catseye Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Catseye Nebula]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hall of Feasting|Sub-chapter 42 - Hall of Feasting]] |money drop = 250¢ - 988¢ }} ==Enemy== Gabriel differs from [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] by having lower attack power and range in exchange for Area Attack, more health and faster movement speed, allowing him to take down stacks of cats easily. As he is outranged by all [[Cat Units]], he will usually move forward a little after killing a unit, making that if you don't knock him back, he will keep inching closer and closer until he reaches the [[Cat Base]]. ==Strategy== If this enemy is sent out rapidly and in hordes, he can be very annoying. Try to not let him take advantage of his many knockbacks by killing him with few, powerful blows. You can use any cat with high damage or DPS like [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|UFO Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], etc., while defending with [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]] to exploit his Angel trait. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 114 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Gabriel |enemy_endesc1 = Great-grandaddy of the Doge clan.
Watches to make sure his descendants
keep up their studies: sleeping in class
earns a bite from the old man! |image1 = Enemy icon 114.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんこのご先祖様。
いつも、わんこの背後で勉強を
見守っている。勉強中に居眠りすると、
具現化してわんこに噛み付く |enemy_jpdesc1 = Doge's great-granddaddy.
Always watches over Doge's studies from behind.
When Doge falls asleep while studying,
he materializes and gives him a bite. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使ガブリエル (Tenshi Gaburieru, Angel Gabriel) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]]=== *Stage 1-25: [[Madagascar (Into the wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Angelic Gory''' (天使ゴンザレス ''Tenshi Gonzaresu'', '''Angel Gonzales''') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy that appears in [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Angelic Gory |image = Angelicgory.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Liar's Fate|Sub-chapter 19 - Liar's Fate]]
'''ItF''': [[Alaska (Into the Future)|Chapter 2 - Alaska]]
'''CotC''': [[Catseye Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Catseye Nebula]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Immortal Zenith|Sub-chapter 43 - Immortal Zenith]] |money drop = 500¢ - 1,975¢ }} ==Enemy== Angelic Gory is essentially a souped-up [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Black]], with even higher health, DPS and speed, less knockbacks and a harder-to-counter trait. ==Strategy== A good strategy for this enemy is to stall him with high health cats like [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]]/[[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]] and strike him with mid-ranged cats such as [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]]. This will knock him back fairly easily, allowing for a quick breather for your team. [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Rocker Cat]] excels against Angelic Gory, especially in his [[True Form]], as he does considerable damage and only takes 1/4 of the damage. [[Dioramos (Uber Rare Cat)|Dioramos]] also gets a chance to be useful against Angelic Gory, but be wary that he doesn't get swarmed too quickly! [[Juliet Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Juliet Cat]] might not be the best choice against Angelic Gory as her long attack animation causes her to miss often with Angelic Gory's high knockback count. If you have any [[Ancient Heroes Ultra Souls (Gacha Event)|Ultra Souls]] or [[Food Stall Cat (Rare Cat)|Delivery Cat]], they also have a chance to prove their worth; as when supported by groups of [[Talents|Talented]] [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cats]], they will effectively stall and destroy Angelic Gory as well as any Angelic support he may have. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 115 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Angelic Gory |enemy_endesc1 = An ugly mug is what got this guy
chased out of heaven.
An old-school fallen angel who makes
a living by lurking at the slot machines. |image1 = Enemy icon 115.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 顔がコワイ。という理由で天上界から
たたき落とされた堕天使ゴリラ。
堕天使になってからはパチプロで
生計を立てている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Has a scary face.
For that reason, the heavenly world kicked out this fallen Angel gorilla.
Since becoming a fallen Angel,
he's been making a living as a pachinko pro. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使ゴンザレス (Tenshi Gonzaresu, Angel Gonzales)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]]=== *Stage 2-40: [[Alaska (Into the ---- {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Stories of Legend Enemies]] [[Category:Angel Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]
description:
An ugly mug is what got this guy
chased out of heaven.
An old-school fallen angel who makes
a living by lurking at the slot machines.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|Not to be confused with [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher]] or [[Ms. Sign]].}} '''Angel Fanboy '''(天使愛好家 ''Tenshi Aikō-ka'', '''Angel Fanboy''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Angel Fanboy |image = Angelfanboy.jpg |first appearance = [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]]
'''SoL''': [[Gouache Ghouls|Sub-chapter 42 - Gouache Ghouls]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 16|Infernal Tower - Floor 16]] |money drop = 1¢ - 4¢ }} ==Enemy== Angel Fanboy serves as a weak enemy to remind you that [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Anti-Floating cats]], such as [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Shaman Cat]], [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kotatsu Cat]] and [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Mer-Cat]], will not deal Anti-Floating effects to [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel Enemies]]. He only does 1 damage with a long delay on attacks, has 5 health, drops almost no money on death, and is classified as a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy. He only appears in 8 stages, which renders him a glorified peon whose sole purpose is to remind you of enemy mechanics. ==Strategy== His very low health and attack power make him pathetically easy to defeat, and at the points where you encounter him, he should be the least of your worries. With that being said, use any cat that you have to defeat him easily. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 116 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Angel Fanboy |enemy_endesc1 = Blew his life savings on Angel goods.
Discovered Angels aren't actually
Floating enemies after obsessively
collecting Rare Cat Capsules. |image1 = Enemy icon 116.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 天使の為に全財産を投じた実業家。
天使には、天使属性以外の特殊攻撃が
効かないということをレアガチャを
やりまくることで発見した功労者。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This businessman invested all his wealth because of an Angel.
A meritorious guy who discovered Angels aren't affected
by special attacks, except for anti-Angel abilities,
after obsessively rolling Rare Cat Capsules. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使愛好家 (Tenshi Aikō-ka, Angel Fanboy)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 42-3: [[Gouache Ghouls]] (10%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)|Wrath of Heaven]]: [[Oncoming Maelstrom (Expert)]] (100%) *[[Wrath of the Divine Stages|Wrath of the Divine]]: [[Wrath of A-Cyclone (Insane)]] (100%) *[[No Plan A (Deadly)|Clionel Ascendant]]: [[No Plan A (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Clionel Dominant Stages|Clionel Dominant]]: [[New Testament (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[The Angel & The Demon]]: [[No Plan A (Deadly) (Angel & Demon)|No Plan A (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 16|Floor 16]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 16|Floor 16]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Angel Fanboy |Health = 5 HP |Attack Power = 1 damage
(0.05 DPS) |Attack Range = 800
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 605f 20.17 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 6f 0.2s
(8f 0.27s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== AngelFanboyspritesheet.png|Angel Fanboy's spritesheet Angelfanboyjp.png|Angel Fanboy's appearance in [[Nyanko Daisensou|BCJP]] IdleAngelFanboyJP.gif|Angel Fanboy's moving animation (JP) ==Trivia== *He is one of the two enemies whose Enemy Guide entries do not mention their traits, the other being [[Bun Bun Black (Black/Floating)|Bun Bun Black]]. **The reason behind his bizarre attributes is to prevent him from being killed in one hit before the player has the chance to read his sign, while not encouraging the player to bring an [[:Category:Anti-Metal Cats|anti-Metal unit]] for such a trivial enemy. *Prior to [[Version 6.4 Update|Version 6.4]], which added [[Grotesque Gallery]], Angel Fanboy was exclusively found in Event Stages. *His English description used to be: "Blew his life savings on Angel goods. Discovered Angels can't be hurt by non-Angelic attacks after obsessively collecting Rare Cat Capsules." It was likely changed due to its potential to be misleading. *His advice is actually incorrect in the case of one enemy: [[Variety Bears (Event Enemy)|Variety Bears]] defy the rule by having both Floating and Angel traits. *In other languages, such as Spanish and French, the text on this enemy's sign is still in English. Angel Fanboy shares this particularity with [[Ms. Sign]], but not [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher]], as Aku Researcher's sign is actually translated across versions. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/118.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Wall Doge''' (カベわんこ ''Kabe Wanko'', '''Wall Doggy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Wall Doge |image = WallDogeBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Monkey Magic|Sub-chapter 20 - Monkey Magic]] |money drop = 200¢ - 790¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Patient Red Fox|Sub-chapter 38 - Patient Red Fox]] }} ==Enemy== Wall Doge is similar to [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]]. However, she has more attack power and health. Spawned in groups to protect stronger enemies, just like how Wall Cat is used. ==Strategy== Use any high DPS unit like [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]], or [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]], just to name a few. On some stages, you can use her as a stepping stone to snipe backline enemies with [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave]]/[[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge]]/[[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]] units, because of her high HP and low DPS. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 117 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Wall Doge |enemy_endesc1 = A Doge who stole Wall Cat's schtick
and turned herself into a wall.
Didn't predict that other Doges would
use her to replace missing dominoes. |image1 = Enemy icon 117.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ネコカベをライバル視して、負けじと
自分もカベになってみたわんこ。
たまに足らないドミノの代わりとして
使われることもある。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Thinking of Wall Cat as a rival and
refusing to lose, this Doge also became a wall.
Sometimes used to replace missing dominoes. |Enemy name (JP) = カベわんこ (Kabe Wanko, Wall Doggy) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Coffin Zoge |Wall Doge's [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant. It has higher health, slightly increased damage and range, and can [[Special Abilities#Revive|revive]] with 100% HP an unlimited number of times. Unlike most other Zombies, it cannot [[Special Abilities#Burrow|burrow]] past your cats. |Icy Doge |An ice-themed variant of Wall Doge first seen in [[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]]. Has more health, along with very slightly increased attack power and range. |Chocolate Wall Doge |Wall Doge's black variant designed to look like a chocolate bar. It can be found in certain [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. It possesses significantly more health and damage, with [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze Immunity]] and a guaranteed chance to create Lv.4 [[Wave Attack#Mini-Wave|Mini-Waves]]. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 12: [[Nepal (Aku Realm)|Nepal]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 20-4: [[Monkey Magic]] (100%) *Stage 20-7: [[Pig Swill]] (100%) *Stage 21-2: [[Claustronyctophobia]] (100%) *Stage 22-5: [[Dictator's Garden]] (100%) *Stage 23-1: [[Feast of Betrayal]] (100%) *Stage 23-6: [[Saint Red Fox]] (100%) *Stage 24-5: [[Dark Nemesis]] (100%) *Stage 26-5: [[Littering Coast]] (6,000%) *Stage 29-4: [[Thorny Dialogue]] (300%) *Stage 39-3: [[Mineral Treatment]] (600%) *Stage 41-6: [[Broadband Omens]] (400%) *Stage 42-5: [[Baroque Beasts]] (300%) *Stage 47-5: [[Cave Conclusion]] (300%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-1: [[Escolar Coast]] (600%) *Stage 14-2: [[A Private Rainforest]] (600%) *Stage 21-1: [[Furry Cavern]] (600%) *Stage 24-2: [[Slave to Energy]] (600%) *Stage 38-2: [[Patient Red Fox]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Mr. Awakens! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Ginger Snache''' ('''赤毛のにょろ''' ''Akage no Nyoro'', '''''Redhead Nyoro''''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[Snache]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Ginger Snache |image = Ginger Snache.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Gandara's Rest|Sub-chapter 20 - Gandara's Rest]]
'''ItF''': [[Ghana (Into the Future)|Chapter 2 - Ghana]]
'''CotC''': [[Red Rectangle (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Red Rectangle]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Immortal Zenith|Sub-chapter 43 - Immortal Zenith]] |money drop = 130¢ - 514¢ }} ==Enemy== Unlike fellow Red peon [[B.B.Bunny (Red)|B.B.Bunny]], Ginger Snache can pose an actual threat, with non-stop attacks, very high damage, more knockbacks and speed. Despite being single-target, his DPS and tendency to be spammed can make him almost impossible to just stall. ==Strategy== Try to focus on numbers rather than slow-moving powerhouses like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]], as Ginger Snache can push hard if there's nothing around to knock him back. [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] and other [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red units]] can quickly kill Ginger Snache, as well as spammable mid-ranged attackers like [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 118 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Ginger Snache |enemy_endesc1 = His lovely red locks inspired a
master's thesis on reptilian hair care.
The hair dye is still watercolor, and this
information still means nothing. |image1 = Enemy icon 118.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = にょろのような形をしたヘビ。
赤毛がにょろっと一本出ているため、
どっかの学者が名づけた名前である。
体の赤色はもちろん水彩絵の具。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Snake shaped like a nyoro*.
He was named by some scholar because
he had a single red hair sticking out.
The red color of his body is of course watercolor paint.
*Nyoro is both Snache's Japanese name and another term for a wave dash or tilde. |Enemy name (JP) = 赤毛のにょろ (Akage no Nyoro, Redhead Nyoro)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]]=== wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sunfish Jones''' (マンボーグ鈴木 ''Manbōgu Suzuki'', '''Manborg Suzuki''' [''manbō = sunfish'']) is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sunfish Jones |image = Sunfishjones.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Imp's cold sweat|Sub-chapter 20 - Imp's cold sweat]] |latest appearance = '''UL:''' [[Learned to Hate|Sub-chapter 38 - Learned to Hate]] |money drop = 3,333¢ - 13,165¢ }} ==Enemy== Sunfish Jones moves slow with a relatively long attack interval, but has a lot of health and range and a 30% chance to slow your cats down for 3 seconds. ==Strategy== Since Sunfish Jones has massive range, the only realistic way to deal with him is to create an opening by defeating the enemies' frontline first. Once exposed, no amount of stealth can protect him from the likes of [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed M. Titan Cat]]. An alternative is to use [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]]/[[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]], but that is rarely an option. An excellent unit to use against Sunfish Jones is [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]], due to his attack, HP, and [[Special Abilities#Resistant|Resistance]] vs. Angels as well as not being knocked back until he is killed. Cats like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare]] nukers/rushers make quick work of Jones, as their massive DPS can turn him into fish meat. Just make sure to clear out any peons with the [[Cat Cannon]] or support units. Jones' lowish damage for a backliner allows them to tank a few hits from him, making the window for them to be sent out much bigger, as well as allowing them to land more hits on him. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 119 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Sunfish Jones |enemy_endesc1 = A sunfish named Jones. Yeah, so what?
Shaped like a stealth bomber, and
therefore undetectable by radar systems.
Actually, that's how he got into heaven. |image1 = Enemy icon 119.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = マンボウなのに本名は鈴木。
ステルスつきのため魚群探知機に
反応しない。姿を目撃したものは
あの世に逝けるという。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Although he is a sunfish, his real name is Suzuki.
Because he has stealth, he can't be detected by fish finders.
It is said that those who witness his appearance will pass away. |Enemy name (JP) = マンボーグ鈴木 (Manbōgu Suzuki, Manborg Suzuki [''manbō = sunfish'']) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Ayumi Manbosaki |A [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of Sunfish Jones that only appears in the [[Survive! Mola Mola! Collaboration Event]]. Much weaker overall, but has 1 knockback instead of 4. |Spacefish Jones |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of Sunfish Jones. Generally deals much higher damage than Sunfish Jones, but has much less health. It also has a [[Barrier]] with a breaking point of 12,000. |Golem Sunfish |A [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of Sunfish Jones. Similar to [[Ultima Beast Naala (Relic / Behemoth)|Ultima Beast Naala]], it has several dangerous abilities: [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] and most notably, a 3-part [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] attack with each attack striking a further area and getting weaker as it progresses. }} [[Grats! 3 Years!!|Birthday Present!]] |money drop = 2¢ - 7¢ }} ==Enemy== This is actually a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal enemy]], 3 Doges inside a birthday cake. https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Pigeon de Sable''' (ド鳩・サブ・レー, ''Dohato-Sebu-Rē'') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Pigeon de Sable |image = PigeondeSableBattle2.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Safe and Not Sorry|Sub-chapter 21 - Safe and Not Sorry]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hall of Feasting|Sub-chapter 42 - Hall of Feasting]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ }} ==Enemy== Pigeon de Sable has a mild attack rate and will always make a Lv.1 [[Wave Attack]]. Much like R.Ost, his range is enough for him to hide behind other peons while still blocking hits for the boss. Do not underestimate Pigeon de Sables, because groups of them can shred your units and easily break through even the toughest of meatshields. A Lv.1 Wave Attack might not sound like much, but it covers a range of exactly 467.5, being able to hit all units under that range. ==Strategy== [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] is a ridiculously good counter against Pigeon de Sable, since it is resistant to Floating enemies, can weaken them and blocks Wave Attacks, which are this enemy's strongest point. Even without his Immune to Waves [[Talents|Talent]], [[Kung Fu Cat (Special Cat)|Dancer Cat]] is a great counter to Pigeon de Sables in many stages, being able to take out groups of them in a single strike. [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)|Miyamoku Musashi]] is similarly effective, but make sure to support him with other attackers. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 123 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Pigeon de Sable |enemy_endesc1 = Never fears leading the battle charge
to defend his pacifist ideals.
Lovingly batters Cat invaders
with his sharp beak of diplomacy. |image1 = Enemy icon 123.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 平和のシンボルとして、代々引き継が
れてきた宿命を背負う17代目ハト。
侵略してくるにゃんこに平和の頭突きが
うなりを上げる！ |enemy_jpdesc1 = As a symbol of peace, this 17th-generation
pigeon comes bearing the same destiny
as those who came before him.
Batters the invading Cats with headbutts of peace! |Enemy name (JP) = ド鳩・サブ・レー (Dohato-sebu-rē) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Sa-Bat |A weaker variant of Pigeon de Sable first seen in the [[All Hallows Road (Celebration Event)|All Hallows Road]] event. https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dark Otter''' (ブラッコ ''Burakko'') is [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of [[Otta-smack-u]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[Into the Future]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dark Otter |image = DarkOtterBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Claustronyctophobia|Sub-chapter 21 - Claustronyctophobia]]
'''ItF''': [[Colombia (Into the Future)|Chapter 2 - Colombia]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Ironsand Beach|Sub-chapter 33 - Ironsand Beach]] |money drop = 250¢ - 988¢ }} ==Enemy== Dark Otter is a lot stronger than his predecessor, having about 4x the attack and about 6x HP the health of a normal [[Otta-smack-u]]. He also retains the short range of the original Otta and has two knockbacks instead of one, but unlike most other [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black Enemies]], has a low money drop. ==Strategy== Since he has high DPS and stamina, it is recommended to use meatshields like [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]], and stack up attackers like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]]. [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Weightlifter Cat]] works the best for this enemy. [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Magica Cat]] is another option to keep pushing him away from your cats; or even better, [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]]. Any of the [[Sengoku Wargods Vajiras (Gacha Event)|Sengoku Wargods]] can and will make this enemy a breeze. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 124 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Dark Otter |enemy_endesc1 = Bears his family's ultimate weapon:

Beefcake Cat is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Kung Fu Cat (Special Cat)]].}} '''Dancer Cat''' (ネコダンサー neko dansā, '''Cat Dancer''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dancer Cat |image = Dancer Cat (enemy).png |first appearance = [[Path of Kung-Fu (Expert)]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 20|Infernal Tower - Floor 20]] |money drop = 2,220¢ - 7,770¢ }} ==Enemy== Dancer Cat has very high health with no clear weaknesses (excluding Ubers), having a fast attack rate, extreme range, and insane damage. Power-stalling with 4 Meat-Shields is definitely required. His stats are magnified by 2x in Insane, rendering him almost immortal. ==Strategy== [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]] is effective against Dancer Cat, especially if she consecutively knocks him back many times in a row, but their difference in range is only 5, so she won't last long unless she knocks him back a lot.[[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)| Bahamut]] can deal heavy damage to Dancer Cat.[[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)| Li'l Nyandam]] can last longer due to his range, but he doesn't do much damage. [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]] can also be used. For the Cat Unit, see [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)]].}} '''Flying Ninja Cat''' (ムササビネコ忍者 ''Musasabi Neko Ninja'', '''Flying Squirrel Ninja Cat''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Flying Ninja Cat |image = Flying Ninja Cat (enemy).png |first appearance = [[Way of the Ninja (Veteran)]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 22|Infernal Tower - Floor 22]] |money drop = 1,980¢ - 7,821¢ }} ==Enemy== Flying Ninja Cat has low range, slow movement and rapid, moderate damaging attacks with splash damage. She has one million health, being able to soak up many hits. ==Strategy== In [[Ninja Awakens! Stages|Ninja Awakens!]], the support is light enough that you can win using only 3-4 meatshields (including [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]]) and a bunch of long-ranged attackers (e.g., [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Crazed Bahamut Cat]]). Otherwise, use [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating cats]] to deal with this enemy. [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Sadako Cat]] is great here, as she can tank the damage and weaken the Ninja. [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] is another great unit because she outranges Flying Ninja Cat by 10. Just protect and spam her and the Ninja is killed in no time. Another method is stacking [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Necromancer Cats]]; if you use [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cat]] as well, you can halt Flying Ninja Cat almost entirely. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ninja Awakens! Stages|Ninja Awakens!]]: **[[Way of the Ninja (Veteran)]] (100%) **[[Way of the Ninja (Insane)]] (200%) *[[Deadly Carnival! Event|Deadly Carnival]]: [[Awakened Carnival (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 22|Floor 22]] (300%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 22|Floor 22]] (300%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Flying Ninja Cat |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,220 damage

([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 18f 0.6 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 6f 0.2s
(12f 0.4s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Gallery== 135 e.png|Flying Ninja Cat's spritesheet TheFlyingNinja.gif|Flying Ninja Cat's animations ==Trivia== *Her gender is confirmed by the Caltrops' description in [[The Burgle Cats]]: "Ninja Cat forgot to clean up after herself. Just rubber, but the pointy bits still hurt when stepped on! Imagine if it was actual steel!" *Her movement animation is identical to Kanzo Hattori's "Flying Squirrel Technique" in [[wikipedia:Ninja Hattori-kun|''Ninja Hattori-kun'']], and her parachute looks just like Hattori's outside of having a swirl-pattern design. Furthermore, her Japanese name is Flying Squirrel Ninja Cat. **Incidentally, Hattori is afraid of frogs, which may be why [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Frog Cat]] only rides another Ninja Cat in a frog mask. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/137.html ----

For the Cat Unit, see [[Skirt Cat (Special Cat)]].}} '''Loincloth Cat '''(ねこななふん Neko Nanafun) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Loincloth Cat |image = Loincloth Cat (enemy).png |first appearance = [[Skirting Danger (Veteran)]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 28|Infernal Tower - Floor 28]] |money drop = 950¢ - 3,752¢ }} ==Enemy== Loincloth Cat has pretty low health and attack damage compared to other Awakened enemies. It has slightly slower movement speed than its cat [[Skirt Cat (Special Cat)|counterpart]], but attack rate is 3 times faster and has a very long attack range. ==Strategy== Any [[:Category:Wave_Attack_Cats|wave attacker]] that can reach Loincloth Cat will be very good against Loincloth Cat (this is apparent in [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 28|Floor 28]]). Some examples are [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Macho Legs]], [[Wonder MOMOCO (Legend Rare Cat)|Wonder MOMOCO]], [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Slime Cat]] and more. Just note that the wave attacker that you are using '''HAS''' to have a [[Wave Attack]] level higher than 4. Otherwise, the wave will not be able to reach Loincloth Cat. Other cats that will work are cats with an extremely high range, like [[The Grateful Crane (Uber Rare Cat)|Super Galaxy Cosmo]], or cats that have a very high effective [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] range, like [[Radiant Aphrodite (Uber Rare Cat)|Radiant Aphrodite]]. However, some such cats may need a stepping stone to reach Loincloth Cat. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Skirt Awakens! Stages|Skirt Awakens!]]: **[[Skirting Danger (Veteran)]] (100%) **[[Skirting Danger (Insane)]] (150%) *[[Awakened Carnival (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 28|Floor 28]] (150%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 28|Floor 28]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Loincloth Cat |Health = 180,000 HP |Attack Power = 1,600 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Trolly Blogger''' (はぐれたヤツ ''Hagureta Yatsu'', '''The Stray Guy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]], [[Into the Future]] and [[Cats of the Cosmos]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Trolly Blogger |image = Trolly Blogger.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[The Red Carpet|Sub-chapter 22 - The Red Carpet]]
'''ItF''': [[Easter Island (Into the Future)|Chapter 2 - Easter Island]]
'''CotC''': [[Altair (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 3 - Altair]] |money drop = 75¢ - 296¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] }} ==Enemy== This enemy looks underwhelming at first due to his low stats and one knockback, but has a rapid Area Attack with 15% chance to knockback Cats, becoming a hindrance to short-ranged cats like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]]. Unless they have immunity to knockback, Meatshields and tankers stand no chance against large swarms of them constantly repelling your units. Surprisingly, his range is double that of [[Those Guys]], making this enemy even more annoying. While this enemy is indeed irritating due to how he is used, his range doesn't mean much compared to things like Mr. Mole or Henry. Hence, he is not a very prominent threat in all of his appearances, excluding maybe [[Perfume Room]]. ==Strategy== Trolly Blogger's range allows him to hide behind many close-ranged attackers, such as [[Gory|Gories]], [[Otta-smack-u]]s, or even [[Bore (Red)|Bores]]. Despite this, he is easily defeated by cats with long-ranged Area Attacks, such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] or [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]]. [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Gross Cat]] works especially well since the [[Wave Attack]]s he produces will usually kill all Trolly Bloggers in range. Alternatively, Trolly Blogger's knockback effect and low damage can be abused by units like Bullet Train Cat, as it will reset their animations and cause them to attack again. This is notable against [[Cruel Angel Clionel (Angel)|Cruel Angel Clionel]] in [[No Plan A (Deadly)|No Plan A]], where Bullet Train Cat could be used to both eliminate the Trolly Bloggers and keep Clionel pinned in the start. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 146 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Trolly Blogger |enemy_endesc1 = Talked smack about his friends on
his personal blog, "Just Bein' Honest".
Got too popular and no one calls
him anymore - the internet never forgets! |image1 = Enemy icon 146.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 日々の出来事を赤裸々に語っていた
自身のブログ「本能のままに」が炎上。
以来、仲間の誘いが激減したため
ピンでの活動を余儀なくされている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = He was talking nakedly about her daily events
when his own blog "Instinctively" went up in flames.
Since then, he has been forced to work as a freelancer
because he has received fewer invitations from his friends. |Enemy name (JP) = はぐれたヤツ (Hagureta Yatsu, Stray Guy) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]]=== *Stage 2-33: [[Easter It has 30 HP at 100% strength magnification, but only takes one damage from non-[[Critical Hit|Critical]] attacks like all other Metal enemies. It is more of a nuisance alone, but beware it is spammed in nearly all its appearences. ==Strategy== [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Hurricat]] can be very useful against this enemy due to his rapid area attacks, either ending them with a critical hit or tearing them down rapidly over time. Alternatively, stacked [[Jurassic Cat (Rare Cat)|Catasauruses]] and [[Talents|Talented]] [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cats]] can both perform a similar feat to Hurricat, albeit not as effectively as him. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 147 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Metal Doge |enemy_endesc1 = Walking home from prep school,

wikiLink:

For the Cat Unit, see [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)]].}} '''Li'l Nyandam''' (コニャンダム ''Ko Nyandamu'', '''Kid Nyandam''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy found in [[Saint Red Fox]], the final stage of [[Dead End Night]]. When defeated, he may join the player as a [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] - [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Li'l Nyandam]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Li'l Nyandam |image = LilNyandamEnemyBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Saint Red Fox|Sub-chapter 23 - Saint Red Fox]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's All-Stars|Sub-chapter 38 - Hell's All-Stars]] |money drop = 2,200¢ - 8,690¢ }} ==Enemy== Li'l Nyandam attacks much faster and has slightly longer range than [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|his older self]]. A toddler with an adult Nyandam's face, he has small demonic minion by his side, also like his older self. He ironically has much higher health and attack power than his older self, but has the same knockback count. ==Strategy== Attacking him with [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]] or [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] whenever there are no peons in front of him can do some major damage to him, Long-ranged attackers such as [[Adult Cat (Rare Cat)|Prisoner Cat]] or [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]] can also chip away his health over time. The classic [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] or any other rushers + [[Cat Cannon]] interruption can take off a good chunk of his health. Be sure that there is no strong supporter by Li'l Nyandam's side, or else Bahamut may have no effect. With proper stalling and enough time, you can defeat this meddlesome child via rinse and repeating. However, it may be hard to find an opening in the stages he appears in to do this. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 148 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Li'l Nyandam |enemy_endesc1 = A quantum blip de-aged him back to a kid.
People don't know what to think when that
leathery face cries over candy, but he still
has to pay full price at the movies. |image1 = Enemy icon 148.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 時空の歪みによって子供に戻ってしまった
ニャンダム。顔が大人のままなことに
ショックを受けキャンディで子供らしさを
アピールするが電車は大人料金である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Distortion of spacetime de-aged Nyandam back to a child.
Shocked that he still has an adult face, his childishness
when receiving candy may help make him more appealing,
but he still has to pay adult fare for the train. |Enemy name (JP) = コニャンダム (Ko Nyandamu, Kid Nyandam) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 23-6: [[Saint Red Fox]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 38-2: [[Patient Red Fox]] *Stage 38-6: [[Hell's All-Stars]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Li'l Nyandam |Health = 669,000 HP |Attack Power = 17,200 damage
(2,389 DPS) |Attack Range = 620
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 216f 7.2 seconds |Movement Speed = 2 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 77f 2.57s

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Le'noir''' (松 黒蔵 ''Matsu Kurozō'') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]], [[Into the Future]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Le'noir |image = Le'noir.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Black Premonition|Sub-chapter 23 - Black Premonition]]
'''ItF''': [[India (Into the Future)|Chapter 3 - India]] |money drop = 1,200¢ - 4,740¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Learned to Hate|Sub-chapter 38 - Learned to Hate]] }} ==Enemy== A Black variant of [[Le'boin]]. He has slightly more range, less speed and far higher stats, with unusually high health compared to enemies of the same caliber. ==Strategy== Using [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]] and [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut]] with good meatshielding is the general way to deal with Le'noir, but it is very tedious. If you have [[Little Leaguer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Major Leaguer Cat]] and if Le'noir is protected by other bulky enemies that do not get easily knocked back, just send more of them, Crowd-Controllers that freeze the frontliners and more meatshields. Thus, you'll be able to defeat Le'noir by using other enemies as stepping stones, as Major Leaguer Cat's standing range is in his blindspot, causing him to hit enemy backliners like Le'noir. This strategy works extremely well in mid- to late-game stages like [[Angry Fighting]] and [[Leadfoot Drive]]. Le'noir is particularly vulnerable to stunlocking by [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]], due to his long time between attacks. However, as Le'noir is usually sent with many frontliners or supported by other Le'noirs, this only works if there isn't any other enemy in the way. One more strategy is using [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic King Dragon]] and other Backliner-class Units as his [[True Form]] gives him enough range to effectively chip away at Le'noir; a well timed [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]] can also at least hit Le'noir once, doing massive damage to him provided good conditions, further augmented by his wave attack talent which allows him to reach Le'noir even if other enemies get in the way. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 149 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Le'noir |enemy_endesc1 = This ink-black pachy is a manic collector
of rare "gentlemen's cinema". Afraid
his hobby might be found so
smashes anyone who gets near his stash. |image1 = Enemy icon 149.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 入手困難なセクシーなビデオを
古今東西から収集している真っ黒のゾウ。
没収されると大変困る物があるためか
近づく者はみさかいなく蹴散らしてくる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This ink-black elephant collects hard-to-get
sexy videos from east and west and past and present.
Heedlessly keeps back anyone who comes close because of
something that would lead to serious trouble if it were confiscated. |Enemy name (JP) = 松 黒蔵 (Matsu Kurozō)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]]=== *Stage 3-17: [[India (Into the Future)|India]] (100%) *Stage 3-39: [[Las Vegas (Into the Future)|Las Vegas]] (100%) ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 34: [[Canada (Aku Realm)|Canada]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 23-3: [[Black Premonition]] (100%) *Stage 23-6: [[Saint Red Fox]] (100%) *Stage 24-2: [[Angry Fighting]] (100%) *Stage 28-2: [[Learned to Love]] (100%) *Stage 29-5: [[Darkweb]] (100%) *Stage 31-1: [[DNA & DHA]] (100%) *Stage 32-5: [[Leadfoot Drive]] (200%) *Stage 46-2: [[Virtual Harvest]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 4-2: [[Wandering Conch]] (250%) *Stage 8-3: [[No Hope Ranch]] (250%) *Stage 13-4: [[Caged Carp]] (250%) *Stage 17-3: [[Standing Sauna]] (250%) *Stage 18-2: [[The Night of Claws]] (250%) *Stage 26-6: [[Cats in the Stars]] (250%) *Stage 36-1: [[The Ivy-Sealed Door]] (250%) *Stage 38-2: [[Patient Red Fox]] (200%) *Stage 38-3: [[Learned to Hate]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Speed Cat (Veteran)|Tuesday Blitz Stage]]: [[Speed Cat (Veteran)]] (100%) *[[Refined Palate (Insane)|XP Megablitz!]]: [[Refined Palate (Insane)]] (100%) *[[The Proving Grounds]]: [[2nd Round: Dawn (Deadly)]] (150%) *[[Growing Evil]]: [[Aku's Murmur (Insane)]] (150%) *[[Evil Cat Awakes! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article is about the enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Mola King (Uber Rare Cat)]].}} '''Mola King''' (マンボ王, ''Manbo ō'', ''Lit. Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== Another one of the Survive! Mola Mola enemies, this one has a very long range (same as [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]]) but is single target. Deals significant damage, but has quite low health (~3,000). It is basically a Nyandam with a faster attack animation and much lower health, and due to Single Target attack, it's way less of a threat. If your [[Cat Cannon]] is strong enough, you can simply fire it to OHKO Mola King by firing it. Even then, units such as [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] can simply tank a hit from it and go in for the kill. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Survive! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Crab''' (カニ, ''kani'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in the [[Survive! Mola Mola! Collaboration Event]] and [[Summer Break Cats]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crab |image = Crab.png |appearance = [[Survive! Mola Mola! Collaboration Event]]
[[Summer Break Cats]] |money drop = 400¢ - 1,580¢ }} ==Enemy== Has a rather high amount of health compared to other fishes, and does about 300 damage. This enemy has low range, so is very easily defeated using almost any combination of cats. Basically the [[Sir Seal (Red)|Sir Seal]] of the sea, but beware when he becomes more buffed, as then Crab can be a notable threat for underlevelled players. ==Strategy== As mentioned before, this enemy isn't very threatening, so a combination of [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]] and/or [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cat]] paired with [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] should take it out easily. Area attackers such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]] can take groups of them, making her a great choice against it. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Summer Break Cats]]: **[[Sea Floor Treasure]] (400%) **[[A Secret Cove]] (800%) ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Survive! ---- {{Survive! Mola Mola!}} {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Collaboration Event Enemies]] [[Category:Floating Enemies]] [[Category:Single Target Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Martin''' (マーチン ''Māchin'', '''Martin''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy introduced in [[War on Valentines (Celebration Event)|War on Valentines]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Martin |image = Martin.png |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ |appearance = [[War on Valentines (Celebration Event)|War on Valentines]]
[[Wonderful Conquest (Insane)|Monthly Event All Stars Wonderful Celebration!]]
[[A Colossal Valentine's]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 10|Heavenly Tower - Floor 10]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 10|Infernal Tower - Floor 10]] }} ==Enemy== Martin is a yellow-ish koala who seems to be holding a cracker stick dipped in chocolate, similar to a [[wikipedia:Pepero|Pepero]], and attacks by smashing it down. Looks like an angry version of [[Kory]]. With his constant, hard-hitting Area Attacks, Martin can be treated as a [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]] with longer range and no trait. ==Strategy== This enemy may seem deadly with his range, but unlike his other variants, Martin CANNOT make [[Wave Attack]]s. This means meatshields are extremely useful against him. [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] outranges Martin, so stack them in huge numbers to take him down! You can also use fast, hard-hitting units such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] to deal some quick damage and claim [[Timed Score Reward]]s. [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat/Cyborg Cat]] outranges Martin, so you can spam them as well, due to their low recharge time. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Chickful A''' (天使ヒオコエル ''Tenshi Hiokoeru'', "'''Angel Hiokoel'''" [''hiyoko'' = "chick"]) is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Chickful A |image = Chickful A.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Her Highness, Milk T.|Sub-chapter 24 - Her Highness, Milk T.]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hall of Feasting|Sub-chapter 42 - Hall of Feasting]] |money drop = 770¢ - 3,042¢ }} ==Enemy== Chickful A has a 25% chance to freeze your cats, as well as high attack power and range, with decent stats all across the board. Her health is somewhat low, but that doesn't matter too much since she attacks too fast for most melee units to effectively reach her in time; this is more noticeable when there are two or more Chickful As de-synced. ==Strategy== Most mid-rangers such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]] will be outranged, but a [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] or [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Dragon Cat]] should be safe, and [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]] like [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Crimson Mina]] can hit Chickful As behind the backlines. [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|Rushers]] such as [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Butterfly Cat]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] are still usable against her, but need good timing to land a hit. Rushers will work a lot better if they have enough time to knockback Chickful A before she attacks if timed well. This way, they won't get hit by Chickful A in the process and be able to (hopefully) defeat her in one go. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 160 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Chickful A |enemy_endesc1 = A bright-eyed rookie only on her second
day of her heavenly job. Her friend Duche
is getting real sick of hearing her go on
about how great her new flat in paradise is. |image1 = Enemy icon 160.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 大空へ羽ばたくため高台を目指して旅を
続ける生後2日の新米天使。8回目の旅に
友達のアヒルンルンを誘ったが断られた。
すぐカッとなる性格は祖母譲り。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A 2-day-old rookie angel who travels to the hills with the
aim of flying into the heavens. Invited her friend Ahirunrun
[Duche] to her 8th trip, but he refused. Her hair-trigger
temper is inherited from her grandmother. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使ヒオコエル (Tenshi Hiokoel, "Angel Hiokoel" [''hiyoko'' = "chick"]) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Chicka Fry |A [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of Chickful A, with quicker attack speed but less range, damage and health. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Nimoy Bore''' (イノヴァルカン, ''Inovarukan'', "'''Vulcan Bore'''") is an [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant of [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] that appears in [[Into the Future]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Nimoy Bore |image = NimoyBoreBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Floating Continent (Into the Future)|Chapter 1 - Floating Continent]]
'''SoL''': [[Winning Back|Sub-chapter 25 - Winning Back]]
'''CotC''': [[Uranus (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Uranus]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 7,110¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Treadmill Powered|Sub-chapter 25 - Treadmill Powered]] }} ==Enemy== Nimoy Bore's base health and damage, attack rate and speed are all inferior to Bore and most of his other variants, so in the end he may actually be the easier of the bunch, despite his 50% chance to knock back cats (can be used to allow cats with long backswings to attack over and over again). Nevertheless, don't take him lightly when you encounter him in [[Floating Continent (Into the Future)|Floating Continent]], especially in Chapter 3. ==Strategy== There are two things that are important to have when facing Nimoy Bore: crowd-control and [[Anti-unstarred Alien Treasures]]. Stall him with units such as [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Psychocat]], [[Surfer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Surfer Cat]] and [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Onmyoji Cat]] to reduce his pushing power while stacking attackers such as [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] to whittle away his health. Once frozen or slowed, [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]] or [[Wheel Cat (Rare Cat)|Solar Cat]] can be used to deliver huge damage to him. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 177 |enemy category = Alien |Enemy name = Nimoy Bore |enemy_endesc1 = His bowl cut helps contain the force of
his rational power. Looking for a dashing
starship captain to help him learn how to
feel. Clears the way with logic and tusks. |image1 = Enemy icon 177.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = キューティクルヘアーでヒヅメを掲げる
という鉄板ギャグで有名なイノシシ。

ありとあらゆるものをふっとばして逃走中 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This wild boar is famous for his ironclad
gag of holding up his hoof with cuticle hair.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Professor A.''' (教授 ''Kyōju'', '''Professor''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[Master A.]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Professor A. |image = Professor A.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Pecking Order|Sub-chapter 33 - Pecking Order]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Reincarnation Ring|Sub-chapter 36 - Reincarnation Ring]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Professor A. has even higher DPS and range than [[Master A.]] along with a chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] units on hit. ==Strategy== Professor A.'s biggest weakness lies in units that outrange him, especially [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]]. [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Dark Emperor Catdam]] and [[Adult Cat (Rare Cat)|Prisoner Cat]] are great no gacha ways to get rid of him. If Professor A. has support, try and bring him down first as it's far easier to kill an unprotected Professor A. than one with endless waves of tough enemies to fight for him, unless of course you use them as "stepping stones" for Long Distance/[[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave]]/[[:Category:Surge Attack Enemies|Surge Attackers]]. [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] may also get a hit on Professor A if you get lucky with timing. [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fried Shrimp Cat]] and [[Talents|Talented]] [[Bondage Cat (Special Cat)|Ultimate Bondage Cat]] can be used as another strategy. With high health vs. Reds and weaken/freeze respectively, they are both able to perfectly stall Professor A. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 185 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Professor A. |enemy_endesc1 = Even though he's still a college undergrad,
his research into dirty stuff is so in-depth
and thorough that his friends call him Professor.
Dating experience is still somehow zero. |image1 = Enemy icon 185.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 少女の思春期を描く著書「江口高校」で一躍
有名になった官能小説家。今はヤマアラシ大学で
文学科の教授として教鞭を振るっている。
女性とお付き合いした経験はもちろん無い。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A sensual novelist who became very famous for his book
"Eguchi High School", which describes a girl's puberty.
He is currently teaching at the University of Yamarashi as a
literature professor. Of course, he has no experience dating women. |Enemy name (JP) = 教授 (Kyōju, Professor) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 33-1: For the Cat Unit, see [[Rathalos (Special Cat)]].}} '''Rathalos''' (リオレウス '''Rioreusu''') is an enemy that only appears in the [[Monster Hunter Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy_Info |name = Rathalos |image = Rathalos.png |appearance = [[Monster Hunter Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 2,250円 - 8,887円 }} ==Enemy== The weaker beast out of the [[Rathian (Enemy)|two]], this "king" is easily a threat in nearly every stage he appears in! High health, average attack, high range as well as a 25% Strengthen increase when at 75% health. Although the 25% doesn't seem like much, it can be very deadly in stages where he is at a high magnification. ==Strategy== In the first three times you encounter Rathalos, you can easily take him down with the [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cats]] but in his fourth encounter it is recommended to bring units that outrange or work effectively against Floating.
In the [[Hunt Sky And Fire Dragons! 【G Class】|final stage]], he is at his highest magnification being 350%, giving him 1,050,000 health and 24,640 damage, not counting the Strengthen increase or the Weaken effect from [[Rathian (Enemy)|Rathian]]! [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Anti-Floating]] units are practically required to beat the final encounter. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} *[[Monster Hunter Collaboration Event#Monster Hunter Hunting Quest|Monster Hunter Hunting Quest]]: **[[King Of The Sky・Rathalos 【Inferior】]] (25%) **[[Proud and Strongest Couple! 【Superior】]] (100%) *[[Monster Hunter Collaboration Event#【Emergency】 Monster Hunter Hunting Quest|【Emergency】 Monster Hunter Hunting Quest]] **[[The Sky Has Fallen, King Of The Sky! 【Superior】]] (250%) **[[Hunt Sky And Fire Dragons! 【G Class】]] (350%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Rathalos |Health = 300,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,040 damage

Very high health, high damage, average range, 50% Strengthen increase when at 50% health and finally a 50% chance to weaken the players [[Cat Units]].
The 50% damage increase will make this enemy have a total of 14,850! Even the weaken effect of this enemy can be rather deadly as it halves the attack of the players [[Cat Units]] essentially making her have 720,000 health, nearly one million!
When paired with [[Rathalos (Enemy)|Rathalos]] they are a deadly duo to deal with. ==Strategy== Just like Rathalos, the first three times you encounter Rathian, you can easily take her down with the [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cats]] but in her fourth encounter it is recommended to bring units that outrange or work effectively against Floating.
In the [[Hunt Sky And Fire Dragons! 【G Class】|final stage]], she is at her highest magnification being 350%, giving her 1,680,000 health and 34,650 damage, not counting the Strengthen increase or the Weaken effect! For the Cat Unit, see [[God of War - Odin (Uber Rare Cat)]].}} '''God of War - Odin''' (軍神オーディン, ''Gunshin Ōdin'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Yurudrasil Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = God of War - Odin |appearance = [[Yurudrasil Collaboration Event]] |image = Odin YuruDora Enemy.jpg |money drop = 2,500円 - 9,875円 }} ==Enemy== Extremely high health, somewhat average attack, large range and slow speed. This enemy isn't much to worry about if you know what you're dealing with. His slow speed makes his advance to the base very sluggish as well as his eleven second TBA.
This enemy also has no special abilities to help him advance makes him nothing but at backliner that does barely anything.
In his debut stage he is the first enemy to spawn along with a boss shockwave, allowing the player to get some quick damage on him before the other enemies arrive. ==Strategy== There's the obvious choice of Cat Units that outrange him such as [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]] which will also help on his debut stage where he is supported by other Yurudrasil enemies, however if your [[:Category:Normal Cats|Normal Cats]] are around about level 50, you can conquer his stage with just [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|three]] [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|normal]] [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|units]]! ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Yurudrasil Collaboration Event#Yurudrasil Divine!|Yurudrasil Divine!]]: [[The End is Coming?! '''[[Goddess of Abundance - Freya (Enemy)|<< Goddess of Abundance - Freya]] | [[Capy (Red)|Capy >> ]] '''

---- {{Yurudrasil}} {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Traitless Enemies]] [[Category:Collaboration Event Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Capy''' (カルピンチョ ''Karupincho'', '''Carpincho''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Capy |image = Capy but not biting.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Oil Platform|Sub-chapter 26 - Oil Platform]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Roast Meat, Not Cities|Sub-chapter 42 - Roast Meat, Not Cities]] |money drop = 350¢ - 1,382¢ }} ==Enemy== Capy has huge health and DPS, a 15% chance for a [[Critical Hit]] at a surprisingly high 335 range, and a low money drop. You won't be able to tank her attacks as she'll chomp through even the strongest tanks in seconds, and that's if she doesn't put you into a budget deficit first. However, she is a single-target attacker, so meatshielding and using ranged attackers is an effective way to fight her. ==Strategy== She is very easy to stall with meatshields due to her single-target attacks. However, if she is supported by powerful area attackers like [[J.K Bun Bun (Red/Floating)|J.K Bun Bun]], they can wipe out all your meatshields while she will annihilate your stronger cat units (notably in [[Oil Platform]] and [[Morning Rush Hour]]). Capies are usually fought in multiples. With the right support, groups of Capies can actually push, so try using the [[Cat Cannon]] to sync their attack animations. This is particularly important in Morning Rush Hour, where you have to use a "ranged meatshield" such as [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] to bait them out; see Lucas IV's [https://youtu.be/e8YVxHYGcO4 video] for more information. There is no difference between [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser]] [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat]] [[Li'l Tank Cat (Special Cat)|variants]] and other 75¢ meatshields, as they all get killed in one hit, so bringing 75¢ meatshields is recommended over the former as they'll absorb a hit for half the cost, unless if she is supported by a backliner who can't one hit kill your Erasers (like [[Camelle]] in [[A Day of Reckoning]]). [[Kyubey Cat (Rare Cat)|Kyubey Cat]] is also useful against Capy due to its 40% chance to survive a lethal strike. "Strong" Effect UP [[Cat Combo|Combos]] on [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Fish]] and [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]] work greatly against a single Capy, and fantastically against multiple, if meatshielded properly. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 205 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Capy |enemy_endesc1 = Furry Brazilian fitness freak. Hits the gym twice
a day and always chews her food thoroughly.
Weighed down by muscle, she's slower than she
looks, but those critical attacks hurt real bad… |image1 = Enemy icon 205.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 健康オタクなカピバラ。モットーはご飯を
よく噛むことと、のぼせるまで温泉に
浸かること。見た目よりは移動速度が

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Berserkory''' (バトルコアラッキョ, ''Batoru Koarakkyo'', "'''Battle Koalacchio'''") is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[Kory]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Berserkory |image = Bersekory.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Revolving-door Floats|Sub-chapter 26 - Revolving-door Floats]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Three Evil Brothers|Sub-chapter 37 - Three Evil Brothers]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== Berserkory acts almost the same as his original form, performing a medium-strength attack and firing a [[Wave Attack]]. However, the Wave Attack range has been tripled, so few Cats can avoid it. He only has one knockback and very high health, causing even more Wave Attacks if you don't use any [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red Cats]]. Luckily, he has lower range and movement speed, not to mention the lack of Base Destroyer. ==Strategy== Despite the waves, there are several units who can easily stall this enemy. [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fried Shrimp Cat]], for example, has no issue holding Berserkory back, plus they can lower the damage of its attack AND wave. Other units who can stall and wear down Berserkory include [[Viking Cat (Rare Cat)|Maximum the Fighter]], [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]] [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|and]] [[Li'l Fish Cat (Special Cat)|variants]], [[Talents|Talented]] [[Bondage Cat (Special Cat)|Ultimate Bondage Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]], or [[Pirate Cat (Rare Cat)|Dread Pirate Catley]] (especially if Talented), to name a few. When relying on Maximum and/or Islands, make sure to use [[Cat Combo]]s like [[Seasons of Love (Combo)|Seasons of Love]] and [[Three Kings (Combo)|Three Kings]] for extra tankiness. If you have [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|iCat]], then deploy two of them out of sync. In doing so, you will render Berserkory powerless (granted there aren't any other main attackers for support that could demolish them), which you can then finish off easily. [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] such as [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] and [[Cat Machine (Uber Rare Cat)|Cat Machine Mk 3]] are very effective at blocking Berserkory's Wave Attacks, allowing your units to get in close and destroy it. iCat, if paired with Octopus, pretty much nullifies Berserkory entirely. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 206 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Berserkory |enemy_endesc1 = One day I woke from a nap to find a Kory
making stew in my kitchen. After I kicked him
out for raiding my fridge, it seems the sunset
on his back awoke his hidden dark powers. |image1 = Enemy icon 206.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 居候中のバトルネコの家で料理に目覚めた
エキセントリックコアラ。高級食材ばかり使う
のでまた家を追い出された。夕日に染まった
彼はついに「波動」の極意に目覚める。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An eccentric koala who woke up to cooking at Battle Cat's
[Axe Cat's] house while freeloading there. Only uses gourmet ingredients, so he was kicked out once again.
At last, dyed by the setting sun, he has awakened to the secret of the "wave". |Enemy name (JP) = バトルコアラッキョ (Batoru Koarakkyo, "Battle Koalacchio") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 26-8: [[Revolving-door Floats|Revolving-Door Floats]] (100%) *Stage 27-1: [[Sunset's Howl]] (100%) *Stage 28-3: [[Cat Catharsis]] (100%) *Stage 29-5: [[Darkweb]] (100%) *Stage 30-4: [[Docking Massacre]] (100%) *Stage 34-3: [[Dungeon of Dreams]] (100%) *Stage 36-2: [[Rickety Coaster]] (100%) *Stage 39-2: [[Boiling Spring]] (100%) *Stage 39-6: [[Steamed to Death]] (100%) *Stage 41-6: [[Broadband Omens]] (150%) *Stage 42-6: [[Atrocious Deco]] (100%) *Stage 47-6: [[Apocalypse Temple]] (150%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 4-4: [[Utsubobo Seamount]] (150%) *Stage 19-5: [[The Bloody Wharf]] (200%) *Stage 23-2: [[Brave Dog's Bone]] (200%) *Stage 28-4: [[Swamp of Ignorance]] (200%) *Stage 37-3: [[Three Evil Brothers]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Fish Maniac: [[Ogre Island (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Growing Strange]]: [[An Elder Secret (Merciless)]] (150%) *[[River City Stages#River City Three-Leg Race ③|River City Three-Leg Race ③]]: [[VS Team Red ③|VS Team Red]] (100%) *[[Seeing Red Stages#The March of Flames|The March of Flames]]: [[Final Battleground (The March of Flames)|Final Battleground]] (150%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 25|Floor 25]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 25|Floor 25]] (200%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Red Summit: [[Summit Shrine (Merciless)/Red|Summit Shrine (Merciless)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Berserkory |Health = 920,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,444 damage
