wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Brollow''' (ツバメンズ ''Tsubamenzu'') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Brollow |image = BrollowBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[I'm onto you|Sub-chapter 26 - I'm onto you]] |money drop = 150¢ - 593¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Night of the Hustler|Sub-chapter 44 - Night of the Hustler]] }} ==Enemy== Basically a faster and stronger version of [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriel]], Brollow flies at extreme speeds, has low health, and deals high damage that can easily break through your defenses in numbers. ==Strategy== Brollow's high attack damage, high knockback count, and low health makes '''groups of them''' '''DEADLY''', as a few hits from meatshields like [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Mohawk Cat]] and [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] can easily knock them back. Having a full backswing cooldown only further increases their lethality, as all it takes is a stream of weak hits, the default cat cannon or breakerblast for them to steamroll your defenses. Therefore, it is recommend not to use these types of cannons unless absolutely necessary. High numbers of hits per second is very bad against them, but powerful single blows from semi-spammable, bulky and heavy-hitting cats like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]], [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]] and [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] work well against small groups of Brollows. However, for large flocks of Brollows, more expensive [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] may be required, such as [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Cat]], who has enough damage to wipe them out instantly. Incidentally, [[D'artanyan (Uber Rare Cat)|D'artanyan]]'s Normal Form's blind spot does not include Brollows, who will rest at the 150 mark instead of 140. This means that, in theory, D'artanyan can obliterate Brollows, though it is better to have meatshields take hits instead of D'artanyan. [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kotatsu Cat]], the [[Ototo Development Team#Iron Wall|Iron Wall Cat]], [[Kai (Uber Rare Cat)|Kai]] or [[Sodom (Uber Rare Cat)|Sodom]] can help a lot as walls to gather many Brollows in the same area to kill them all at once. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 207 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Brollow |enemy_endesc1 = DO YOU EVEN LIFT??? He's gluten-free, but
never misses a chance to impress chicks
with crumbs from the organic bakery.
Brain the size of a cashew, but he's got game. |image1 = Enemy icon 207.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 出会い頭系アイドルグループのメンバー。
食パンをくわえて登校すると出会えることで
人気沸騰中！すぐに記憶をなくす
ドジっぷりも乙女心をくすぐる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A member of an idol meeting group. He's getting popular
because you can meet up with him when you attend school
with bread [in your mouth]! Can tickle even the clumsiest
maiden's heart, but forgets about them immediately. |Enemy name (JP) = ツバメンズ (Tsubamenzu) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Zollow |A [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]]/[[:Category:Floating Brollows can be seen flying in the background after the player passes the tenth checkpoint. Pogocat Brollow.jpeg|A Brollow flying near a tree GGPC 207 e.png|Brollow's spritesheet in [[Go! Go! Pogo Cat]] ==Gallery== BrollowSpritesheet.png|Brollow's spritesheet Brollow.gif|Brollow's attack animation IdleBrollow.gif|Brollow's flying animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Tsubamenzu, contains the word ''tsubame'', meaning "swallow" (as in the bird). *The phrase, "DO YOU EVEN LIFT???" in his description is a reference to [http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/do-you-even-lift a meme of the same name]. *He outspeeds all [[Cat Units]], including [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bullet Train Cat]]. *He is the second-fastest enemy in the game, beaten by [[Assassin Bear (Black)|Assassin Bear]]. *His design takes inspiration from several different birds: **He is mainly based off of the swallow, a type of bird well known for its black coat and v-shaped tail. Swallows are also a symbol of good luck, fidelity in marriage and fertility in Japanese culture. **He closely resembles a gannet, known to be the "missile bird". **He is additionally based off of the common swift, the world's fastest bird in '''horizontal''' flight, which can be clearly seen as Brollow moves forward. It also has a shorter, smaller v-shaped tail, though it is still noticeable. Another similarity between Brollow and the swift: the wings are slightly more forward on the body than they are on a swallow. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/209.html ----

Even some long-ranged attackers like [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Leg Cat]] and even [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|King Dragon Cat]] are outranged by 20 range, but certain [[:Category:Tanker-class Cats|tankers]] can also be used since his DPS is not high. ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Cyclops |Health = 160,000 HP |Attack Power = 4,500 damage

For the Cat Unit, see [[Golem (Special Cat)]].}} '''Golem''' (ゴーレム, ''Gōremu'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Golem |appearance = [[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event|Castle & Dragon Collaboration]] |image = Golemcandd.png |money drop = 2,000円 - 7,900円 }} ==Enemy== High health, moderate attack, range and overall high stats apart from his speed and knockback count. This enemy isn't much to be feared about despite his high stats, because every stage he appears in doesn't set him to high magnifications, apart from the [[Arena of Honor]] stage of which you may not even encounter him at his full 600% magnification. ==Strategy== Any units that can outrange him such as [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]], [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Li'l Catdam]] and many more can stay safe out of his attack range. Alternatively the player can brute force him by using strong hitting units, [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attack Cats]] or even [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Units with Long Distance]]. The [[Castle and Dragon and Cats|first stage]] he appears in he is basically a one hit punching bag being at 1%, there is no strategy to beating him in that stage. However for the other stages he is supported by other [[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event|Castle & Dragon]] enemies which allows the player to use wave or long distance units to deal damage to him. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} *[[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event#Castle & Dragon|Castle & Dragon]]: **[[Castle and Dragon and Cats]] (1%) *[[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event#Immortal Castle & Dragon|Immortal Castle & Dragon]]: **[[Things Born From Eggs (Insane)]] (200%) *[[Castle & Dragon Collaboration Event#Castle Dragon VS Castle Dragon|Castle Dragon VS Castle Dragon]]: **[[Knights Invasion (Easy)]] (20%) ===[[Catclaw Dojo]]=== *[[Arena of Honor]]: [[Arena of Honor/Castle & Dragon And Dojo|Castle & Dragon And Dojo]]: (100%, 300%, 400%, 500%, 600%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Golem |Health = 225,000 HP |Attack Power = 10,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Cruel Angel Clionel''' (断罪天使クオリネル ''Danzai Tenshi Kuorineru'', "'''Condemned Angel Quolinel'''") is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Cli-One (Alien/Floating)|Cli-One]] introduced in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[No Plan A (Deadly)|Clionel Ascendant]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Cruel Angel Clionel |image = Cruelone.png |money drop = 5,000¢ - 19,750¢ |appearance = [[No Plan A (Deadly)|Clionel Ascendant]]
[[Clionel Dominant Stages|Clionel Dominant]]
[[The Angel & The Demon]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] }} ==Enemy== One nightmare of a sea angel. She does very high damage and attacks rapidly as opposed to [[Cli-One (Alien/Floating)|Cli-One]], having a chance to slow anything that survives. Her attack hits between ranges 400-1,200, meaning that no normal meatshields can survive, and neither can [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]]. Though she has a sizable blindspot, in almost all her appearances she is accompanied by enemies that cover it, forming exceptionally lethal synergies, such as with Angelic Sleipnir, Hannya and Relic Doge. ==Strategy== When fighting Clionel, use close-ranged cats such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]], [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]] and [[Urashima Taro (Uber Rare Cat)|Guardian Gamereon]], as almost everything gets outranged. [[Asiluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Assassinlan Pasalan]] and a few others can barely outrange Clionel (1250 > 1200). Despite his minuscule attack damage of 5660 at level 30, he can at least help slow down the powerful supports such as [[Angelic Gory (Angel)|Angelic Gory]], given the player brings along sufficient meatshields. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 232 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Cruel Angel Clionel |enemy_endesc1 = This mystical being is humanity's salvation...
or it's destruction. But for now, it's too busy
being an overprotective single parent who
protects its kid with ultra long range attacks. |image1 = Enemy icon 232.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 腐敗したこの世を裁くため天界より
降り立った裁きのシ者。子煩悩な
モンスターペアレントとしても恐れられる。
超射程の後方攻撃をかいくぐれれば... |enemy_jpdesc1 = Descending from the heavens to judge this decayed world,
this is the Beginning and the End. A doting monster parent to be feared.
Attacks with incredible range, allowing strikes to
slip through to the backlines... |Enemy name (JP) = 断罪天使クオリネル (Danzai Tenshi Kuorineru, "Condemned Angel Quolinel") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. *[[No Plan A (Deadly)|Clionel Ascendant]]: [[No Plan A (Deadly)]] *[[Clionel Dominant Stages|Clionel Dominant]]: **[[New Testament (Deadly)]] **[[A Cat Screaming Love (Merciless)]] *[[The Angel & The Demon]]: [[No Plan A (Deadly) (Angel & Demon)|No Plan A (Deadly)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 44|Floor 44]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Cruel Angel Clionel |Health = 2,400,000 HP |Attack Power = 32,000 damage
(6,621 DPS) |Attack Range = 600
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 145f 4.83 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 71f 2.37s
(74f 2.47s backswing) |Ability = 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 400~1,200) |Element = Angel }} ==Gallery== CruelAngelClionelspritesheet.png|Cruel Angel Clionel's spritesheet IdleCruelAngelClionel.gif|Cruel Angel Clionel's moving animation clionel attack.gif|Cruel Angel Clionel's attack animation Medal 028.png|Cruel Angel Clionel on the ''Angel's Cruelty'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *She is quite literally a [[wikipedia:Sea_angel|sea angel]], a creature known for its grace, beauty and horror, seen in [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xlc7r34Sh-c this video]. *Amongst the first seven [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Cruel Angel Clionel represents the sin of wrath. **Alternatively, Clionel could be symbolic of the eighth Deadly Sin, despair/despond, as "[[No Plan A (Deadly)|No Plan A]]" is a name that greatly suggests hopelessness. This would leave [[Kappy Jr.]] as wrath. *Her Japanese description is a reference to [[wikipedia:/Neon_Genesis_Evangelion|Neon Genesis Evangelion]], specifically incorporating the wordplay from Episode 24:「最後のシ者」 The Beginning and the End. The specific borrowed term can be read in three different ways, either as envoy, casualty or on the water's edge. Presumably this enemy is all three at once. *Her title is a reference to the name of the main theme of Neon Genesis Evangelion, [[w:c:evangelion:A_Cruel_Angel's_Thesis|A Cruel Angel's Thesis]]; while the first sentence of the description states the main plot of the anime ([[w:c:evangelion:Human_Instrumentality_Project|Human Instrumentality]], also known as [[w:c:evangelion:Third_Impact|Third Impact]]). *Her gender is confirmed by the [https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/battle-cats/images/e/e9/ClionelPoster.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200802011854 event poster] for Clionel Ascendant, which says, "Can you withstand her as she rains fire from long distance?!" *By hacking to make [[Kung-Fu X Awakens! Stages|event map 1091]] appear before it was fully implemented, Clionel could once be fought alongside [[Gentleman Bros. (Enemy)|Gentleman Bros.]] in an [https://youtube.com/watch?v=Sxgc-WCp-bA unfinished stage] with the placeholder name その１ (''Sono 1'', lit. "Part 1"), which later became [[Old Master (Expert)]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/234.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mr. Mole''' (ドリュウ, '''''Doryuu''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mr. Mole |image = Mr. Mole.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Love and Death|Sub-chapter 27 - Love and Death]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Disaster Cycle|Sub-chapter 37 - Disaster Cycle]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has a great deal of health, long range (450, the same as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]]), mediocre attack power and a 100% chance of knocking back your cats. The most dangerous thing about him is that he can stunlock and destroy stacks of ranged units quickly even with his relatively weak attacks, thanks to his massive [[Long Distance]] range of 350~900. Despite his burrowing animation, Mr. Mole can still be hit normally and his hitbox does not move during his attack. He also has a lot of knockbacks, being able to reposition quickly even if you manage to get to him. ==Strategy== Mr. Mole cannot attack close-ranged units, so it is better to use melee cats such as Awakened Bahamut Cat, [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed M. Titan Cat]] to deal with this enemy, although beware this will knock him back and put said units within his range yet again. [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] is a very good choice against him, as it will attack again after Mr. Mole knocks it back; making it an effective counter. Uber-Long Distance cats such as [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]] or [[Otaku Geek Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Geek Cat]] can work too. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 235 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Mr. Mole |enemy_endesc1 = I seek a worthy rival! #MoleFight is the only
Tweet from his aspiring martial artist on his
feed. His secret technique "Rising Mole Fist"
knocks back enemies from uber-long distance. |image1 = Enemy icon 235.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 俺より強いモグラに会いに行く」と
ツイートし、真の格闘家を目指すモグラ。
独学で「昇土竜拳」をマスターし
後方攻撃と吹っ飛ばす技を身につけた |enemy_jpdesc1 =A mole who aims to be a true fighter,
tweeting, "I seek a mole who's stronger than me.”
Self-taught master of the "Shodoryuken".
Has backline-attacking and knockback techniques. |Enemy name (JP) = ドリュウ (Doryuu) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Corporal Weyland |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of Mr. Mole. He has lower health, damage and range, along with a 2,500 HP [[Barrier|barrier]] and 30% chance to [[warp]] your cats backwards. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 27-8: [[Love and Death]] (100%) *Stage 30-5: [[Subterranean Stalker]] (100%) *Stage 33-6: [[The Spy Who Pet Me]] (100%) *Stage 37-4: [[Lovechild Lane]] (100%) *Stage 39-5: [[The Sauna Crew]] (100%) *Stage 45-1: [[Shiver Junction]] (100%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 8-4: [[Hunter's Hills]] (100%) *Stage 13-2: [[Nautilus Tomb]] (100%) *Stage 18-4: [[Exaggeration Falls]] (100%) *Stage 23-4: [[Patience Prevails]] (150%) *Stage 27-6: [[Happily Ever After]] (150%) *Stage 28-6: [[Burning Blue]] (150%) *Stage 31-1: [[Pilgrim Agitators]] (150%) *Stage 37-2: [[Disaster Cycle]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Crimson Vengeance Stages|Crimson Vengeance]]: [[Revenge of R-Cyclone (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Empress' Report 3]]: [[Aku Studies 301: Field Research]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 39|Floor 39]] (100%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Labyrinth of Spirit: [[A Year's Training (Deadly)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Mr. Mole |Health = 420,000 HP |Attack Power = 4,500 damage
(1,125 DPS) |Attack Range = 450
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 120f 4 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 8 times |Occurrence = 61f 2.03s
(45f 1.5s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 350~900) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== Mr.Molespritesheet.png|Mr. Mole's spritesheet IdleMrMole.gif|Mr. Mole's moving animation ==Trivia== *His Rising Mole Fist is a reference to the Shoryuken, a move from the [[w:c:streetfighter:Street_Fighter_series|Street Fighter]] franchise. [[Ken (Uber Rare Cat)|Ken]] (known as Sho-Ryu-Ken) means Rising Dragon Fist. *His Japanese name, ''doryu'' (ドリュウ), is an uncommon reading of 土竜 ("mole") that happens to contain the name of [[Ryu (Uber Rare Cat)|Ryu]] (リュウ). **The more common reading is ''mogura'', which is used as [[Corporal Weyland (Alien)|Corporal Weyland]]'s Japanese namesake, Captain Mogū. **The Rising Mole Fist's Japanese name, Shodoryuken (昇土竜拳), is, of course, a portmanteau of ''doryu'' and ''Shoryuken'' (昇龍拳). ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/237.html ----

This feral feline has extreme health and attack power, as well as faster movement speed than [[Crazed Cat (Enemy Unit)|Crazed Cat]] along with a slightly faster attack rate. Even the short range plays in his favor, as he can burst past your frontline more easily when combined with his increased speed. He may seem impossible to stall, but if your [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]] is level 30 and your [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] is at least level 20+23, then he won't push too much. Combine that with [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]] and add support from cats like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and the battle won't be as hellish as it was. ==Strategy== :''See [[Deathhawk (Deadly)]] or [[Infernal Tower/Floor 31|Floor 31]].'' ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. *Cat Maniac: [[Deathhawk (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 31|Floor 31]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Manic Mohawk Cat |Health = 4,800,000 HP |Attack Power = 13,880 damage

For the weaker boss that must be beaten first, see [[Crazed Bird Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Manic Flying Cat''' (大狂乱の天空のネコ, ''Dai Kyōran no Tenkū no Neko'', '''''Insane Sky Cat''''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy found in [[Forest Beasts (Deadly)|Forest Beasts]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Manic Flying Cat |image = 06.png |appearance = [[Forest Beasts (Deadly)]] [[Infernal Tower/Floor 33|Infernal Tower - Floor 33]] |money drop = 1,999¢ - 7,896¢ }} ==Enemy== Although this enemy has no special abilities, it has an extremely powerful, long ranged attack and a massive health pool. It is also a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating enemy]], meaning that [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|anti-Traitless cats]] won't work on it while [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|anti-Floating cats]] will. ==Strategy== :''For strategies, see [[Forest Beasts (Deadly)]].'' ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Bird Maniac: [[Forest Beasts (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 33|Floor 33]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Manic Flying Cat |Health = 2,680,000 HP |Attack Power = 32,000 damage

For the weaker boss that must be beaten first, see [[Crazed Fish Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Manic Island Cat''' (大狂乱のネコ島 ''Dai Kyōran no Neko Shima'', '''Insane Island Cat''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy found in [[Ogre Island (Deadly)|Fish Maniac]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Manic Island Cat |image = Manic island.png |appearance = [[Ogre Island (Deadly)|Fish Maniac]] [[Infernal Tower/Floor 35|Infernal Tower - Floor 35]] |money drop = 520¢ - 2,054¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has mediocre health and insane DPS, so you have to treat it like a less durable [[R.Ost]] with only 1 knock back but more DPS. You'll have to deploy many meatshields and rangers when warding them off. This enemy's biggest weaknesses lie in its low range and speed. ==Strategy== Due to Manic Island Cat's high DPS but somewhat low-ish health, the best way to deal with it is to spam [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] that can outrange it like [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Cyborg Cat]] or [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama/Slapsticks Cats]]. It will still probably advance and kill some of your stack, but killing a stack of these will allow you to recover your losses and spam more of them. [[Ogre Island (Deadly)|Ogre Island]] is the first stage in which Manic Island Cat appears in, which has a [[Berserkory (Red)|Berserkory]] in it. Naturally, any ranged [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shield]] units are optimal, namely [[Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo (Uber Rare Cat)|Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo]] or [[Eva Unit-00 (Uber Rare Cat)|Eva Unit-00]]. Because of the Manic Island's extreme DPS at close range, [[Octopus Cat]] will be unable to consistently block Berserkory's waves. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Fish Maniac: [[Ogre Island (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 35|Floor 35]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Manic Island Cat |Health = 227,000 HP |Attack Power = 10,200 damage
(17,000 DPS) |Attack Range = 260
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 18f 0.6 seconds |Movement Speed = 6 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 10f 0.33s
(7f 0.23s backswing) |Ability = 3% chance to perform a [[Critical Hit]] |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== ManicIslandCatspritesheet1.png|Manic Island Cat's spritesheet IdleManicIsland.gif|Manic Island Cat's moving animation ==Trivia== *Along with its [[Crazed Fish Cat (Enemy Unit)|crazed counterpart]], Manic Island Cat has the lowest critical chance out of all the enemies in the game. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/250.html ----

For the weaker boss that must be beaten first, see [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Manic King Dragon Cat''' (大狂乱のネコキングドラゴン, ''Dai Kyōran no Neko Kingu Doragon'', '''Insane King Dragon Cat''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy introduced in [[Draconian (Deadly)|Lizard Maniac]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Manic King Dragon Cat |image = ManicKingDragonCat.PNG |appearance = [[Draconian (Deadly)|Lizard Maniac]] [[Infernal Tower/Floor 36|Infernal Tower - Floor 36]] |money drop = 1,350¢ - 5,332¢ }} ==Enemy== It has even more range than its [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Enemy Unit)|Crazed Counterpart]], more damage and has more health. It is protected by highly buffed [[Otta-smack-u]]s in its [[Draconian (Deadly)|Debut Stage]] making it significantly harder to reach. ==Strategy== This enemy has somewhat low health for its damage output, so it's easy prey for [[Hacker Cat]], [[Super Galaxy Cosmo]], Wave units or even [[Otaku Geek Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Otaku Geek Cat]]. Just make sure that you can keep the Otta-smack-us from getting too close! [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] can also be used to deal heavy damage on the Manic Dragons, while the [[Otta-smack-u]]s are not on the battlefield, so you should try your best to eliminate them before more could stack and cause trouble. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Lizard Maniac: [[Draconian (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 36|Floor 36]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Manic King Dragon Cat |Health = 700,000 HP |Attack Power = 2,900 damage

'''[[Manic Island Cat (Enemy Unit)|<< Manic Island Cat]] | [[Manic Jamiera Cat (Enemy Unit)|Manic Jamiera Cat >>]] '''

---- {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Traitless Enemies]] [[Category:Event Enemies]] [[Category:Enemy Cats]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the Cat Unit, see [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)]]. For the weaker boss that must be defeated first, see [[Crazed Titan Cat (Enemy Unit)]].}} '''Manic Jamiera Cat''' (大狂乱のネコジャラミ ''Dai Kyōran no Neko Jarami'', '''Insane Jarami Cat''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy found in [[Resident Feline (Deadly)|Titan Maniac]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Manic Jamiera Cat |image = Crazed jamira Cat.png |appearance = [[Resident Feline (Deadly)|Titan Maniac]] [[Infernal Tower/Floor 37|Infernal Tower - Floor 37]] |money drop = 2,125¢ - 8,394¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy is the Goliath to your David. He has incredibly high health and attack (though, oddly, not as much as the much smaller [[Manic Eraser Cat (Enemy Unit)|Manic Eraser]] and [[Manic Mohawk Cat (Enemy Unit)|Manic Mohawk]]), and a 1-in-4 chance, ''with '''every''' attack'', to fire off a level 7 [[Wave Attack]]. Due to his high attack power, it will kill most Cats that aren't immune to waves, and the few survivors will be low on health or [[Special Abilities#Slow|slowed]] for a long time. ==Strategy== Stacked [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Cyborg Cats]], and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cats]] can lay the hurt on him, but they will probably die if he does a [[Wave Attack]]. You can stall him just like your own Crazed Titan Cat by making it miss. The Gory groups help you accomplish this by eliminating your meatshields that Manic Jamiera would have attacked, as if an enemy misses their initial attack, the wave won't happen. Using [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] or [[Cat Machine (Uber Rare Cat)|Cat Machine Mk3]] to negate Jamiera's [[Wave Attack]] will not guarantee that your ranged attackers will survive. Because of Jamiera's sheer damage and the units' inability to outrange the boss, Octopus will only be able to block the wave within a small window, and Cat Machine's survivability depends on if Manic Jamiera slows him or not. Also be wary that if the boss creates a wave on the same hit that your wave blocker dies or gets knocked back, their hitbox will despawn, and every unit behind will get destroyed. The only wave blockers in the game to break this rule are [[Eva Unit-00 (Uber Rare Cat)|Eva Unit-00]], [[Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo (Uber Rare Cat)|Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo]] and [[Mighty Kristul Muu (Legend Rare Cat)|Mighty Kristul Muu]] since they have 350, 350 and 400 range respectively and can outrange the boss, who only has 320 range. If you have any of these quite rare units, this enemy is turned into a complete joke, as they will be able to consistently block its waves while staying safe. This means that you are able to stack cats that would normally not be a good idea to use, such as [[Tecoluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Lufalan Pasalan]]. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Titan Maniac: [[Resident Feline (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Manic Jamiera Cat |Health = 3,560,000 HP |Attack Power = 22,000 damage
(8,148.15 DPS) |Attack Range = 320
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 81f 2.7 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 47f 1.57s
(34f 1.13s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
50% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] all Cat Units for 200f 6.67 seconds
25% chance to create a Lv.7 [[Wave Attack]] |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== ManicJamieraCatspritesheet1.png|Manic Jamiera Cat's spritesheet IdleManicJamiera.gif|Manic Jamiera Cat's walking animation ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/252.html ----

specialAbility: 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units by 50% for 150f <sub>5 seconds</sub>

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Two Can''' (キョセーヌ ''Kyosēnu'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Two Can |image = Two Can.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Beautiful Finale|Sub-chapter 28 - Beautiful Finale]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Silver Current|Sub-chapter 43 - Silver Current]] |money drop = 950¢ - 3,752¢ }} ==Enemy== This dual-type enemy has low range and Single Target but can create an extremely powerful [[Wave Attack]]. Although Two Can is remarkably frail in comparison to other bulky [[:Category:Wave Attack Enemies|Wave Attackers]], his high damage is beyond compensation. Otherwise, his Single Target attack and long attack animation are his only other direct weaknesses. ==Strategy== Try to exploit his dual typing with powerful [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|anti-Red]]/[[:Category:Anti-Black Cats|Black]] units such as [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] and [[Dom Cat (Special Cat)|Dark Lazer]], which can both tank his attacks and deliver heavy damage, especially with [[Cat Combo]]s. Otherwise, units such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Immortal Yukimura]] can knock him back easily, though this requires some decent timing, especially if there are multiple Two Cans since both units are outranged. [[Tropical Kalisa (Uber Rare Cat)|Tropical Kalisa]] and other such [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|Rushers]] can do much the same. Two Can is also very much vulnerable to [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|iCat]] and [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]], which can permafreeze any amount of Two Cans if the timings line up. Due to Two Can's single-target attack, Wave Shields like [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] can make him a cakewalk as long as they are protected properly. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 255 |enemy category = Red/Black |Enemy name = Two Can |enemy_endesc1 = Used to be the host of a famous game show.
This migratory fellow now travels around the
world playing golf, coming home for TV gigs if
he runs out of money. Fires waves of greed. |image1 = Enemy icon 255.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 有名クイズ番組の元司会者。現在は海外で
ゴルフ三昧の余生を過ごしているが、
金欠になると母国のテレビ出演で荒稼ぎしては
すぐに飛び立つ渡り鳥。波動を放つ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Used to be the host of a famous quiz show.
This migratory bird now spends his life playing golf abroad,
returning to his home country for a TV gig if he runs out of
money, then immediately taking off. Fires waves. |Enemy name (JP) = キョセーヌ (Kyosēnu)}} ==Variant== {{Variant |Youcan |Two Can's [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]]/[[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant. Has slightly longer Wave Attacks, [[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]], and a [[Barrier]] with a breaking point of 266,000. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 41: [[Machu Picchu (Aku Realm)|Machu Picchu]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 28-4: [[Beautiful Finale]] (100%) *Stage 29-5: [[Darkweb]] (100%) *Stage 31-1: [[DNA & DHA]] (100%) *Stage 36-2: [[Rickety Coaster]] (200%) *Stage 38-5: [[Grand Exhibition]] (100%) *Stage 48-6: [[Goblet of the Oath]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 12-3: [[Good Spirits]] (300%) *Stage 18-3: [[Rocky Surface]] (300%) *Stage 24-2: [[Slave to Energy]] (300%) *Stage 28-4: [[Swamp of Ignorance]] (300%) *Stage 36-1: [[The Ivy-Sealed Door]] (300%) *Stage 43-5: [[Silver Current]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Bad to Worse]]: [[Doom Paradise (Insane)]] (100%) *[[The Proving Grounds]]: [[2nd Round: Dawn (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Duel Stages#Duel Under the Sea|Duel Under the Sea]]: [[Elite (Deadly) (Sea)|Elite (Deadly)]] (200%) *[[Total War: Fall Special]]: [[Feast of Fall: Advanced (Deadly)]] (100%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Black Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Black|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Two Can |Health = 250,000 HP |Attack Power = 12,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Tackey ''' (タッちゃん ''Tatchan'') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and the [[Arena of Honor/Shadow Trial|Shadow Trial]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Tackey |image = Tackey.jpeg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Thorny Dialogue|Sub-chapter 29 - Thorny Dialogue]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Payday the 13th|Sub-chapter 32 - Payday the 13th]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has rather low health and few knockbacks but his black spiky ball inflicts high damage. It has a moderate attack speed and identical standing range as [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], which can be a handful. However, the attack hits between ranges 600-850, resulting in a huge blindspot with 600 range. ==Strategy== Defeating Tackey on its own isn't too much of an issue. However, this enemy exists to support melee attackers; its effective range will push back/damage your cats greatly while they're fighting the melee enemies, hitting your backliners and midrangers. Even with random accuracy, Tackey can greatly damage your cats. However, Tackey has a large blindspot, so if a close-ranged cat (e.g. [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]], etc.) makes its way in, they can deal damage to Tackey unharmed. Tackey thus also serves as an anti-backliner. Try using units with adequate health to tank at least one hit or fast units like such as [[Crazed Cow Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Giraffe Cat]] or [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] to enter Tackey's blindspot. If all else fails or is not effective, then consider using cats with the [[Wave Attack]] ability. Examples that are usable include [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Macho Legs]], [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] and [[Talents|Talented]] [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]] or [[Dom Cat (Special Cat)|Dark Lazer]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 256 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Tackey |enemy_endesc1 = A ruthless semi-pro pitcher who resorts to
any means necessary to win the game.
Throws non-regulation balls from long
distance to intimidate the away team batters. |image1 = Enemy icon 256.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 幼馴染と約束した夢を亡き弟に代わり
果たそうとする最凶のブルペンピッチャー。
遠方から放つ必殺の魔球で、
両チームまとめてゲームセット。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A ruthless bullpen pitcher who's trying to fulfill their
childhood friend's dream in place of their deceased
younger brother. A game set for both teams, with deadly
curveballs thrown from long distance. |Enemy name (JP) = タッちゃん (Tatchan) }} ==Variants== {{Variant |Hackey |A [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] fire-breathing variant of Tackey. It has higher health, further effective range and exceptionally high attack power, being able to kill most non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] units in one hit but with an even greater blindspot and attack delay. |Ackey |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Tackey. It has higher damage, slightly higher range, [[Special Abilities|Multi-hit]] and a [[shield]]. During its attack animation, it shoots a dodecahedron that causes three explosions, each having a 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cats for 2 seconds. }} ==Encounters== wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''King Wahwah''' (チワワン伯爵 ''Chiwawan Hakushaku'', '''Earl Chiwawan''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy introduced in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly)|King Wahwah's Revenge]]. {{Enemy Info |name = King Wahwah |image = WahwahBattleFinalVersion.jpg |appearance = [[N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly)|King Wahwah's Revenge]]
[[King Wahwah's Return Stages|King Wahwah's Return]]
[[The King & The Maiden]]
[[The King & The Angel]]
[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 46|Heavenly Tower - Floor 46]] |money drop = 9,999¢ - 39,496¢ }} ==Enemy== King Wahwah moves slowly, has high health, great standing range and a massive omni strike area. His devastating attack is evenly distributed into three hits, guaranteed to knockback on each. He has a lot of knockbacks himself, which can be helpful or annoying depending on the situation. What makes him so difficult is that he usually appears in stages with restrictions, which make him a much bigger problem than what he'd be without. ==Strategy== :''See each stage's article for strategies.'' ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 257 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = King Wahwah |enemy_endesc1 = Born in Year 1196 of the cosmic calendar, he
earned a crown through his military service and
advancement of the sciences. Annoyed that his
kid brother is more famous for a reality show. |image1 = Enemy icon 257.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 宇宙暦1196年画家の息子として生まれる。
類まれな努力家で伯爵の地位まで上り詰めた
芸人でボケ担当。相方はプドール夫人。
弟のぺロは宇宙NO.1ホストで有名。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Born as the son of a painter in year 1996 of the cosmic
calendar. An exceptionally hard worker who ascended to the rank of earl. Also a comedian in charge of ''boke''*; his partner
is Lady Poodle [Mistress Celeboodle]. His younger brother
Pero [Wanwan] is famous for being the No.1 host in space.
*A ''boke'' is the "funny man" in a ''manzai'' comedy act; it can also refer to when a comedian purposely acts like a fool on television. |Enemy name (JP) = チワワン伯爵 (Chiwawan Hakushaku, Earl Chiwawan) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Everlord Wanwan |The [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of King Wahwah. He behaves very similarly, but has higher health and damage, and most of his damage distributed in the first two hits, with the third being weak while [[Special Abilities#Warp|warping]] units back by 2,000 range for over a minute. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *King Wahwah's Revenge: [[N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly)]] *[[King Wahwah's Return Stages|King Wahwah's Return]]: **[[Revenge of N-1 (Merciless)]] **[[Wrath of the Dogelord (Merciless)]] *[[The King & The Maiden]]: [[N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly) (King & Maiden)|N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly)]] *[[The King & The Angel]]: [[N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly) (King & Angel)|N-1 Grand Prix (Deadly)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 46|Floor 46]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = King Wahwah |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 24,000 damage
(2,676.58 DPS) |Attack Range = 600
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 269f (8.97 seconds) |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 25 times |Occurrence = 39f 1.3s
(16f 0.53s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (8,000 at 39f 1.3s, 8,000 at 69f 2.3s, 8,000 at 98f 3.27s)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -500~1,000) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 257 e.png|King Wahwah's spritesheet IdleKingWahWah.gif|King Wahwah's moving animation Medal 032.png|King Wahwah on the ''Usurper'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Amongst the first seven [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], King Wahwah appears to represent the sin of pride. Despite being implied to envy his younger brother, pride is still more likely, as [[Hannya (Red)|Hannya]]'s mask already symbolizes jealousy and the only alternative is [[Queen B (Alien/Floating)|Queen B]], who fits much better with lust. *His name is a play on the word "chihuahua". *His Japanese name, Earl Chiwawan, is a portmanteau of ''chiwawa'', meaning "chihuahua", and ''wan'', the onomatopoeia for a dog's bark. *He was mentioned by name in [[Mistress Celeboodle (Alien)|Mistress Celeboodle]]'s Japanese description 2 years before he was introduced. *According to their Japanese descriptions, Mistress Celeboodle and King Wahwah are a [[wikipedia:Manzai|''manzai'']] comedy duo with Mistress Celeboodle as the ''tsukkomi'' (the short-tempered "straight man" who takes things seriously) and King Wahwah as the ''boke'' (the airheaded "funny man" who gets everything wrong). *The combined descriptions of King Wahwah, [[Everlord Wanwan (Alien)|Everlord Wanwan]] and Mistress Celeboodle imply that the little brother mentioned in Wahwah’s description is Wanwan, which is not only because Wanwan is a variant of Wahwah but also because Mistress Celeboodle's description states that she married a chihuahua reality TV star. (Wanwan and Wahwah are based off of chihuahuas). Thus, this leads to Wahwah being Mistress Celeboodle’s brother-in-law. **This is confirmed in Wahwah's Japanese description, which included the name of his younger brother years before he was added. *It can be inferred that the two dogs pulling his chariot are a more haggard female [[Dagshund]] and Mistress Celeboodle. Note the bandana worn by the frontmost dog (the bunny ears) and the wig and tufts of hair on the other dog. *He has the highest money drop of all [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless Enemies]], and the second highest in the game along with [[Mega Cat (Enemy)|Mega Cat]], which are only beaten by [[Awakened Eva Unit-13 (Eva Angel)|Awakened Eva Unit-13]]. *The enemy ID he uses was unoccupied until [[Version 6.7 Update|Version 6.7]], when he was added to the game; hence why it's so far behind [[Winged Pigge (Angel)|Winged Pigge]] and [[Mystic Mask Yulala (Enemy Unit)|Mystic Mask Yulala]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/259.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article is about the enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)]].}} '''Codename "Red Riding"''' (わんこずきんミーニャ ''Wanko Zukin Mīnya'', '''Dog Hood Minya''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy introduced in [[Learned to Love]], which has a chance to unlock her [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] counterpart [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Red Riding Mina]] when completed. {{Enemy Info |name = Codename "Red Riding" |image = Codenameredriding.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Learned to Love|Sub-chapter 28 - Learned to Love]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's All-Stars|Sub-chapter 38 - Hell's All-Stars]] |money drop = 5,000¢ - 19,750¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has extremely powerful [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] attacks with a gigantic range, so try to prevent her from advancing more than 1/5th of the battlefield, as she will hit the [[Cat Base]]. If she hits the base, though, you still have some time to beat her before it's too late, as her DPS is pretty low for a Long Distance enemy. She also has a huge blindspot of 2,800, which can be exploited by faster units. In her first appearance, you can lure her to your base so that her attack hits the base without killing any cats that you deploy. However, in order for this to work, you have to synchronize and kill the [[H. Nah]]s quickly and rush towards "Red Riding" before the [[Le'noir (Black)|Le'noirs]] and [[Sunfish Jones (Angel)|Sunfish Jones]] get in the way. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 258 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Codename "Red Riding" |enemy_endesc1 = A wandering forest girl hired as an assassin
by the Dog Army. Feared by the Cat Army for
ruthlessly using any tactic necessary to
make the kill. Even a long-distance bazooka! |image1 = Enemy icon 258.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんこ軍団に雇われた森ガール系暗殺者。
任務遂行のためならどんな卑怯な手でも使う。
超遠距離から攻撃出来るバズーカで
にゃんこ城を狙撃してくる厄介な敵。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A forest girl assassin hired by the Dog Army.
Will use even the most unfair tactics to complete her mission.
An annoying enemy whose bazooka can snipe the
Cat Base from uber long distance. |Enemy name (JP) = わんこずきんミーニャ (Wanko Zukin Mīnya, Dog Hood Minya) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 28-6: [[Learned to Love]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 38-3: [[Learned to Hate]] (100%) *Stage 38-6: [[Hell's All-Stars]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 39|Floor 39]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 39|Floor 39]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Codename "Red Riding" |Health = 1,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 22,222 damage
(1,109.25 DPS) |Attack Range = 1,500
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 601f 20.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 76f 2.53s
(69f 2.3s(backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 2,800~3,700) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 258 e.png|Codename "Red Riding"'s spritesheet IdleCodenameRedRiding.gif|Codename "Red Riding"'s moving animation ==Trivia== *Other than resembling a famously known folktale character [[wikipedia:Little Red Riding Hood|Little Red Riding Hood]], Codename "Red Riding"'s appearance, personality, and arsenal may be inspired by the ''[[w:c:dark-stalkers:Vampire Savior: The Lord of Vampire|Vampire Savior]]'' character [[w:c:capcom:Baby Bonnie Hood|Baby Bonnie Hood]], who dons an innocent "red riding hood" appearance but in reality is a psychopath. She appears with devilish eyes whenever she is seen attacking, similar to "Red Riding". Hidden in her basket are various weaponry, such as landmines, an Uzi, or, just like "Red Riding", a bazooka. **The way [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Awakened Mina]]'s animals cower in fear when Mina is attacking is also reminiscent of how Baby Bonnie Hood's dog Harry cowers in fear when she attacks. *She uses an exploding [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] as a rocket, which is replaced by a [[Killer Cat (Rare Cat)|Killer Cat]] when she joins the Cat Army. *She has the largest blindspot of 2,800. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/260.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Boraphim''' (イノエンジェル ''Inoenjeru'') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Boraphim |image = Boraphim.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Lord of the Abyss|Sub-chapter 30 - Lord of the Abyss]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Burning Crimson|Sub-chapter 41 - Burning Crimson]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Boraphim has a rapid attack rate, high attack power and moves quite quickly. Unlike most of his counterparts, he has 5 knockbacks instead of 2, which help to mitigate his otherwise insane pushing power. However, this can also let him escape from your [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|Crowd Controllers]] momentarily and push again or even lead to your units to get killed by other enemies, like [[Sunfish Jones (Angel)|Sunfish Jones]] in [[Irresistable Henhouse]] and [[Razorback (Black)|Razorback]] in [[The Holy Exploit]], so be wary. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Anti-Angel Cats|Anti-Angel Cats]] are almost required to kill Boraphim. [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]] is a strong meatshield, for it takes many hits from Boraphim before dying. Artist, with the help of several [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Magica Cats]] or a [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super Rare Cat)|Prof. Cat Jobs]], can grant full protection from Boraphim while having enough spare health to protect from other [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angels]] in the meantime. Alternatively, a stack of [[Juliet Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Princess Juliet Cats]] and/or [[Cat Toaster (Super Rare Cat)|Cat Projectors]] can be used to to slow or stop his advance. If you have [[Sanzo Cat]] with the Target Angel [[Talents|Talent]] unlocked, this enemy becomes a pushover. If you're concerned with other enemies, unlock Sanzo's [[Special Abilities#Survive|Survive]] Talent. If permafrozen/slowed/weakened, Boraphim can easily be dealt with by short-ranged but powerful units like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]]. In spite of that, it is not recommended to use them, especially if you have cats with more survivability. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 261 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Boraphim |enemy_endesc1 = Executive assistant to heaven's most famous
recort ''[sic]'' label producer. Ghost-writer for two
one-hit wonders: "Cats Ain't No Sin" and
"C.P.U. (Future Intelligence Pt. II)" |image1 = Enemy icon 261.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 某有名探偵事務所の最高顧問であり、
耳に残るメロディを作曲することで有名な
天界の大物作曲家の一番弟子。代表曲は
「ニャンピュータ作戦」「ネコ道楽」など。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Chief adviser of a certain famous detective agency and
highest disciple of one of Heaven's major composers,
famous for his catchy melodies. Notable songs include
"Operation Nyamputer", "Cat Dōraku", etc.*
* These are references to ''Operation Love'' and Kani Dōraku, which Tarō Kida famously composed music for. |Enemy name (JP) = イノエンジェル (Inoenjeru) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 30-6: [[Lord of the Abyss]] *Stage 31-5: [[Heavenly Creatures]] *Stage 36-5: [[Irresistable Henhouse]] *Stage 38-2: [[Sea Breeze Salon]] *Stage 41-5: [[The Holy Exploit]] *Stage 42-6: [[Atrocious Deco]] *Stage 48-4: [[A Moment of Serenity]] *Stage 48-7: [[Twilight Zephyr]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 11-2: [[Pyroclastic Flow]] *Stage 14-5: [[Spa of Ascension]] *Stage 19-1: [[Beachhead Invasion]] *Stage 26-2: [[Icarus' Instinct]] *Stage 37-2: [[Disaster Cycle]] *Stage 41-2: [[Burning Crimson]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[The Proving Grounds]]: [[4th Round: Dawn (Merciless)]] *[[Citadel#Angel|Angel Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Angel|Top Floor]] *[[Divine Archangel Strikes]]: [[Divine Archangel Strikes/Summit Wilderness (Merciless)|Summit Wilderness (Merciless)]] *[[Island of Hidden Treasure]]: [[Holy Refuge]] ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Holy Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Angel|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Boraphim (Angel) |Health = 1,440,000 HP |Attack Power = 17,700 damage
(48,273 DPS) |Attack Range = 155
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 11f0.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 24 |Knockback = 5 times |Ability = - |Element = Angel |Occurrence = 8f 0.27s
(3f 0.1s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 261 e.png|Boraphim's spritesheet IdleBoraphim.gif|Boraphim's walking animation ==Trivia== *His name is a portmanteau of "[[Bore (Red)|Bore]]" and "Seraphim", the highest class of angel in Christianity. *His Japanese name, Inoenjeru, is a portmanteau of ''inoshishi'' ("wild boar") and ''enjeru'' ("angel"). *He has the highest base DPS of all [[Legend Stages]] enemies, and overall is only behind the Scarecrows, Cyclones and [[Teacher Cybear (Metal)|Teacher Cybear]]. *He is most probably based on [[wikipedia:ja:キダ・タロー|Tarō Kida]]. Not only are they both famous composers with grey hair, but Boraphim's Japanese description says he's chief adviser of a certain famous detective agency, the same title held by Tarō Kida on ''[[wikipedia:Knight Scoop|Knight Scoop]]''. **Additionally, the songs mentioned in his Japanese description are "Operation Nyamputer" and "Cat Dōraku", which is a reference to how Tarō Kida famously composed music for the television series ''[[wikipedia:Operation Love|Operation Love]]'' and the restaurant [[wikipedia:Kani Dōraku|Kani Dōraku]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/263.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|The official name of this enemy is unknown.}} '''Drummer Doge''' (やぐらわんこ, ''Yagurawanko'') is a stationary enemy that first appears in [[Summer Diary (Celebration Event)|Summer Diary]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Drummer Doge |image = Drums Doge.png |appearance = [[Summer Festival (Celebration Event)#Summer Diary|Summer Diary]]
[[Summer Break Cats]]
[[Infernal Tower]]
[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]] |money drop = 1,600¢ - 6,320¢ }} ==Enemy== Has very slow attack speed, and negligible damage, but can stall your team for a long time with its long range, lots of HP and freeze ability, meaning they can be annoying as support. Their freeze is not too bad, as it lasts for only a single second. Due to their lack of speed, they are used to protect the base from damage. ==Strategy== You really have nothing to fear. This enemy will easily fall to almost any cat with [[:Category:Cats with Freeze Immunity|freeze immunty]] due to its very low damage. On top of that, it has no immunities, meaning you can either knock it behind the base or freeze it using [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|anti-traitless]] cats. It can even be ignored entirely by hitting the base using certain cats with [[:Category:Omni Strike Cats|piercing range]]. If killing it is necessary, [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] can get the job done fast. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Summer Festival (Celebration Event)#Summer Diary|Summer Diary]]: **[[Candy Apple Dentistry]] (30%) **[[Sparkler Heaven]] (100%) **[[Backyard BBQ]] (150%) *[[Summer Break Cats]]: **[[Citronella Scent]] (10%) **[[Schoolyard Dance]] (25%) **[[Music in the Distance]] (50%) **[[Final Fireworks]] (150%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 3|Floor 3]] (100%) *[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 3#Traitless|Floor 3]] (20%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Rundown Hideout: [[Afternoon Bug Hunt]] (1%) *Stylish Hideout: [[Evening Bug Hunt]] (1%) *Perfect Hideout: [[Midnight Bug Hunt]] (1%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Drummer Doge |Health = 300,000 HP |Attack Power = 100 damage
(11.95 DPS) |Attack Range = 1,800
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 251f 8.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 0 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 52f 1.73s
(27f 0.9s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 30f 1 second |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 262 e.png|Drummer Doge's spritesheet IdleDrummerDoge.gif|Drummer Doge's idle state ==Trivia== *Drummer Doge appears to be beating a [[wikipedia:Taiko|Taiko Drum]], a traditional percussion instrument used in Japan. *Drummer Doge, [[Package Doge (Event Enemy)|Package Doge]], and [[Angry Sun (Event Enemy)|Angry Sun]] are the only stationary enemies in the game, due to their lack of movement speed. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/264.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Henry''' (ヒカル, '''''Hikaru''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Henry |image = Henry.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Conservation Society|Sub-chapter 31 - Conservation Society]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Lamps Aloft|Sub-chapter 42 - Lamps Aloft]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 7,110¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has Long Distance, high health and relatively low damage. His main power is the ability to permanently freeze cats, or at least until they are knocked back. Henry's area of effect is massive, so no cats are safe from him. Note that Henry's freeze duration is the exact same as his attack rate, so if he gets knocked back, your units will get unfrozen. ==Strategy== Henry freezes your attackers by abusing your meatshields as stepping stones so other enemies could easily steamroll through them, making him a powerful support unit. He does have a minimum range, so if you can get your cats in a good position, you've basically already won. Another strategy is to lure him to the [[Cat Base]], as not as many cats will be frozen due to LD units standing at their minimum effective range, and he doesn't inflict much damage to the base. If there's an opening, rushers like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] can deal massive damage to him, as his standing range is well within Henry's blindspot, although some other short-ranged units can also work, as long as they're fast enough. Do take note that Henry will still attack if there is something in his standing range, including his blindspot. [[:Category:Cats with Freeze Immunity|Units that are immune to freeze]] such as [[Li'l Tank Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Eraser Cat]] are great against Henry. Use them even if you may not normally. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 266 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Henry |enemy_endesc1 = Took 9 gap years before working up the
courage to enroll in college. Hoping to major
in nuclear physics to better control his particle
beams, but dad wants him to study accounting. |image1 = Enemy icon 266.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 9浪中の浪人生。受験勉強中に編みだした
怪光線で、試験会場中の受験生の動きを止めるも
試験官たちに強制退場させられた
両親からのプレッシャーに弱い |enemy_jpdesc1 = A student who failed the university entrance exams 9 times.
The peculiar ray of light he made while studying helped to stop the movement of
the other students in the examination hall, but the examiners forced him to leave.
Weak to parental pressure. |Enemy name (JP) = ヒカル (Hikaru) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 32: [[United Kingdom (Aku Realm)|United Kingdom]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 31-6: [[Conservation Society]] (100%) *Stage 32-3: [[Weeping Dunes]] (100%) *Stage 33-5: [[Close Encounters]] (100%) *Stage 36-3: [[Virtual Nightmare]] (100%) *Stage 39-1: [[Electric Bath]] (100%) *Stage 41-1: [[Caliban's Keeper]] (100%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 6-1: [[Deadly Weapons]] (150%) *Stage 10-4: [[Snitches Get Stitches]] (150%) *Stage 14-4: [[13th Ward Resident]] (150%) *Stage 17-1: [[Steamworks Ltd.]] (150%) *Stage 20-2: [[Lonely Goldfish]] (150%) *Stage 23-4: [[Patience Prevails]] (150%) *Stage 31-4: [[Adventurer's Journal]] (150%) *Stage 35-5: [[Cloned Farmers]] (150%) *Stage 42-2: [[Lamps Aloft]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Total War: Fall Special]]: [[Feast of Fall: Supreme (Merciless)]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Henry |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 2,500 damage
(375 DPS) |Attack Range = 450
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 200f 6.67 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 27f 0.9s
(66f 2.23s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 200f 6.67 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 650~1,300) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== Henryspritesheet.png|Henry's spritesheet IdleHenry.gif|Henry's moving animation ==Trivia== *In the [[Nyanko Daisensou|Japanese version]], Henry is called Hikaru, a common Japanese name meaning "to shine; to give off light". His English name unfortunately has no such significance, aside from being another common name that starts with the letter "H". **According to a post from the official Battle Cats LINE account, his parents chose the name Hikaru because they wanted him to shine. Ironically, he is anything but a shining example, having failed the university entrance exams 9 times in a row. *Despite being male, Henry's appearance is that of a female anglerfish; males are much smaller and don't have lures. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/268.html *https://seesaawiki.jp/battlecatswiki/d/%a5%d2%a5%ab%a5%eb ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Hannya''' (般若我王 ''Hannya Gaō'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] introduced in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|River Styx]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Hannya |image = Hannya.png |appearance = [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|River Styx]]
[[River Acheron Stages|River Acheron]]
[[The Angel & The Demon]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] |money drop = 4,500¢ - 17,775¢ }} ==Enemy== Hannya has a decently fast attack rate, does massive damage and weakens cats to 25% from a range of 800 with no blind spot, this combined with the support in the stages that she appears in make her range and damage all the more threatening. Unlike the original [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]] and [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]], Hannya is NOT a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy. ==Strategy== In [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|Realm of Carnage]] and [[Wrath of Carnage (Deadly)|Wrath of Carnage]], the only hard part about defeating Hannya is the [[R.Ost]]s that come with her, the only non-Red enemy in the stage. To beat R.Ost, it's advised that you use [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] during R.Ost's backswing (the second peck) or after freezing him with the [[Ototo Development Team#Thunderbolt|Thunderbolt Cannon]], as explained in [https://youtu.be/DTyCijjxVd4 this video]. [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|Anti-Red Cats]] such as [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]], [[Swordsman Cat (Rare Cat)|Elemental Duelist Cat]] and [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fried Shrimp Cat]] are all extremely helpful when fighting this demon, although Hannya will have to be weakened in order for Elemental Duelist at level 33 to survive a hit and you'll have to press your luck with Fried Shrimp Cat's low weaken chance. [[Kuu (Uber Rare Cat)|Divine Kuu]] or [[Pai-Pai (Uber Rare Cat)|Pai-Pai]] are especially great options as they have anti-red abilities boosting their effective health and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|weaken immunity]], allowing them to safely tank Hannya's hits. [[Tropical Kalisa (Uber Rare Cat)|Tropical Kalisa]] is extremely useful, as she will be able to deal insane damage to Hannya when timed well. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 267 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Hannya |enemy_endesc1 = Wore a creepy mask as a joke, transformed
into a flesh-eating demon. That can happen.
Breathes pure corruption born of vengeful hate.
The normal Face isn't so bad anymore, eh? |image1 = Enemy icon 267.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 呪われた般若の面を被ってしまったがゆえに
成仏できない魂を喰い集める鬼へと変貌
口から吐き出される怨念の魂に触れたものは
恐怖で本来の力を出せなくなってしまう |enemy_jpdesc1 = Wore the cursed Hannya mask, transformed into a demon
who eats the souls of those who cannot attain
enlightenment. Spews grudeful souls that cause others to
lose their full power out of fear. |Enemy name (JP) = 般若我王 (Hannya Gaō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)|River Styx]]: [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)]] *[[River Acheron Stages|River Acheron]]: **[[Wrath of Carnage (Deadly)]] **[[Revenge of Carnage (Merciless)]] *[[The Angel & The Demon]]: [[Realm of Carnage (Deadly)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 44|Floor 44]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Hannya |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 36,000 damage
(7,152 DPS) |Attack Range = 800
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 151f 5.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 24f 0.8s
(17f 0.57s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units to 25% for 150f 5 seconds |Element = Red }} ==Gallery== 267 e.png|Hannya's spritesheet IdleHannya.gif|Hannya's moving animation Medal 029.png|Hannya on the ''Charon's Crossing'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *A [[Wikipedia:Hannya|Hannya]] is a mask used in [[Wikipedia:Noh|Noh]] theater to represent a jealous female demon. *Amongst the first seven [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Hannya represents the sin of envy, as her mask is a symbol of female jealousy. *Her gender was confirmed in a [https://twitter.com/PONOS_EN/status/776236850591723520 Tweet] made by [[PONOS Corporation|PONOS]]. *The term used for "attaining enlightenment" in her Japanese description specifically refers to achieving Buddhahood; attaining nirvana. This theme of Buddhism would later be carried on with [[Black Okame (Red/Black)|Black Okame]] in [[The Pure Land (Merciless)|The Pure Land]], the celestial realm of a buddha or bodhisattva. *The word Gaō in her Japanese name, Hannya Gaō (般若我王), doesn't mean anything on its own and is just a pun on ''kao'' (顔), meaning "face", though it can rarely also be a person's name. It consists of the kanji for "ego" or "self-assertion" (我) and "king" (王). *She and [[Kappy Jr.]] are the only Advent Bosses to have neither Long Distance nor Omni Strike. **While Kappy Jr. has a powerful [[Surge Attack|Surge]], Hannya has no means to hit units beyond her attack range. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/269.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Li'l Bun Bun''' (ちびぶんぶん, '''''Chibi Bun Bun''''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Li'l Bun Bun |image = Li'l Bun Bun.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Trouble at the Mansion|Sub-chapter 32 - Trouble at the Mansion]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Local Harvest Forecast|Sub-chapter 45 - Local Harvest Forecast]] }} ==Enemy== [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]]'s son has fast movement and attack, fairly high health and attack power, and, perhaps most importantly, drops a minuscule amount of cash when dying. However, he still has many knockbacks and short range. He is known for being sent out in hordes and/or spawned infinitely like a very strong peon. With their high movement speed and rapid attacks, Li'l Bun Buns quickly meet up with each other to form a stack, doing insane DPS to whatever they touch. In most of his appearances, he is buffed to 1,000%, giving him about 0.75x as much health but 1.25x as much attack power as the 400% Teacher Bun Bun from the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon/Iriomote]]. ==Strategy== Treat him like a pure Floating [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]], but devise a cost-efficient way to get rid of him as he drops much less cash. He can be beaten easily by [[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Anti-Floating Units]] that do high damage like [[Archer Cat (Rare Cat)|Cataur]], or high area damage cats, such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] or [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 272 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Li'l Bun Bun |enemy_endesc1 = Grand Champion of the Problem Child Grand
Prix, terror of kindergarten classrooms every-
where. Maybe Dad let him read the Russian
classics too early? Favorite word = LOVE |image1 = Enemy icon 272.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんぱくちびっこグランプリで、審判と
周りの保護者をも打ち倒した話題の小学生。
大変な読書家でもあり、将来は父親と同じく
教師になりたいと思っている。好きな言葉は愛情。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A primary school student who hit both the referee
and other kids' parents in the Problem Child Grand Prix
An avid reader, he wants to be a teacher like his dad
when he grows up. Favorite word is LOVE. |Enemy name (JP) = ちびぶんぶん (Chibi Bun Bun) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 32-6: [[Trouble at the Mansion]] (1,000%) *Stage 35-1: [[Virus Smugglers]] (1,000%) *Stage 37-2: [[Gossip Rags]] (1,000%) *Stage 40-6: [[Houses of the Holy]] (1,000%) *Stage 43-5: [[Tunguska Event]] (1,000%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (1,000%) *Stage 49-1: [[Eldritch Forces]] (1,200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 15-3: [[Lord's Lecture]] (5%, 1,500%) *Stage 23-6: [[Cursing the Curser]] (400%) *Stage 27-1: [[The Prince's Woods]] (1%, 1,500%) *Stage 36-4: [[Canopy Altar]] (1,500%) *Stage 38-5: [[Infernal Forces]] (1,500%) *Stage 45-2: [[Local Harvest Forecast]] (1,500%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Strange]]: [[Fear of Flying (Merciless)]] (1,000%) *[[Growing Epic]]: [[Miracle Iris (Deadly)]] (1,200%) *[[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)|Typhoon Nemo]]: [[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)]] (1,000%) *[[Typhoon Nihil Stages|Typhoon Nihil]]: [[Creation's Gyre (Merciless)|Creation's Gyre]] (1,000%) *[[Isle of the Map Lord]]: [[Church of Mercator (Merciless)|Church of Mercator]] (1,000%) *[[The Proving Grounds]]: [[4th Round: Dusk (Merciless)]] (1,000%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] (1,300%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 30|Floor 30]] (1,500%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Li'l Bun Bun |Health = 29,997 HP |Attack Power = 1,125 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Gertrud''' (ゲルルート ''Gerurūto'') is a [[:Category:Witch Enemies|Witch]] enemy that appears in the [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gertrud |image = gertrud.PNG |appearance = [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 1,200¢ - 4,740¢ }} ==Enemy== This butterfly-like Witch attacks by throwing red couches at a decent distance. Her attack can wipe out most small cats and some medium cats in one hit, so it is still best to keep an ongoing meatshield of smaller cats to protect any larger heavy hitters. ==Strategy== It is recommended to use any cats that outrange her and keep them protected by using any smaller and cheaper cats. In the long run, defeating Gertrud should be not be much of a sweat. One way to speed up the fight is by using both [[Li'l Madoka (Rare Cat)|Li'l Madoka]] and [[Li'l Homura (Special Cat)|Li'l Homura]] to activate the [[My Very Best Friend (Combo)|My Very Best Friend]] [[Cat Combo|Combo]], which will greatly amplify the effect of the "Witch Killer" ability against Gertrud. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *Witch's Labyrinth (Gertrud): **[[The Rose Garden Witch (Easy)]] (20%) **[[The Rose Garden Witch (Veteran)]] (400%) *[[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event#Witch's Labyrinth: Rose Garden Witch|Witch's Labyrinth: Rose Garden Witch]]: **[[Allow Me To Introduce Myself]] (20%) **[[But Before That]] (150%) **[[Some Cleaning Up]] (400%) **[[Is In Order]] (600%) **[[Tiro Finale!]] (900%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Gertrud |Health = 150,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,500 damage

---- {{Puella Magi Madoka Magica}} {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Witch Enemies]] [[Category:Collaboration Event Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{DISPLAYTITLE:Charlotte (Witch)}} {{Disambig|For the second, weaker form, see [[Charlotte (Doll) (Witch)]].}} '''Charlotte''' (シャルロッテ ''Sharurotte'') is the name of two enemy units that appear in the [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]]. This is the snake form. {{Enemy Info |name = Charlotte |image = charlottesnake.jpg |appearance = [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== This form is the larger and stronger one, with a high damage output but a relatively slow attack rate. Her bite attack may look like it has a specified range because of the formed gap between her head and body, but targets a wider area. Still, treat her like most other enemy units with this kind of area of effect. == Strategy == The snake form may be bulky in health and an annoyance for her powerful bite attack, but the fight should not be difficult as long as you do not get out-stalled. Just stack up on long-range attack cats like [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] and at least one heavy hitter such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]]. As long as they can outrange this form of Charlotte, all you need to do is protect them by spamming other smaller cats. The doll form, on the other hand, should be an easy kill and not require any particular strategies. If you have [[Li'l Madoka (Rare Cat)|Li'l Madoka]], [[Li'l Homura (Special Cat)|Li'l Homura]], or any [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] from [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event|the collaboration event]], use them. Since both forms of Charlotte are [[:Category:Witch Enemies|Witches]], then they will become much easier to defeat due to the collab units' Witch Killer ability. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages]]=== *Witch's Labyrinth (Charlotte): **[[The Dessert Witch (Normal)]] (20%) **[[The Dessert Witch (Expert)]] (300%) *[[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event#Witch's Labyrinth: Dessert Witch|Witch's Labyrinth: Dessert Witch]]: **[[My Body Is Light]] (20%) **[[With Such Joy]] (200%) **[[A Battle Like This]] (300%) **[[I'm Afraid of Nothing]] (400%) **[[I'm Not Alone Anymore]] (500%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Charlotte |Health = 300,000 HP |Attack Power = 12,000 damage
(3,243.24 DPS) |Attack Range = 380

(46f 1.53s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Witch }} ==Gallery== 274 e.png|Charlotte's spritesheet File:Charlotteupgradedversion.gif|Charlotte's animations ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/276.html ----

---- {{Puella Magi Madoka Magica}} {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Collaboration Event Enemies]] [[Category:Witch Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Kirsten''' (キルステン ''Kirusuten'') is a [[:Category:Witch Enemies|Witch]] enemy that appears in the [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Kirsten |image = Kirsten.PNG |appearance = [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} == Enemy == This enemy unit consists of a flying computer monitor accompanied by two wooden angel-like creatures. Although she is above the ground, she does not count as a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy. Instead, she has only the Witch trait. In this case, she will stand no chance against [[:Category:Witch Killer Cats|Witch Killers]] such as [[Li'l Madoka (Rare Cat)|Li'l Madoka]], [[Li'l Homura (Special Cat)|Li'l Homura]] or any [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] from [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event|the collaboration event]]. ==Strategy== Despite her enormous DPS, Kirsten has mediocre range and a longer-than-average backswing, making her easy to stall with enough meatshields. As such, she should be a pushover as long as you use Witch Killers or other long range-attacking cats leveled up enough and protect them with smaller cats like the [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Basic Cat]] and [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]]. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *Witch's Labyrinth (Kirsten): **[[The Box Witch (Hard)]] (25%) **[[The Box Witch (Insane)]] (200%) *[[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event#Witch's Labyrinth: Box Witch|Witch's Labyrinth: Box Witch]]: **[[I Know My Wish]] (25%) **[[Miracles and Magic Are Real]] (100%) **[[Did I Do Well?]] (200%) **[[I Have No Regrets]] (300%) **[[You'll Be Happy, Won't You]] (400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Kirsten |Health = 750,000 HP |Attack Power = 20,000 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Walpurgisnacht''' (ワルプルギスの夜 ''Warupurugisu no Yoru'', Walpurgis Night) is a [[:Category:Witch Enemies|Witch]] enemy that appears in the [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Walpurgisnacht |image = Walpurgisnacht.PNG |appearance = [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 8,000¢ - 31,600¢ }} ==Enemy== Walpurgisnacht is a particularly tough enemy from the Madoka Magica collab. This is because her falling building attack can destroy lots of Cats at once and slow down any survivors. Her area of effect is tremendously wide as well. Also keep in mind that she is not a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy despite being in the air. ==Strategy== Surprisingly, this enemy becomes very easy to beat if you have unlocked both [[Li'l Madoka (Rare Cat)|Li'l Madoka]] and [[Li'l Homura (Special Cat)|Li'l Homura]] and use them in battle. The [[Cat Combo]] called [[My Very Best Friend (Combo)|My Very Best Friend]] involving these Cats will further improve the effect of their Witch Killer ability by a massive factor. You can use also any of the [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] from the collaboration should you have received them; see [[Puella Magi Madoka Magica Collaboration Event/Gacha Drop|here]] for a list of units who have the ability. Without [[:Category:Witch Killer Cats|Witch Killers]], the battle becomes more challenging, as weak or low-leveled cats will die in the process before being able to deal significant damage. Alternatively, you can use [[Stone Cat (Rare Cat)|Stone Cat]] boosted with combos to slowly drain its health, but be aware that in higher magnifications, Stone Cat can and eventually will be one-shotted due to the [[Critical Hit|Critical]] damage, and using it alone takes a long time to win. Still, Stone Cat can work wonders with stalling Walpurgisnacht while other units deal damage. Even if you don't have [[Stone Cat (Rare Cat)|Stone Cat]], you can use [[Talents|talented]] [[Pogo Cat (Rare Cat)|Jiangshi Cat]] and speed combos. Keep in mind this only works with a M speed combo and maybe lvl 8-10 or lvl 10 with a Sm speed combo. You also need Slow Resist to a good level so that it can move forward as soon as the knockback animation finishes. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Walpurgisnacht Stage|Walpurgisnacht]]: **[[The Stagebuilding Witch (Deadly)]] (10%) *[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)|Walpurgisnacht]]: **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1]] (10%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 2]] (76%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 3]] (142%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 4]] (208%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 5]] (274%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 6]] (340%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 7]] (406%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 8]] (472%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 9]] (538%) **[[Walpurgisnacht (Gauntlet)/Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 1~10|Stagebuilding Witch: Cycle 10]] (600%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Walpurgisnacht |Health = 2,400,000 HP |Attack Power = 40,000 damage
