wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Razorback''' (イノワール ''Inowāru'') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Razorback |image = Razorback.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[The Spy Who Pet Me|Sub-chapter 33 - The Spy Who Pet Me]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Border Between Worlds|Sub-chapter 37 - Border Between Worlds]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Razorback is designed to be almost unbeatable without [[:Category:Anti-Black Cats|anti-Black cats]], having ''extremely'' high health, speed, DPS and attack rate. He also strengthens by 50% at 50% health. ==Strategy== One [[Oda Nobunaga (Uber Rare Cat)|Oda Nobunaga]] or two or more [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercats]] are enough to permafreeze Razorback. The number of Bombercats needed can be reduced to one if you use one "Freeze" Effect UP (M) or two (Sm) [[Cat Combo]]s. However, timing Bombercat is crucial in [[Taste of Success (Merciless)|Taste of Success]]. The [[Tackey (Black)|Tackeys]] can wipe out your Bombercats before they even reach the frontline to freeze Razorback, who can push to your base and destroy it easily. If you don't have Nobunaga or Bombercat to freeze him, Razorback is still beatable. Bring as many anti-Blacks as it takes to keep the pressure on him, such as [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Cooldown Cat]], [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Cat Eastwood]], [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Holy Valkyrie Cat]], [[Pumpcat (Rare Cat)|Cat O'Lantern]], and [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 280 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Razorback |enemy_endesc1 = After years of wandering the wastelands,
his fur and his soul have been blackened
by the corruption of the world. Receives
awards for perfect attendance at work. |image1 = Enemy icon 280.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 闇の世界を渡り歩き、その腹黒さゆえ全身が
黒くなったイノシシ。たてがみのセットに2時間
かかるが仕事に遅れたことは一度も無い。
たてがみが崩れだすと凶暴化するのが悪い癖。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = After wandering the dark world, he turned black from all of the evil.
Takes 2 hours every morning to perfectly style his mohawk, but has never been late for work.
Turns extra violent when his hairstyle starts to lose shape. |Enemy name (JP) = イノワール (Inowāru) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 33-6: [[The Spy Who Pet Me]] (100%) *Stage 35-4: [[High Watchtower]] (100%) *Stage 39-4: [[Soap Scum]] (100%) *Stage 41-5: [[The Holy Exploit]] (100%) *Stage 42-6: [[Atrocious Deco]] (100%) *Stage 48-2: [[Thirst for Vengeance]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 11-2: [[Pyroclastic Flow]] (100%) *Stage 19-1: [[Beachhead Invasion]] (100%) *Stage 26-6: [[Cats in the Stars]] (100%) *Stage 34-2: [[Tropical Garden]] (150%) *Stage 37-5: [[Border Between Worlds]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Merciless XP!: [[Taste of Success (Merciless)]] (150%) *[[Growing Strange]]: [[Hearts of Darkness (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Empress' Report 5]]: [[Aku Studies 501: Intro]] (100%) *[[Citadel#Black|Black Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Black|Top Floor]] (100%) *[[Dark Descent Stages|Cover of Darkness]]: [[Final Battleground]] (100%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Black Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Black|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] (100%) ===[[Catclaw Dojo]]=== *[[Arena of Honor|Arena of Power]]: [[Arena of Honor/Tearful Tournament|Tearful Tournament]] (150%, 200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Razorback |Health = 1,150,000 HP |Attack Power = 20,000 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/The '''Scarecrow''' (木人城 , '''Wooden Castle''') is an animated [[Enemy Bases|Enemy Base]] found in [[Wanderer's Trial (Stage 1)]] in the [[Catclaw Dojo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Scarecrow |image = Rc283 e.png |appearance = [[Catclaw Dojo|Hall of Initiates]]
[[Arena of Honor]] |money drop = N/A }} ==Enemy== This enemy base can attack Cat Units in range, with a slow attack rate. Because it is a base, it does not move. All of its attacks are basically an instant-kill, except against [[:Category:Cats with Metal ability|Metal Cats]] and [[:Category:Lethal Strike Resistant Cats|Cats that survive lethal strikes]]. The Scarecrow is immune to all effects because it is an enemy base. ==Strategy== Basically any unit that it can outrange, it will kill. Therefore, the best way to counter the Scarecrow is to use units that outrange it, or time your units so that they go directly before the Scarecrow attacks so your units can trigger the next wave as fast as possible, as the boss wave knocks your units out of the Scarecrow's range. ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Scarecrow |Health = 2,147,483,647 HP |Attack Power = 999,999 damage
(49,261 DPS) |Attack Range = 300
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 609f 20.3 seconds |Movement Speed = 0 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 10f
(27f backswing) |Ability = Immune to [[Freeze]], [[Slow]], [[Curse]], [[Knockback]], and [[Weaken]] |Element = Typeless }} ==Gallery== Scarecrowspritesheet.png|Scarecrow's spritesheet ==Trivia== *In reality, the Scarecrow's health is not infinite. It actually has 2,147,483,647 health but due to the time limit of the stage, it is not possible to defeat it without hacking. *The Scarecrow is the first enemy base that can attack Cat Units. *[[Hades the Punisher (Uber Rare Cat)|Hades the Deathdealer]] is able to tank a hit from this base if at level 50+54 or at level 54 with max health [[Talents]] and a Defense UP (M) combo. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/285.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zoge''' (ゾンビワン ''Zonbiwan'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Doge]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[The Aku Realms]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zoge |image = ZogeBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Home Sweet Mausoleum|Sub-chapter 34 - Home Sweet Mausoleum]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Multiplanar Studios|Sub-chapter 38 - Multiplanar Studios]] |money drop = 45¢ - 178¢ }} ==Enemy== Zoge is the basic Zombie enemy, and so he doesn't do anything noteworthy apart from reviving and burrowing. He's much slower than [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] and [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriel]], but his abilities can briefly put a halt to your front lines. Due to his strong Area Attacks, it may be riskier to stall groups of Zoges in front of the [[Cat Base]] than with other basic peons. ==Strategy== Zoge is generally more of a nuisance than an actual threat. If you really have a hard time with him in Zombie Outbreaks, a good strategy is to spam [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Giraffe Cats]] and [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cats]] to attack the enemy base head-on and trigger the burrows of any Zoges and other Zombies that may be spawning from it. Otherwise, you can use Giraffe Cat to have him burrow early and then use strong attackers like [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Mythical Titan Cat]] to take him out in a few hits, or stack [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|UFO Cats]] while protecting them with [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cats]] and [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Wall Cats]]. Obviously, Area [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]] such as [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Polevaulter Cat]], [[Li'l Bird Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Flying Cat]] and [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Cadaver BearCat]] excel against Zoge, although only Polevaulter Cat is realistically obtainable before this enemy becomes irrelevant. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 284 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zoge |enemy_endesc1 = Doge's late father, buried several years ago.
Even the grave couldn't stop him from
worrying over his kids' grades. Only showing
a report card can put him permanently to rest. |image1 = Enemy icon 284.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 数年前に埋葬されたはずのわんこのお父さん。
息子の受験勉強の様子が気になり帰宅した。
誰かに見つかりそうになると地面に潜って
やり過ごす。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Doge's father, thought to have been buried years ago.

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Znache''' (にょろろん ''Ni ~yororon'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Snache]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Znache |image = ZnacheBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Swamp of Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 34 - Swamp of Sacrifice]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Fullstop Valley|Sub-chapter 47 - Fullstop Valley]] |money drop = 60¢ - 237¢ }} ==Enemy== Znache is a deceptively strong peon with the ability to [[Special Abilities#Burrow|burrow]] ''very'' far past your frontline - combined with its Area Attack, you may often find Znache chomping on your [[Cat Base]] before you even notice it's there. ==Strategy== Use similarly powerful [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] of your own to strike Znache when it resurfaces in your backlines. [[Bird Cat (Normal Cat)|Bird Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] can do this quite effectively. Other units can also work, but they have to be [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rushers]] or have to brute-force Znache so it does as little damage as possible to your frontline. It is still a peon, but that burrow distance is no joke in some stages. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 285 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Znache |enemy_endesc1 = A slithery creature who uses watercolors for
horror makeup (really already dead, though.)
The only information you need is that
it possesses gruesome area attack powers. |image1 = Enemy icon 285.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 墓場に稀に出没するにょろのような形をした生物。
ツチノコと間違えられる事があるが
学術的にはミミズに近い。
最近の研究では範囲攻撃という事が解っている |enemy_jpdesc1 = Snache-like creature that rarely appears in the graveyard.
Although it is sometimes mistaken for a tsuchinoko*, it is
academically closer to earthworms.
Recent research confirmed that it has area attack.
*A tsuchinoko is a snake-like cryptid of Japanese folklore. |Enemy name (JP) = にょろろん (Ni ~yororon) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== Zombie wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zomboe''' (カバタリアン ''Kabatarian'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Hippoe]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zomboe |image = ZomboeBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Revenant Road|Sub-chapter 34 - Revenant Road]] |money drop = 200¢ - 790¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[The Belated Priest|Sub-chapter 31 - The Belated Priest]] }} ==Enemy== Zomboe attacks slowly, but its damage is considerably high. It possesses the usual Zombie abilities (burrowing past your cats and reviving once with 50% HP) and also has a chance to slow units. Not much of a problem alone, but can really hurt when used as a peon for enemies such as [[Zyclone (Zombie)|Zyclone]] or [[Le'noir (Black)|Le'noir]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 286 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zomboe |enemy_endesc1 = Wandered through a poison bog one
gloomy night and later woke up dead.
(S)he doesn't seem to mind though.
Now we'll never know if it's a he or she. |image1 = Enemy icon 286.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 散歩中にうっかり毒沼にハマったカバちゃん。
その夜に毒がまわって死んでしまったが
本人は特に気にしていない。最近は口臭が
気になりだし、ため息の日々を送っている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Hippo-chan [Hippoe] fell into a poisonous swamp while
going for a walk. Died after being consumed by the poison
that night, but doesn't seem to mind it. Worrying about bad
breath lately, it continues to sigh everyday. |Enemy name (JP) = カバタリアン (Kabatarian) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== Strength magnifications wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zackie Peng''' (ジャッキー・ペンZ ''Jakkī Pen Z'', "'''Jackie Peng Z'''") is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Jackie Peng]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[Cats of the Cosmos]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zackie Peng |image = ZackiePengBattle.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Swamp of Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 34 - Swamp of Sacrifice]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Oil Spill Rainbow|Sub-chapter 33 - Oil Spill Rainbow]] |money drop = 150¢ - 593¢ }} ==Enemy== He has high DPS with short range, and, like most other Zombie enemies, can burrow and revive once. However, Zackie Peng's attacks are single-target, making him useless if he burrows into an area with a lot of meatshields. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 288 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zackie Peng |enemy_endesc1 = After his debut film bombed, a big hole
was all thats left where Peng's heart used
to be. Even death by bad reviews won't
stop his revenge on ungrateful audiences! |image1 = Enemy icon 288.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 念願のハリウッドデビューを果たすもなぜか
心にぽっかり穴が空いたような気がするペンギン。
身も心も軽くなってアクションにも幅が出たが、
ゾンビもののオファーしか来なくなった。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A penguin who somehow still feels a hole in his heart even after fulfilling his dream of making it into Hollywood. Shows up in a lot of action scenes due to having a light body and heart, but he only ever gets offers for zombie films. |Enemy name (JP) = ジャッキー・ペンZ (Jakkī Pen Z, "Jackie Peng Z") }} ==Encounters== https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zir Zeal''' (ブチゴマさま ''Buchigoma-sama'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Sir Seal (Red)|Sir Seal]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zir Zeal |image = Zir Zeal.png |money drop = 450¢ - 1,778¢ |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Revenant Road|Sub-chapter 34 - Revenant Road]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Multiplanar Studios|Sub-chapter 38 - Multiplanar Studios]] }} ==Enemy== Zir Zeal has the typical burrowing and respawning abilities of a Zombie enemy. However, when Zir Zeal burrows, he takes his sweet time to dig a huge 1500-length tunnel underground, exceeding the standing range of any cat. Consequentially, Zir Zeal tends to overshoot the blindspots of [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]] and will actually not pose an immediate threat to your backline. Of course, this also means that he may dig past any attackers that could immediately deal with him, so it's advised that you save the [[Cat Cannon]] to cancel his burrow or force him to the surface with a Holy Blast. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 290 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zir Zeal |enemy_endesc1 = Through the morning mists, I beheld a Seal
He called me to join him in a voice neither
living nor dead, beckoning me to join him
on the distant shore of an uncanny world... |image1 = Enemy icon 290.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ちまたでウワサのアザラシに憧れて
あの世からやってきたアザラシのような生物。
普段はどぶ川に仰向けで浮かび黄色い声で
名前を呼ばれるのを待ちわびている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Seal-like being who came from the other world,
hoping to become the subject of some rumors in the
streets. Usually, he's laying on his back on a dirty river, eagerly awaiting someone to call out his name in a high-pitched voice. |Enemy name (JP) = ブチゴマさま (Buchigoma-sama) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zang Roo''' (スカルボクサー Sukarubokusā, '''Skull Boxer''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Kang Roo]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zang Roo |image = ZangRoo.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Silenced Meowing|Sub-chapter 34 - Silenced Meowing]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Retreat of the Living Dead|Sub-chapter 46 - Retreat of the Living Dead]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== Easily the strongest Zombie peon, Zang Roo moves slower than [[Shadow Boxer K (Black)|Shadow Boxer K]] but has only 1/5th the knockbacks, making her very difficult to fend off should she appear at your base - which is more likely than not with her 1125-distance burrow. She also revives with full HP if not done in by a [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]], and she has just enough range to ensure that it won't be [[Li'l Bird Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Flying Cat]] or [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Cadaver BearCat]], though again, due to the backswing, the latter's high burst damage does allow him to practically sneak in one hit or two even at a range disadvantage. Zang Roo's backswing is just long enough for her to be stalled indefinitely when by herself, but combined with just about any support (including but not limited to other Zang Roos), she can plow through your attackers with ease. It is recommended to 'waste' her burrow by either knocking back or killing her before she burrows, timing right the [[Cat Cannon]] so that it hits her right before she burrows, force her to burrow early or use your Holy Blast. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 291 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zang Roo |enemy_endesc1 = After 50 years as a boxer, her body just
couldn't handle the doping anymore.
Still, chemicals were effective enough to
keep her body punching even after death. |image1 = Enemy icon 291.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ドーピングの限りを尽くし力を保持する
カンガルーボクサー。先日、56年の
ボクサー人生に終止符を打ったのは
グローブの判別がつかなくなったという噂。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A kangaroo boxer who maintains her strength by doping as
much as possible. Rumor has it that her gloves are now
indistinguishable from the ones that ended her 56th year
as a boxer the other day. |Enemy name (JP) = スカルボクサー (Sukarubokusā, Skull Boxer }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== Strength magnifications are wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zroco''' (ワニボン ''Wanibon'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Croco]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zroco |image = ZrocoBattle.jpg |money drop = 90¢ - 356¢ |first appearance ='''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Revenant Road|Sub-chapter 34 - Revenant Road]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Border Soil|Sub-chapter 43 - Border Soil]] }} ==Enemy== On top of dealing large Single Target damage and being able to weaken cats, Zroco has a remarkably short burrow duration and distance compared to other Zombies, leaving you with almost no breathing room before it appears right in the middle of your ranged stack. It has the same health as a [[Zoge (Zombie)|Zoge]], with slightly longer range. Obtain [[Wushu Cat (Rare Cat)|Shigong]] as he functions well as a counter against him; or stack meatshields, as he is single target. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 292 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zroco |enemy_endesc1 = A poor gator who died of hunger.
Too weak to swim across the River Styx,
it came back to this world as a half-baked
ghost. Sometimes mistaken for dumbells. |image1 = Enemy icon 292.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = お腹がすいて死んでしまったワニ。
三途の川を渡る途中で体力が尽き
中途半端な姿でこの世に復帰した。
最近はダンベルと間違えられることが多い。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A crocodile who died of hunger.

complete. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Lord Gravey''' (墓手太郎 ''Hakate Tarō'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Lord Gravey |image = Lordgravey.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[Silenced Meowing|Sub-chapter 34 - Silenced Meowing]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Border Soil|Sub-chapter 43 - Border Soil]] |money drop = 2,500¢ - 9,875¢ }} ==Enemy== As the boss of the [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon/Iriomote]] stage's Zombie Outbreak in [[Empire of Cats]] Chapter 1, Lord Gravey is somewhat like [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]], a powerful wall to keep units from pushing too far. He has very high health and even more when not slain by a [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]], as he revives with 100% HP instead of the usual 50%. He doesn't burrow, but he has above-average range for a Zombie, a constant attack rate and a 100% chance to inflict knockback, making him very dangerous against slow melee attackers such as [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titan Cat]] and [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Mer-Cat]]. Despite his knockback effect, his backswing buys enough time for more meatshields to enter his range between attacks and thus prevent him from moving, so he's more of a support enemy than a serious threat when on his own. And with 250 range and no burrows, one can easily stack [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cats]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cats]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cats]] on him while he stays in place. Also, since he's often the last strong enemy to go down, fast units like [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] or, later on, [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] can be slipped past him before he revives, destroying the enemy base a little earlier than if you were to wear down his full health pool. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 293 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Lord Gravey |enemy_endesc1 = Some squatter has made his home in
Zoge's grave! How rude! Whoever
this mysterious cadaver is, his will to
rock seems to be alive and well. |image1 = Enemy icon 293.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんこの父のお墓。に間違って埋葬された誰か。
生前はいつまでも少年の心を忘れない
気のいいおじさんだったが、セクハラで訴えられ
生きがいを失ってしまった地縛霊。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The grave of Doge's father, someone else was buried in it by accident. Was a nice old man with a youthful heart when he was alive, but lost the will to live after being accused of sexual harassment and became a bound spirit. |Enemy name (JP) = 墓手太郎 (Hakate Tarō) }} (60f attack frequency) |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 2 times |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] at 100% HP after being dead for 120f 4 seconds (1 time) |Element = Zombie |Occurrence = 22f 0.73s
(38f 1.27s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 293 e.png|Lord Gravey's spritesheet IdleLordGravey.gif|Lord Gravey's moving animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Hakate Tarō, is probably a reference to [[wikipedia:Taro Hakase|Taro Hakase]], or Hakase Tarō in Japanese. It's also a play on words, as Hakate is spelled with the kanji for "grave" (墓) and "hand" or "arm" (手). *His attack animation is ''[[wikipedia:Kanchō|kanchō]]'', a Japanese prank which involves using one's fingers to poke the target's behind. Most units don't face the right direction for it to work, but [[Kung Fu Cat (Special Cat)|Dancer Cat]] isn't so lucky. *His backswing animation is a reference to ''[[wikipedia:Terminator 2: Judgement Day|Terminator 2: Judgement Day]],'' where the T-800 terminator gives a thumbs up before sinking into molten metal. *When knocked back, his hands do the "[https://natalie.mu/comic/news/159046 Chudōn Pose]" (ちゅどーんポーズ), a gag pose found in works by [[wikipedia:Rumiko Takahashi|Rumiko Takahashi]] such as ''[[Ranma 1/2 Collaboration Event|Ranma 1/2]]''. *His Japanese description says that he is a ''jibakurei'', meaning a ghost who can't leave a specific location. In this case, it would presumably be his grave. *He is apparently [[Miss Haka (Zombie)|Miss Haka]]'s husband. Lord Gravey's Japanese description mentions that he was accused of sexual harassment, while Miss Haka's says her husband was taken in for that same reason. Also, their Japanese names share the surname Hakate (墓手). *If counting him as an [[Empire of Cats]] enemy, then he and Miss Haka are the only ones to have no variants. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/295.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zyclone''' (アンデッドサイクロン, ''Andeddo Saikuron'', '''Undead Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy introduced in [[Unholy Tempest (Insane)|The Rolling Dead]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zyclone |image = Zyclone.png |appearance = [[Unholy Tempest (Insane)|The Rolling Dead]]
[[Deadly Carnival III Event|Deadly Carnival III]]
[[The Dead Keep Rolling Stages|The Dead Keep Rolling]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Like most [[Cyclone]]s, Zyclone is slow, but has unmatched attack rate, health, and DPS. He revives infinitely, but can't burrow, and isn't a floating enemy either. ==Strategy== It is suggested to use crowd-controllers and ranged attackers, just like against the other Cyclones. Some of the most accessible options for crowd-control include [[Gardener Cat (Rare Cat)|Gardener Cat]], [[Welterweight Cat (Rare Cat)|Welterweight Cat]] and more importantly, [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Vaulter Cat]]. However, since this Cyclone can revive infinitely, it is advised to either bring [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]] (which the aforementioned anti-zombie units all possess) or to have [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rushers]] that can slip by before he revives, such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] or [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]]. Landing the finishing blow with a zombie killer is of utmost importance before it becomes a prominent threat, especially in [[Revenge of the Unholy (Merciless)|Revenge of the Unholy]] where 3 of them spawn. If you have [[Frontline Assault Iron Legion (Gacha Event)|Frontline Assault Iron Legion]] units, [[Sarukani (Uber Rare Cat)|Sarukani]], [[Bunny & Canard (Uber Rare Cat)|Disciple Psychoduck]] or other good [[:Category:Anti-Zombie Cats|anti-Zombie]] [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]], Zyclone becomes much easier to deal with, as they all have good anti-zombie abilities that can be put to great use. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 294 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zyclone |enemy_endesc1 = The spirits of those defeated by the
Battle Cats have gathered into a
vengeful storm. How can you defeat
a whirlwind that is already dead? |image1 = Enemy icon 294.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 戦いに敗れた者たちの怨念が集まって出来た大渦
近づくもの全ての命を掻き取ることで
自らの命を何度でも蘇らせるおぞましい敵。
ゾンビキラーの力で蘇生を防げるというが... |enemy_jpdesc1 = The vengeful souls of those who died in battle have coalesced into this great vortex.
By absorbing the life force of all who get near, it can revive itself many times.
Perhaps you could prevent it from reviving with the power of Zombie Killers... |Enemy name (JP) = アンデッドサイクロン (Andeddo Saikuron, Undead Cyclone) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Unholy Tempest (Insane)|The Rolling Dead]]: [[Unholy Tempest (Insane)]] (100%) *[[Deadly Carnival III Event|Deadly Carnival III]]: [[Tornado Carnival III (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[The Dead Keep Rolling Stages|The Dead Keep Rolling]]: **[[Wrath of the Unholy (Deadly)]] (100%) **[[Revenge of the Unholy (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 38|Floor 38]] (100%) **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 42|Floor 42]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Zyclone |Health = 1,222,222 HP |Attack Power = 44,444 damage
(266,664 DPS) |Attack Range = 120
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 0f
(5f attack frequency) |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 120f 4 seconds (unlimited) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== ZycloneSpritesheet.png|Zyclone's spritesheet IdleZyclone.gif|Zyclone's moving animation Medal 025.png|Zyclone on the ''Typhoon Z'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *He is the first [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy to have more than 1 revive. *He has the highest DPS of all Zombies and is tied with his nephew [[Li'l Zyclone (Zombie)|Li'l Zyclone]] for the fastest attack rate of all Zombies. *Despite being an amalgamation of souls, he is one of the only [[Cyclone]]s to have a gender, the other being Li'l Zyclone. **Additionally, they are the only Cyclones to have a moving eye. **Coincidentally, both are also Zombies. *Prior to [[Version 5.8 Update|Version 5.8]], Zyclone was limited to reviving 99 times. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/296.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Miss Haka''' (墓手花子 ''Hakate Hanako'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Miss Haka |image = Misshaka.jpg |first appearance = '''EoC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''SoL''': [[The Haunted 1LDK|Sub-Chapter 36 - The Haunted 1LDK]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Sappy Underpass|Sub-Chapter 36 - Sappy Underpass]] |money drop = 2,500¢ - 9,875¢ }} ==Enemy== Miss Haka looks similar to [[Lord Gravey (Zombie)|Lord Gravey]] and has similar stats, but is able to [[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrow]] infinitely until she's at the [[Cat Base]]. Of course, the balancing factor is that she gets knocked back up to 20 times before death reclaims her. Even if she isn't Z-killed, she revives only once. ==Strategy== A good strategy for Miss Haka is to use powerful cats like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] or [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] without meatshields and try to inflict as much damage as possible on the enemy base before Miss Haka gets to yours. Bahamut can in fact just stunlock and solo Haka if both are not supported by other units. If she gets there, she can easily be pushed away from your base using semi-cheap attackers like [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]]. You should be able to destroy the enemy base before she destroys yours. It is also helpful to have a few [[Welterweight Cat (Rare Cat)|Heavyweight Cats]] to defend the base. Because of her infinite burrows, it is extremely easy to finish her off with a well-timed Holy Blast which can delete large amounts of her HP in a single hit. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 303 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Miss Haka |enemy_endesc1 = Zoge's wife was supposed to be
buried here, but she's still alive at
158 and it seems like someone
else took over the open real estate. |image1 = Enemy icon 303.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんこの叔母のお墓。に間違って埋葬された誰か。
旦那がセクハラで連行されてしまってからは
悠々自適生活を送り158歳まで生きた超シニア。
埋葬後も死にきれず墓を背負い遊び回っている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The grave of Doge's aunt, someone else was buried in it by
accident. A super senior who lived carefreely until 158 after
her husband was taken away for sexual harassment.
Refusing to die even after being buried, she continues to
travel with the grave on her back. |Enemy name (JP) = 墓手花子 (Haka-te Hanako) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Empire of Cats]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== *Stage 2-48: [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon]] (30%) *Stage 3-48: [[Moon (Empire of Cats)|Moon]] (50%) ===[[Into the Future]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== *Stage 2-48: [[Moon (Into the Future)|Moon]] (200%) *Stage 3-48: [[Moon (Into the Future)|Moon]] (150%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 36-6: [[The Haunted 1LDK]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 18-6: [[Slave to Instinct]] (300%) *Stage 29-3: [[Second Unlife]] (300%) *Stage 36-5: [[Sappy Underpass]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Citadel#Zombie|Zombie Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 7#Zombie|Floor 7]] (100%) *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 27|Floor 27]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 27|Floor 27]] (300%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Necro Cradle: [[Cradle Shrine (Deadly)/Zombie|Cradle Shrine (Deadly)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Miss Haka |Health = 720,000 HP |Attack Power = 25,000 damage
(12,500 DPS) |Attack Range = 150
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 60f 2 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 20 times |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrows]] underground 500 when a Cat enters its range (unlimited)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 240f 4 seconds (1 time) |Occurrence = 22f 0.73s
(38f 1.27s backswing) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== HakaJP.png|HD Miss Haka (JP) 303 e.png|Miss Haka's spritesheet (JP) IdleMissHaka.gif|Miss Haka's moving animation (JP) ==Trivia== *''Haka'' (墓) is a Japanese word meaning "grave" or "tomb", so her name literally means Miss Grave. **In [[Nyanko Daisensou|BCJP]], this kanji appears on her grave instead of "RIP". *She is apparently [[Lord Gravey (Zombie)|Lord Gravey]]'s wife. Lord Gravey's Japanese description mentions that he was accused of sexual harassment, while Miss Haka's says her husband was taken in for that same reason. Also, their Japanese names share the surname Hakate (墓手). *If counting her as an [[Empire of Cats]] enemy, then she and Lord Gravey are the only ones to have no variants. *Prior to [[Version 5.8 Update|Version 5.8]], Miss Haka was limited to burrowing 9,999 times. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/305.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Big Sal''' (オオさん ''Ō-san'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Big Sal |image = Big Sal.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[The Infected King|Sub-chapter 35 - The Infected King]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Toy Boat Graveyard|Sub-chapter 40 - Toy Boat Graveyard]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Big Sal is like an upgraded [[Miss Haka (Zombie)|Miss Haka]] - he burrows infinitely until he reaches the [[Cat Base]], and has only one knockback to boot, while also reviving once with 50% health. With Base Destroyer and upwards of 120k attack in most of his appearances, it's effectively guaranteed that he'll destroy the base in one hit if allowed to complete his attack animation. However, he moves very slowly on the battlefield and has short range. ==Strategy== The traditional strategy to deal with him alone is to mass-produce units with high DPS like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]] and [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Whale Cat]] to inflict as much damage as possible between burrows, and use [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] only after he revives. Another strategy for a lone Sal is to use [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super Rare Cat)|Prof. Cat Jobs]], who can weaken his damage to 1%. In levels such as [[Deep Sea Dying]], however, Big Sal is spawned in hordes so you'll have to press your luck with the [[Surge Attack|Surge]] created by Prof. Cat Jobs' [[True Form]]. Units such as [[Piledriver Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Power Piledriver Cat]], [[Welterweight Cat (Rare Cat)|Heavyweight Cat]], [[Kubiluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Kubilan Pasalan]] and [[Mighty Bomburr (Uber Rare Cat)|NEK-0 Sky Fortress]] can keep Big Sal away from the base with their knockback abilities. NEK-0 Sky Fortress can even solo him, provided if it gets one hit in, meaning that you can't spawn other units or Sal will burrow and cause NEK-0 Sky Fortress to miss its attack. Stacking any other crowd-controller who can freeze Zombies is another way to deal with Big Sal. [[Gardener Cat (Rare Cat)|Lumbercat]] is one of the best for this job, and when paired with [[Healer (Special Cat)|Healer Cat CC]] in The Infected King, they can easily permafreeze him. Lumbercat might also get the last hit in due to his high attack rate, swiftly finishing him off. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 304 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Big Sal |enemy_endesc1 = Best leave this lazybones be, he'll
chomp anyone who disturbs his naptime.
Or worse: he'll tell you neverending stories
about his minor league baseball career. |image1 = Enemy icon 304.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 目を開けることすら嫌がる面倒くさがり屋の
オオサンショウウオ。プロ野球現役時代は
「4本足打法」でチームを優勝に導いた。
引退してもタッチを逃れて潜る癖は治らない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This salamander is a troublesome lazybones who doesn't
even want to open his eyes. During his pro baseball career,
he led his team to victory with his "4-legged batting style".
Even in retirement, he hasn't ditched his habit of escaping touch and diving underground. |Enemy name (JP) = オオさん (Ō-san) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Axoloty |Big Sal's [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant. It has a [[Barrier]] with 10k HP and can create lethal Lv.10 [[Wave Attack]]s from a distance, provided it has a backswing lasting over 4 minutes. This backswing is the only delay between attacks that it has, so each of its 5 knockbacks gives it another chance to strike. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 35-6: [[The Infected King]] (200%) *Stage 38-3: [[Deep Sea Dying]] (100%) *Stage 48-3: [[Glory of Glories]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-3: [[Loach Breach]] (200%) *Stage 16-3: [[Hangover Couch]] (200%) *Stage 24-4: [[Despotism at Home]] (200%) *Stage 29-1: [[Slumbering Cavern]] (250%) *Stage 34-1: [[Angkor S.W.A.T.]] (250%) *Stage 40-1: [[Toy Boat Graveyard]] (250%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Big Sal |Health = 300,000 HP |Attack Power = 60,000 damage
(11,920.53 DPS) |Attack Range = 120
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 151f 5 seconds |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 111f 3.7s
(40f 1.3s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]] (deals x4 damage to the [[Cat Base]])
[[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrows]] underground 250 when a Cat enters its range (unlimited)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 50% HP after being dead for 120f 4 seconds (1 time) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== BigSalspritesheet.png|Big Sal's spritesheet SadSal.gif|Big Sal's animations ==Trivia== *He is a [[wikipedia:Japanese giant salamander|Japanese giant salamander]], the third-largest species of salamander in the world. They have poor eyesight and extremely slow metabolisms, but their skin is covered in special sensory cells that can pick up on vibrations made by their prey. They're also endangered. *His Japanese name, Ō-san, is derived from ''Ōsanshōuo'', the Japanese word for the salamander he's based on. **The word ''ō'' (王) can mean "king" in Japanese, which is why Big Sal debuts in [[The Infected King]]. *He is a reference to [[wikipedia:Sadaharu Oh|Sadaharu Oh]]. Both are retired baseball players who are called Ō in Japanese, and the "4-legged batting style" in Big Sal's Japanese description is a reference to the "flamingo" leg kick or "[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/一本足打法 1-legged batting style]" (1本足打法) that Oh is famous for. *Prior to [[Version 5.8 Update|Version 5.8]], Big Sal was limited to burrowing 9,999 times. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/306.html ----

On the contrary, Pikotaro has very high attack damage which can kill most Cat Units in one hit. However, his backswing is also long so stalling him won't be an issue at all. ==Strategy== Since his attack rate is quite slow and [[PPAP|his stage]] does not have [[Assassin Bear (Black)|Assassin Bear]] to force lose the player when they takes too much time, using fast-hitting cats is an effective way to deal with him. Even spamming [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Tank Cat]] or [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] is enough to kill him. [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Cat]] can also be helpful to stop Pikotaro from getting near to your base. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Pikotaro Collaboration Event#Pikotaro|Pikotaro]]: [[PPAP]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Pikotaro |Health = 100 HP |Attack Power = 99,999 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mammothe''' (パオンモス, ''paon mosu'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mammothe |image = Mammothe.PNG |appearance = [[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]]
[[Megaton Blast (Insane)|Event All-Stars Grand Jubilee]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 5|Infernal Tower - Floor 5]]
[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]] |money drop = 1,600¢ - 6,320¢ }} ==Enemy== A bigger, hairier variant of [[Le'boin]] based off a Woolly Mammoth. It can create level 3 [[Wave Attack|Wave Attacks]] allowing it to reach much further. Like Le'boin, it has high health and damage output. Its waves combined with the [[Snowball (Event Enemy)|Snowballs]] that usually spawn with it makes for a dangerous mix, and can clear the player's defense pretty quickly. ==Strategy== There are a select few cats that can outrange its Wave Attacks like [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Cat]], but it'll take really long to kill Mammothe using only them. Mammothe's highest attack power in the whole event chapter is just around 3000 damage, so the player can just use [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] to decrease its health little by little. However, they should be aware of other threats such as the Snowballs and strong peons. Units that ignore or block Waves or have very high health such as [[Cat Machine (Uber Rare Cat)|Cat Machine]] or [[Akira (Uber Rare Cat)|Akira]] will make dealing with Mammothe much easier. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]]: **[[White Dove]] (10%) **[[Buddha of Romance]] (75%) **[[Icy Desire]] (100%) *[[:Category:Monthly Event All-Stars Stages|Event All-Stars Grand Jubilee]]: [[Megaton Blast (Insane)]] (400%) *[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Traitless|Top Floor]] (500%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 5|Floor 5]] (400%) *[[Empress' Excavation 1]]: [[Archaeology 101: Analysis]] (400%) ==Stats == {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Mammothe |Health = 120,000 HP |Attack Power = 3,200 damage
(582 DPS) |Attack Range = 400

'''[[Mammothe (Event Enemy)|<< Mammothe]] | [[Snowball (Event Enemy)|Snowball >>]]'''

---- {{Enemies}} [[Category:Enemy Units]] [[Category:Event Enemies]] [[Category:Traitless Enemies]] [[Category:Area Attack Enemies]]

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Snowball''' (雪玉) is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]] and [[Megaton Blast (Insane)|Megaton Blast]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Snowball |image = SnowballBattle.jpg |appearance = [[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]]
[[Megaton Blast (Insane)|Event All-Stars Grand Jubilee!]] |money drop = 1¢ - 4¢ }} ==Enemy== Snowballs that are thrown from the enemy base to the Cat Base at really high speed. They are the most annoying enemy in the event: they remain on the ground after they hit a Cat Unit and need an attack from the Cats to actually clear them out, which is a disadvantage for players that bring many Cats that attack one enemy at a time. Their damage increase as the player progress through the event. The third stage in the event has snowballs that spawn at ridiculous rates. They are very similar to [[Brollow (Floating)|Brollow]] as they attack quickly and hard, but they stay on the ground for good. ==Strategy== Good defense is necessary to endure the snowballs, particularly in the form of lots of meatshields. If one has cats that can perform [[Wave Attack]]s ([[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Macho Legs]], [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Slime Cat]] etc.) use them, as they can easily clear the path of many snowballs. Snowballs can be cleared when they are flying to the Cats by any kind of attack. However, their quick speed makes it so that most cats cannot hit them in time. [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Cat]] can be useful against them in small numbers, but the massive amounts of snowballs in later stages will easily break him down. [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Hurricat]] is a noteworthy exception, as it completely obliterates snowballs; it outranges them, attacks extremely quickly, its mediocre damage-per-hit isn't an issue, and has Area Attack to clear out large amounts of snowballs. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Cats in the Snow (Celebration Event)|Cats in the Snow]] **[[Langue de Chat]] (100%) **[[White Dove]] (100%) **[[Snow at Dawn]] (300%) **[[Buddha of Romance]] (800%) **[[Icy Desire]] (1,200%) *[[:Category:Monthly Event All-Stars Stages|Event All-Stars Grand Jubilee!]]: [[Megaton Blast (Insane)]] (2,400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Snowball |Health = 1 HP |Attack Power = 400 damage
(1.5 DPS) |Attack Range = 100
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 8,002f 266.73 seconds |Movement Speed = 75 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(8,001f 266.7s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Floating }} ==Gallery== 308 e.png|Snowball's spritesheet ==Trivia== *Snowball has the longest backswing/attack frequency out of any enemy. *Like [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Curling Cat]], Snowballs have a ludicrously long backswing, making it effectively only able to attack once. **Curling Cat is the first Cat Unit to have this gimmick. *This enemy's stats are similar to [[Capsule Cat (Special Cat)|Capsule Cat]]; it has potent attack power, impressive speed, yet if it is struck by almost literally anything it will die. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/310.html ----

"'''Coffin Dog'''") is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Wall Doge]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Coffin Zoge |image = Coffin Zoge.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Greeter at the Gates|Sub-chapter 36 - Greeter at the Gates]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Don't Rush Love|Sub-chapter 44 - Don't Rush Love]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ }} ==Enemy== Coffin Zoge can't burrow, but can revive an infinite amount of times, making it an annoying wall, especially in its first appearance paired with [[Dark Emperor Nyandam (Red)|Dark Emperor Nyandam]] and [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]]. ==Strategy== When facing a horde of Coffin Zoges, it's a good idea to use [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] (preferably with [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]]) to extinguish them quickly. If you kill them individually, it will be difficult to push past them because the previous Coffin Zoge usually revives before you can kill the next one. You could though, use Coffin Zoge to clog the enemy limit to prevent even more dangerous enemies from spawning, which is required in [[Veggie Friends]] and [[Forever Fishing]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 309 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Coffin Zoge |enemy_endesc1 = An ancient hero of the Doge Army.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zamelle''' (キャベロン ''Kyaberon'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Camelle]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zamelle |image = Zamelle.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[50 Degrees Hotter|Sub-chapter 36 - 50 Degrees Hotter]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Border Between Worlds|Sub-chapter 37 - Border Between Worlds]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== She attacks and moves slower than Camelle, being knocked back only when killed. While she does not burrow, she can revive an infinite amount of times. ==Strategy== Use a [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]] such as [[Mighty Kat-A-Pult (Uber Rare Cat)|CAT-6 Siege Engine]], [[Mr. (Special Cat)|Hyper Mr.]] or the [[Ototo Development Team#Holy Blast|Holy Blast]] to get the last hit on her as otherwise you'll have to tackle her again and again. [[Wushu Cat (Rare Cat)|Sifu Cat]] is especially effective for this as he can tank many hits from Zamelle while chipping her down, and due to having only one knockback, Zamelle will have some serious trouble trying to destroy them alone. Despite lacking the Zombie Killer ability, [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]], together with his [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed/Manic variant]], are great units as they can potentially attack Zamelle several times before death, dealing incredibly high damage in just a few cycles, usually enough for you to then finish her off with a Zombie Killer. High-leveled [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed M. Titan Cat]] are also suited for this role. If you are unable to permanently kill Zamelle, use fast units like [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]], [[Crazed Cow Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Giraffe Cat]], or [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] to bypass her before she could rise up again. Just beware that cheesing strategies are not always effective in some cases. [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Ubers]] that deal well with this enemy are [[:Category:Anti-Zombie Cats|anti-Zombie]] [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rushers]] and [[:Category:Tanker-class Cats|tankers]], such as [[Ganglion (Uber Rare Cat)|Ganglion]] (especially in [[True Form]]) and [[Seashore Kai (Uber Rare Cat)|Seashore Kai]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 310 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zamelle |enemy_endesc1 = Passed away after botched plastic surgery on
her unfashionable hump. Makes for a beautiful
corpse - the first undead cover girl!
Don't mention the unnatural fur tone... |image1 = Enemy icon 310.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 雑誌で紹介されていた美コブ整形の手術を受け
副作用でゾンビ化したラクダ。汗をかかない
愛されボディを持っているがラクダの
基本性能であることを彼はまだ知らない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This camel underwent a type of cosmetic hump surgery
introduced in a magazine, but became a Zombie due to side
effects. Has a gorgeous body that doesn't sweat, but she
still doesn't realize that it is the basic performance of the camel. |Enemy name (JP) = キャベロン (Kyaberon)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 36-4: [[50 Degrees Hotter]] (200%) *Stage 37-4: [[Lovechild Lane]] (200%) *Stage 43-3: [[Adamski Type]] (250%) *Stage 48-3: [[Glory of Glories]] (250%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-4: [[Seagull Reserve]] (300%) *Stage 11-1: [[Magma Bath]] (300%) *Stage 24-5: [[Unauthorized Breathing]] (300%) *Stage 29-2: [[Cozy Corpses]] (300%) *Stage 32-5: [[Internal Scream]] (300%) *Stage 37-5: [[Border Between Worlds]] (300%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Strange]]: [[Seas of Death (Merciless)]] (250%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Zamelle |Health = 120,000 HP |Attack Power = 5,937 damage
(1,979 DPS) |Attack Range = 550
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 90f 3 seconds |Occurrence = 11f 0.37s
(36f 1.2s backswing) |Movement Speed = 6 |Knockback = 1 time |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Base Destroyer|Base Destroyer]] (deals x4 damage to the [[Cat Base]])
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 240f 8 seconds (Unlimited) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== 310 e.png|Zamelle's spritesheet Zamelle.gif|Zamelle's attack animation IdleZamelle.gif|Zamelle's walking animation ==Trivia== *Her Japanese name, Kyaberon, is a portmanteau of ''Kyameron'', the Japanese pronunciation of ''Cameron'' (as in [[wikipedia:Cameron Diaz|Cameron Diaz]], who also used to be a cover girl); and ''beron'', an onomatopoeia for sticking one's tongue out. **When written in Japanese, ''Cameron Diaz'' can also be read as ''Camelon Diaz''. *Her description is a reference to how plastic surgery is infamously known for its lethality, especially when done by unscrupulous agencies, primarily due to blood loss, heart failure, or poisoning. *Despite what her Japanese description may say, camels can actually sweat, though they require a much higher temperature than humans; on the rare occasions that they do sweat, it evaporates directly from their skin rather than their coat, which helps to provide a cooling effect. *Zamelle, like [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]], has never been met debuffed or unbuffed. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/312.html ----

For the Cat Unit, see [[Killer Cat (Rare Cat)]].}} '''Killer Cat''' (殺意のネコ Satsui no Neko, '''Murderous Cat''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Killer Cat |image = Enemykillercat.png |appearance = [[Day of the Cat (Celebration Event)|Day of the Cat]]
[[Horde of Cats]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 1|Infernal Tower - Floor 1]] |money drop = 100¢ - 395¢ }} ==Enemy== Killer Cat is a strong and fast pushing [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black enemy]], somewhat similar to [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Black]] in behaviour, but with few knockbacks. Even though it has single target, it can become a serious threat when at higher magnifications and in extreme quantities. ==Strategy== Thanks to their Single Target attacks and short range, it is not too difficult to get many of them clumped up by using lots of meatshields; this often results in them being easy targets for [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]] and [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ring Girl Cat]], who are both able to easily neutralize the threat posed by groups of Killer Cats regardless of their durability. In general, any meatshields + midrangers approach works fine too, though that depends by the circumstances. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Day of the Cat (Celebration Event)|Day of the Cat]]: **[[Savage Instinct]] (50%) **[[Bloodstained Claws]] (1,200%) **[[The 222 Incident]] (8,000%) *[[Horde of Cats]]: **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.1]] (50%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.2]] (170%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.3]] (1,200%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.4]] (2,560%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.5]] (3,920%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.6]] (5,280%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.7]] (6,640%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.8]] (8,000%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.9]] (11,000%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.10]] (16,000%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 1|Floor 1]] (100%, 1,200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Killer Cat |Health = 3,600 HP |Attack Power = 240 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This base has no official name.}} The '''Corrupted Cat Base''' (黒ネコの城 ''Kuro Neko no Shiro'', '''Black Cat's Castle''') is an animated [[Enemy Bases|enemy base]] that appears in [[Day of the Cat (Celebration Event)|Day of the Cat]] and [[Horde of Cats]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Corrupted Cat Base |image = Rc312 e.png |appearance = [[Day of the Cat (Celebration Event)|Day of the Cat]]
[[Horde of Cats]] |money drop = N/A }} ==Enemy== Similar to other [[:Category:Animated Enemy Bases|Animated Bases]], this base is immune to most effects. Additionally, the Corrupted Cat Base can fire off a level 20 [[Wave Attack]] if a cat steps in its range, which combined with its typically high magnifications can wipe the field clear of any unit not immune to waves due to its extreme coverage. Notably, just like the [[Doge Base (Enemy Base)|Doge Base]], the Corrupted Cat Base itself is single target, and also features less range. This means fighting outside of its range remains an option in addition to wave blockers. ==Strategy== Trying to stall the [[Killer Cat (Enemy)|Killer Cats]] outside of the Corrupted Cat Base's range to avoid the Wave Attacks is the best idea. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Day of the Cat (Celebration Event)|Day of the Cat]]: **[[Savage Instinct]] (100%) **[[Bloodstained Claws]] (2,000%) **[[The 222 Incident]] (20,000%) *[[Horde of Cats]]: **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.1]] (100%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.2]] (700%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.3]] (2,000%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.4]] (5,600%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.5]] (9,200%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.6]] (12,800%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.7]] (16,400%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.8]] (20,000%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.9]] (30,000%) **[[Horde of Cats/Bloodthirsty Lv.1~10|Bloodthirsty Lv.10]] (40,000%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Corrupted Cat Base |Health = 3,000 HP |Attack Power = 100 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article's name is not official.}} The '''Doge Base''' (わんこの城 ''Wanko no Shiro'', '''Doggy's Castle''') is an animated [[Enemy Bases|enemy base]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Doge Base |image = rc315 e.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Multiversal Studios|Sub-chapter 37 - Multiversal Studios]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Stand By Motel|Sub-chapter 46 - Stand By Motel]] |money drop = N/A }} ==Enemy== Very similar to the [[Corrupted Cat Base (Enemy Base)|Corrupted Cat Base]], Doge Base is a Single Target [[:Category:Typeless Enemies|Typeless]] enemy with high range and fires off an extremely damaging level 20 [[Wave Attack]], having enough reach to cover the entire stage in all its appearances. Though it never is the main threat, the support enemies usually featured are more than compensation. It has to hit a cat unit for its wave to occur. As such, if your wave blocker is positioned correctly or you have multiple out at once, it will only destroy one of your frontline units before the wave itself gets neutralized. Otherwise, it will simply destroy everything on the field that isn't immune to waves. Depending on stage length, fighting outside of its range is another possible option. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 37-6: [[Multiversal Studios]] (50,000%) *Stage 40-6: [[Houses of the Holy]] (60,000%) *Stage 42-2: [[Surrealist Sins]] (150,000%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (70,000%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-1: [[Escolar Coast]] (55,000%) *Stage 19-6: [[Multitetrapod]] (100,000%) *Stage 23-1: [[Loser's Complaint]] (100,000%) *Stage 25-1: [[Treadmill Powered]] (60,000%) *Stage 27-2: [[Aria of the Princess]] (60,000%) *Stage 27-4: [[Glass Slippers]] (80,000%) *Stage 34-2: [[Tropical Garden]] (80,000%) *Stage 38-4: [[Multiplanar Studios]] (60,000%) *Stage 46-2: [[Stand By Motel]] (60,000%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[River City Stages#River City Challenge Course|River City Challenge Course]]: **[[Power On Through]] (4,000%) **[[Mistakes Don't Matter]] (20,000%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Doge Base |Health = 1,500 HP |Attack Power = 50 damage
(2 DPS) |Attack Range = 1,000
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 751f 25.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 0 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 2f 0.07s
(10f 0.33s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to create a Lv.20 [[Wave Attack]]
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Immune to Waves]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]], and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] |Element = Typeless }} ''*Note that these are the stats of the Doge Base at 100% strength magnification; it does not appear at magnifications under 4,000% in any stage, and is typically featured at 50,000% or above.'' ==Gallery== 315 e.png|The Doge Base's spritesheet ==Trivia== *It is tied with the [[Corrupted Cat Base (Enemy Base)|Corrupted Cat Base]] for the highest [[Wave Attack]] level in the game. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/317.html ----

For the Cat Unit, see [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)]].}} '''Inumusha''' (犬武者 武蔵 ''Inumusha Musashi'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy introduced in [[Multiversal Studios]], the final stage of [[Walk of Fame]]. He is the enemy version of [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)|Miyamoku Musashi]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Inumusha |image = Inumusha.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Multiversal Studios|Sub-chapter 37 - Multiversal Studios]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's All-Stars|Sub-chapter 38 - Hell's All-Stars]] |money drop = 4,000¢ - 15,800¢ }} ==Enemy== He deals high damage but has slow movement speed, with a somewhat slow attack rate. His range is 600 and he has Area Attack, making his attacks devastating to most units. Once he is killed by a non-[[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]], Inumusha will [[Special Abilities#Revive|revive]] one more time, but with only 1/4 of his original health. Unlike most other Zombies, Inumusha cannot [[Special Abilities#Burrow|burrow]] past your cats. His weaknesses are his somewhat slow attack rate and high KB count (every 16,000 damage taken), so it's easy to regain ground against him until something like the [[Zir Zeal (Zombie)|Zir Zeal]] in [[Multiversal Studios]] or the [[Dread Bore (Zombie)|Dread Bore]] in [[Heavenly Tower]] [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 43|Floor 43]] gets in the way. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 316 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Inumusha |enemy_endesc1 = A Doge warrior spirit possessed an up-and
coming young actor who took on his role in a
stage adaptation of his legend. Don't get too
close... his cursed castle might just react too. |image1 = Enemy icon 316.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 演劇「巌流島の戦い」に出演し、
いわく付きの小道具のせいでわんこに
憑り付かれた不幸な貧乏役者。
近づきすぎると呪われた城が動き出すという… |enemy_jpdesc1 = Appeared in the play "The Battle of Ganryu Island".
An unfortunate penniless actor who was possessed by the
Doge haunting the props. It is said that his cursed castle begins to move if you get too close to it...
* |Enemy name (JP) = 犬武者 武蔵 (Inumusha Musashi)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 37-6: [[Multiversal Studios]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 38-4: [[Multiplanar Studios]] *Stage 38-6: [[Hell's All-Stars]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 43|Floor 43]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Inumusha |Health = 800,000 HP |Attack Power = 40,000 damage

([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 199f 6.63 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 50 times |Occurrence = 42f 1.4s
(93f 3.1s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 25% health after being dead for 120f 4 seconds (1 time) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== 316 e.png|Inumusha's spritesheet Inumusha.gif|Inumusha's attack animation IdleInumusha.gif|Inumusha's moving animation DB8F8A08-E5C8-4E9B-8AC1-9AAEBED20483.png|Inumusha on the ''Ronin's Redemption'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Inumusha literally means "Dog Warrior" in Japanese. *The title of the play in his Japanese description, "The Battle of Ganryu Island", refers to a legendary battle taking place at Ganryu Island, where the famed swordsman Miyamoto Musashi fought and dueled his rival, Sasaki Koujiirou, and won with a wooden sword crafted from an oar. More details can be found within the [[wikipedia:Miyamoto_Musashi#Duel_with_Sasaki_Kojir.C5.8D|Wikipedia article]]. *The "cursed castle" in his description refers to the [[Doge Base (Enemy Base)|Doge Base]] in [[Multiversal Studios]]. *He is the only [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] [[:Category:Enemy Cats|Enemy Cat]]. *He has the highest knockback count of all Zombies. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/318.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Daboo of the Dead''' (亡者デブウ ''Mōja Debuu'', '''Dead Debuu''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy introduced in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Parade of the Dead (Deadly)|Dead on Debut]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Daboo of the Dead |image = Daboo of the Dead.png |appearance = [[Parade of the Dead (Deadly)|Dead on Debut]]
[[Dead by Encore Stages|Dead by Encore]]
[[The Queen & The Dead]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] |money drop = 4,444¢ - 17,553¢ }} ==Enemy== Daboo of the Dead is truly a monstrous threat, with a whopping '''3 million HP''', '''30,000 damage''' along with a massive [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] range of 800 and a 10-second slow effect, on top of that, he even has immunities to almost every debuff you can think of. Unlike most other [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]], he cannot burrow past your cats, yet he can still revive with 10% HP an unlimited number of times. ==Strategy== Since he has almost 100% uptime on his slow, any unit he can knock back in one hit will likely be unable to ever reach Daboo, instead allowing him to chain attacks on them until they die. For this reason and due to how few units can outrange him, it is recommended to use slow immune units, fast units and tanky units above all; the more of these features, the better. Meatshields that work great include [[Wushu Cat (Rare Cat)|Wushu Cat]], boosted [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Ramen Cat]], talented [[Sumo Cat (Special Cat)|Riceball Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]]. Shigong Cat (the true form of Wushu Cat) is a direct counter to Daboo, since he gains immunity to slow. A stack of Shigongs can absolutely take out Daboo, provided you have other units to deal with the non-Zombie peons. Titan Cat variants, especially [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Jamiera]], work well against him too, being able to block him and damage him for a relatively long time. The problem usually comes in doing that while also dealing with whatever supports him, meaning that units should be picked with his supporters in mind. Do not worry too much about his revive ability. It takes a while for him to revive with relatively little health, plus Daboo is usually the last "major threat" to die in the first place as you must get through all his support before you could deal with him. If he isn't Zombie-Killed, a level 20+ [[Ototo Development Team#Holy Blast|Holy Blast]] can be used to instantly finish him off due to only reviving with 10% max health, the exact percentage Holy Blast does to him. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 317 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Daboo of the Dead |enemy_endesc1 = "The best zombie is an educated zombie," is
what Poppa always said. It's just back issues
of trashy horror comics inside that ominous
cover, though. Immune to all negative effects. |image1 = Enemy icon 317.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 「勉強しないと立派なゾンビになれないぞ」と
いつも親に説教されているゾンビ。シブい
ブックカバーを付けて読んでいるのはマンガ。
あらゆる妨害効果を無効化する能力を持つ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = "You won't be a good Zombie if you don't study."
A Zombie who is always lectured by his parents.
He's reading a manga with a fancy book cover.
Immune to all negative effects. |Enemy name (JP) = 亡者デブウ (Mōja Debuu, Dead Debuu) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Heavenly Herald Papuu |Daboo of the Dead's [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant. She has less health, attack power and range, but has only one knockback, a faster attack rate, a further Omni Strike and triple damage when her HP is lowered. Instead of slowing cats, she deals 40% Toxic damage, killing units without toxic immunity in up to three hits. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. *Dead on Debut: [[Parade of the Dead (Deadly)]] *[[Dead by Encore Stages|Dead by Encore]]: **[[Prisoner's Progress (Merciless)]] **[[March to Death (Merciless)]] *[[The Queen & The Dead]]: [[Parade of the Dead (Deadly) (Queen & Dead)|Parade of the Dead (Deadly)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 46|Floor 46]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Daboo of the Dead |Health = 3,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 30,000 damage
(2,307.69 DPS) |Attack Range = 300
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 390f 13 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 91f 3.03s
(45f 1.5s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 300f 10 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -700~800)
Revives with 10% HP after being dead for 600f 20 seconds (unlimited)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Immune to Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]] |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== DabooSpritesheet.png|Daboo of the Dead's spritesheet IdleFatassDabooOfTheDead.gif|Daboo of the Dead's moving animation Medal 031.png|Daboo of the Dead on the ''The Big Z'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] daboo attack.gif|Daboo of the Dead's attack animation ==Trivia== *His name is derived from the Japanese word ''debu'', meaning "fat" or "chubby". This is more obvious with his Japanese name, that being Debuu. *Amongst the first seven [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Daboo of the Dead represents the sin of gluttony. *He bears more than a passing resemblance to [[w:c:the-nightmare-before-christmas:Oogie Boogie|Oogie Boogie]], the main antagonist of the Tim Burton movie ''The Nightmare Before Christmas''. *His minimum money drop bring 4,444 is likely a reference to how, in Japanese, one of the two pronunciations for the number 4 sounds exactly like the Japanese word for death. Moreover, his English name has four words while his Japanese name has four syllables (亡者デブウ, Mō-ja De-buu). *Prior to the [[Version 5.10 Update]], he had Long Distance with an effective range of 0~800. *He is the first non-collab enemy to have Omni Strike and the first non-stationary enemy besides [[Walpurgisnacht (Witch)|Walpurgisnacht]] to have any immunities. *He has the highest health of all Advent Bosses and is tied with [[Johnnyleon (Red/Alien/Zombie)|Johnnyleon]] for the highest health of all Zombies. *He has most of his stats in a multiple of 3, sporting 3 million health, 30,000 attack damage, 300 range, 3 knockbacks, slowing cats for 300f and reviving with 300,000 health after 600f. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/319.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dolphina''' (イルカ娘 ''Iruka Musume'', "'''Dolphin Daughter'''" or "'''Dolphin Girl'''") is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dolphina |image = Dolphina.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[No Return Flights|Sub-chapter 38 - No Return Flights]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Curry Comet|Sub-chapter 26 - Curry Comet]] |money drop = 750¢ - 2,953¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy has powerful [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] attacks that can reach to 350~650 but has merely 150 standing range, which is well within her blind spot. Dolphina also possesses 450k health and extremely fast movement speed, and is nearly always seen in groups. This may all sound insane for an enemy of this caliber, but fortunately she has 30 knockbacks. ==Strategy== Dolphina's many knockbacks can dramatically increase her survivability, so units with high damage per hit are preferred in most stages. Use strong attackers with short enough range to enter her blind spot, like [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]] or [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Sexy Legs Cat]]. The best strategy against Dolphina is to use "ranged meatshields" or few or no meatshields and attackers with short range or short attack animations. [[Saber (Uber Rare Cat)|Saber]] is ideal against Dolphina, as long as you don't spawn any meatshields as long as she is outside of Dolphina's effective range. Rushers such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]], [[Li'l Valkyrie (Uber Rare Cat)|Li'l Valkyrie]], [[Maglev Cat]] are best used without meatshields. You can also use tanky units like [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]], [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]] and [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed M. Titan Cat]] to get into Dolphina's blind spot as they will take full advantage of her 30 knockbacks. It is most preferable to use slower meatshields, but only if they can tank at least two hits. This stops Dolphina's attack from being triggered too quickly, similarly to a strategy used against [[Lord Gravey (Zombie)|Lord Gravey]] and [[Miss Haka (Zombie)|Miss Haka]], and this gives your cats more time to deal damage to knock her back. If she has support enemies such as the [[Master A.]] and [[Rain D.|Rain Ds]] in [[No Return Flights]], it is best to either use mid-range cats with high health or spammable mid-range units so they can stack enough to prevent the Dolphinas from ever attacking, which can quickly cripple a stack of cats. [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] and [[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge Attackers]] can also be very effective. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 318 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Dolphina |enemy_endesc1 = Often seen riding on the last train home after
a night of partying. Now she reflects upon
her careless youth, and vows to improve.
Only overslept for work 3 times last week. |image1 = Enemy icon 318.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 汽車にのって東京から帰ってきたイルカの
娘さん。ふざけすぎた過去を反省し、
今はまじめに働いている。
先週は3回しか遅刻しなかった。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The daughter of a dolphin who came back from Tokyo on a train.
Reflecting on her careless youth, she now works diligently.
Was only late to work 3 times last week. |Enemy name (JP) = イルカ娘 (Iruka Musume, "Dolphin Daughter" or "Dolphin Girl") }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Kid Tappa |The [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] version of Dolphina. Deals very low damage and has short reach, but has high health and a Barrier with a breaking point of 15,000. Basically the enemy version of [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]], as he's deployed as a tank for more powerful enemies. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 32: [[United Kingdom (Aku Realm)|United Kingdom/Nagano]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 38-6: [[No Return Flights]] (100%) *Stage 39-5: [[The Sauna Crew]] (100%) *Stage 40-2: [[Romantic Highway]] (100%) *Stage 43-4: [[Chupacabra Love]] (100%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-1: [[Escolar Coast]] (200%) *Stage 16-6: [[Lamb's Boudoir]] (100%) *Stage 20-3: [[Demon COO]] (100%) *Stage 23-6: [[Cursing the Curser]] (100%) *Stage 26-1: [[Curry Comet]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 35|Floor 35]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 35|Floor 35]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Dolphina |Health = 450,000 HP |Attack Power = 7,500 damage
(2,184 DPS) |Attack Range = 150
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 103f 3.43 seconds |Movement Speed = 36 |Knockback = 30 times |Occurrence = 44f 1.47s
(30f 1s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 350~650) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 318 e.png|Dolphina's spritesheet Dolphina.gif|Dolphina's attack animation IdleDolphina.gif|Dolphina's moving animation ==Trivia== *Her Japanese name, Iruka Musume (Dolphin Girl), is a reference to the anime and manga ''[[wikipedia:Squid Girl|Squid Girl]]'', whose Japanese name is ''Ika Musume''. *Dolphina and the first stage she appears in, No Return Flights, both reference songs by folk singer [[wikipedia:ja:イルカ (歌手)|Iruka]], whose stage name literally means "dolphin": **Dolphina's description pulls from the 1975 song "[https://youtu.be/FwXluXjBaqw Nagori Yuki]", as it mentions riding a train (from Tokyo no less, in her Japanese description), a careless youth, and wasting time without realizing it. **No Return Flights' Japanese name, Mō Riku ni wa Kaerenai ("Can't Return to Land Anymore") is an obvious play on the title of the 1985 song "[https://youtu.be/x-JJ5NJXvt4 Mō Umi ni wa Kaerenai]" ("Can't Return to Sea Anymore"). ***Both songs are featured in [https://youtu.be/DBfDNiCASBw this video]. *Dolphina (and possibly the whole of [[Cutpurse Coast]]) were planned for [[Version 5.10 Update|update 5.10]], but for some reason, her enemy ID was empty. *Along with [[Johnnyleon (Red/Alien/Zombie)|Johnnyleon]], she has the lowest standing range of all [[:Category:Long Distance Enemies|Long Distance Enemies]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/320.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{JPExclusive}} '''Wedding Kerihime''' (ウェディングケリ姫 Wedingu keri hime) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Princess Punt Sweets Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Wedding Kerihime |image = WeddingKerihime.png |appearance = [[Princess Punt Sweets Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 3,000円 - 11,850円 }} ==Enemy== Wedding Kerihime has rather fast movement speed of 35 and is able to cover an extremely wide area due to having 1,300 range! She also has a guaranteed chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] cat units allowing her to push slowly towards the players base. However due to her health only being at 35,000 she doesn't serve that much as a main threat but more of a backliner support for other enemies to advance. ==Strategy== Fast Cats such as [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]], [[Capsule Cat (Special Cat)|Capsule Cat]], [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Sanada Yukimura]], Awakened Bahamut, [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]]'s variants, etc. are all effective against the Princess. ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Wedding Kerihime |Health = 35,000 HP |Attack Power = 5,200 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Golden R.Ost''' (純金倶楽部 ''Junkin Kurabu'', lit. "'''Solid Gold Club'''") is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[R.Ost]] that appears in [[Golden Week Event|Golden Week]] and [[Silver Week (Celebration Event)|Silver Week]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Golden R.Ost |image = Golden R.Ost.png |appearance = [[Golden Week Event#The Midas Touch|The Midas Touch]]
[[Silver Week (Celebration Event)|Silver Week]] |money drop = 540¢ - 2,133¢ }} ==Enemy== The real deal in the event. It shares many similarities with the common [[R.Ost]]: fast attack rate, high DPS, decent speed... However, it has almost no health and lacks the ability to do [[Critical Hit]]s. Use [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]] to take it down easier. Despite being the strongest golden enemy in the event, it has a lower money drop than both [[Goldoge (Event Enemy)|Goldoge]] and [[Sir Hippoe (Event Enemy)|Sir Hippoe]]. ==Strategy== Golden R.Ost can be treated as a [[Metal Doge (Metal)|Metal Doge]] with longer range. Use fast-attacking and/or ranged cats such as [[Crazed Cow Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Cow Cat]], [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] or [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Cat]] to take it out quickly. If you need to use [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Ubers]], then [[Hayabusa (Uber Rare Cat)|Hayabusa]], [[Marauder Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Marauder Cat]], [[Graveflower Verbena (Uber Rare Cat)|Graveflower Verbena]] or [[Sakura Sonic (Uber Rare Cat)|Sakura Sonic]] are some of your best choices. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Golden Week Event#The Midas Touch|The Midas Touch]]: **[[Golden Age's Dawn]] (100%) **[[Never Not Shovelin']] (100%) **[[Dreams Come False]] (150%) *[[Silver Week (Celebration Event)|Silver Week]]: [[A Distant Road]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Golden R.Ost |Health = 20 HP |Attack Power = 2,400 damage
