https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Cala Maria''' (イカ天 ''Ika Ten'') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Calamary (Alien/Floating)|Calamary]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Cala Maria |image = Calamaria.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Steamed to Death|Sub-chapter 39 - Steamed to Death]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Pulled Punch Bout|Sub-chapter 37 - Pulled Punch Bout]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== Cala Maria is a powerful enemy that has a very different attack than her [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant. To attack, she slams the ground three times in succession, dealing very high damage, enough to kill or severely damage most units. However, to balance this, she has Single Target. She moves at the same speed as [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Cat]] and has two knockbacks before death. Not many good attackers outrange her, which, despite her single target, still means that frail units will easily be in her reach, ready to be hit as soon as there is an opening. Unlike Calamary, she is not considered a Floating enemy. ==Strategy== Her weakness is that her three consecutive attacks are all Single Target, which means she can only hit three [[Cat Units]] per attack animation (the three frontmost units) in a stack of many. This allows your damage dealers to survive easily if protected by a horde of meatshields. The important thing is maintaining that horde, for a gap in the meatshield line might easily result in a precious backliner losing most, if not all of its health. Cala Maria makes up for Single Target by delivering very high damage, causing cats with [[Special Abilities#Resistant|Resistance]] against [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemies, such as [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Ramen Cat]] and [[Urashima Taro (Uber Rare Cat)|Gamereon]], to rarely be worth as much as a group of cheaper, one-off meatshields. When paired with Area Attack foes or even other Single Target attackers ([[Berserkory (Red)|Berserkory]] in [[Steamed to Death]] and [[Capy (Red)|Capy]] in [[Drunken Backrub]]), however, tanking the damage might still be the better option, so don't rule out Ramen if you see her! ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 340 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Cala Maria |enemy_endesc1 = A heavenly taste of the sea, sent
as a religious vision by the Cat God to
those pure of heart. Culinary paradise
awaits those who pass this test of faith. |image1 = Enemy icon 340.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 夢半ばでてんぷらにされた、
翼のイカれたエンジェル。
硬くなった身を生かしたオリジナル肩たたきは
受けた者をもれなく昇天させる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A squid-winged angel that was made tempura in the middle of a dream.
Making full use of her hardened body, her shoulder-strike
attack causes those hit by it to ascend to Heaven. |Enemy name (JP) = イカ天 (Ika Ten, Squid Sky) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 36: [[Bermuda (Aku Realm)|Bermuda]] wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Croakley''' (ケロ助, '''''Kerosuke''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Croakley |image = Croakley.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Broadband Omens|Sub-chapter 41 - Broadband Omens]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Pithouse Academy|Sub-chapter 45 - Pithouse Academy]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== Croakley is durable, has slow movement speed and a Long Distance attack with expansive reach. His damage is not that strong, but it is guaranteed to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] all cats for a minute, which may as well be certain death for units that aren't immune. To compensate for an attack of this caliber, Croakley has a massive blindspot and his standing range is well within it. ==Strategy== Treat this enemy like [[Queen B (Alien/Floating)|Queen B]], but with lower damage and a longer slow. If Croakley is alone, even the weakest of cats can defeat him. If he's paired with a more powerful enemy (like [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] or [[Berserkory (Red)|Berserkory]] in [[Broadband Omens|his debut stage]]), then [[Wave Attack]]s or [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long-Distance attacks]] can be used to pick him off from a safe distance. Due to his blindspot, most units can simply enter it without much timing. DO NOT give units the Resist Slow [[Talents|Talent]] solely to counter him, as Croakley's slow has 100% uptime even against [[:Category:Resist Slow Cats|slow-resistant cats]]. [[:Category:Cats with Slow Immunity|Slow Immunity]], on the other hand, is a very useful asset against him. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 355 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Croakley |enemy_endesc1 = eSports pro famous for rage-quitting during
tournaments by using his tongue to
hit the reset button. Guess that's one way to
maintain a perfect win-loss ratio... |image1 = Enemy icon 355.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = なめプレイで有名なプロ格闘ゲーマーのカエル。
負けそうになると舌を伸ばしてリセットを押す。
ブーイングの嵐の中でもケロッとしている
ド根性の持ち主だがお酒に関しては下戸。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This frog is a pro fighting gamer famous for licking "play".
When he's about to lose, he stretches his tongue out to hit "reset".
Even in the face of a booing crowd, he's got guts, but
when it comes to drinking alcohol, he can't do it. |Enemy name (JP) = ケロ助 (Kerosuke) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Ribbo |A [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of Croakley. Has lower range, extremely low health, a [[Barrier]] with a breaking point of 65,000, and [[Warp]]s back cats instead of slowing them down. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 41-6: [[Broadband Omens]] (100%) *Stage 42-4: [[Death by Dada]] (100%) *Stage 45-2: [[Leaky Tunnel]] (100%) *Stage 48-5: [[False Resurrection]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 8-4: [[Hunter's Hills]] (100%) *Stage 10-4: [[Snitches Get Stitches]] (150%) *Stage 14-3: [[Rude on the Beach]] (150%) *Stage 21-4: [[Stars in the Sewers]] (150%) *Stage 25-5: [[Sauna Handstands]] (100%) *Stage 31-2: [[The Belated Priest]] (150%) *Stage 36-2: [[Reincarnation Ring]] (150%) *Stage 45-1: [[Pithouse Academy]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Report 4]]: [[Aku Studies 401: Methods]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Croakley |Health = 360,000 HP |Attack Power = 3,789 damage
(762.89 DPS) |Attack Range = 900
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 149f 4.97 seconds |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 20f 0.67s
(21f 0.7s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 1,800f 60 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 1,100~1,400) |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 355 e.png|Croakley's spritesheet frogge.gif|Croakley's animations ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Kerosuke, contains ''kero'', the Japanese onomatopeia for a frog's ribbit. *His Japanese description calls him a ''geko'' (下戸), meaning someone who can't or doesn't like to drink alcohol. The joke is that it sounds like げこっ ''geko'', meaning croak. **This same joke would later be used as [[Ribbo (Alien)|Ribbo]]'s Japanese namesake, Gekokku. *When he moves, he doesn't actually stay still, instead his sprite moves backwards to make it seem like he is still. This can be seen well if he is slowed. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/357.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Corporal Weyland''' (キャプテン・モグー ''Kyaputen Mogū'', '''Captain Moguu''') is a [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] enemy that appears in [[Cats of the Cosmos]], [[The Aku Realms]], and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Corporal Weyland |image = Corporalweyland.png |first appearance = '''CotC''': [[Deneb (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 1 - Deneb]]
'''SoL''': [[Eat the Weak|Sub-chapter 44 - Eat the Weak]] |money drop = 750¢ - 2,962¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Warning of the Setting Sun|Sub-chapter 47 - Warning of the Setting Sun]] }} ==Enemy== The Starred Alien version of [[Mr. Mole]]. He has a long-ranged Area Attack with a 30% chance to warp Cats backwards by 250 range and an extremely weak barrier. Thankfully, he's much weaker than his [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] counterpart due to his lower stats and attack rate, plus having a trait making him vulnerable to any [[:Category:Anti-Alien Cats|anti-Alien Cats]]. ==Strategy== If Corporal Weyland has no backup, it's a simple task to defeat him. If he has back up, then he can be slightly problematic, as he can teleport groups of cats from a distance. The only upside to this is that he has low attack power compared to other Starred Alien enemies. Corporal Weyland's greatest asset is that he can constantly warp your longer ranged slow attacking units, making them nearly unusable. But because of his rather low HP for a backliner, he is highly susceptible to being sniped by [[Wave Attack|waves]], and is directly countered by [[Little Leaguer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Major Leaguer Cat]]. [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|Rushers]] (particularly [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahumut Cat]] and [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Express Cat]]) also work well against him, as they have shorter range, and can therefore creep into his blind spot, destroying him before he could hit them. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 365 |enemy category = Alien |Enemy name = Corporal Weyland |enemy_endesc1 = A proud soldier of the great Mole Army,
safeguarding peace and love throughout
the cosmos. His antimatter uppercut
catapults Cats to another dimension. |image1 = Enemy icon 365.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 宇宙の平和を守るため活動しているモグラ。
潜入捜査続きで自分を見失いかけている。

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Winged Pigge''' (天使ブッタ ''Tenshi Butta'') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[St. Pigge the 2nd (Red)|St. Pigge the 2nd]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Winged Pigge |image = Wingedpigge.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Heaven's Oasis|Sub-chapter 44 - Heaven's Oasis]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hall of Feasting|Sub-chapter 42 - Hall of Feasting]] |money drop = 1,200¢ - 4,740¢ }} ==Enemy== Besides her decently high health and DPS, the scariest thing about Winged Pigge is that she has a very fast attack rate and 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] cats to 10% for 5 seconds, gravely crippling whatever attackers you're using against her. She has only 10 more range than St. Pigge but her omni strike reaches 340 range, letting her weaken groups of mid-ranged cats while also tanking hits for other enemies. ==Strategy== Do not let Winged Pigge weaken your attackers as that will make her extremely difficult to get rid of. Because she has long reach, tanky meatshields such as [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]] and/or [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Ramen Cat]] are useful against her. *[[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Cyborg Cat]] outranges her, deals heavy damage when stacked, and being weaken immune, they will not be crippled as much if Winged Pigge does hit. Beware her high cost though as if you don't stall beforehand, you could end up without money to continue spamming her, and it could cost you a victory. *Many Uber Rares from the [[Ancient Heroes Ultra Souls (Gacha Event)|Ultra Souls]] set are excellent counters to this enemy: [[Urashima Taro (Uber Rare Cat)|King Gamereon]] for his resistance to Angels and immunity to Weaken, being able to nearly solo her at level 40; [[Momotaro (Uber Rare Cat)|The Peach Devils]] for being able to freeze her, and if [[Talents|Talented]], weaken her too; [[Kasa Jizo (Uber Rare Cat)|Jizo's Moving/Mega-Castle]] for its huge damage, being able to kill her in a few hits although if you are using his True Form, be mindful of other attackers that may do enough damage to cause Winged Pigge to be knocked back by the first two multi-hit attacks; and [[Kintaro (Uber Rare Cat)|Kinrangers Robo/GigaForce]] for being able to slow her, and if True Formed, Curse her to disable the weaken ability. *[[Kalisa (Uber Rare Cat)|Kalisa]] will be weakened and knocked back before she can hit Winged Pigge, so her first strike is the most valuable against her. Otherwise, it is recommended to use [[Lesser Demon Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Lesser Demon Cat]], as he deals extreme damage and is immune to weaken; and can effectively do what Kalisa should do. However, despite being outranged by just 10, Winged Pigge typically inflicts too much damage for Lesser Demon Cat to get a clean hit off unless support and [[Talents]] are put into the equation. *[[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Curling Cat]] is a useful tank against Winged Pigge; and should be unlocked at this point in the game. If not already, hypermax this cat without regret. *[[Kasli the Bane (Uber Rare Cat)|Kasli the Bane]] is excellent against Winged Pigge as she outranges Winged Pigge's Omni Strike by 60 and can consistently curse Winged Pigge, making her primary gimmick useless. *[[Mighty Rekon Korps (Uber Rare Cat)|Mighty Rekon Korps]] works well against Winged Pigge, as he can be expected to be knocked back, then start an attack that will hit just after the weaken effect runs out, thus making this unit basically immune to Winged Pigge's weaken ability. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 379 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Winged Pigge |enemy_endesc1 = A lovely Pigge with a cute heart-shaped nose.
She doesn't mean any harm with her merry
bouncing, but it'll crush your will to fight.
Just wants to go home to her heavenly family. |image1 = Enemy icon 379.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ハート型のお鼻がキュートなメスブタ。
可愛らしくぴょんぴょん飛び跳ねる姿は、
見た者の戦意を喪失させる。これは天上界への
帰省本能が働いているとの学説が有力らしい。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A female pig with a cute heart-shaped nose.
Her cutesy bouncing causes those who see it to lose their will to fight.
It seems likely that the theory of natural instinct to return to the
heavenly world is working and influential. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使ブッタ (Tenshi Butta) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 44-6: [[Heaven's Oasis]] (100%) *Stage 45-1: [[Shiver Junction]] (100%) *Stage 48-4: [[A Moment of Serenity]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 3-1: [[Kosamin Ruins]] (150%) *Stage 8-2: [[Lady in the Clink]] (100%) *Stage 12-4: [[Woods of Resentment]] (150%) *Stage 21-3: [[Gas-Powered Birds]] (150%) *Stage 31-3: [[Choir Battle]] (150%) *Stage 37-4: [[Pulled Punch Bout]] (150%) *Stage 42-5: [[Hall of Feasting]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Strange]]: [[Holy Wrath (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Divine Archangel Strikes]]: [[Divine Archangel Strikes/Frontier Wilderness (Merciless)|Frontier Wilderness (Merciless)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Winged Pigge |Health = 800,000 HP |Attack Power = 6,000 damage
(8,182 DPS) |Attack Range = 170
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 22f 0.73 seconds |Movement Speed = 12 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 14f 0.47s
(8f 0.27s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|Weaken]] Cat Units to 10% for 150f 5 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -340~340) |Element = Angel }} ==Gallery== 379 e.png|Winged Pigge's spritesheet IdleCancerIncarnate.gif|Winged Pigge's moving animation ==Trivia== *Her name and appearance reference the phrase "when pigs fly", although her wings could never realistically allow her to take flight. *Her Japanese name, Tenshi Butta, may be a pun combining ''buta'' (pig) and ''budda'' (Buddha); ''tenshi'' simply means "angel". *She originally had a minimum range of 0 rather than -340. This was changed at an unknown date. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/381.html ----

For the Cat Unit, see [[Masked Yulala (Special Cat)]].}} '''Mystic Mask Yulala''' (謎仮面のウララー ''Nazo Kamen no Urarā'', '''Mysterious Mask Urara''') is [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears on the [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 40|40th]] and [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 49|49th]] floors of the [[Heavenly Tower]]. Defeating him on Floor 40 will unlock his [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] counterpart [[Masked Yulala (Special Cat)|Masked Yulala]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mystic Mask Yulala |image = Yasked Mulala.PNG |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ |first appearance = [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 40|Heavenly Tower - Floor 40]] |latest appearance = [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 49|Heavenly Tower - Floor 49]] }} ==Enemy== Mystic Mask Yulala moves very fast and stands at 200 range but can hit cats up to 400 range. Combined with his guaranteed chance to warp cats far back, low time between attacks, and considerably high DPS, he can be a truly monstrous pushing force against those unprepared to deal with him. [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Glass Macho Cat]], [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Macho]], [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]], and other [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|Anti-Traitless Cats]] help a lot at stalling and defeating him. ==Strategy== :''See [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 40]] and [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 49]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 380 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Mystic Mask Yulala |enemy_endesc1 = Sacred guardian of the Heavenly Tower. Only
those who pass his test are deemed worthy.
With fewer visitors lately, he’s taken on a job
teaching modern dance to kindergarteners. |image1 = Enemy icon 380.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = にゃんこ塔を守る一族の長。
一族のオキテに従い、塔を訪れた者に試練を課す
事になっているが、近年は客足が遠のきつつあり
普段は学校の先生として生計を立てている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Head of the clan who guards the Heavenly Tower.
According to the law of the clan, he's supposed to challenge
anyone who visits the Tower, but the number of customers
has declined in recent years. Usually, he makes a living as a schoolteacher. |Enemy name (JP) = 謎仮面のウララー (Nazo Kamen no Urarā, Mysterious Mask Urara) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Spiritual Yulala |A [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant of Mystic Mask Yulala that appears in [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40|Floor 40]] of the [[Infernal Tower]]. Has significantly improved health and damage, can Curse and Warp every unit that survives the attack and has only 9 knockbacks instead of 10. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 40|Floor 40]] **[[Heavenly Tower/Floor 49|Floor 49]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Mystic Mask Yulala |Health = 2,250,000 HP |Attack Power = 25,000 damage
(12,295.08 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 61f 2.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 30 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 39f
(22f backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective range: -400~400)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Warp|Warp]] Cat Units back by 1,500 range for 1f 0.03 seconds |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 380 e.png|Mystic Mask Yulala's spritesheet Un-green yulala.gif|Mystic Mask Yulala's animations ==Trivia== *His design may be a reference to the character [[w:c:snk:Mudman|Mudman]] from the ''[[w:c:snk:World Heroes (series)|World Heroes]]'' series. *He is [[Master Uril (Special Cat)|Master Uril]]'s son. Mystic Mask Yulala's Japanese description calls him the head of his clan, and [[Master Uril (Enemy Unit)|enemy Master Uril]]'s Japanese description says he passed down that same title to his son when he retired. *It is heavily implied that [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]] is the daughter of Yulala, as they both wear masks, have the same white hair and seem to use the same attack. [[Masked Yulala (Special Cat)|Masked Yulala]] also mentions "his 12-year old daughter" in his Evolved Form's description. Ururun Cat's description says that her father is a school teacher and Mystic Mask Yulala's description states that he teaches modern dance to kindergartners, further hinting that he is Ururun's dad. Their Normal Forms' descriptions also state that both Yulala and Ururun will "join those who have defeated them," suggesting that they all follow the family tradition of joining those who have defeated them. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/382.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Hackey''' (ヒウマ ''Hiuma'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Hackey |image = RedTackeyBattle.png |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Scorched Tollbooth|Sub-chapter 45 - Scorched Tollbooth]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Burning Sunset|Sub-chapter 41 - Burning Sunset]] }} ==Enemy== This enemy, while not so durable, has extremely powerful Long Distance Area Attacks, strong enough to destroy most units in one hit. Fortunately, Hackey has an extremely large blind spot of 1200, with his standing range being well within it, meaning most units can sneak inside due to his long attack delay. ==Strategy== Time your attackers perfectly to minimize Hackey's destruction, as anything he hits will lose a massive amount of health or outright perish immediately. Much of the same strategies that work against the original Tackey should also work against this enemy, but you '''do not''' want it getting a hit off on any of your important units. Luring can work, but be careful not to let him get too close to the [[Cat Base]], because even a maxed base can only withstand three fastballs from this fiery pitcher. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 387 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Hackey |enemy_endesc1 = Aspiring pitcher whose burning passion
usually ends up just warming the bench.
Hopes to prove the power of his long-
range fastball assaults one day! |image1 = Enemy icon 387.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 熱い闘魂を持った熱血ピッチャー。
高い体温で仲間の為にベンチを温める。
火をつけたボールを魔球と呼び、
超遠方から投げつけてくる手ごわいヤツ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A pitcher whose fighting spirit is as hot as his blood.
Warms the bench for his teammates with his body heat.
A tough opponent who ignites the ball and calls it a "demon
ball" before throwing it from uber-long distance. |Enemy name (JP) = ヒウマ (Hiuma)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 44: [[NASA (Aku Realm)|NASA]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 45-6: [[Scorched Tollbooth]] (100%) *Stage 46-2: [[Virtual Harvest]] (100%) *Stage 48-2: [[Thirst for Vengeance]] (100%) ====[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]==== *Stage 10-4: [[Snitches Get Stitches]] (200%) *Stage 16-5: [[Bathtub of Whimsy]] (200%) *Stage 21-5: [[Postapocalypse Panic]] (200%) *Stage 25-3: [[Protein Cartel]] (200%) *Stage 28-4: [[Swamp of Ignorance]] (200%) *Stage 30-5: [[Passionate Release]] (200%) *Stage 33-2: [[Ironsand Beach]] (200%) *Stage 35-6: [[Gene Salesmen]] (200%) *Stage 41-6: [[Burning Sunset]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Strange]]: [[Color of Blood (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Total War: Winter Special]]: [[Dance of Winter: Supreme (Merciless)]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 21|Floor 21]] (200%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Red Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Red|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Hackey |Health = 248,000 HP |Attack Power = 54,000 damage

Not to be confused with [[Corrupted Moneko (Enemy)|Corrupted Moneko]].}} '''Crazed Moneko''' (狂乱のもねこ ''Kyōran no Moneko'', '''Crazed Moneko''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[In JAPAN (Crazed Moneko)|In JAPAN]] and [[In LONDON]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Crazed Moneko |image = crazedmonekoenemy1.png |money drop = 999¢ - 3,946¢ |appearance = [[In JAPAN (Crazed Moneko)|in JAPAN]] [[In LONDON|in LONDON]] }} ==Enemy== Crazed Moneko has low range, many knockbacks and a multi-hit attack with a 100% chance of creating a Lv. 5 [[Wave Attack]] on the third hit. Unlike [[Crazed Moneko (Special Cat)|her cat counterpart]], the enemy version can only [[Critical Hit]] at a 50% chance while the allied version is able to Critical Hit at a 100% chance. ==Strategy== When fighting Crazed Moneko by herself, it is sufficient to send out no meatshields or only an occasional [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] to trigger her attack animation. As long as no units with a range under 240 are deployed during her attack, she will be unable to produce a [[Wave Attack]], making her much less of a threat. When there are other enemies on the battlefield, then just enough meatshields must be deployed to keep your backline attackers safe without allowing her to hit anything with her last attack. It is ill-advised to use [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Cat]] or other meatshields/close-ranged attackers that can survive the first two hits of Crazed Moneko's attack without getting knocked back, as they can easily give her a chance to unleash her Wave. The only [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] that won't backfire on the player are [[Eva Unit-00 (Uber Rare Cat)|Eva Unit-00]], [[Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo (Uber Rare Cat)|Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo]] and [[Mighty Kristul Muu (Legend Rare Cat)|Doom Engine Pandora]]. ==Variant== {{Variant |Corrupted Moneko |Corrupted Moneko has identical stats to Crazed Moneko, the only difference being that Corrupted Moneko appears at 100% strength magnification while Crazed Moneko only appears at 12% and 50%. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Crazed Moneko Stages|Crazed Moneko]]: **[[In JAPAN (Crazed Moneko)|In JAPAN]] (12%) **[[In LONDON]] (50%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Crazed Moneko |Health = 2,400,000 HP |Attack Power = 60,000 damage
(9,944 DPS) |Attack Range = 240
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 180f 6 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 12 times |Occurrence = 4f 0.13s
(42f 1.4s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (20,000 at 4f 0.13s, 20,000 at 19f 0.63s, 20,000 at 139f 4.63s)
100% chance to create a level 5 [[Wave Attack]] on third hit
50% chance to perform a [[Critical Hit]] on third hit |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 396 e.png|Crazed Moneko's spritesheet IdleCrazedMoneko.gif|Crazed Moneko's moving animation ==Trivia== *At 100% strength magnification, Crazed Moneko has the exact same stats as [[Corrupted Moneko (Enemy)|Corrupted Moneko]]. The difference is that Crazed Moneko only appears at 12% or 50% strength magnification, while Corrupted Moneko is at full strength in both of her appearances. *Along with Corrupted Moneko, she was the first enemy to have an ability that only activates on one part of a multi-hit attack. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/398.html ----

Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,172¢ }} ==Enemy== Pokota is a backliner who interestingly has a multi-hit attack. At his highest strength ([[Rainbow Blast!]] at 3 crown difficulty), he sports 128,000 health and does 10,000 damage with each part of his multi-hit attack. In the field, he's a bruiser to Cat Units who aren't able to outrange him and, despite being a backliner, he attacks more frequently than his allies ([[Ovis (Enemy)|Ovis]] or [[Coco (Enemy)|Coco]]). ==Strategy== As Pokota's damage output is fairly high, it's important to bring meatshields so that he doesn't piledrive the more important units on your team. [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Mohawk Cat]], [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]], [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]] should be sufficient for the combination of Pokotas, Ovis, and Cocos that are present in [[Rainbow Blast!]]. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[LINE Pokopang! Additionally, he only has one knockback. ==Strategy== There is not much one can do to Ovis besides deplete his enormous health pool with many attackers. [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hip Hop Cat]]'s range is on par with Ovis' and can always take at least the very first hit from him if his True Form has been unlocked. [[Fencer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fencer Cat]] would be complementary to Hip Hop because he can outrange Ovis and still do some good damage. But if Ovis is with other Pokopang members, such as Pokota and/or Coco, Crazed Bahamut Cat should also be present to keep them at bay. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[LINE Pokopang! Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== Coco fulfills the status role of the Pokopang group, as he has a guaranteed chance to weaken your Cat Units. Coco's weaken duration lasts for 100 frames and Coco attacks every 97 frames, so it is possible for cats to get stuck in a weaken lock if they are not knocked back. At his highest strength ([[Rainbow Blast!]] at 3 crown difficulty), he has 240,000 health and 20,000 attack power. ==Strategy== Stacking [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|King Dragon Cats]] is sufficient for dealing with Coco if he is alone, because King Dragon Cat outranges him and has enough firepower for the job. A level 60 King Dragon Cat will kill a 200% Coco in twenty hits if protected. But if [[Pokota (Enemy)|Pokota]] is also present, then it may be better to have a heavy-hitting cat like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Crazed Bahamut Cat]] occupy the backline instead. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[LINE Pokopang! https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the Cat Unit, see [[Mecha-Bun (Special Cat)]]. Not to be confused with [[Bun Bun Monger Prototype (PC Special Cat)|Bun Bun Monger Prototype]].}} '''Mecha-Bun''' ('''レジェンドブンブンΩ''' ''Rejendo Bun Bun Ω'', '''''Legend Bun Bun Ω''''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that serves as the boss of [[Eldritch Forces]], the final stage of [[Stories of Legend]]. It can be unlocked as a [[Mecha-Bun (Special Cat)|Special Cat]] with a guaranteed drop in said level. {{Enemy Info |name = Mecha-Bun |image = Mechabunbun.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Eldritch Forces|Sub-chapter 49 - Eldritch Forces]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's All-Stars|Sub-chapter 38 - Hell's All-Stars]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== Universally amongst [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]]'s variants, Mecha-Bun sports gargantuan health and damage. In addition to this, it has an Omni Strike with 40 piercing range, with greater speed and attack rate. Notably, despite its name and appearance, Mecha-Bun isn't a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy. ==Strategy== If you don't want Mecha-Bun to push, your safest option is to not let it attack at all. The best unit and the only one you will need to perma-freeze it in Eldritch Forces is [[Shaman Cat (Rare Cat)|Necro-Dancer Cat]], who outranges Mecha-Bun's Omni Strike by 60. You might also want to use either [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] or [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]] to stop Mecha-Bun in his tracks so your Necro-Dancer stack can attack it more safely. The [[Ototo Development Team#Thunderbolt|Thunderbolt]] can help with the beginning of the fight, as it will ensure that your crowd-controllers attack before Mecha-Bun. You also need some other LD/Wave/Surge units to wipe the peons such as they don't prevent your CC units from hitting Mecha-Bun. Do not use [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cat]], as he only outranges Mecha-Bun's Omni Strike by 10. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 405 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Mecha-Bun |enemy_endesc1 = Artifact of an ancient empire which once ruled
the Earth. A dark union of Doges has revived
this terrible force, but thankfully they only
have one copy of the pilot's manual to share! |image1 = Enemy icon 405.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = かつて地上を支配した古代種の力を
闇の組織が均らせた。 圧倒的な手数で
敵をボコボコに出来るが、パイロットが

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the Cat Unit, see [[Mecha-Bun (Special Cat)]]. For the weaker boss that must be beaten first, see [[Mecha-Bun (Floating)]].}} '''Relic Bun-Bun''' (真レジェンドブンブン ''Shin Rejendo Bun-Bun'', '''True Legend Bun-Bun''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy introduced in the first stage of [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]], [[An Ancient Curse]]. It is the enemy version of [[Mecha-Bun (Special Cat)|Ultimate Mecha-Bun]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Relic Bun-Bun |image = Relicbunbun.jpg |first appearance = '''UL''': [[An Ancient Curse|Sub-chapter 1 - An Ancient Curse]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== The first boss of Uncanny Legends, Relic Bun-Bun has a 100% chance to apply the Curse effect to your cats. Cursed cats are unable to use anti-trait [[Special Abilities|abilities]] ([[Special Abilities#Massive Damage|massive damage]], [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]], etc.) for a short period of time, but can still use neutral abilities ([[Wave Attack]]s, [[Critical Hit]]s, etc.). Unlike other variants of [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]], it isn't [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]], making it that much more difficult to counter. However, most anti-Floating units would lose their anti-Floating abilities to the curse anyhow while Relic Bun-Bun demolishes them. Other than what is stated above, this enemy is very similar to [[Mecha-Bun (Floating)|Mecha-Bun]]. It is different in that it deals half as much damage, gets knocked back half as many times, has longer [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] reach, and moves slower. ==Strategy== With huge DPS, Omni Strike, a 10-second Curse and 3,000,000 HP, this enemy is extremely dangerous. Use tanky units such as [[Primordial Cat (Rare Cat)|Modern/Future Cat]]. Modern/Future Cat will need research combos to keep up, however. Additionally, use [[:Category:Anti-Relic Cats|anti-Relics]] that can outrange it, like [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)|Awakened Musashi]], [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Awakened Mina]], [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], [[Master Uril (Special Cat)|Mystic Uril]], [[Medusa Cat (Rare Cat)|Twintail Medusa Cat]] and [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapstick Cats]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 406 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Relic Bun-Bun |enemy_endesc1 = An unstoppable artifact who mercilessly crushes
any intruder into the realm of the ancients.
The prophecies speak of some who can resist
the dark curses this guardian places on its foes. |image1 = Enemy icon 406.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = いにしえの地に踏み込みいれるものを
容赦なく殴り続ける古代の番人。
特殊能力を封印する「古代の呪い」が
効かない者たちがいるらしいが... |enemy_jpdesc1 = An ancient guardian who mercilessly beats down
anything that steps foot into the land of the ancients.
It appears that there are some who are unaffected
by the "Ancient Curse" that seals special abilities... |Enemy name (JP) = 真レジェンドブンブン (Shin Rejendo Bun-Bun, True Legend Bun-Bun) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 1-1: [[An Ancient Curse]] *Stage 10-6: [[The Red Cat Gambit]] *Stage 23-5: [[A Boat Too Far]] *Stage 34-5: [[Khao Man Guys]] *Stage 39-1: [[Aku Altar's Seal]] *Stage 46-3: [[Aven-Jazz Cafe]] *Stage 47-6: [[Neverending Footsteps]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Relic Bun-Bun |Health = 3,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 11,111 damage
(20,833 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 16f 0.53 seconds |Movement Speed = 13 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 10f 0.33s
(6f 0.2s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -300~300)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 300f 10 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Existence Elsewhere== ===Nyanko Defence Force=== In [[Nyanko Defence Force]], Relic Bun-Bun had multiple new variants that could be fought as Raid Bosses. {| style="margin:2px 0px;padding:3px;border-radius:5px;border:1px #ddd solid;width:100%;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" |- | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:NDFRelicBunBun.png|center|130px]] | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd; border-right:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:Lava Relic Bun Bun.PNG|center|100px]] | style="padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd" | [[File:relic umbral bun bun.png|center|100px]] |- | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;border-right:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | General Relic Bun-Bun
(古代の　大将 ぶんぶん先生) | style="width:20%;padding:2px;border-bottom:1px solid #ddd;border-right:1px solid #ddd; text-align:center" | Lava Relic Bun-Bun | style="width:20%;padding:2px; text-align:center" | Umbral Relic Bun-Bun
(古代 闇 ぶんぶん先生) |} ==Gallery== RelicBunBunspritesheet.png|Relic Bun-Bun's spritesheet Green teacher.gif|Relic Bun-Bun's animations ==Trivia== *Relic Bun-Bun's description is accurate to its debut. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Relic Doge''' (古代わんこ ''Kodai Wanko'', "'''Ancient Doggy'''") is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Relic Doge |image = Relicdoge.jpg |first appearance = '''SoL''': [[Eldritch Forces/Invasion|Sub-chapter 49 - Eldritch Forces Invasion]]
'''UL''': [[An Ancient Curse|Sub-chapter 1 - An Ancient Curse]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Rest Stop Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 45 - Rest Stop Sacrifice]] |money drop = 100¢ - 395¢ }} ==Enemy== Relic Doge is a medium-fast moving enemy with remarkably high health and attack power for a peon, surpassing even [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] and [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriel]]. This is especially the case on higher Crown difficulties, where Relic Doge will have 150k HP, 24k damage per hit, and over 17k damage per second. As with most relics, it also has the nasty curse ability, though this is sadly less relevant than its stats, due to its non-guaranteed activation and short duration. ==Strategy== Because of its stats, Relic Doge is quite hard to simply stall in early encounters. The use of [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapsticks Cats]] or the [[True Form]] of one of the [[Stories of Legend]] [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cats]] is recommended when dealing with this Doge. In its later appearances, however, the introduction of [[Sir Rel (Relic)|Sir Rel]] greatly diminishes its threat, by which point your attackers shouldn't have too much trouble defeating it. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 407 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Relic Doge |enemy_endesc1 = Ancestral nemesis of the Cat Empire.
Serious and hardworking like any Doge,
but sometimes thoughtlessly lets a Curse out
when focusing hard. Oops, sorry about that! |image1 = Enemy icon 407.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 太古の昔に生息していたわんこ。
まじめな性格で成績も優秀だが、
勉強しながら呪いの言葉を吐く癖が
あり、周りに迷惑がられている |enemy_jpdesc1 = A dog that lived in ancient times.

but has a habit of cursing while studying,
which annoys everyone else nearby. |Enemy name (JP) = 古代わんこ (Kodai Wanko, "Ancient Doggy")}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]=== *Stage 49-IN: wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sir Rel''' (イングリッス ''Ingurissu'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant of [[Squire Rel]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sir Rel |image = Sir Rel.jpeg |first appearance = '''UL''': [[John Gool|Sub-chapter 3 - John Gool]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 50¢ - 197¢ }} ==Enemy== The Relic variant of [[Squire Rel]], he has 2/3 as much health as [[Relic Doge (Relic)|Relic Doge]] and a strong, single-target attack dealing 12,500 damage per hit as well as a 100% curse effect. He's faster than the original with more knockbacks, as well as a much higher attack rate giving him nearly 30k DPS. Furthermore, he's often spammed and has an extremely low money drop. ==Strategy== Much like Li'l Bun Bun, Sir Rel is an extremely strong peon with the stats to steamroll through any defense you may put up against him. However, it only takes a mere 10,000 damage to knock back this superpowered squirrel, and so a small stack of area attackers might be just enough to ward him off when protected. In some levels, Sir Rel shows up to assist enemies that you essentially need to use status effects to beat, such as [[Bore (Red)|Bore]], and in those kinds of levels it is recommended that you use a [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attacker]] or a fast-acting [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attacker]] such as [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapstick Cats]] to repel them before he destroys your CC units. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 412 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Sir Rel |enemy_endesc1 = Speaks only in Olde English,
meaning he's a very young Relic.
If the Cats took their studies seriously,
they might learn a lot from this guy. |image1 = Enemy icon 412.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 古代に生息している英語っぽい発音で
しゃべるリス。タイムマシンで現代に
駅前留学していた時に覚えた。と
自慢げに話しているようだが伝わらない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An ancient squirrel who sounds like he's speaking English.
"I remember when I used a time machine to study in front
of the station in modern times," is what he seems to be
boasting about, but it doesn't get conveyed. |Enemy name (JP) = イングリッス (Ingurissu) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 3-6: [[John Gool]] wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Oldhorn''' (コライノくん ''Koraino-kun'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Oldhorn |image = Oldhorn.jpg |first appearance = '''UL:''' [[Annin Pass|Sub-chapter 2 - Annin Pass]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Infinity Ridge|Sub-chapter 47 - Infinity Ridge]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== The Relic variant of [[One Horn (Red)|One Horn]], Oldhorn is extremely resilient with 2.4 million health and 30,000 DPS when unbuffed. He slowly approaches the [[Cat Base]] with 4 movement speed. ==Strategy== When you first encounter this time-traveling terror, he's the only thing in the entire stage, making it easy to build an entire set dedicated to defeating him. [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super Rare Cat)|Prof. Cat Jobs]] makes this enemy very easy by weakening his damage down to a mere 120 per hit. [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]] can do the same but only [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weakens]] to 50%. Because Oldhorn is so vulnerable to being Crowd-Controlled, you can slow or knock him back with cats like [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Gato Amigo]], [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Dark Emperor Catdam]] or [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Cat]]. [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Rodeo Cat]] is another great Cat to use as Oldhorn's short range allows Rodeo Cats to be stacked, resulting in a perma-slow. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 413 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Oldhorn |enemy_endesc1 = An ancient prophet who learns of impending
doom by time-traveling. His time-trips aren't
very accurate, so by the time he gets
home the bad stuff has already happened... |image1 = Enemy icon 413.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 未来を見通すことができる古代の預言者。
悪いことが起こる人のところへ行って
助言をする旅を続けているが着く頃には
いつも事後なので伝えたことはまだない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An ancient prophet who can see the future.
On a journey to go to people who will have bad things happen
to them and give them advice, but he never gets to tell them
because the bad stuff has already happened by the time he arrives. |Enemy name (JP) = コライノくん (Koraino-kun) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 2-3: [[Annin Pass]] (100%) *Stage 2-6: [[Mince Hill]] (100%) *Stage 3-3: [[Playing Bandits]] (100%) *Stage 4-4: [[Utsubobo Seamount]] (100%) *Stage 5-5: [[Seahorse Siren]] (100%) *Stage 6-3: [[Sunlit Caves]] (100%) *Stage 9-3: [[Loach Breach]] (100%) *Stage 10-2: [[Gutter Lord]] (100%) *Stage 11-6: [[Supervolcano]] (100%) *Stage 13-3: [[Lost Sailors]] (100%) *Stage 22-5: [[Rebel Scraps]] (100%) *Stage 25-4: [[Anaerobic Cycling]] (100%) *Stage 29-2: [[Cozy Corpses]] (100%) *Stage 34-4: [[Poison on Rice]] (200%) *Stage 43-5: [[Silver Current]] (100%) *Stage 45-3: [[Clay Pot Soul Food]] (100%) *Stage 46-2: [[Stand By Motel]] (100%) *Stage 47-4: [[Infinity Ridge]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Prelude to Ruin: [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 31|Floor 31]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Oldhorn |Health = 2,400,000 HP |Attack Power = 12,000 damage

(6f 0.2s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 300f 10 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== OldhornSprites.png|Oldhorn's spritesheet Green rino.gif|Oldhorn's animations ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Koraino-kun, is a pun combining ''korai'', meaning "from ancient times", and ''raino'', the Japanese pronunciation of "rhino". *He has the shortest range of all Relic enemies. *Despite being introduced before [[Sir Rel (Relic)|Sir Rel]], Oldhorn is listed after him in the Enemy Guide and has a higher ID. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/415.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Othom''' (超町長 ''Chō Chōchō'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Othom |image = Othom.jpg |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Rutsborg Vortex|Sub-chapter 4 - Rutsborg Vortex]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== Othom has more damage and health than both [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]] and [[Maawth (Alien/Floating)|Maawth]], with an [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] that hits cats up to 440 range away from him, outranging the majority of non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] units. As with most Relic enemies, Othom also has [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]], but it is generally ignorable due to it being lower than his attack rate, so it rarely if ever comes into play, except in [[Rutsborg Vortex]], where he debuts. He is also very tanky, especially for a backliner, with 800,000 HP and only one knockback. In 2-Crown Uncanny Legends, Othom has up to 1.2 million HP, 16,667 damage, and 5,688 DPS. His HP buff is negligible since he still only has one knockback, but his attack becomes strong enough to kill a maxed [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] in two hits instead of three, along with many more interaction changes. This may require high-level cats to counteract properly. ==Strategy== Thanks to his Omni Strike, most cheap attackers such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Cyborg Cat]] or [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]] become obsolete, so use cats that can outrange him such as [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Awakened Ururun]] and/or [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], as they can hit Othom from a safe distance. You could also use [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Awakened Mina]], provided there is something that can be used as a stepping stone for her to snipe Othom, otherwise, she's about as useful as a [[Drury Swordsman (Rare Cat)|Drury Witch]]. You could also use long-ranged Ubers such as [[Catman (Uber Rare Cat)|Ultimate Catman]] (who also does massive damage to Relics) or [[Kintaro (Uber Rare Cat)|Kinrangers GigaForce]], should you be lucky enough to have them. Since he only has one knockback, the [[Ototo Development Team#Breakerblast|Breakerblast Cannon]] can be useful for keeping him at bay. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 414 |enemy category = Relic/Floating |Enemy name = Othom |enemy_endesc1 = Mayor of the ancient Duchy of Lepidoptera.
His citizens hate his long, rambling stories
that make the morning town council
meetings drag on late into the night. |image1 = Enemy icon 414.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 古代レピドプテラ地方に生息していた
町長を超越したすごい町長さん。
話が超長くてみんな超迷惑している。
長時間におよぶ朝礼は夜まで続く。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An outstanding mayor who transcends even
the last mayor of the ancient Lepidoptera region.
Everyone is annoyed by his excessively long stories.
His long morning assemblies drag on late into the night. |Enemy name (JP) = 超町長 (Chō Chōchō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 4-6: [[Rutsborg Vortex]] *Stage 5-3: [[Buoys & Gills]] *Stage 6-2: [[Rogue's Twilight]] *Stage 7-4: [[Inspirational Mural]] *Stage 10-6: [[The Red Cat Gambit]] *Stage 12-1: [[A Joyful Song]] *Stage 13-5: [[Quay of Camels]] *Stage 16-1: [[Eager Entryway]] *Stage 22-3: [[Unmoving Conveyer]] *Stage 24-6: [[Bare Fangs at the Throne]] *Stage 29-5: [[Botanical Burial]] *Stage 32-3: [[Normal Activity]] *Stage 34-2: [[Tropical Garden]] *Stage 37-4: [[Pulled Punch Bout]] *Stage 43-5: [[Silver Current]] *Stage 45-2: [[Local Harvest Forecast]] *Stage 46-5: [[Titanic Steakhouse]] *Stage 47-1: [[Fullstop Valley]] *Stage 47-5: [[Eternal Ancient Woods]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 26|Floor 26]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Othom |Health = 800,000 HP |Attack Power = 11,111 damage
(3,788 DPS) |Attack Range = 340
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 88f 2.93 seconds |Movement Speed = 20 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 34f 1.13s
(54f 1.8s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -440~440)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 60f 2 seconds |Element = Relic/Floating }} ==Gallery== 414 e.png|Othom's spritesheet green moth.gif|Othom's animations ==Trivia== *The name "Othom" is an anagram of [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]]. *Like Mooth, his Japanese name, Chō Chōchō (超町長), is a pun that doesn't translate well to English: it literally translates to "Super Mayor", but each syllable shares a pronunciation with 蝶 (''chō'', meaning butterfly), so if it were spelled differently it would mean "Butterfly Butterfly Butterfly". *When Othom was first released, his [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] trait was not mentioned in his Enemy Guide entry. This was fixed at an unknown date. *Lepidoptera is an order of insects that includes butterflies and moths. *He is tied with [[Haniwanwan (Relic)|Haniwanwan]] for the lowest curse duration of all enemies. **He's also one of the four cursing enemies whose curse duration is lower than their attack rate, the others being [[Urs & Fenrir (Relic)|Urs & Fenrir]], [[Haniwanwan (Relic)|Haniwanwan]] and [[Golem Sunfish (Relic, Floating)|Golem Sunfish]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/416.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Selena''' (ナミエちゃん ''Namie-chan'') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy introduced in [[Never Not Summer! (Monthly Event)|Never Not Summer!]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Selena |image = Selena.png |first appearance = [[Leak Year]] |latest appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 13|Infernal Tower - Floor 13]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 7,110¢ }} ==Enemy== Compared to [[Sunny Celeboodle (Event Enemy)|Sunny Celeboodle]], Selena has much higher health and deals damage per hit, with no delay between attacks, but has one additional knockback and significantly shorter range. She also a 100% chance of knocking back cats and a 40% chance of slowing them. ==Strategy== For the most part, the same strategy that works against Sunny Celeboodle also works against Selena: meatshield non-stop while slowly whittling down her health with long-ranged attackers, including [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] and other heavy hitters. Avoid using short-ranged units like [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Titans]] against Selena, as they will most likely be killed or knocked back repeatedly before they have a chance to attack. Also, if you time [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]] correctly, she will be unable to move. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Never Not Summer! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Kid Tappa''' (マナブくん ''Manabu-kun'') is a [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] variant of [[Dolphina]] that appears in [[Cats of the Cosmos]], [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]], and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Kid Tappa |image = Kid Tappa.jpg |first appearance = '''CotC''': [[Triton (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 2 - Triton]]
'''UL''': [[Escolar Coast|Sub-chapter 9 - Escolar Coast]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Dilemma of Birth|Sub-chapter 30 - Dilemma of Birth]] }} ==Enemy== Kid Tappa is a defense-oriented enemy, similar to [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]]. He is speedy, tough, has a 15,000 HP [[Barrier]], one knockback and a great deal of health (especially if the player doesn't have all [[Anti-Starred Alien Treasures]]) but low damage and range. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Barrier Breaker Cats|Barrier Breakers]] such as [[Li'l Gross Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Macho Legs]] or [[Fencer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kendo Cat]] can obliterate his barrier, although they aren't necessary to bring if you have any cat with attack power over 15,000. All that's required after is damage, but there is no danger in keeping Kid Tappa alive, so anyone can take it from there. Instead, his high health and tendency not to move can be exploited by cats who need a stepping stone, such as [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Mina]], [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Polevaulter]] or, later on, [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]]. In stages where it is best not to waste time and push through Kid Tappa quickly, the use of [[Wheel Cat (Rare Cat)|Chill Cat]] is recommended to melt through his health. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 417 |enemy category = Alien |Enemy name = Kid Tappa |enemy_endesc1 = Express delivery across the galaxy!
His girlfriend thinks he should start
looking for a real job, so he's joined
the elite Alien shock division. |image1 = Enemy icon 417.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 宇宙で速達便のバイトをしている
マナブくん。彼女のケイコから
いいかげん就職しろと言われたので
宇宙侵略の派遣に登録してみた。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Manabu-kun has a part-time job carrying out
express deliveries in space. His girlfriend Keiko
said he should start looking for a real job, so he
tried to register for galactic invasion deployment. |Enemy name (JP) = マナブくん (Manabu-kun) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 46: [[Hollywood (Aku Realm)|Hollywood]] (1,200%) ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]]=== *Stage 2-10: [[Triton (Cats of the Cosmos)|Triton]] (100%) *Stage 2-16: [[Calabash Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Calabash Nebula]] (100%) *Stage 2-20: [[Vega (Cats of the Cosmos)|Vega]] (100%) *Stage 2-23: [[Deneb (Cats of the Cosmos)|Deneb]] (100%) *Stage 2-28: [[Buutara (Cats of the Cosmos)|Buutara]] (100%) *Stage 2-33: [[Darararah (Cats of the Cosmos)|Darararah]] (100%) *Stage 2-39: [[Ababwa (Cats of the Cosmos)|Ababwa]] (100%) *Stage 2-46: [[Andromeda (Cats of the Cosmos)|Andromeda]] (100%) *Stage 2-48: [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] (100%) *Stage 3-1: [[Earth (Cats of the Cosmos)|Earth]] (150%) *Stage 3-6: [[Mercury (Cats of the Cosmos)|Mercury]] (200%) *Stage 3-10: [[Triton (Cats of the Cosmos)|Triton]] (200%) *Stage 3-16: [[Calabash Nebula (Cats of the Cosmos)|Calabash Nebula]] (250%) *Stage 3-20: [[Vega (Cats of the Cosmos)|Vega]] (250%) *Stage 3-28: [[Buutara (Cats of the Cosmos)|Buutara]] (350%) *Stage 3-39: [[Ababwa (Cats of the Cosmos)|Ababwa]] (550%) *Stage 3-48: [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] (1,300%) *Stage 3-IN: [[Filibuster Invasion (Cats of the Cosmos)|Filibuster Invasion]] (600%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 9-1: [[Escolar Coast]] (200%) *Stage 10-4: [[Snitches Get Stitches]] (200%) *Stage 15-2: [[Mermaid Sauce]] (1,200%) *Stage 24-3: [[Raise Your Torches]] (1,200%) *Stage 28-3: [[Formalin Marina]] (1,200%) *Stage 30-2: [[Dilemma of Birth]] (1,200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Kid Tappa |Health = 40,000* HP |Attack Power = 50* damage

''*Stats shown are with all [[Anti-Starred Alien Treasures]].'' |Element = StarredAlien }} ==Gallery== 417 e.png|Kid Tappa's spritesheet IdleKidTappa.gif|Kid Tappa's moving animation ==Trivia== *His design is based on [[wikipedia:Beluga whale|Beluga Whales]], which are known for their echolocation abilities and lack of dorsal fins. *His Japanese name, Manabu-kun, is a reference to the work-and-hobby-focused magazine ''[[wikipedia:ja:ケイコとマナブ|Keiko to Manabu]]'', as proven by the line "His girlfriend Keiko said he should start looking for a real job" in his Japanese description. **His joining the elite [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] shock division could be an allusion to ''Keiko to Manabu'''s publisher, Recruit. *His behavior may refer to how real-life shock troops are expected to lead attacks and absorb heavy damage. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/419.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For other uses, see [[God (disambiguation)|God]].}} '''Cat God (Cool Dude)''' (紳さま (本気), ''Shin-sama (Honki)'', '''God the Gentleman (Serious)''' ) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy seen as the boss of [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] in [[Cats of the Cosmos]] Chapter 2. {{Enemy_Info |name = Cat God (Cool Dude) |image = E 421.png |appearance = '''CotC''': [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 2 - The Big Bang]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== Cat God is no longer [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]! He has a standing range of 300, but his attacks go up to 1,000. His attacks are now mixed; he will first cast God Bless You, which will [[Special Abilities#Knockback|Knockback]] AND [[Special Abilities#Slow|Slow]] all cats within his reach. He then prepares his last attack, which deals 65,999 damage at 100% strength magnification. Due to his initial buff being 1,100%, if the player does not have the [[Mystery Mask]] treasure, this enemy has a whopping '''16,499,989 HP''' and deals '''747,967 damage'''! Like all the other Cat Gods, it's a requirement that the Mystery Mask is up to 100% to fully reduce his power. ==Strategy== :''See [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)]]'' In order to reduce his pushing power, cats with [[Special Abilities#Knockback|Knockback]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow Immunity]] are recommended, Cats with [[Special Abilities#Survive|Survive]] ability can endure his 3rd hit and prevent him from moving forward. [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|Anti-Traitless Cats]] can significantly help during the boss fight. [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Vendor Cat and Kitten]] shines against him. Knockback and [[Special Abilities#Freeze|Freeze]] resets his attack animation, while Knockback and Slow immunity prevent Cat God from pushing them back. Watch out for alien peons, though. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 419 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Cat God |enemy_endesc1 = Hey there! It's me, everyone's favorite Cat God!
Hope you had a real good time in Cosmos Ch. 2!
Life in the real world can be tough... I actually
had to move back with my mom last week... |image1 = Enemy icon 419.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 久しぶり！みんな大好き神さまだよ☆
宇宙編第2章楽しんでくれたかな？
ボクの私生活、みんな気になってるよね？
実は、こう見えて実家ぐらしなんだけど...... |enemy_jpdesc1 = Long time no see! It's everybody's beloved god. ☆
Did you enjoy Cosmos Chapter 2?
Everybody wants to know about my personal life, right?
To tell you the truth, despite my appearances I still live with my parents... |Enemy name (JP) = 紳さま (本気) (Shin-sama (Honki)) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]]=== *Stage 2-48: [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Cat God (Cool Dude) |Health = 1,499,999* HP |Attack Power = 67,997* damage
(5,087* DPS) |Attack Range = 300
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 401f (13.37 seconds) |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 90f 3s
(101f 3.37s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (999 at 90f 3s, 999 at 150f 5s, 65,999 at 300f 10s)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units on first two hits
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 50f 1.67 seconds on first two hits
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -1,000~1,000)
''*Stats shown are with a completed Ch. 2 [[Mystery Mask]].'' |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== CatGodSpritesheet.png|Cat God (Cool Dude)'s spritesheet THISTHINGWASTERRIBLETORENDER.gif|Cat God (Cool Dude)'s animations ==Trivia== *His pose is taken from Michelangelo's ''[[wikipedia:David (Michelangelo)|David]]'' sculpture. *Although his trait is listed as Cool Dude in the Enemy Guide, Cat God is considered a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy. *The kanji 紳 (''shin'') in his Japanese name means gentleman; it shares a pronunciation with the kanji 神 (''shin''/''kami''), meaning god. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/421.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Loris''' (ダテメガネル ''Datemeganeru'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant of [[LeMurr (Alien)|LeMurr]] introduced in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Loris |image = Loris.PNG |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Young Cuttlefish|Sub-chapter 5 - Young Cuttlefish]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Master of Demon Keep|Sub-chapter 47 - Master of Demon Keep]] |money drop = 750¢ - 2,962¢ }} ==Enemy== The bane of many debuffers, Loris has a moderately damaging attack which consists of him detaching his sunglasses-like eyes, revealing another, identical pair underneath, jumping into the air, and throwing them into your backlines. He can be considered as a Relic variant of [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]], but is more dangerous for his Long Distance curse than his damage output, as the effect lasts just long enough for him to effectively perma-curse your ranged attackers. Although he deals less damage, he has more than double the health and knockbacks of Tackey, significantly increasing his survivability. When buffed to 150% or more, Loris can potentially become more threatening, although that is mostly dependent on the stage in question. Loris's attack per hit and damage per second do remain underwhelming at ~9,000 damage per hit and a mere ~1,800 DPS, but he gains more survivability as he has 560,000 or more health now, a tad more helpful as he can consistently reposition and allow the frontline to move forward. ==Strategy== Loris will curse your backlines with his range and stop some of your attackers from using their abilities (massive damage, slow, freeze, etc.) and thus can cripple your army, so your best bet is to rely on attackers that are [[:Category:Cats with Curse Immunity|immune to curse]] or can enter his blind spot. Still, he isn’t too hard to deal with thanks to his light (for a Relic) damage and slowish attack speed. Being a Long Distance unit, you could also choose to use shorter-ranged units, such as they might be able to make it inside. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 420 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Loris |enemy_endesc1 = Last year's in-vogue celebrity, famous for
his flashy taste in eyewear. But it's actually
just what his eyes look like... Weird how
he can throw them like that. Relics, amirite? |image1 = Enemy icon 420.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 裸眼なのに古代メガネベストドレッサー賞に
選べれてしまったメガネザル。
商品として押し付けられたメガネの着け心地が
気に入らなくてイライラしている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Tarsier who was chosen for the Ancient Glasses Best
Dresser award even though they're just what his eyes look
like. Annoyed because he doesn't like the idea of the
feeling of wearing glasses being pushed as a commodity. |Enemy name (JP) = ダテメガネル (Datemeganeru) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 5-6: [[Young Cuttlefish]] (100%) *Stage 6-4: [[Glittering Peaks]] (100%) *Stage 7-4: [[Rogue's Twilight]] (100%) *Stage 15-6: [[Total Myopia]] (100%) *Stage 20-6: [[Campus Law]] (100%) *Stage 22-4: [[VIP Warehouse]] (100%) *Stage 22-6: [[Smokestack to Heaven]] (100%) *Stage 26-4: [[Planetarium Love]] (100%) *Stage 27-6: [[Happily Ever After]] (100%) *Stage 29-3: [[Second Unlife]] (100%) *Stage 40-4: [[Breakwater Blood Feud]] (100%) *Stage 42-2: [[Lamps Aloft]] (100%) *Stage 45-1: [[Pithouse Academy]] (150%) *Stage 45-4: [[Chiefs' Smoking Area]] (150%) *Stage 45-6: [[Outta This Village]] (150%) *Stage 47-1: [[Fullstop Valley]] (150%) *Stage 47-2: [[Master of Demon Keep]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Epic]]: [[Miracle Iris (Deadly)]] (100%) *[[Top of the Bog Stages|Top of the Bog]]: [[Water Conservancy (Merciless)]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 19|Floor 19]] (100%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *[[Hunter's Map III]]: [[Red Stone Forest 3]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Loris |Health = 360,000 HP |Attack Power = 6,000 damage
(1,200 DPS) |Attack Range = 449
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 150f 5 seconds |Movement Speed = 9 |Knockback = 6 times |Ability = Long Distance (Effective Range: 500~800)

(9f 0.3s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 420 e.png|Loris' spritesheet green lemur.gif|Loris' animations ==Trivia== *A [[wikipedia:Loris|loris]] is a slow-moving nocturnal primate known for its huge eyes. Unlike the [[The Battle Cats|Battle Cats]] enemy, however, real lorises generally don't have tails. *His Japanese name, Datemeganeru, is derived from the words ''date'' ("vain" or "stylish"), ''date megane'' ("fake glasses") and ''meganezaru'' ("[[wikipedia:Tarsier|tarsier]]"). ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/422.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Le'saint''' (大天使エルファント, ''Daitenshi Erufanto'', lit. "'''Archangel Elephant'''") is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Le'saint |image = Le'saint.png |money drop = 4,590¢ - 18,130¢ |appearance = [[Ghostly Strangers (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Strangers]]
[[August Gauntlet II]]
[[Citadel#Angel|Angel Citadel]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 16|Infernal Tower - Floor 16]] }} ==Enemy== Le'saint has a faster attack rate than both [[Le'boin]] and [[Lord Enma (Event Enemy)|Lord Enma]], with higher health, attack power and a [[Special Abilities#Strengthen|strengthen]] ability that raises his attack power by 100% at 50% HP. However, Le'saint's attack animation is longer than that of any other Le'boin variant and he has 80 less range than the regular Le'boin. ==Strategy== Since Le'saint has even shorter range than Lord Emma, more units can outrange it and defeat it when paired with meatshields such as [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Wall Cat]]. Some attackers that can outrange him are [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Dragon Cat]]. Instead of using traditional meatshields, another alternative is to use [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artists Cat]] because of his sturdiness, attack power and resistance against Angels, making him the perfect fit to defeat this angelic titan when paired with the ranged attackers mentioned above. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ghostly Strangers (Monthly Event)|Ghostly Strangers]]: **[[Dad's Back to Heaven]] (100%) **[[Long Line at Cerberus]] (150%) **[[Charon's Overbooked]] (200%) **[[Still on Vacation]] (250%) **[[See You Next Year]] (300%) *[[August Gauntlet II]]: **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.11]] (200%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.12]] (222%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.13]] (244%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.14]] (266%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.15]] (288%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.16]] (310%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.17]] (332%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.18]] (354%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.19]] (376%) **[[August Gauntlet II/Strangers Lv.11~20|Strangers Lv.20]] (400%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 16|Floor 16]] (400%) *[[Citadel#Angel|Angel Citadel]]: **[[Citadel/Floor 7#Angel|Floor 7]] (100%) **[[Citadel/Floor 9#Angel|Floor 9]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Le'saint |Health = 600,000 HP |Attack Power = 12,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''The Red Malice''' (レッドヘルクマッチョ ''Reddo Heru Kumaccho'', '''Red Hell Kumacho''' [''kuma = bear'']) is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy introduced in [[Old Guys in the City (Monthly Event)|Old Guys in the City]]. {{Enemy Info |name = The Red Malice |image = The Red Malice.jpg |appearance = [[Old Guys in the City (Monthly Event)|Old Guys in the City]]
[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]]
[[September Gauntlet II]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Infernal Tower - Floor 11]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== He has a much higher attack and more health than [[Teacher Bear]] and attacks more frequently along with a 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#knockback|knockback]] Cat Units. However, he still has 10 knockbacks, making him easier to control, but also making him take longer to kill. Treat him like a non-[[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] version of [[Cadaver Bear (Zombie)|Cadaver Bear]], with more health and knockbacks. ==Strategy== Use powerful, long-ranged cats like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Crazed Bahamut Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], or [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Luxury Bath Cat]]. His knockback ability is not much of a problem, in fact, it can save some of your cats from taking unnecessary damage by blocking them from other enemies' attacks, so [[:Category:Cats with Knockback Immunity|knockback immune]] [[:Category:Tanker-class Cats|tankers]] may not be the best idea. Unless he is weakened or frozen, It also isn’t recommended to use rushers such as [[Sanada Yukimura (Uber Rare Cat)|Yukimura]] or Awakened Bahamut Cat against him, as his damage is usually sufficient to knock them back with each hit, and his fast attack rate will likely prevent them from ever hitting him, even without support. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Old Guys in the City (Monthly Event)|Old Guys in the City]]: **[[Night Shuffleboard]] (100%) **[[Twilight Wandering]] (150%) **[[5 Secret Families]] (170%) **[[The Wife Still Wins]] (300%) *[[September Gauntlet II]]: **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.11]] (250%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.12]] (261%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.13]] (272%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.14]] (283%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.15]] (294%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.16]] (305%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.17]] (316%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.18]] (327%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.19]] (338%) **[[September Gauntlet II/In The City Lv.11~20|In The City Lv.20]] (350%) *[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Red|Top Floor]] (400%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Floor 11]] (400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = The Red Malice |Health = 400,000 HP |Attack Power = 4,400 damage
(3,666 DPS) |Attack Range = 300
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 36f (1.2 seconds) |Movement Speed = 20 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 7f 0.23s
(6f 0.2s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|Knockback]] Cat Units |Element = Red }} ==Trivia== *It's unclear whether "The Red Malice" refers to the main steroid-bear or to the group as a whole. *His hair may be a reference to Gajeel from the anime and manga ''Fairy Tail''. *May be a refrence to The Red Menace from ''Star Wars''. *The cubs look similar to [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Teacher BearCat]], but with slightly thinner arms and larger feet. ==Gallery== 422 e.png|The Red Malice's spritesheet IdleTheRedMalice.gif|The Red Malice's walking animation ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/424.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Lowkey''' (古我王 ''Ko Gaō'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Lowkey |image = relicface.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Languid Lakeside|Sub-chapter 6 - Languid Lakeside]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Lowkey combines attributes of The Face, [[Shy Boy (Red/Floating)|Shy Boy]] and [[Hannya (Red)|Hannya]], with high health, rapid attacks, one knockback and long range, but extremely slow movement speed. Like most other Relic enemies, it has a 100% chance of inflicting [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]], which combined with his range of 500 can be deadly under the right circumstances. Similarly to [[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]] and other long-ranged [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic enemies]], Lowkey's attack power is still relatively low; because of that and his sluggish movement speed, he will never be able to push far on his own. ==Strategy== As with most Relic enemies, any short-ranged units that rely on [[:Category:Anti-Relic Cats|anti-Relic]]/[[:Category:Anti-Floating Cats|Floating]] abilities should not be used due to the [[Special Abilities#Curse|Curse]] effect, and those that should be used should either be [[Special Abilities#Immune to Curse|Immune to Curse]], long-ranged units ([[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Awakened Mina]], etc.) or tanky units with high DPS like [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Island Cat]] and [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera]] [[Crazed Titan Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cat]] [[Li'l Titan Cat (Special Cat)|variants]] that can survive Lowkey's fast, long-ranged attacks; or [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]] even should you have it. Keep in mind that Lowkey's range of 500 means few non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] units will be able to outrange him, and for those that can may they still need a stepping stone to hit him with piercing range. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 423 |enemy category = Relic/Floating |Enemy name = Lowkey |enemy_endesc1 = Lifeform whose purpose is to drive Cats extinct.
Thought destroyed a millennia ago during a
great battle with the original Cat Army.
Smallest and most beautiful of the Faceoids(?) |image1 = Enemy icon 423.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = にゃんこ達を滅亡に追い込む生命体。
れじぇんどにゃんこ達との死闘により
駆逐されたため現代では絶滅している。
種族の中では最も小顔で美形。らしい。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Lifeform whose purpose is to drive Cats extinct.
Extinct in modern times because he was destroyed in
a fight to the death against the Legend Cats.
Smallest and most beautiful member of his race, it would seem. |Enemy name (JP) = 古我王 (Ko Gaō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 6-6: [[Languid Lakeside]] *Stage 7-3: [[Paper Skyscraper]] *Stage 8-6: [[Revolver Ridge]] *Stage 10-1: [[Cricket Ideology]] *Stage 13-5: [[Quay of Camels]] *Stage 18-3: [[Rocky Surface]] *Stage 19-4: [[Nighttime Lure]] *Stage 22-6: [[Smokestack to Heaven]] *Stage 29-1: [[Slumbering Cavern]] *Stage 40-3: [[Dried Fish Market]] *Stage 45-2: [[Local Harvest Forecast]] *Stage 47-6: [[Neverending Footsteps]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40|Floor 40]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Lowkey |Health = 1,111,111 HP |Attack Power = 6,000 damage
(4,390 DPS) |Attack Range = 500
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 41f 1.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 2 |Knockback = 1 time |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 300f 10 seconds |Element = Relic/Floating |Occurrence = 24f 0.8s
(17f 0.57s backswing) }} ==Gallery== Lowkeyspritesheet.png|Lowkey's spritesheet Green head.gif|Lowkey's animations ==Trivia== *Lowkey's name may be a reference to the Norse god of trickery, [[wikipedia:Loki|Loki]]. *The word Gaō in Lowkey's Japanese name, Ko Gaō (古我王), doesn't mean anything on its own and is just a pun on ''kao'' (顔), meaning "face", though it can rarely also be a person's name. It consists of the kanji for "ego" or "self-assertion" (我) and "king" (王). ''Ko'' (古) just means old. *Lowkey has the lowest movement speed of all [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relics]] and is tied with [[Loris (Relic)|Loris]] for the lowest attack power of all Relics. *Lowkey's health was lowered in the [[Version 7.4 Update]], having 1,444,444 before then. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/425.html ----
