wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''M. Ost''' (オールドリー ''Ōrudorī'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant of [[R.Ost]] that only appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = M. Ost |image = Relic R Ost.PNG |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Unmanned Station|Sub-chapter 7 - Unmanned Station]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Warning of the Setting Sun|Sub-chapter 47 - Warning of the Setting Sun]] |money drop = 1,080¢ - 4,266¢ }} ==Enemy== M. Ost has high health and damage, extremely fast movement speed and attacks, decent range and guaranteed knockback + slow + curse, all of which allows him to wreak havoc upon your units if not dealt with properly. His biggest weakness is that he has a whopping 10 knockbacks despite his health, making him manageable if you lock him in a knockback cycle with many attackers. ==Strategy== Although M. Ost appears on paper to be R.Ost on steroids, he really isn't as terrifying as he may seem. His guaranteed knockback and slow can actually help push your more expensive ranged attackers back into safety when they're hit, making Slapsticks Cats a good counter to him. Once you have a sizeable stack of mid-ranged attackers, you should be able to knock him back before he destroys your cats. His slow ability also somewhat alleviates the suicidal tendency of fast ranged attackers, such as [[The Grateful Crane (Uber Rare Cat)|Super Galaxy Cosmo]], [[Kachi-Kachi (Uber Rare Cat)|Fire Squad Kachiyama]] and [[Saber (Uber Rare Cat)|Saber]]. [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]] in particular works very well against him. If the stage gives you the option to stack long-ranged Cats, that can also be used to keep M. Ost constantly knocked back. If you've finished the painful process of clearing all 4-Crown [[Stories of Legend]] stages, and have completed the [[Eldritch Forces/Invasion|Eldritch Forces Invasion]], [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]] is a fantastic counter to M. Ost, due to her massive damage and short attack animation. However, timing is an absolute must for rushers, including Idi:N2, as M.Ost outranges them, unless you have some freeze effects at hand to paralyze M.Ost. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 424 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = M. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dead Donny Dash''' (ダッシュ死太郎 ''Dasshu Shitarō'', '''Shitarō Dash''' [''shi = death'']) is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy introduced in the [[Sports Night]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Dead Donny Dash |image = Donny Dash.png |appearance = [[Sports Night (Monthly Event)|Sports Night]]
[[October Gauntlet II]]
[[Citadel#Zombie|Zombie Citadel]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 18|Infernal Tower - Floor 18]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== The Zombie variant of [[Leggsy (Event Enemy)|Leggsy]]. He appears to be a Leggsy with purple hair that covers up most of his head, sporting a white bandana and purple shoes. Unlike Leggsy and his legless variants, Dead Donny Dash attacks by flinging his shoe into the air, which then expands and comes crashing down. In practice, he behaves less like Leggsy and more like a faster [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]] with Zombie attributes and a smaller blind spot. ==Strategy== He's a lot faster than Tackey, so you can let him burrow, get close, and use cats like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] or [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] to enter his range and destroy him with ease. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Sports Night (Monthly Event)|Sports Night]]: **[[Inviting Cemetary]] (100%) **[[2 Bodies, 0 Legs]] (100%) **[[Fallen Priest]] (150%) **[[Hours 'Til Morning]] (200%) *[[Citadel|Zombie Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 8|Floor 8]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 18|Floor 18]] (250%) *[[October Gauntlet II]]: **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.11]] (300%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.12]] (311%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.13]] (322%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.14]] (333%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.15]] (344%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.16]] (355%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.17]] (366%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.18]] (377%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.19]] (388%) **[[October Gauntlet II/Sports Night Lv.11~20|Sports Night Lv.MAX]] (400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Dead Donny Dash |Health = 200,000 HP |Attack Power = 6,000 damage
(1,224 DPS) |Attack Range = 400
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 147f 4.9 seconds |Movement Speed = 25 |Knockback = 2 times |Occurrence = 44f 1.47s
(27f 0.9s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 400~700)
[[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrows]] underground 750 when a Cat enters its range (1 time)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 240f 8 seconds (1 time) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== 425 e.png|Dead Donny Dash's spritesheet Dead Donny Dash.gif|Dead Donny Dash's attack animation IdleDeadDonnyDash.gif|Dead Donny Dash's moving animatiin ==Trivia== *Dead Donny Dash is very likely based off of [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Kitarō|Kitarō]], the titular protagonist of ''[[wikipedia:GeGeGe no Kitarō|GeGeGe no Kitarō]]''. The most obvious similarity is their hairstyles, but there are multiple other connections as well: **Both come from the grave: Donny is a Zombie enemy introduced in [[Inviting Cemetary]], while Kitarō was born in a cemetery. **Donny attacks by kicking his shoes at [[Cat Units]] and having them reappear on his feet, which is similar to how Kitarō uses his weaponized [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Geta|Geta]] sandals. **The ''GeGeGe no Kitarō'' opening theme mentions "[[Sports Night (Monthly Event)|sports festivals in the graveyard at night]]". **The smoking gun is that Donny's first name in Japanese is Shitarō (死太郎); this is spelled and pronounced identically to Kitarō (鬼太郎), except that it swaps ''ki'' (鬼) with ''shi'' (死), meaning "death". ***Incidentally, the first [[Sports Night (Monthly Event)|Sports Night]] event ended the day before [[Yuru-i GeGeGe no Kitarou: Youkai Dotabata Daisensou]] was released. ***His Japanese name may additionally be a reference to ''[[wikipedia:Dash! Yonkuro|Dash! Yonkuro]]'', as ダッシュ死太郎 is not that far off from ダッシュ!四駆郎. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/427.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''CTO Seal''' (パワハラッコ部長 ''Pawaharakko Buchō'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[Otta-smack-u]] introduced in [[Worker's Revolution (Monthly Event)|Worker's Revolution]]. {{Enemy Info |name = CTO Seal |image = CTO Seal.jpg |appearance = [[Worker's Revolution (Monthly Event)|Worker's Revolution]]
[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Infernal Tower - Floor 11]]
[[November Gauntlet II]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== CTO Seal is a well-rounded enemy with a fast attack rate, long range and a 100% chance of [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freezing]] Cats with each hit, which is pretty much permafreeze considering his freeze duration is more than 4 times his attack rate. His attack power isn't too high, but he is usually accompanied by enemies with high pushing power, which help him gradually move forward and eventually reach your back line if you're not careful. ==Strategy== CTO Seal can shut down almost anything with under ~390 range, so the most reliable way to defeat him is to steadily chip away at him with ranged attackers, all the while sending out lots of meatshields to ensure that he doesn't push too much. [[Adult Cat (Rare Cat)|Prisoner Cat]] in particular is a good choice, as he has great range and is strong against [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]. [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Salon Cat]] are both outranged by CTO Seal, so avoid using them. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Worker's Revolution (Monthly Event)|Worker's Revolution]]: **[[Premium Friday]](100%) **[[Total Professional]] (150%) **[[CORE TIME]] (200%) **[[Maternity Leave Forever]] (250%) **[[Late Nite Shake-Up]] (300%) *[[Citadel#Red|Red Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 9#Red|Floor 9]] (200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 11|Floor 11]] (400%) *[[November Gauntlet II]]: **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.11]] (300%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.12]] (322%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.13]] (344%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.14]] (366%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.15]] (388%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.16]] (410%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.17]] (432%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.18]] (454%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.19]] (476%) **[[November Gauntlet II/Revolution Lv.11~20|Revolution Lv.MAX]] (500%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = CTO Seal |Health = 160,000 HP |Attack Power = 2,300 damage
(2,555.56 DPS) |Attack Range = 380
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 27f 0.9 seconds |Movement Speed = 10 |Knockback = 2 times |Occurrence = 14f
(9f backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds |Element = Red }} ==Gallery== 426 e.png|CTO Seal's spritesheet CTO Seal.gif|CTO Seal's attack animation IdleCTOSeal.gif|CTO Seal's moving animation ==Trivia== *CTO stands for Chief Technology Officer or Chief Technical Officer. *His Japanese name, Pawaharakko Buchō, combines ''pawahara'' (short for "power harassment", meaning abuse of power by a higher-up at a workplace), with ''rakko'' (sea otter); ''buchō'' means "department chief", the equivalent of an American vice president (of a company). *He's actually an otter, not a seal. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/428.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Cadaver Bear''' (クマンケン ''Kumanken'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Teacher Bear]] that appears in [[Into the Future]]'s [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Cadaver Bear |image = Zombie Teacher Bear.PNG |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''UL''': [[Panic Tower|Sub-chapter 8 - Panic Tower]]
'''Aku Realms''': [[France (Aku Realm)|France/Gifu]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Fullstop Valley|Sub-chapter 47 - Fullstop Valley]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== Cadaver Bear has long range for a Zombie enemy, [[Special Abilities#Burrow|burrows]] far past cats, gets knocked back only four times and having no backswing, it can push with terrifying ease, destroying many non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] units in up to two hits (especially when buffed). It even [[Special Abilities#Revive|revives]] with 100% HP instead of the usual 50%. ==Strategy== It's recommended to stall this enemy with tons of (preferably strong) meatshields. '''DO NOT USE ANY ATTACKERS WITH UNDER 360 RANGE''' (only exceptions are [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance]] units, but they only help if there are peons to use as stepping stones), as they will be killed near-instantly by its non-stop attack rate. Therefore, the only [[:Category:Anti-Zombie Cats|anti-Zombie]] [[:Category:Rare Cats|Rare Cats]] that can outrange this monster are [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Corrupted Psychocat]] and [[Archer Cat (Rare Cat)|Cataur]] (365 and 390 respectively), with Target [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] [[Talents|Talent]]. Although Corrupted Psychocat has been well-known to be a reliable support unit, he mostly fails to slow down Cadaver Bear due to his speed and short range differences. Cataur, however, can be a very potent attacker, especially with the [[Special Abilities#Zombie Killer|Zombie Killer]] Talent unlocked. Tanky units such as [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist Cat]] or [[Wushu Cat (Rare Cat)|Sifu Cat]] can also be used to chip or stall Cadaver Bear, hopefully down to a point where you could then send a Zombie Killer to finish him off. All units from the [[Frontline Assault Iron Legion (Gacha Event)|Iron Legion]] event are exceptional counters to this enemy, as long as they're protected by meatshields, as their range generally keeps them safe while their anti-zombie abilities could handle it well. As a rule of thumb, '''DO NOT LET CADAVER BEAR REVIVE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES'''. Best case scenario, it revives at the enemy base, giving you a little bit more trouble. Worst case scenario, it revives in front of or in the middle of your attackers and quickly demolishes them. Its burrow could also prove problematic, so be prepared to have your [[Ototo Development Team#Holy Blast|Holy Blast]] ready. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 427 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Cadaver Bear |enemy_endesc1 = Made up of the strongest parts from several
expired [[Teacher Bear]]s. The head wouldn't
sit right, so it had to be bolted on.
Urge to kill seems to be growing... |image1 = Enemy icon 427.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 死んだクマをつなぎ合わせて
作られた恐ろしいクマ。ボルトで
つないだ頭部が生前と形が違うことに
気づき、殺意が芽生え始めた。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A terrifying bear made by piecing together other bears who
passed away. After noticing that the bolted-on head has
a different shape from when it was alive, the urge to kill began to grow. |Enemy name (JP) = クマンケン (Kumanken) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Into the Future]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Dread Bore''' (シノシシ ''Shinoshishi'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] found in [[Into the Future]]'s [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy_Info |name = Dread Bore |image = Dread Bore.jpg |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]] '''UL''': [[Morbid Mesa|Sub-chapter 8 - Morbid Mesa]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's Crater|Sub-chapter 41 - Hell's Crater]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 7,110¢ }} ==Enemy== Compared to Bore, Dread Bore gains the usual Zombie abilities of burrow + revive and moves significantly faster, but its other stats are more or less the same. However, because there are far fewer [[:Category:Anti-Zombie Cats|Anti-Zombie cats]] than there are [[:Category:Anti-Red Cats|Anti-Red cats]], it will often prove to be much harder to deal with. Its money drop is notably quite high for a Zombie enemy. ==Strategy== It is critical to use Cats that can inflict status effects on Dread Bore to bring him to a halt. But beware as this enemy will burrow under your front line, blocking the way and attacking incoming units. This can be a problem when combined with other enemies that you need a consistent stream of meatshields for, like [[Lord Gravey (Zombie)|Lord Gravey]]. To keep Dread Bore at bay, options from the [[:Category:Rare Cats|Rare]] category include [[Welterweight Cat (Rare Cat)|Heavyweight Cat]], [[Gardener Cat (Rare Cat)|Lumbercat]], [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Magica Cat]], [[Talents|Talented]] [[Witch Cat (Rare Cat)|Enchantress Cat]] and Talented [[Psychocat (Rare Cat)|Corrupted Psychocat]]. In terms of [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]]/[[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rares]], anti-Zombies are obviously the way to go; the longer they can stall him for, the better. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 428 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Dread Bore |enemy_endesc1 = Thanks to a tragic accident with a perm

of dreadlocks... and became an ex-Bore.

unplanned image change with a set of dreadlocks. Super
popular in the reggae world nowadays, but was really
aiming for an ''Enka''* debut with a punch perm.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Bakoo''' (ユメミちゃん ''Yumemi-chan'') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] enemy introduced in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Bombergirl (Deadly)|Deeply Dreaming]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Bakoo |image = Bakoo.PNG |appearance = [[Bombergirl (Deadly)|Deeply Dreaming]]
[[A Deeper Dream Stages|A Deeper Dream]]
[[The King & The Maiden]]
[[The Queen & The Maiden]]
[[Heavenly Tower]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== Bakoo is one of the many Deadly [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]]. While she has low HP for an Advent Boss, she has high damage, a fast attack rate and ridiculous range. Even though her standing range may seem very low, she has Long Distance which can reach up to 1,850 range, allowing her to effectively outrange every Cat in the game by at least 600 range. Along with that, she freezes all units in her massive attack area, at a 100% chance. She also has many knockbacks, a flaw which you can take to your advantage. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 431 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Bakoo |enemy_endesc1 = A dream-eating cutie who wanders around
half-awake. Still wears a diaper, even though
she's fourteen. Don't startle this gentle
sleepwalker no matter how loud she snores. |image1 = Enemy icon 431.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = いつも夢を見ている夢見がちなバク。
夢うつつのまま町中を歩き回り、
巨大ないびきでみんなをびっくりさせる。
おねしょが心配でオムツがとれない14歳。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A dreamy tapir who is always dreaming.
Sometimes wanders the town while sleepwalking, startling
everyone with her loud snores. A 14-year-old who can't
get a diaper because she's afraid of wetting the bed. |Enemy name (JP) = ユメミちゃん (Yumemi-chan) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Doremi |The [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of Bakoo. Rather than freezing all of your Cat Units, Doremi only slows them down, but packs much higher stats than Bakoo. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Bombergirl (Deadly)|Deeply Dreaming]]: [[Bombergirl (Deadly)]] *[[A Deeper Dream Stages|A Deeper Dream]]: **[[Wrath of the Dreamer (Deadly)]] **[[Revenge of the Dreamer (Merciless)]] *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 45|Floor 45]] *[[The King & The Maiden]]: [[Bombergirl (Deadly) (King & Maiden)|Bombergirl (Deadly)]] *[[The Queen & The Maiden]]: [[Bombergirl (Deadly) (Queen & Maiden)|Bombergirl (Deadly)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Bakoo |Health = 500,000 HP |Attack Power = 10,000 damage
(3,529.41 DPS) |Attack Range = 180
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 85f 2.83 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 10 times |Occurrence = 49f 1.63s
(36f 1.2s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 150f 5 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 50~1,850) |Element = Black }} ==Gallery== Bakoospritesheet.png|Bakoo's spritesheet IdleBakoo.gif|Bakoo's moving animation Medal 033.png|Bakoo on the ''Time to Wake Up'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] RealTapir.jpg|Bakoo's real-life counterpart, the Malayan tapir (''Acrocodia indica'') ==Trivia== *She is based on the ''[[wikipedia:Baku (mythology)|baku]]'', a Japanese mythical creature that devours dreams. **The Japanese term ''baku'' can also refer to a [[wikipedia:Malayan tapir|Malayan tapir]]. *Amongst the first seven [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Bakoo represents the sin of sloth. *Her Japanese name, Yumemi(-chan), literally means "dreaming" or "dream". *Bakoo, [[Black Cyclone (Black/Floating)|Black Cyclone]], [[Dark Lazer (Enemy)|Dark Lazer]] and [[Two Can (Red/Black)|Two Can]] are the only [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black Enemies]] whose eyes are not red. *She has the lowest health of all [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]] and is tied with [[Doremi]] for the shortest standing range and longest reach of all Advent Bosses. **She also has the longest effective range of all Black enemies. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/433.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sister Lione''' (獅子姉妹 ''Shishi Shimai'', '''Sister Lion''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy introduced in [[Another New Year (Monthly Event)|Another New Year]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sister Lione |image = Sister lione.png |appearance = [[Another New Year (Monthly Event)|Another New Year]]
[[January Gauntlet II]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 12|Infernal Tower - Floor 12]] |money drop = 1,800¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== She is slower than the original Mooth, but she has higher health, longer range, and the ability to weaken Cat Units. She loses the 1-knockback characteristic of most of Mooth's variants. ==Strategy== Using [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Kotatsu Cat]] is a very viable strategy to stall and weaken Sister Lione. Also, [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Lizard Cat]] and [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Lizard Cat]] both outrange Sister Lione by 25. Thus, they should be able to quickly deal with her when paired with Kotatsu Cat. She normally acts as support, hiding behind the frontlines. Therefore, [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]] or [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attack Cats]] can focus on her while other units deal with the front. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Another New Year (Monthly Event)|Another New Year]]: **[[Chores Unending]] (100%) **[[Unknown Relatives]] (150%) **[[I Hope It's an Uber]] (200%) **[[Different from the Ad]] (200%) **[[Just What I Wanted]] (200%) *[[January Gauntlet II]]: **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.11]] (200%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.12]] (222%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.13]] (244%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.14]] (266%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.15]] (288%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.16]] (310%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.17]] (332%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.18]] (354%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.19]] (376%) **[[January Gauntlet II/Another Year Lv.11~20|Another Year Lv.MAX]] (400%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 12|Floor 12]] (300%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Sister Lione |Health = 140,000 HP |Attack Power = 8,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Lucky Dags''' (幸福の犬 ''Kōfuku no Inu'', lit. "'''The Dog of Happiness'''") is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of [[Dagshund]] introduced in [[Ritual Confusion (Monthly Event)|Ritual Confusion]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Lucky Dags |image = Lucky Dags.jpg |appearance = [[Ritual Confusion (Monthly Event)|Ritual Confusion]]
[[February Gauntlet II]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 13|Infernal Tower - Floor 13]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ }} ==Enemy== Lucky Dags is a Single Target enemy, which makes it very easy when on its own. However, it compensates for this with very high damage and a rapid attack rate, meaning that any cat that gets hit is a lost cause. It is particularly dangerous when stacked, as groups of Lucky Dagses can attack faster than one can spam cats. ==Strategy== Make sure to spam meatshields at all times. You can prioritize the cheaper ones because Lucky Dags can instantly kill most meatshields other than high leveled [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] or [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]]. Using units with high DPS like [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ring Girl Cat]] is a good idea, because Lucky Dags can't hit them even if they are in its range. Fast units such as [[Valkyrie Cat (Special Cat)|Valkyrie Cat]] may not work when there are multiple of them, because immediately after the first group of meatshields die, Valkyrie Cat charges ahead of the second group, getting killed instantly. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Ritual Confusion (Monthly Event)|Ritual Confusion]]: **[[Hang onto Happiness]] (100%) **[[Silent Family]] (150%) **[[Eat Happy Sushi]] (200%) **[[Expired Joy]] (250%) **[[Sins and Blessings]] (300%) *[[February Gauntlet II]]: **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.11]] (300%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.12]] (333%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.13]] (366%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.14]] (399%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.15]] (432%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.16]] (465%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.17]] (498%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.18]] (531%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.19]] (564%) **[[February Gauntlet II/Confusion Lv.11~20|Confusion Lv.MAX]] (600%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 13|Floor 13]] (500%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter_Stats |Enemy = Lucky Dags |Health = 100,000 HP |Attack Power = 24,000 damage

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Primeval Cyclone''' (エンシェントサイクロン, ''Enshento Saikuron'', '''Ancient Cyclone''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy introduced in [[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)|Typhoon Nemo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Primeval Cyclone |image = Reliccyclone.png |appearance = [[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)|Typhoon Nemo]]
[[Typhoon Nihil Stages|Typhoon Nihil]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 38|Infernal Tower - Floor 38]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Compared to other [[Cyclone]]s, Primeval Cyclone moves very fast at 18 speed. However, it has a relatively low damage output (7,777), which allows it to be stopped via [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]]. This applies before the activation of its [[Special Abilities#Strengthen|strengthen]] ability, which triples its damage to 23,331 per hit. ==Strategy== [[Delinquent Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Ultra Delinquent Cat]], [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapstick Cats]], [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]], [[Talents|Talented]] [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Rodeo Cat]], Talented [[Fortune Teller Cat (Rare Cat)|Doctor Cat]], and [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]] are good units for this enemy. Strategies based around [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] may need a [[Battle Items#Rich Cat|Rich Cat]] in order to work. [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super_Rare_Cat)|Prof. Cat Jobs]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and "Weaken" Effect UP [[Cat Combo|Combos]] (ex. [[Power of Darkness (Combo)|Power of Darkness]], [[Cat High (Combo)|Cat High]]) is another way to defeat it, as he can weaken this enemy's damage to a pathetic 77. If you decide to use Prof. Cat Jobs, it is important you '''DO NOT''' bring Thaumaturge Cat, Talented Slapstick Cats, [[Red Riding Mina (Special Cat)|Awakened Mina]] or any other cat that can weaken Relic enemies, as their effects will override Prof. Cat Jobs's superior weaken ability. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 438 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Primeval Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = The most ancient of cyclones, born from
the Big Bang itself. Hasn't weakened even
after devouring the dinosaurs. Inflicts Curse,
grows stronger after taking damage. |image1 = Enemy icon 438.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 遥か昔に発生した地球最古のサイクロン。
恐竜を一掃してなお吸引力は衰えない。
特殊効果を封印する「古代の呪い」を持ち
自らの消滅が近づくと破壊力が増すという。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The oldest cyclone that occurred long ago. Its suction
power hasn't gone down even after wiping out the dinosaurs.
Has an "Ancient Curse" that seals special effects. It is said
that its destructive power increases as its own extinction draws near. |Enemy name (JP) = エンシェントサイクロン (Enshento Saikuron, Ancient Cyclone) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Typhoon Nemo: [[Charybdis' Mouth (Merciless)]] *[[Typhoon Nihil Stages|Typhoon Nihil]]: **[[Creation's Gyre (Merciless)]] **[[Extinction's Vortex (Merciless)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 38|Floor 38]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Primeval Cyclone |Health = 2,333,333 HP |Attack Power = 7,777 damage

100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 450f 15 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== HD Primeval Cyclone.png|HD Primeval Cyclone RelicCycloneSpritesheet.png|Primeval Cyclone's spritesheet Green circle.gif|Primeval Cyclone's animations Medal 027.png|Primeval Cyclone on the ''Ancient Tempest'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Primeval Cyclone has the fastest attack rate and highest DPS of all [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic Enemies]]. *Primeval Cyclone is the fastest Cyclone. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/440.html ----

Not to be confused with [[Saber (Enemy)]].}} '''Saber Alter''' (セイバーオルタ) is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in the [[Fate/Stay Night: Heaven's Feel Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Saber Alter |image = Saberalterbattle.png |appearance = [[Fate/Stay Night: Heaven's Feel Collaboration Event]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Saber Alter is an enemy that has massive health, a Lv.3 [[Wave Attack]] and a powerful [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]]. Her base damage is fairly moderate, but with the wave, it jumps up to 16,000 damage, which is quite a formidable number for her fast attack rate and movement speed. Her weaknesses are her large knockback count and fairly low base range. ==Strategy== [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] is recommended to be used against her, as Octopus can block the waves she creates. Otherwise, tankers like [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]] or [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Roe Cat]] are ideal; or [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|anti-Traitless cats]] such as [[Mightycat (Rare Cat)|Supercat]], who is able to both block her waves and [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] her. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Holy War: Saber Alter Stages|Holy War: Saber Alter]]: **[[Consumed by Shadow (Veteran)]] (15%) **[[Consumed by Shadow (Deadly)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Saber Alter |Health = 1,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 8,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Ms. Madonna''' (マドンナ先生 ''Madonna-sensei'', '''Teacher Madonna''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy introduced in [[Spring for Sensei (Monthly Event)|Spring for Sensei]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Ms. Madonna |image = MsMadonna.jpg |appearance = [[Spring for Sensei (Monthly Event)|Spring for Sensei]]
[[April Gauntlet II]]
[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Ms. Madonna has many knockbacks, short range and an Area Attack with a 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] cats and create a Lv.3 [[Wave Attack]]. This enemy can be dealt with very easily when she's alone, but when supported by heavy hitters such as [[Teacher Bun Bun (Floating)|Teacher Bun Bun]] or [[Zang Roo (Zombie)|Zang Roo]], she can become quite the nuisance. ==Strategy== Due to Ms. Madonna's low damage output, the player can use tanky units like [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Island Cat]] or [[Titan Cat (Normal Cat)|Jamiera Cat]], or [[:Category:Cats with Wave Immunity|Wave Immune cats]] like [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)|Miyamoku Musashi]]. Note that due to being knocked back with the first attack, [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] will not block the wave attack if it's in Ms. Madonna's range (130 < 200). You can also use [[:Category:Cats with Knockback Immunity|cats that are immune to knockback]] to prevent the enemies' front line from moving forward. This is especially important in later stages, where there are powerful backliners that could advance. It is best to defeat her as fast as possible as she can become an annoying support for the enemies. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Spring for Sensei (Monthly Event)|Spring for Sensei]]: **[[Faculty Change]] (100%) **[[You in a Petri Dish]] (150%) **[[Dangerous Equations]] (150%) **[[Litmus of Love]] (200%) **[[U + Me = Photosynthesis]] (300%) *[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Floor 7#Traitless|Floor 7]] (100%) *[[April Gauntlet II]]: **[[April Gauntlet II/Sensei! wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For other uses, see [[God (disambiguation)|God]].}} '''Final Boss Giga-God (Cool Dude)''' (ファイナルギガグランド神さま ''Fainaru Giga Gurando Kami-sama'', '''Final Giga Grand God''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy seen as the boss of [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] in [[Cats of the Cosmos]] Chapter 3. {{Enemy Info |name = Final Boss Giga-God |image = Screenshot (7).png |appearance = '''CotC''': [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|Chapter 3 - The Big Bang]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== This is the weakest version of Cat God in terms of HP. He has only 1 million HP, while maintaining the same knockbacks as his other variants. However, this Cat God is more support-oriented, because his main ability is to generate a Lv.12 [[Wave Attack]] that [[Warp|warps]] every cat it hits back 1,500 range, letting the peons destroy the [[Cat Base]] or letting him advance to destroy the base with his final strike. ==Strategy== The [[Mesocosmocyclone (Alien)|Mesocosmocyclones]] will teleport your cats forward to let Giga-God generate his warp wave attack and let the peons push to your base, but you can send weak meatshields or cats with the [[Special Abilities#Warp Blocker|Warp Blocker]] ability to be knocked back instead of being teleported forward by Mesocosmocyclones to avoid generating the wave. [[Rover Cat (Rare Cat)|Catellite]] is not the best at doing this due to his one knockback, but can instead stall the Mesocosmocyclones. Another way to deal with his wave is staying near your base. While he teleport some cats, fast meatshields like [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Mohawk]] or [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser]] can reach Giga-God before he finishes his animation shortly after they leave the base, stalling him pretty successfully. Rush units with no foreswing like [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]] and [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]] are pretty effective here, because they will be teleported after dealing some damage and they can attack again once they are teleported back, dealing continuous damage until they die. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 446 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Final Boss Giga-God (Cool Dude) |enemy_endesc1 = Oho, we meet again! Cat God isn't defeated
that easily! Yeah, you've done okay in that last
Cosmos chapter, I guess. Maybe you've
finally earned the right to be my sidekick... |image1 = Enemy icon 446.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 会うのは3回目だね、神さまです！
宇宙は無事、侵略できたかな？
突然だけどなぞなぞ出しまーす！
めっちゃカッコよくって皆に好かれて…… |enemy_jpdesc1 = This is the 3rd time you've met me: God!
Was the invasion of the universe a success?
And now, I'll give you a riddle!
It's incredibly handsome and everyone likes it... |Enemy name (JP) = ファイナルギガグランド神さま (Fainaru Giga Gurando Kami-sama, Final Giga Grand God) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]]=== *Stage 3-48: [[The Big Bang (Cats of the Cosmos)|The Big Bang]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Final Boss Giga-God (Cool Dude) |Health = 999,999* HP |Attack Power = 73,997* damage
(4,944.12* DPS) |Attack Range = 800
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 449f (14.97 seconds) |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 90f 3s
(51f 1.7s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (3,999 at 90f 3s, 3,999 at 120f 4s, 65,999 at 150f 5s);
100% chance to create a level 12 [[Wave Attack]] on the first hit
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Warp|warp]] [[Cat Units]] back by 1,500 range for 90f 3 seconds on the first hit
''*Stats shown are with a completed Ch. 3 [[Mystery Mask]].'' |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 446 e.png|Final Boss Giga-God (Cool Dude)'s spritesheet Walking god with clothes.gif|Final Boss Giga-God (Cool Dude)'s animations ==Trivia== *His design is based on Christ's depiction in ''[[wikipedia:The Last Judgment (Michelangelo)|The Last Judgment]]'' by Michelangelo. * During the third hit of his attack, his pose is almost the same as Ultimate Kars' in the second ''[[wikipedia:JoJo's Bizarre Adventure|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]]'' opening, "BLOODY STREAM". *Despite being listed as a Cool Dude in the Enemy Guide, he is actually considered a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy. *He has the highest attack power of any Traitless enemy. *His name implies that he created the enemy encyclopedia and recorded his trait as ‘Cool Dude’. **Additionally, his description breaks the fourth wall, talking about the last [[Cats of the Cosmos]] chapter. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/448.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For other uses, see [[Filibuster Cat (disambiguation)]].}} '''Filibuster Obstructa''' (スターフィリバスター ''Sutā Firibasutā'', '''Star Filibuster''') is an enemy that appears in [[Cats of the Cosmos]] Chapter 3. He appears in his own [[Filibuster Invasion (Cats of the Cosmos)|special stage]] that works like [[Zombie Outbreaks]], albeit in Cats of the Cosmos Chapter 3, and it is only available once the chapter is completed. After clearing the stage, he will be unlocked as the [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]], [[Filibuster Cat X (Special Cat)|Filibuster Cat X]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Filibuster Obstructa |image = Filibusterobstructa.PNG |appearance = '''CotC''': [[Filibuster Invasion (Cats of the Cosmos)|Filibuster Invasion]] |money drop = 6,000¢ - 23,700¢ }} ==Enemy== Filibuster Obstructa will always destroy the [[Cat Base]] in one hit and can reach it no matter how far away he is. Your goal is to prevent him from ever completing his attack animation. His attack animation is 40 seconds long and he has 200 knockbacks, making it fairly easy to interrupt him, as only 10,000 damage is needed to trigger a knockback. The problem lies in his immunity to the [[Cat Cannon]] and [[Wave Attack]]s, not to mention his massive range, which makes him hard to reach with all kinds of enemies in front of him. ==Strategy== :''See [[Filibuster Invasion (Cats of the Cosmos)]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 447 |enemy category = Alien/Floating |Enemy name = Filibuster Obstructa |enemy_endesc1 = After millennia lost among the stars, a
strange force once again wreaks havoc
on the Galactic Cat Empire. The chaos
it wields may rewrite the laws of reality... |image1 = Enemy icon 447.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 星々の間を彷徨いながら
破壊を繰り返す謎の生命体。
その凄まじき超絶破壊力は
宇宙の構造すら書き換える。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A mysterious lifeform who causes repeated
destruction while roaming the stars.
Its unfathomable destructive power can
rewrite even the structure of the universe. |Enemy name (JP) = スターフィリバスター (Sutā Firibasutā, Star Filibuster) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Cats of the Cosmos]]=== *Stage 3-IN: [[Filibuster Invasion (Cats of the Cosmos)|Filibuster Invasion]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Filibuster Obstructa |Health = 2,000,000* HP |Attack Power = 1,000,000* damage
(22,205* DPS) |Attack Range = 2,000
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 1,351f 45.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 30 |Knockback = 200 times |Occurrence = 1,200f 40s
(151f 5.03s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 300~4,300)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Immune to Waves]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]]
''*Stats shown are with all [[Anti-Starred Alien Treasures]].'' |Element = StarredAlien/Floating }} ==Gallery== Filibuster Spritesheet.png|Filibuster Obstructa's spritesheet File:THISTOOKAGES.gif|Filibuster Obstructa's animations ==Trivia== *He is based on [[Evangelist Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Evangelist Cat]]'s Evolved Form, Filibuster Cat. **"Obstructa" could be a reference to Filibuster Cat's Japanese description, which states that he can "obstruct the flow". *He is the only [[:Category:Starred Alien Enemies|Starred Alien]] to have neither [[Warp]] nor [[Barrier]] abilities. *He has the highest base attack power of all enemies, standing at 1 million, barely surpassing the [[Scarecrow (Enemy Base)|Scarecrow]]'s and [[Teacher Cybear (Metal)|Teacher Cybear]]'s 999,999 damage. However, due to his 45.03-second attack rate, he's still a long way off from having the highest DPS. *He has the longest effective range and is tied with [[Angry Sun (Event Enemy)|Angry Sun]] for the second-longest standing range of all enemies, with [[Shin Godzilla (Enemy)|Shin Godzilla]] in first place. *He has the longest attack foreswing of all enemies. *Prior to version 8.3.2, Filibuster Obstructa had an effective range of 50~4050, rather than 300~4300. This would cause him to stand 50 range away from the base, and thus in front of the enemies designed to protect him. This change was made to prevent the player from cheesing him easily with [[Sniper the Cat]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/449.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''HaterBaa 2.0''' (柏餅2.0, '''''[[wikipedia:Kashiwa mochi|Kashiwa Mochi]] 2.0''''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[Baa Baa]] introduced in [[Lovesick Again (Monthly Event)|Lovesick Again]]. {{Enemy Info |name = HaterBaa 2.0 |image = 2sdDsNH.jpg |appearance = [[Lovesick Again (Monthly Event)|Lovesick Again]]
[[Infernal Tower/Floor 14|Infernal Tower - Floor 14]]
[[May Gauntlet II]] |money drop = 160¢ - 632¢ }} ==Enemy== HaterBaa 2.0 resembles a normal Baa Baa but with the wool texture being flat and covered in a giant oak leaf, aside from having metal legs, head, horns and tail. Its horns appear to have an armoured design, being darker than the rest. When HaterBaa 2.0 is attacking, its outer mochi shell jiggles forward, revealing a metal interior. It has high attack power and DPS, however, due to its Single Target it acts a lot like [[Capy (Red)|Capy]]/[[Lucky Dags (Event Enemy)|Lucky Dags]] with a faster attack rate, albeit weaker. ==Strategy== HaterBaa 2.0 has very low health despite its Metal ability, so fast attackers and cheap units such as meatshields are recommended. [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] and [[Ninja Cat (Special Cat)|Ninja Cat]] work good against this enemy. [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critters]] such as [[Catornado (Super Rare Cat)|Hurricat]] or [[Jurassic Cat (Rare Cat)|Catasaurus]] can also dispatch of HaterBaa 2.0 rather quickly. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Lovesick Again (Monthly Event)|Lovesick Again]]: **[[Pain of Love]] (100%) **[[No Right Swipes]] (100%) **[[Arranged Marriage]] (150%) **[[Biological Hourglass]] (150%) **[[Settling Down]] (10%, 200%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 14|Floor 14]] (200%) *[[May Gauntlet II]]: **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.11]] (200%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.12]] (206%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.13]] (212%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.14]] (218%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.15]] (224%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.16]] (230%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.17]] (236%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.18]] (242%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.19]] (248%) **[[May Gauntlet II/Again Lv.11~20|Again Lv.MAX]] (250%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = HaterBaa 2.0 |Health = 15 HP |Attack Power = 13,500 damage
(14,464 DPS) |Attack Range = 110
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 28f 0.93 seconds |Movement Speed = 10 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 14f 0.47s
(14f 0.47s backswing) |Ability = - |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== 449 e.png|HaterBaa 2.0's spritesheet IdleHaterBaa2'0.gif|HaterBaa 2.0's moving animation ==Trivia== *Its Japanese name is Kashiwa Mochi 2.0, referring to its resemblance to the traditional Japanese snack [[wikipedia:Kashiwa mochi|kashiwa mochi]] eaten on Children's Day - the basis of the [[Love is Sickness (Monthly Event)|Love is Sickness]] and [[Lovesick Again (Monthly Event)|Lovesick Again]] events. *HaterBaa 2.0 is the second enemy, alongside [[Metal Doge (Metal)|Metal Doge]], who has a red flickering light bulb as a tail to represent the [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] trait. **In [[Yuru-i GeGeGe no Kitarou: Youkai Dotabata Daisensou|YuruGeGe]], however, every Metal enemy has one of these bulbs on top of their head. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/451.html ----

For the Cat Unit, see [[Dogumaru (Special Cat)]].}} '''Dogumaru''' (土偶戦士ドグ丸 ''Dogūsenshi Dogumaru'', "'''[[wikipedia:Dogū|Dogū]] Warrior Dogumaru"''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy found in [[Primitive Souls]], the final stage in [[Depths of My Heart]]. He is the enemy version of [[Dogumaru (Special Cat)|Dogumaru]]. {{Enemy_Info |name = Dogumaru |image = Dogumaru.png |appearance = '''UL''': [[Primitive Souls|Sub-chapter 12 - Primitive Souls]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Dogumaru appears to be a half-human, half-horse clay statue bearing the green gem often found on Relic enemies. He attacks by charging a pulse before firing it at the ground, creating a green explosion. His red eyes glares during his attack animation. This enemy behaves like a stronger version of [[Manic King Dragon Cat (Enemy Unit)|Manic King Dragon Cat]], having more health, damage, an already high standing range of 500, an [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] that reaches up to 700 range and a 20-second curse. Due to his reach, he is difficult to attack safely. His main weakness is his somewhat low DPS for a Relic, but keep in mind up to 3 of him are spawned on a timer in [[Primitive Souls]]. When introduced into 2~{{3c}}, his danger increases significantly and is no longer possible Uberless with any degree of simplicity. ==Strategy== :''See [[Primitive Souls]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 450 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Dogumaru |enemy_endesc1 = An ancient fighter excavated by the Doges.

lower body of the horse ''dogū'' that had fallen beside him.
*''Haniwa'' and ''dogū'' are types of ancient clay figurines. 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 600f 20 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== 450 e.png|Dogumaru's spritesheet Green mkd.gif|Dogumaru's animations ==Trivia== *He is based on ancient [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogū#Shakōkidogū ''Shakōkidogū''] figurines, the most recognizable form of ''dogū''. *The word ''maru'' in Dogumaru's name can mean "full" or "whole" in Japanese. This may refer to how being attached to a horse statue's lower body has made Dogumaru complete again, as ''Shakōkidogū'' in real life are seldom found with all of their limbs intact. *For a few reasons, Dogumaru could potentially be a nod to Hanimaru from the children's television program [[wikipedia:ja:おーい!はに丸|''Ōi! Hanimaru'']]: **Both combine the name of an ancient Japanese clay figurine with 丸 ''maru'' (Hanimaru is ''haniwa'', Dogumaru is ''dogū''). **As an enemy, Dogumaru's Japanese description mentions that he was thought to be a ''haniwa''. **Hanimaru is usually seen with his horse ''haniwa'' Hinbei, while enemy Dogumaru's Japanese description states that he was mistakenly attached to the lower body of a horse ''dogū'' that had fallen beside him. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/452.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Awakened Eva Unit-13''' (第13号機 疑似シン化第3+形態（推定）) is an [[:Category:Eva Angel Enemies|Eva Angel]] enemy that appears in the [[Neon Genesis Evangelion Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Awakened Eva Unit-13 |image = AEU13.jpg |appearance = [[Unit-13 Strikes! Stages|Unit-13 Strikes!]] |money drop = 10,000¢ - 39,500¢ }} ==Enemy== Awakened Eva Unit-13 is currently the most powerful Eva Angel from the Evangelion Collaboration, having massive amounts of damage and immunity to almost all status effects excluding [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]]. Along with its ability to knockback, freeze and weaken all Cat Units with a 100% chance. It also has a very long Omni Strike range of -3600~1200. Its negative range combined with its immunity to [[Wave Attack]]s makes cheesing not an option and/or a stressful challenge for many. Thankfully, Unit-13 has low movement speed, low standing range and plenty of knockbacks. However, at 100% strength magnification, it has 4,000,000 HP and 100,000 damage (200,000 damage when strengthened!) and considering all [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|non-immune]] cats will get weakened, it effectively has 8 million HP! Combined with the peons in its [[We'll Meet Again (Merciless)|Merciless]] stage, this Angel can be considered a challenge for many. ==Strategy== The player must have a good timing on sending their units, so using most non-[[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rusher]] [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] is not a good idea, due to most getting killed in a single blow. Any Eva Angel killers are also good to bring. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Collaboration Event Stages|Collaboration Stages]]=== *[[Unit-13 Strikes! Stages|Unit-13 Strikes!]]: **[[It's Not Your Fault (Veteran)]] (15%) **[[We'll Meet Again (Merciless)]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Awakened Eva Unit-13 |Health = 4,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 100,000 damage
(24,590 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 122f 4.06 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 6 times |Occurrence = 54f 1.8s
(68f 2.27s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 150f 5 seconds
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units to 50% for 750f 25 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Strengthen|Strengthens]] by 100% at 50% health
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -3600~1200)

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zuche''' (チキランラン ''Chikiranran'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Duche]] that appears in [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zuche |image = Zombieduche.PNG |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''UL''': [[Steamworks Ltd.|Sub-chapter 17 - Steamworks Ltd.]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hall of Feasting|Sub-chapter 42 - Hall of Feasting]] |money drop = 200¢ - 790¢ }} ==Enemy== Zuche is meant to be a glass cannon. He runs at the speed of a [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]], burrows once, revives with 100% HP and has rapid and ''highly'' damaging multi-hit attacks, but has short range and low health; two or three [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon]] hits are enough to put him out of commission, and many [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]]/[[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rares]] can take him out in one shot. However, he has strong pushing power and can deal heavy damage to your backliners if he burrows into them. In short, he can be recognized as the opposite of his traitless variant, [[Duche]], as Duche is a tank with high health but low attack power. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 468 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zuche |enemy_endesc1 = A mad scientist set his tail on fire

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''The Thrillerz''' (スリラーズ ''Surirāzu'', '''Thrillerz''') are a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Those Guys]] found in [[Into the Future]]'s [[Zombie Outbreaks]], [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = The Thrillerz |image = Thosezombies.PNG |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]] '''UL''': [[Standing Sauna|Sub-chapter 17 - Standing Sauna]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Tear-Soaked Puppy|Sub-chapter 44 - Tear-Soaked Puppy]] |money drop = 75¢ - 296¢ }} ==Enemy== The Thrillerz are more ravenous than your average stick figure, but in some ways also goofier. The one in front has his arms stretched out ahead of him, constantly flailing them around; the middle cadaver is carrying his own disembodied head; and the walker in the back appears to be hunched over. Bad posture aside, The Thrillerz have high DPS, [[Special Abilities#Burrow|burrow]] twice and [[Special Abilities#Revive|revive]] with 100% HP once. They are usually spawned in much greater numbers compared to other Zombies, acting as a fast-moving barricade for the player's meatshields ==Strategy== Their low HP and Single Target makes them very easy to dispose of, for the most part. [[Li'l Bird Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Flying Cat]] and other strong [[:Category:Area Attack Enemies|Area Attackers]] can easily neutralize them. Be wary of their double burrow, as it gives them an opportunity to sneak up to your backlines and possibly leave a dent in it before they are defeated. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 469 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = The Thrillerz |enemy_endesc1 = The guys are never alone in life or in death.
Luckily there was a shuttle bus service
from the cemetery to the battlefield.
Undeath doesn't cure codependency... |image1 = Enemy icon 469.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 一人だと心細いので、トリオで死亡。
墓場から出ているシャトルバスに乗って
「にゃんこ大戦争」に参加した。
三人とも生前からけっこう持病持ち。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = One of them was lonely, so he died in a trio.
Took a shuttle bus from the graveyard to
participate in "The Great Cat War".
All three have had a long-standing illness. |Enemy name (JP) = スリラーズ (Surirāzu, Thrillerz) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 49: [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon/Iriomote]] wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mr. Puffington''' (フグ太くん ''Fugu Futo-kun'') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mr. Puffington |image = Mrpuffington.PNG |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Hot Spring Reception|Sub-chapter 17 - Hot Spring Reception]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Outta This Village|Sub-chapter 45 - Outta This Village]] }} ==Enemy== Mr. Puffington combines some of the qualities found in [[Brollow (Floating)|Brollow]] and [[Rain D.]] and deals much higher damage than all other Relic enemies seen at this point in the game. His close-range attack has 200 piercing range and inflicts [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] for 10 seconds, paralleling the time his attack animation takes to start again. ==Strategy== Do not use units with low damage per hit because they will constantly knock him back, allowing him to attack more times. This is especially dangerous with his [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] as he can kill your whole army in one go, and the units that survive are cursed until his attack starts again with '''no''' downtime. Instead, use units with high damage per hit like [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapsticks]]. [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi]] can also be put to great use, as her 200k+ damage versus relics per hit will tear him down in no time. [[Special Abilities#Slow|Slow]] is a great debuff against him, as his standing range is quite low. [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]] is good for this, as he has a massive range advantage over him. However, do pay attention to the contents of each stage he appears in, as they each feature a different niche and thus must be worked around. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 477 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Mr. Puffington |enemy_endesc1 = Branch manager of an undersea trading
company. Once known for his poisonous
personality, marriage has made him more
approachable in spite of his prickly looks. |image1 = Enemy icon 477.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 海底の商社に勤めるサラリーマン。
結婚して、妻の実家に養子として
転がり込んだ。トゲのある性格だったが
最近は丸くなったともっぱらの噂。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Salaryman who works for an undersea trading company.
After getting married, he rolled into his wife's home as a foster child.
Used to have a prickly personality, but lately the talk's been that he's become more rounded. |Enemy name (JP) = フグ太くん (Fugu Futo-kun) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Puffsley's Comet |Mr. Puffington's [[:Category:Alien Enemies|Alien]] variant, seen as the boss in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Puffer Planet (Merciless)|Blue Impact]]. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Black Okame''' (阿亀我王 ''Okame Gaō'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]] variant of [[Hannya (Red)|Hannya]] first seen in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[The Pure Land (Merciless)|Courts of Torment]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Black Okame |image = [[File:Blackhannya.PNG]] |appearance = [[The Pure Land (Merciless)|Courts of Torment]]
[[Courts of Agony Stages]] |money drop = 4,500¢ - 17,775¢}} ==Enemy== Though it resembles Hannya in more ways than one, Black Okame has plenty of differences and is overall tougher than its predecessor. While it inflicts less damage than Hannya, it has more than double the health with only one knockback, attacks almost twice as frequently, and possesses long-ranged [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] attacks with a 100% chance of [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|freeze immunity]]. It has only one weakness: as a Red and Black hybrid enemy, there are a wide range of units which might be effective against it, assuming they're sturdy, [[:Category:Cats with Knockback Immunity|immune to knockback]], outrange it, or is a [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|rusher]] unit. ==Strategy== :''See [[The Pure Land (Merciless)]], [[Heaven and Hell (Merciless)]] and [[Okame's Teahouse (Merciless)]] for each stage's strategy.'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 491 |enemy category = Red/Black |Enemy name = Black Okame |enemy_endesc1 = A malicious expression hides behind this
traditional image of innocent maidenhood.
Seeking revenge on everyone who has
taken advantage of youthful naivete. |image1 = Enemy icon 491.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 漆黒の仮面に秘められた悪しき乙女心が
群がる男衆に悪意の吐息を撒き散らす。
立ちはだかる者をふきとばして進む
その衝動は誰にも止められない |enemy_jpdesc1 = The jet-black mask hides an evil maiden's heart,
breathing pure malice upon men.
None can stop the urge to knockback all who stand in the way. |Enemy name (JP) = 阿亀我王 (Okame Gaō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Courts of Torment: [[The Pure Land (Merciless)]] *[[Courts of Agony Stages]]: **[[Heaven and Hell (Merciless)]] **[[Okame's Teahouse (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Black Okame |Health = 2,600,000 HP |Attack Power = 24,000 damage
(11,428.57 DPS) |Attack Range = 320
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 63f (2.1 seconds) |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 24f 0.8s
(17f 0.57s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|Knockback]] all Cat Units
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -200~800)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Immune to Freeze]] |Element = Red/Black }} ==Gallery== Okamemedal.png|Black Okame on the ''Tormented'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] OkameSprite.png|Black Okame's spritesheet IdleBlackOkame.gif|Black Okame's moving animation ==Trivia== *An Okame or Otafuku is a mask used in ''[[wikipedia:Kyōgen|Kyōgen]]'' theater to represent a positive female and good luck-bringer being; the distaff counterpart to [[wikipedia:Hyottoko|Hyottoko]]. *Black Okame can be seen as a foil to [[Hannya (Red)|Hannya]]. Where Hannya's mask is a symbol of bitterness and jealousy, Okame's represents felicity and blessings. *As a symbol of innocent maidenhood, Black Okame represents the virtue of chastity amongst the Tier 2 [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]]. *The word Gaō in Black Okame's Japanese name, Okame Gaō (阿亀我王), doesn't mean anything on its own and is just a pun on ''kao'' (顔), meaning "face", though it can rarely also be a person's name. It consists of the kanji for "ego" or "self-assertion" (我) and "king" (王). *Hannya's Japanese description mentions that she consumes the souls of those who cannot gain enlightenment, with the term used, ''jōbutsu'' (成仏) specifically referring to attaining Buddhahood. This theme of Buddhism is continued with several of Black Okame's stage names: **[[The Pure Land (Merciless)|Courts of Torment]]'s Japanese name is Narakumon (奈落門), which literally translates to "Hell Gate" or "Gates of Hell". However, the term used for Hell is ''naraku'', which refers to a [[wikipedia:Naraka|Naraka]], the Buddhist equivalent of Hell. **A "[[The Pure Land (Merciless)|pure land]]" is a concept in Mayahayan Buddhism, its many traditions and teachings falling into the branch of [[wikipedia:Pure Land Buddhism|Amidism/Pure Land Buddhism]]. Reaching the Pure Land is the final goal of Amidism and is tantamount to attaining enlightenment. **The opposite of the Pure Land is the land of the living, also called the Impure Land, which appears in [[Heaven and Hell (Merciless)|Heaven and Hell]]'s Japanese name. *Black Okame is currently the only Tier 2 Advent Boss whose [[Medusa Cat (Rare Cat)|drop]] has its own [[:Category:Awakening Stages|Awakening Stages]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/493.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Heavenly Herald Papuu''' (聖者ポプウ ''Seija Popuu'', '''Saint Popuu''') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Daboo of the Dead (Zombie)|Daboo of the Dead]] that appears in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Saintly Sister (Merciless)|Papuu's Paradise]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Heavenly Herald Papuu |image = Saintpopa.PNG |appearance = [[Saintly Sister (Merciless)|Papuu's Paradise]] |money drop = 4,444¢ - 17,553¢ }} ==Enemy== Heavenly Herald Papuu is overall weaker than Daboo of the Dead, with less health and damage, but has a significantly longer [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] range, increased speed, only 1 knockback, plus a shorter battlefield in her debut stage, allowing her to hit the [[Cat Base]] from afar and a faster attack rate. Her attack power is surprisingly low for an advent boss, but her 40% [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] ability allows her to destroy any non-immune units in up to three hits. She retains her predecessor's immunities with the addition of wave immune, and her base damage is tripled at 30% HP. While having more than 30% health, Papuu eliminates cats with... *0 ~ 6,666 health in one attack. *6,667 ~ 40,000 health in two attacks. *40,001~ health in three attacks. While having less than 30% health, Papuu eliminates cats with... *0 ~ 20,000 health in one attack. *20,001 ~ 120,000 health in two attacks. *120,001~ health in three attacks. ==Strategy== :''See [[Saintly Sister (Merciless)]].'' ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 492 |enemy category = Angel |Enemy name = Heavenly Herald Papuu |enemy_endesc1 = Her Archangel qualifying exams are coming

Any Cats who interrupt her studies will be
punished with her Toxic magics. Shhhh! |image1 = Enemy icon 492.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 大天使を目指して今日も猛勉強の女の子。
彼女の分厚い本にはお勉強のための心得と
他人を蹴落とす真っ黒な在技が書かれている。
会得した毒撃で静かに確実に仕留める。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A girl who is studying hard today to become an archangel.
Her thick book is filled with tips for studying
and dirty tricks for kicking others to the curb.
The Toxic attack she learned kills slowly but surely. |Enemy name (JP) = 聖者ポプウ (Seija Popuu, Saint Popuu) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Papuu's Paradise: [[Saintly Sister (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Heavenly Herald Papuu |Health = 2,500,000 HP |Attack Power = 4,000 damage

([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 220f 7.33 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 91f 3.03s

[[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Immune to Waves]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]] |Element = Angel }} ==Gallery== Angel Daboo HD.png|HD Heavenly Herald Papuu 492 e.png|Heavenly Herald Papuu's spritesheet IdleHeavenlyHeraldPappu.gif|Heavenly Herald Papuu's moving animation Angeldaboomedal.png|Heavenly Herald Papuu on the ''Vox Deus'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Amongst the Tier 2 [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Heavenly Herald Papuu represents the virtue of diligence. *She can be seen as a foil to [[Daboo of the Dead (Zombie)|Daboo of the Dead]]. Daboo is an unholy [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] who is told by his 'Poppa' that his education is important, but he would rather read trashy horror comics. Papuu, on the other hand, is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] who takes her studies seriously, reading her textbook wherever she goes. *She is the first enemy to have the Toxic ability. *She has the longest negative omni strike range of all enemies. *She has the lowest base DPS of all Advent Bosses. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/494.html ----

In his [[Flow Like the Stream (Merciless)|first]] [[Guided by Currents (Merciless)|two]] appearances, his short range and slightly delayed attack make it easy for him to miss when the [[Scissoroo (Alien)|Scissoroos]] are still on the field, but once they're dead, beating him becomes heavily dependent on luck. ==Strategy== :''See each stage's article for strategies.'' ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 495 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Kappy Jr. |image1 = Enemy icon 495.png |enemy_endesc1 = This little monster always looks at peace
munching cucumbers in the pond,
until the moment he snaps and blasts
you with a wild Surge Attack! |Enemy name (JP) = かわわっぱJr. (Kawawappa Jr.) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = キュウリの舌ざわりが気に入り
四六時中無心でくわえ続けている妖怪の子。
穏やかに過ごしていたかと思うと突然、
烈火のごとく怒り「烈波」を放つ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A ''yōkai'' child who likes the texture of
cucumber and holds it in his mouth all the time.
Suddenly, when you think that he is calm, like a
raging fire, he releases a furious "Intense Wave".}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Flow Like the Stream (Merciless)|Bottom of the Swamp]]: [[Flow Like the Stream (Merciless)|Flow Like the Stream]] *[[Top of the Bog Stages|Top of the Bog]]: **[[Guided by Currents (Merciless)|Guided by Currents]] **[[Water Conservancy (Merciless)|Water Conservancy]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Kappy Jr. |Health = 2,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 38,000 damage
(14,430 DPS) |Attack Range = 230
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 79f 2.63 seconds |Movement Speed = 14 |Knockback = 6 times |Occurrence = 40f 1.33s
(39f 1.3s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to create a level 1 [[Surge Attack]] for 20f 0.67 seconds between 150 and 750 range |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== 495 e.png|Kappy Jr.'s spritesheet IdleSurgeDemon.gif|Kappy Jr.'s moving animation Medal 072.png|Kappy Jr. on the ''Murky Details'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *He is based on the ''[[wikipedia:Kappa_(folklore)|kappa]]'', an amphibious, reptilian, humanoid ''yōkai'' with a penchant for cucumbers. *His Japanese name, Kawawappa Jr., is a deconstruction of ''kappa''; a portmanteau of ''kawa'', meaning "river", and ''wappa'', meaning "child". *His name may be a reference to Bowser Jr., a ''Mario'' character whose Japanese name is Kappa Jr. *If counting [[Cruel Angel Clionel (Angel)|Cruel Angel Clionel]] the eighth Deadly Sin, despair/despond, then Kappy Jr. can replace her as the Tier 1 [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]]' representation of wrath. *He was the first enemy to have the [[Surge Attack]] ability. *Unlike most of the Advent Bosses, he is the main pushing force of every stage he appears in, rather than being ranged support for the peons. *Even without the Surge Attacks, he would have the highest DPS of any Advent Boss. *He is the only Tier 1 Advent Boss who doesn't apply a status effect or knockback. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/497.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article is about the enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Urs & Fenrir (Special Cat)]].}} '''Urs & Fenrir''' (フェンリルとウルス ''Fenriru to Urusu'', '''Fenrir and Urs''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy that appears in the final stage of [[The Gelatin Mines]], [[Lifesaving Shovel]]. When defeated, they may be unlocked as the [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] [[Urs & Fenrir (Special Cat)|Urs & Fenrir]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Urs & Fenrir |image = Relicurz.PNG |appearance = '''UL''': [[Lifesaving Shovel|Sub-chapter 21 - Lifesaving Shovel]] |money drop = 1,400¢ - 5,530¢ }} ==Enemy== While they are a variant of [[Ururun Wolf (Enemy Unit)|Ururun Wolf]], they behave a bit differently: they have only 50,000 more health, a third the speed and a notably shorter range standing at 300 (as opposed to 415), but their [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] allows them to hit units up to 500 range away from them. With their high DPS, they can push significantly. If that wasn't enough, they have only half the number of knockbacks, while having 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] and [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] cats for 4 seconds. ==Strategy== :''See [[Lifesaving Shovel]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 496 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Urs & Fenrir |enemy_endesc1 = Guardians of the primeval wilderness.
No intruder into their sacred forest has
ever walked out alive. Only those who
defeat them can peek behind the mask. |image1 = Enemy icon 496.png |Enemy name (JP) = フェンリルとウルス (Fenriru to Urusu, Fenrir and Urs) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 原始の密林を守護する獣と番人。
いにしえの時から、ナワバリを侵す
外敵を極めて残忍に戒めてきた。
仮面の下を暴くのは誰であれ厳禁。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Beast and guardian, protectors of the primeval jungle.
Since ancient times, they have brutally kept out anyone who has dared to intrude upon their territory.
It is strictly forbidden for them to reveal what lies under the mask.}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 21-6: [[Lifesaving Shovel]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Urs & Fenrir |Health = 750,000 HP |Attack Power = 35,000 damage
(6,730 DPS) |Attack Range = 300
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 156f 5.2 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 69f 2.3s
(25f 0.83s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units to 10% for 120f 4 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -500~500)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== 496 e.png|Urs & Fenrir's spritesheet green ururun.gif|Urs & Fenrir's animations ==Trivia== *Urs is the rider, Fenrir is the wolf. *In Norse mythology, [[wikipedia:Fenrir|Fenrir]] is a monstrous wolf and child of Loki and a giantess, Angrboða. *Urs is potentially an ancestor of [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]], as referred to in the ending of [[Legend Stages#Stories of Legend|Stories of Legend]]. *They are one of the four cursing enemies whose curse duration is lower than their attack rate, the others being [[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]], [[Haniwanwan (Relic)|Haniwanwan]] and [[Golem Sunfish (Relic, Floating)|Golem Sunfish]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/498.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Croconator''' (ワーニネーター ''Wāninētā'', "'''Croconator'''") is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Croconator |image = Metal croco.png |first appearance = '''UL:''' [[Lifesaving Shovel|Sub-chapter 21 - Lifesaving Shovel]] |latest appearance = '''UL:''' [[The Face of God|Sub-chapter 36 - The Face of God]] |money drop = 150¢ - 592¢ }} ==Enemy== Croconator is unusually weak for a late-game enemy, comparable to a much weaker [[Metal Doge (Metal)|Metal Doge]]. He only has 5 HP at 100% strength magnification and doesn't inflict too much damage. They are sometimes spawned in swarms, such as in [[A Boat Too Far]] and [[A Dutiful Prayer]]. ==Strategy== Croconators usually aren't a threat, just meatshield normally and they'll die rather soon because they only take several hits to kill. [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]] can sweep a group of Croconators in stages like A Dutiful Prayer. Alternatively, you can use [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critters]], but you don't have to as long as they aren't too buffed. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 497 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Croconator |image1 = Enemy_icon_497.png |enemy_endesc1 = Croco volunteered for cyborgization to

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Gobble''' (タッキー ''Takkī'', '''[[wikipedia:Hideaki Takizawa|Tackey]]''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Gobble |image = Gobble.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Smokestack to Heaven|Sub-chapter 22 - Smokestack to Heaven]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Cloak of Hiding|Sub-chapter 42 - Cloak of Hiding]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== A deadly turkey who stands at a mere 200 range but has an [[Omni Strike]] that can hit even [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic King Dragon]]. However, what makes him dangerous is not his long reach, but rather his guaranteed [[Toxic]] ability, which deals 35% of cats' maximum health as damage - in other words, he only needs up to three hits to kill units that aren't immune to his poison. With his Toxic ability and 5,000 base attack, Gobble eliminates cats with... *0 - 7,692 health in one attack *7,693 - 33,333 health in two attacks *33,333 or more health in three attacks ==Strategy== Do not use short-ranged tankers against these feathered fiends, as the Toxic attacks will wear them down in almost no time; instead, rush them down with units such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bullet Train Cat]]. [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fishman Cat]] is especially useful against him, as he moves fast and deals massive damage to Floating (a level 50 Fishman can turn it into a good Thanksgiving meal in just 4 hits, 3 with a level 8+ Attack Buff [[Talents|Talent]]). However, be careful when timing your units and make sure that there aren't bulky enemies in front of them, as those could shield this Toxic avian from your rushers' attacks. [[Hades the Punisher (Uber Rare Cat)|Hades]] and [[Gold Brick Cat (Special Cat)|King Nekokhamen]], with their Toxic Immunity, can tank lots of Gobble hits. [[Papaluga (Uber Rare Cat)|Papalan Pasalan]], the [[Ototo Development Team#Curseblast Cannon|Curseblast Cannon]] and [[Kasli the Bane (Uber Rare Cat)|Kasli the Bane]] can temporarily disable Gobble's Toxic ability by [[Curse|cursing]] him. With her Toxic Immunity Talent unlocked, [[Strike Unit R.E.I. (Uber Rare Cat)|Flight Unit R.E.I.]] can become an excellent counter to Gobble. At level 38, R.E.I. can kill Gobble in 2 hits and tank up to 63 hits from him before she dies. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 498 |enemy category = Floating |Enemy name = Gobble |image1 = Enemy icon 498.png |enemy_endesc1 = Turkey who is also a master salesman.
Went to a palm reader in October and
received very bad news about his future.
Getting ready to escape by training wings. |Enemy name (JP) = タッキー (Takkī, Tackey) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 売れっ子アイドルのシチメンチョウ。
手相占いで自分の命がクリスマス
までと知り、翼をもがれた気分。
ショックでため息が止まらない。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A popular idol turkey.
Learned via palmistry that his life would end by
Christmas, and felt like he had lost his wings.
Can't stop sighing due to shock. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 45: [[Las Vegas (Aku Realm)|Las Vegas]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 22-6: [[Smokestack to Heaven]] *Stage 23-3: [[Poison Bog Cure]] *Stage 25-3: [[Protein Cartel]] *Stage 28-2: [[Anatomy Forest]] *Stage 30-2: [[Dilemma of Birth]] *Stage 31-6: [[Dark Lord's Decree]] *Stage 34-4: [[Poison on Rice]] *Stage 42-4: [[Cloak of Hiding]] ===[[Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 27|Floor 27]] ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Sky Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Floating|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Gobble |Health = 329,000 HP |Attack Power = 5,000 damage
(1,648 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 91f 3.03 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 52f 1.73s
(39f 1.3s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -320~420)
100% chance for a [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] attack (takes 35% of Cat Units' maximum health) |Element = Floating }} ==Gallery== Gobblespritesheet.png|Gobble's spritesheet IdleGobble.gif|Gobble's moving animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Tackey, sounds like "turkey", but could also be a reference to [[wikipedia:Hideaki Takizawa|Hideaki "Tackey" Takizawa]]. This is supported by Gobble's Japanese description, which describes him as "a popular idol turkey." *The "very bad news" in his description alludes to the day of [[wikipedia:Thanksgiving|Thanksgiving]], a holiday celebrated usually during October or November (as mentioned in his description), when Pilgrims originally celebrated their thanksgiving by eating wild turkey. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/500.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Le'Grim''' (ジャイアント黒蔵 ''Jaianto Kurozō'', '''Giant Kurozoh''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of [[Le'noir (Black)|Le'noir]] unique to the [[Le'Grim Strikes]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Le'Grim |image = Baron leboin.png |appearance = [[Le'Grim Strikes]] |money drop = 1,300¢ - 5,135¢ }} ==Enemy== Like the other Gauntlet bosses, this enemy starts out weak but becomes increasingly powerful with each stage. He has a rather slow attack rate, but has very long range and very high damage to make up for the delay and can slow any units that survive his powerful attacks. Additionally, His lack of backswing combined with his damage and range allows him to push forward easily. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 510 |enemy category = Black/Colossal |Enemy name = Le'Grim |enemy_endesc1 = A secret lab used unethical genome editing to
