wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Death Angel Z-Onel''' (死霊妖精クオリネム ''Shiryō Yōsei Kuorinem'', '''Death Fairy Quarinem''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Cli-One (Alien/Floating)|Cli-One]] that appears in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Last of the Dead (Merciless)|Z-Onel Rises!]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Death Angel Z-Onel |image = Zombieclionel.PNG |appearance = [[Last of the Dead (Merciless)|Z-Onel Rises!]] |money drop = 1,111¢ - 4,338¢ }} ==Enemy== Death Angel Z-Onel's health is subpar compared to those merciless [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], at a mere 1,000,000, and retains the blindspot of her [[Cruel Angel Clionel (Angel)|angelic counterpart]]. However, there are several aspects that drastically escalate her threat - Two of her spawn in her debut stage, she's slow enough for her buffed support to demolish your attackers before her LD attacks finish you off with a freeze. The icing on the cake is her revival, which brings her back at a whopping 50% HP 0.5 seconds after defeat. This makes her stage some of the most difficult in the entire game, and especially so without a high-leveled holy blast. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 511 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Death Angel Z-Onel |enemy_endesc1 = Clionel-type being who somehow survived(?)
the mass extinction of their world's polluted
oceans. Don't come near me or my sons ever
again. Said to paralyze Cats with fright. |image1 = Enemy icon 511.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 海の汚染で全滅したはずだったクリオネー族。
自分を慕ってくれる子分たちの前では
何度倒されても立ち上がる骨のある生命体。
むやみに近づく者は動きを止められるという。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The Clione family was supposed to be wiped out by sea pollution.
A being formed from remains who stands in front of her loving children no matter how many times she's defeated.
Able to stop the movement of those who approach her blind spot. |Enemy name (JP) = 死霊妖精クオリネム (Shiryō Yōsei Kuorinem, Death Fairy Quarinem) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Z-Onel Rises!: [[Last of the Dead (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Death Angel Z-Onel |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 30,000 damage
(6,211.18 DPS) |Attack Range = 666
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 145f 4.83 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 71f 2.37s
(74f 2.47s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] [[Cat Units]] for 30f 1 second
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 450~1,300)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 50% HP after being dead for 15f 0.5 seconds (unlimited) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== 511 e.png|Death Angel Z-Onel's spritesheet Death Angel Z-Onel.gif|Death Angel Z-Onel's attack animation IdleDeathAngelZ-Onel.gif|Death Angel Z-Onel's moving animation Medal 077.png|Death Angel Z-Onel on the ''Angel of Undeath'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Amongst the Tier 2 [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Death Angel Z-Onel represents the virtue of charity, which includes self-sacrifice and putting others (her children) above oneself. *She can be seen as a foil to [[Cruel Angel Clionel (Angel)|Cruel Angel Clionel]]. Where Clionel is a heavenly [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] who brings destruction, Z-Onel is an unholy [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] who has experienced extinction. *Her English description references the meme [https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dont-talk-to-me-or-my-son-ever-again Don't Talk To Me Or My Son Ever Again]. *Her face resembles the logo of the [[wikipedia:Punisher|Punisher]], an antihero appearing in Marvel Comics. *The crosses that appear when she attacks may be a reference to the [[:Category:Eva Angel Enemies|Angels]]' death effect in ''Neon Genesis Evangelion''. *She has the longest range of all [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]]. *She stands from a range of 666, commonly recognized as the "[[wikipedia:Number of the Beast|Number of the Beast]]". ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/513.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Li'l Zyclone''' (ミニアンデッドサイクロン ''Mini Andeddo Saikuron'', '''''Mini Undead Cyclone''''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] enemy found in [[Into the Future]] Chapter 3's [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Li'l Zyclone |image = Lilzyclone.png |first appearance = '''ItF''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''UL''': [[Anaerobic Cycling|Sub-chapter 25 - Anaerobic Cycling]]
|latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Artificial Strawberries|Sub-chapter 35 - Artificial Strawberries]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ }} ==Enemy== Contrary to all of his variants inflicting extremely high damage and DPS, Li'l Zyclone acts more as a barrier to cut off the player's meatshield supply. In order to accomplish this, he sports high health, decent movement speed, one knockback and a long burrow distance, as well as quickly reviving with 100% HP once. ==Strategy== With 333,333 health, this little guy is very good at his job, cutting off your supply of meatshields by burrowing behind your main group of cats with a crazy burrow distance of 1,250. He isn't a threat alone due to his relatively low damage and range. The absolute best way to deal with Li'l Zyclone is to either stop his burrow with the regular [[Cat Cannon]] or force him to the surface with [[Ototo Development Team#Holy Blast|Holy Blast]]. If that is not possible, you will usually want to burst him down as quickly as possible to prevent the other enemies from abusing the limited meatshields for too long. [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Cadaver BearCat]] is the optimal choice, but [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] and [[Li'l Bird Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Flying Cat]] work too. In an emergency, [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] can be used, but don't spawn him without some thought. Additionally, Li'l Zyclone's long burrow distance can cause him go go straight up to your base. In this case, [[Welterweight Cat (Rare Cat)|Heavyweight Cat]] and [[Piledriver Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Power Piledriver Cat]] are ideal for pushing him off. Unless a [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killer]] lands the finishing blow, he will respawn with full health one time. If a Zombie Killer unit did not kill him, note that he is only dead for less than 5 seconds so you may or may not get lucky by having your faster units walk through the puddle, but slower units probably won't be able to get past it before he revives. If some of your units don't get past the puddle, just rinse and repeat. If powerful [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance units]] are owned, especially [[:Category:Anti-Zombie Cats|anti-Zombie]] ones, such as [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Vaulter Cat]], Li'l Zyclone can be used as a stepping stone to kill other threats, such as the [[Cadaver Bear (Zombie)|Cadaver Bears]] in the [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Zombie|Necro Frontier]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 512 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Li'l Zyclone |enemy_endesc1 = Beloved nephew of childless uncle Zyclone.
Has his mother's toughness and father's timid
spirit, combining them into a hungry little storm
who hides at the first sign of danger. |image1 = Enemy icon 512.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = アンデッドサイクロンの甥っ子。
母親ゆずりのタフさと父親ゆずりの非力さと
食欲と人見知りと潜りグセをあわせ持つ。
好きな科目は保健体育と国語と蘇生。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The nephew of the Undead Cyclone.
Has his mother's toughness and father's appetite, shyness, weakness and burrowing habits.
His favorite subjects are health and physical education, national language and resurrection. |Enemy name (JP) = ミニアンデッドサイクロン (Mini Andeddo Saikuron, Mini Undead Cyclone) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Into the Future]] [[Zombie Outbreaks|Outbreaks]]=== *Stage 3-2: [[Korea (Into the Future)|Korea]] *Stage 3-7: [[United Kingdom (Into the Future)|United Kingdom]] *Stage 3-11: [[Spain (Into the Future)|Spain]] *Stage 3-14: [[Greece (Into the Future)|Greece]] *Stage 3-17: [[India (Into the Future)|India]] *Stage 3-24: [[The Great Abyss (Into the Future)|The Great Abyss]] *Stage 3-28: [[Egypt (Into the Future)|Egypt]] *Stage 3-29: [[Sahara (Into the Future)|Sahara]] *Stage 3-32: [[Argentina (Into the Future)|Argentina]] *Stage 3-37: [[Mexico (Into the Future)|Mexico]] *Stage 3-40: [[Alaska (Into the Future)|Alaska]] *Stage 3-43: [[New York (Into the Future)|New York]] *Stage 3-46: [[Brazil (Into the Future)|Brazil]] *Stage 3-48: [[Moon (Into the Future)|Moon]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 25-4: [[Anaerobic Cycling]] *Stage 28-5: [[Microscope Bridge]] *Stage 29-4: [[Defaced Tombstone]] *Stage 30-5: [[Passionate Release]] *Stage 32-5: [[Internal Scream]] *Stage 35-2: [[Artificial Strawberries]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Total War: Winter Special]]: [[Dance of Winter: Exalted (Merciless)]] *[[Citadel#Zombie|Zombie Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Zombie|Top Floor]] *[[Empress' Report 5]]: [[Aku Studies 501: Field Research]] ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *Necro Frontier: [[Frontier Shrine (Merciless)/Zombie|Frontier Shrine (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Li'l Zyclone |Health = 333,333 HP |Attack Power = 333 damage
(1,997 DPS) |Attack Range = 100
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 5f 0.17 seconds |Movement Speed = 14 |Knockback = 1 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(4f 0.13s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrows]] underground 1,250 after a Cat enters its range (1 time)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 120f 4 seconds (1 time) |Element = Zombie }} ==Gallery== Li'lZycloneSpritesheet.png|Li'l Zyclone's spritesheet Li'l Zyclone.gif|Li'l Zyclone's attack animation IdleLi'lZyclone.gif|Li'l Zyclone's walking animation ==Trivia== *He has the lowest attack power and overall DPS of all [[Cyclone]]s. *He and [[Zyclone (Zombie)|Zyclone]] are the only gendered Cyclones. **Additionally, they are the only Cyclones to have a moving eye. **Coincidentally, both are also [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/514.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''St. Dober''' (天使ドーヴエル ''Tenshi Dōvueru'', "'''Angelic Dover'''") is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] variant of [[Dober P.D]] that only appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = St. Dober |image = Angeldober.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Bare Fangs at the Throne|Sub-chapter 24 - Bare Fangs at the Throne]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Stars in the Tumbler|Sub-chapter 44 - Stars in the Tumbler]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== St. Dober deals huge damage and has a 33% chance to create a [[Surge Attack]] that hits units up to 350 range away from him. Unlike most aggressive pusher Angels, he is much slower. Although St. Dober’s standing range is shorter than Dober P.D's, he has an [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] attack that reaches farther than him regardless, so he seldom misses his attacks. To sum him up, he is a dangerous threat that attacks and supports at the same time, shredding through your meatshields and melee units. ==Strategy== DO NOT use short-ranged attackers against this heavenly hound, as his Surge Attack will destroy your frontline in no time flat! Instead, use long-ranged attackers like [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic King Dragon]]. Try using [[:Category:Anti-Angel Cats|anti-Angel]] [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|crowd-controllers]] as well such as [[Stilts Cat (Rare Cat)|Acrobat Cats]], [[Juliet Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Juliet the Maiko]], [[Talents|Talented]] [[Bishop Cat (Rare Cat)|Sanzo Cat]], [[Momotaro (Uber Rare Cat)|Momotaro]] or [[Kintaro (Uber Rare Cat)|Kintaro]] to stop him from creating his wild Surge Attacks, as they will typically attack and completely paralyze him before he could hit, and may do so even without the assistance of Meatshields. Should that fail, spending NP to get more [[:Category:Cats with Surge Immunity|Surge-immune units]] is a viable alternative. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 513 |enemy category = [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] |Enemy name = St. Dober |image1 = Enemy icon 513.png |enemy_endesc1 = Loyal to the end, he waits patiently by the
gates of heaven for his master to arrive.
A famous statue of him in mid-Surge Attack
is a well-known meeting spot for teenagers. |Enemy name (JP) = 天使ドーヴエル (Tenshi Dōvueru, Angelic Dover) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 飼い主の帰りを待ち続けて、天に召された犬。
彼が倒れた場所には立派な犬の銅像と
烈波を放つ勇姿を切り取った壁画が描かれ、
若者たちの待ち合わせスポットになっている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A dog called to Heaven, waiting for the return of his owner.
At the place where he fell, there is a bronze statue of a fine dog,
and a mural cut out of a gallant figure creating Intense Waves;
it is a popular meeting spot for young people. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 24-6: [[Bare Fangs at the Throne]] *Stage 25-5: [[Sauna Handstands]] *Stage 27-5: [[Guild of Masks]] *Stage 28-5: [[Microscope Bridge]] *Stage 30-1: [[A Dutiful Prayer]] *Stage 33-1: [[Diversity, Alkilinity]] *Stage 36-4: [[Canopy Altar]] *Stage 37-6: [[Hall of the Four Kings]] *Stage 44-1: [[Stars in the Tumbler]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = St. Dober |Health = 1,800,000 HP |Attack Power = 23,000 damage
(13,529.41 DPS) |Attack Range = 130
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 41f 1.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 2 times |Occurrence = 30f 1s
(12f 0.4s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -300~200)
33% chance to create a Lv.3 [[Surge Attack]] between 150 and 350 range |Element = Angel }} ==Gallery== 513 e.png|St. Dober's spritesheet St. Dober.gif|St. Dober's attack animation IdleStDober.gif|St. Dober's walking animation ==Trivia== *St. Dober's description refers to the story of [[wikipedia:Hachikō|Hachikō]], a Japanese Akita Inu who waited at the train station everyday for his owner even after the latter's death, until he also dies of aging as well. A bronze statue was made in his honour. *Prior to [[Version 9.9 Update|Version 9.9]], his English description mistakenly described his ability to be a [[Special Abilities#Savage Blow|Savage Blow]] instead of Surge Attacks. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/515.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Doremi ''' (ドレミちゃん, '''''Doremi-chan''''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of [[Bakoo (Black)|Bakoo]] that appears in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Baby Fake (Merciless)|First Errand]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Doremi |image = White bakoo.png |appearance = [[Baby Fake (Merciless)|First Errand]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== Doremi has extreme attack power and a high knockback count. She has short range, but also a massive attack area and fast movement speed, so make sure to deploy everything before she strikes! This enemy is also immune to Slow effects. Hard-hitting units, such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and [[Lesser Demon Cat (Uber Rare Cat)|Greater Balrog Cat]], can knockback Doremi before she has a chance to attack, rendering her useless. ==Strategy== :''See [[Baby Fake (Merciless)]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 514 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Doremi |enemy_endesc1 = A veteran baby with over 7 years of experience
in infancy. Perfected the fake cry, with enough
power to knock strangers unconcious. Rejected
by 2 elite kindergartens because of this "talent". |image1 = Enemy icon 514.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 =プロ赤ちゃん歴７年のキャリアを持つバク。
リアルなウソ泣きで相手を思い通りに動かす。
気にいらない大人を超ウルトラ寝息で退け
母からの幼稚園入園の要請も２度退けた。
|enemy_jpdesc1 = A tapir with a 7-year career as a professional baby.
Her convincing lies and tears change her opponents as she desires.
Eliminates adults who do not like her with super ultra sleep breath.
Her mother's request for her to enroll in kindergarten was rejected twice. |Enemy name (JP) = ドレミちゃん (Doremi-chan)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *First Errand: [[Baby Fake (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Doremi |Health = 1,800,000 HP |Attack Power = 28,000 damage
(10,500 DPS) |Attack Range = 180
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 80f 2.67 seconds |Movement Speed = 14 |Knockback = 20 times |Occurrence = 40f 1.33s
(40f 1.33s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 180f 6 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 50~1,850)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Immune to Slow]] |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== Doremispritesheet.png|Doremi's spritesheet IdleDumbBaby.gif|Doremi's walking animation Medal 078.png|Doremi on the ''Helping Out'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *Like [[Bakoo (Black)|Bakoo]], she is based on the ''[[wikipedia:Baku_(mythology)|Baku]]'', a Japanese mythical creature that devours dreams. **The Japanese term ''baku'' can also refer to a Malayan tapir. *Doremi's name may be derived from the "do-re-mi" syllables of the sol-fa scale. **It may also be a reference to [[w:c:touhou:Doremy_Sweet|Doremy Sweet]] from the bullet hell game [[wikipedia:Touhou Project|Touhou Project]], who has a very similar name and is also a ''Baku''. *Amongst the Tier 2 [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], Doremi represents the virtue of humility. *She can be seen as a foil to her original variant: Bakoo is a perpetual sleepwalker whereas Doremi's cries put others to sleep. *She is tied with Bakoo for the shortest standing range and longest reach of any Advent Boss and the smallest blind spot of any character; no [[Cat Units|Cat Unit]] can enter it without taking advantage of knockback clipping. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/516.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mega-Mooth''' (ギガガガ ''Gigagaga'') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of [[Mooth (Floating)|Mooth]] unique to the [[Mega Menace]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Mega-Mooth |image = Mega-Mooth.png |appearance = [[Mega Menace]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,295¢ }} ==Enemy== Mega-Mooth is an [[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]]-like enemy with 30 more effective and standing range, allowing him to hit even [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]]. He has more knockbacks than Othom, but he has support from [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]], [[Brollow (Floating)|Brollows]] and [[Professor A. (Red)|Professor A.]] in [[Mega Menace/On Mighty Wings Lv1~20|On Mighty Wings Lv11~20]]. Like other [[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossi]], he gets more and more powerful with each stage. To top it all off, he knocks back everything he hits, forming a devastating combination with [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriels]] and [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Blacks]] or [[Brollow (Floating)|Brollows]] and [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombies]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 515 |enemy category = Floating/Colossal |Enemy name = Mega-Mooth |enemy_endesc1 = A secret lab used unethical genome editing to

For the Cat Unit, see [[Master Uril (Special Cat)|Master Uril]].}} '''Master Uril''' (達人ウリル ''Tatsujin Uriru'', '''Master Uril''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy found on the [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 50|50th floor]] of the [[Heavenly Tower]], which awards his [[Master Uril (Special Cat)|Cat Unit counterpart]] when completed. {{Enemy Info |name = Master Uril |image = 518.png |appearance = [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 50|Heavenly Tower - Floor 50]] |money drop = 2,222¢ - 8,777¢ }} ==Enemy== Master Uril is one tough enemy to defeat. He isn't the fastest, but deals extremely high damage with a fast attack rate, as well as an omni strike outranging many units. Topping this off is his level 3 surge and curse, meaning next to nothing will be able to withstand him for long. Aside from using units with greater range, some options for stalling him include [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Macho Glass Cat]], [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Macho]], [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Vendor Cat and Kitten]], [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], and [[Sniper the Recruit (Super Rare Cat)|Sniper the Heavy]]. These units work particularly well in their [[True Form]]s and, in Cyberpunk Cat's case, boosted Slow [[Talents]]. ==Strategy== :''See [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 50]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 516 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Master Uril |enemy_endesc1 = Retired head of a powerful clan who still
rules in secret. Built a secret hideaway in
a high tower to enjoy time with his girlfriend
(before being intruded upon by rude Cats!) |image1 = Enemy icon 516.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 =せがれに一族の長を譲り隠居中の元族長。
ギャルと余生を過ごすため塔の最上階に
秘密の楽園を作っているところを
にゃんこ軍団によって発見された。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Former head of a clan who retired after passing down the
role of leader to his son. Built a secret paradise on the top
floor of the Heavenly Tower to live out the rest of his life
with the girl, but was discovered by the Cat Army. |Enemy name (JP) = 達人ウリルー (Tatsujin Uriru, Master Uril) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Heavenly Tower]]: [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 50|Floor 50]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Master Uril |Health = 3,800,000 HP |Attack Power = 25,500 damage
(12,142 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 63f 2.10 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 12 times |Occurrence = 20f
(43f backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to create a Lv. 3 [[Surge Attack]] for 60f 2 seconds between 200 and 450 range
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -400~450)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 300f 10 seconds |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== Masterurilspritesheet.png|Master Uril's spritesheet IdleMasterUril.gif|Master Uril's walking animation ==Trivia== *Master Uril is implied to be related to [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Wolf]] and [[Masked Yulala (Special Cat)|Masked Yulala]]; all three have white and spiky hair, wear tribal masks and joined the Cat Army on their own volition, and both Uril and Yulala reside in the [[Heavenly Tower]]. **[[Master Uril (Special Cat)|Mystic Uril]]'s description indicates that his grandchild gave him his mask. Since Ururun Wolf wears a similar-looking mask, Ururun is most likely Uril's granddaughter, and since Ururun is implied to be Yulala's daughter, Uril is most likely Yulala's father. Furthermore, Mystic Mask Yulala's Japanese description calls him the head of his clan, and [[Master Uril (Enemy Unit)|enemy Master Uril]]'s Japanese description says he passed down that same title to his son when he retired. *He is a reference to [[w:c:dragon-ball-z:Dende|Dende]], a character from ''[[w:c:dragon-ball-z:Main Page|Dragon Ball Z]]''. *He and the [[Relic Doge Base (Enemy Base)|Relic Doge Base]] are the only non-[[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemies that can curse cats. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/518.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Koronium''' (メタルコアラッキョ ''Metaru Koarakkyo'', '''Metal Koalacchio''') is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[Kory]] that only appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Koronium |image = Metalkory.jpeg |first appearance = '''UL:''' [[Lakeside Bootcamp|Sub-chapter 25 - Lakeside Bootcamp]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Three Evil Brothers|Sub-chapter 37 - Three Evil Brothers]] |money drop = 900¢ - 3,555¢ }} ==Enemy== Koronium is a dangerous Metal enemy. Don't let his 150 health fool you, as Koronium, just like most [[Kory]] variants, is able to create a powerful [[Wave Attack]] each time he hits a unit. Koronium also has more range (240) and attack power (15,000 for the initial hit, plus another 15,000 from the Wave Attack) than other variants. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]] are almost mandatory to turn this eccentric koala into scrap metal. Do not use anything with a range less than 240 (except perhaps [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]]). These units will only be stepping stones for Koronium to unleash a wave and shred the rest of your units! The use of meatshields is recommended to try to blot out his Wave Attacks. However, beware as this koala has ridiculous amounts of DPS that can shred [[Mightycat (Rare Cat)|Mightycat]] and [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]]. Long-ranged Wave Shields like [[Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo (Uber Rare Cat)|Hatsune Miku: MM2020 Tokyo]], [[Eva Unit-00 (Uber Rare Cat)|Eva Unit-00]], [[Cat Machine (Uber Rare Cat)|Cat Machine Mk 3]], and [[Mighty Kristul Muu (Legend Rare Cat)|Doom Engine Pandora]] (luring is needed with Pandora) can easily counter him though. He hits considerably hard up close, so getting past his range buffer of 240 by using ranged [[:Category:Critical Hit Cats|Critical Hitters]] such as [[1 Million Dollar Cat (Special Cat)|100 Million Dollar Cat]], [[Volley Cat (Rare Cat)|Curry Cat]], [[Space Cat (Rare Cat)|Space Marine Cat]] or [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] with [[Talents]] is worth it. Talented [[Panties Cat (Special Cat)|Lollycat]] is also very good at delaying him, though beware that it requires a lot of NP for a powerful yet situational Talent. If you have [[Kubiluga (Uber Rare Cat)|E. Kubilan Pasalan]], this enemy will be a joke - not only can E. Kubilan take him out in one shot, but his waves can also reach him from a faraway distance. [[Hayabusa (Uber Rare Cat)|Hayabusa]] can also OHKO him while being able to tank at least one wave from him (depending on the level and magnification), and his Long Distance allows Hayabusa to more easily target Koronium amid a crowd of enemies. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 517 |enemy category = Metal |Enemy name = Koronium |enemy_endesc1 = Mascot/base coach for the NLB Champions,
Koala Krushers. Forced replays of several
games by interfering when his team is losing.
His harshness during training is feared by all. |image1 = Enemy icon 517.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = NLB球団ポイズンユーカリーズの
マスコットキャラ。自軍がピンチになると
勝手に出場しゲームを破壊する。練習でも
選手たちから鬼教官として恐れられている。
|enemy_jpdesc1 = Mascot for the NLB team Poison Eucalyptus.
When his team is in a pinch, he joins in without
permission and destroys the game. Players fear him
as a "demon teacher", even during practice.
|Enemy name (JP) = メタルコアラッキョー (Metaru Koarakkyo, Metal Koalacchio)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny_Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 25-6: [[Lakeside Bootcamp]] *Stage 26-5: [[Meteor Disco]] *Stage 28-6: [[Burning Blue]] *Stage 30-4: [[Persona's Blooming]] *Stage 33-4: [[Love Refinery]] *Stage 37-3: [[Three Evil Brothers]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Koronium |Health = 150 HP |Attack Power = 15,000 damage
(7,500 DPS) |Attack Range = 240
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 60f 2 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 21f 0.7s
(9f 0.3s backswing) |Ability = 100% chance to create a Lv.4 [[Wave Attack]] |Element = Metal }} ==Gallery== Koroniumspritesheet.png|Koronium's spritesheet Koronium.gif|Koronium's attack animation IdleKoronium.gif|Koronium's walking animation ==Trivia== *"Koronium" is a wordplay of [[Kory]] and the hypothetical chemical substance [[wikipedia:Coronium|Coronium]], later discovered to be ionized iron. *The 'NLB' mentioned in his description may be a reference to MLB, or Major League Baseball. The N presumably stands for Nyanko, the Japanese word for Cat. *[[Lakeside Bootcamp]], the stage Koronium is introduced in, is likely a reference to his harsh nature during training. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/519.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{StrategyNeeded}} {{Disambig|For other uses, see [[Zeus (disambiguation)|Zeus]].}} '''Super Zeus''' (スーパーゼウス ''Sūpāzeusu'') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]] enemy that appears in the [[Bikkuriman Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Super Zeus |image = Enemyzeus.png |money drop = 3,200¢ - 12,640¢ |appearance = [[Bikkuriman Collaboration Event]] }} ==Enemy== Super Zeus is relatively slow in both attacks and movement, has moderate health and damage, is easily knocked back,and [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weakens]] anything he hits to 50%. https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Happy Birthday Cake''' (記念ケーキわんこ, "Commemorative Cake Dog") is a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy that appears in the [[Hatsune Miku Collaboration Event]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Happy Birthday Cake |image = Cakedoge-420.png |appearance = [[♪ Birthday Party ♪|Hatsune Miku's Birthday!]] |money drop = 2¢ - 7¢ }} ==Enemy== This enemy appears to be four [[Doge]]s carrying a large birthday cake that stands on a can of Cat Food. At the top of the cake there is a red and gold colored ribbon and a sign written in gold that says Happy Birthday. The Doges remain hidden under the can but can be seen during its attack animation. Although it may not look like one, it is actually a Metal enemy. ==Strategy== [[Cow Cat (Normal Cat)|Cow Cat]] and any other fast attacking characters such as [[Mr. (Special Cat)|Mr.]] can kill this enemy very easily. It deals pretty much no damage per hit, so there's no need to worry about it at all. ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[:Category:Removed Content|Removed Stages]]=== *Hatsune Miku's Birthday!: [[♪ Birthday Party ♪]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Happy Birthday Cake |Health = 100 HP |Attack Power = 1 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zollow''' (テバムラサキホネツバメ ''Tebamurasaki Hone Tsubame'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of [[Brollow (Floating)|Brollow]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zollow |image = Zombie brollow.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Sodden Bones|Sub-chapter 29 - Sodden Bones]]
'''Aku Realms''': [[Colombia (Aku Realm)|Colombia/Gunma]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Tear-Soaked Puppy|Sub-chapter 44 - Tear-Soaked Puppy]] |money drop = 50¢ - 197¢ }} ==Enemy== Zollow, despite appearing much later than his living counterpart, has less health and damage than him while also being slower and only having one knockback as well. But don't treat this enemy lightly, as he has the [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] ability and a nasty [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] attack to compensate. Thanks to his combination of abilities, he can break through meatshield lines and damage your attackers easily. Zollow revives once, but, unlike most Zombies, does not burrow past cats. His Toxic ability takes off 80% of a cat's maximum health on top of the 10,000 base damage from his attack, instantly killing most units that have under 50,000 health. Anything that isn't immune will be taken out by the second hit. ==Strategy== This undead bird shouldn't be underestimated. Due to his low health, it is advised to attack him with [[:Category:Long Distance Cats|Long Distance Cats]], [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave attack Cats]] or [[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge Attack Cats]], killing him before he can land a hit. Using [[:Category:Cats with Toxic Immunity|Toxic-immune cats]] like [[Talents|Talented]] [[Sumo Cat (Special Cat)|Riceball Cat]], [[Gold Brick Cat (Special Cat)|King Nekokhamen]] (which also resists floating enemies) and [[Hades the Punisher (Uber Rare Cat)|Hades the Punisher]] work great against him, as his damage is not that much of a concern then. His ability to revive once after death can easily mess up the player's backliners if they advance; therefore, [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]] should be brought to deal with him for good. [[Vaulter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Housewife Cat]] is an excellent choice, as she has Long Distance and can kill him in one hit. Again, Wave Attackers work wonders, as much like how they are used against Assassin Bears, if you have a decent stack of them it is possible for Zollow to revive right when a Wave occurs, causing him to die immediately. Overall he's not very hard to deal with, unless he's deployed in a way that you struggle to counter, such as in [[Dark Lord's Decree]] where he's spammed. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 527 |enemy category = Zombie/Floating |Enemy name = Zollow |enemy_endesc1 = A bird so ripped that it can swim across
the River Styx whenever it wants to.
Upset that he can't stop the the mass he
worked so hard to cultivate from rotting away. |image1 = Enemy_icon_527.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 毎年お盆になると三途の川を越えて
故郷に帰ってくるタフな渡り鳥。険しい道中で全身の肉をもがれた痛みに
酸性の涙を流しながら帰省する。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Every year during the Obon festival, this tough migratory bird
crosses the Sanzu River and comes back to his hometown.
He returns home with acidic tears in his eyes from the pain
of having his whole body stripped of flesh on a steep road. |Enemy name (JP) = テバムラサキホネツバメ (Tebamurasaki Hone Tsubame) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 38: [[Colombia (Aku Realm)|Colombia/Gunma]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 29-6: [[Sodden Bones]] (100%) *Stage 30-1: [[A Dutiful Prayer]] (100%) *Stage 31-6: [[Dark Lord's Decree]] (100%) *Stage 33-3: [[Oil Spill Rainbow]] (100%) *Stage 35-6: [[Gene Salesmen]] (100%) *Stage 36-5: [[Sappy Underpass]] (100%) *Stage 40-3: [[Dried Fish Market]] (100%) *Stage 44-2: [[Night of the Hustler]] (150%) *Stage 44-4: [[Tear-Soaked Puppy]] (150%, 4,000%) ===[[Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 27|Floor 27]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Zollow |Health = 4,500 HP |Attack Power = 10,000 damage
(2,158 DPS) |Attack Range = 100
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 137f 4.57 seconds |Movement Speed = 55 |Knockback = 1 time |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -200~222)
100% chance for a [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] attack (takes 80% of maximum health)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 200f 6.67 seconds (1 time) |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(136f 4.53s backswing) |Element = Zombie/Floating }} ==Gallery== Zollowspritesheet.png|Zollow's spritesheet Zollow.gif|Zollow's attack animation IdleZollow.gif|Zollow's moving animation StandingZollow.png|Zollow standing upright DryBones.png|Zollow's remains after attacking ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Tebamurasaki Hone Tsubame, makes a pun with ''[https://foodinjapan.org/chubu/tebasaki/ tebasaki]'', a chicken wing dish whose name literally means "wingtips", and ''murasaki'', meaning "purple"; the Hone Tsubame part of the name means "bone swallow", with swallow being the species of bird he was based off of. *His head and, to a lesser extent, his overall body shape when standing upright, are reminiscent of the [https://wiki.evageeks.org/Seventh_Angel Seventh Angel] in ''Rebuild of Evangelion'', often called Clockiel by fans. *His collapsing and reassembling animations are reminiscent of the [[w:c:mario|Dry Bones]] enemies from the ''Mario'' series. *In Greek mythology, the [[wikipedia:Styx|River Styx]] is a river of misery which draws the line between the underworld and the rest of the world. **Instead of the River Styx, Zollow's Japanese description mentions the [[wikipedia:Sanzu_River|Sanzu River]]: a river in Japanese Buddhist tradition which the souls of the deceased must cross before they can reach the afterlife. *His English description has a typo. It says, "Upset that he can't stop the the mass," when it should be, "can't stop the mass." *Prior to [[Version 10.7 Update|Version 10.7]], Zollow wasn't a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy. *Zollow's Toxic currently has the highest damage percentage in the entire game. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/529.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|Not to be confused with [[Emperor Cat (Legend Rare Cat)]].}} '''Evil Emperor Cat''' (悪のネコ帝王 ''Aku no Neko Teiō'', '''Evil Cat Emperor''') is [[Emperor Cat (Legend Rare Cat)|Emperor Cat]], consumed by [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] power and possessed by a malevolent force. He appears in the [[:Category:Advent Stages|Advent Stage]] [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)|Prelude to Ruin]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Evil Emperor Cat |image = Relictyrantenemy.png |appearance = [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)|Prelude to Ruin]] |money drop = 2,850¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Like most [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Bosses]], his great range together with his many abilities leave him to be a support unit rather than the main threat. 520 range means that almost every cat sent out to fight him will be gravely crippled with his Freeze and Curse abilities, rendering them vulnerable to the [[Capy (Red)|Capy]] and [[Oldhorn (Relic)|Oldhorn]]. Evil Emperor Cat also possesses [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] with a range of -630~620 and a Lv.2 [[Surge Attack]], making his debuffs all the more difficult to avoid. However, for an advent boss, his DPS is surprisingly low, and it's mostly the other pushers presenting a threat. ==Strategy== :''See [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 535 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Evil Emperor Cat |enemy_endesc1 = The promised lord of Cats, consumed by
pride in his mastery of elder forest sorceries.
Now the king of ruin, he lashes out at this
decadent world with furious Surges and Curses. |image1 = Enemy icon 535.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 深き森でいにしえの強大な魔力に蝕まれ
ついには自我を失ったネコの国の統治者。
滅びの呪いと烈波を際限なく放ち
破滅の王として世界に終止符を打つ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The ruler of the land of Cats, who has been corrupted by the
ancient magical power in the deep forest and finally
lost his self. He unleashes an endless stream of Curses and
Intense Waves of destruction, bringing a whole rest* to the world as the King of Ruin.
*Whole rest, meaning no note in a bar in music, symbolized the end of the world |Enemy name (JP) = 悪のネコ帝王 (Aku no Neko Teiō, Evil Cat Emperor) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *Prelude to Ruin: [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Evil Emperor Cat |Health = 1,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 6,666 damage
(724 DPS) |Attack Range = 520
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 276f 9.2 seconds |Movement Speed = 6 |Knockback = 8 times |Ability = 100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 45f 1.50 seconds
100% chance to create a Lv.2 [[Surge Attack]] for 40f 1.33 seconds between 600 and 900 range
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -630~620)
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curses|curse]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds |Element = Relic |Occurrence = 103f 3.43s
(30f 1s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 535 e.png|Evil Emperor Cat's spritesheet green nyandam.gif|Evil Emperor Cat's animations Medal 087.png|Evil Emperor Cat on the ''Road to Ruin'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] ==Trivia== *There is a substantial amount of evidence to suggest that he was originally meant to be an [[Uncanny Legends]] boss who would unlock [[Emperor Cat (Legend Rare Cat)|Emperor Cat]] when defeated, acting as a counterpart to [[Li'l Nyandam (Special Cat)|Li'l Nyandam]]. **From [[Version 10.0 Update|Version 10.0]] to [[Version 10.2 Update|Version 10.2]], his ID was used by a placeholder enemy named コニャンダム亜種 ''Ko Nyandamu Ashu'' ("[[Li'l Nyandam (Red)|Li'l Nyandam]] Variant"). **[[Stone Cat (Rare Cat)|Stone Cat]] and [[Possessed by Evil (Merciless)|Possessed by Evil]]'s [[Backgrounds|background]] were also added prematurely in 10.0, but Stone Cat was a placeholder [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] instead of a [[:Category:Rare Cats|Rare Cat]] and the background had a different color scheme closer to that of [[Saint Red Fox]]. [[File:Bg147.png|thumb|right|Older Prelude to Ruin background]] **[[Urs & Fenrir (Relic)|Urs & Fenrir]] seem to be a variant of [[Ururun Wolf (Enemy Unit)|Ururun Wolf]], so PONOS may have intended to keep this trend going with the other [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cats]] from [[Legend Stages/SoL|Stories of Legend]]. **These placeholders were added in the same update as [[Dawn of the Beginning]], whose Japanese name is the opposite of [[Dead End Night]]'s. Dawn of the Beginning also comes 9 sub-chapters after [[Urs & Fenrir (Special Cat)|Urs & Fenrir]] in [[The Gelatin Mines]], which was 9 sub-chapters after [[Depths of My Heart]]. **Emperor Cat has the same range, movement speed and slow chance as allied Li'l Nyandam while Evil Emperor Cat's Omni Strike gives him the same reach as enemy Li'l Nyandam. **Evil Emperor Cat is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]], the same trait as all other Uncanny Legends drops ([[Relic Bun-Bun (Relic)|Relic Bun-Bun]], [[Dogumaru (Relic)|Dogumaru]], [[Urs & Fenrir (Relic)|Urs & Fenrir]], [[Elder Flame Doron (Relic)|Elder Flame Doron]], and [[Ultima Beast Naala (Relic / Behemoth)|Ultima Beast Naala]]). **Before [[Possessed Empress (Aku)|Possessed Empress]] was introduced, Evil Emperor Cat stood out as the only [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Boss]] to be the enemy version of a [[Cat Units|Cat Unit]]. Likewise, Emperor Cat is to this day the only [[:Category:Legend Rare Cats|Legend Rare Cat]] to have an enemy counterpart. *Prior to the [[Version 10.2 Update|Version 10.2.1 Update]], he had a Level 3 [[Surge Attack]] with a distance of 150~255, lasting for 60f. *Since they were only released one update apart, it is possible that he is the titular "Dark Lord" of [[Dark Lord's Decree]]. *His attack stat resembles the well-known [[wikipedia:Number of the beast|Number of the Beast]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/537.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|Not to be confused with [[Li'l Bore (Event Enemy)|Li'l Bore]].}} '''Bore Jr.''' (ウリボーイ ''Uribōi'') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] variant of [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Bore Jr. |image = Li'l Bore.PNG |money drop = 332¢ - 1,382¢ |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Argentina (Aku Realm)|Argentina/Ibaraki]] '''UL''': [[A Pile of Guts|Sub-chapter 32 - A Pile of Guts]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Stylist Mononoke|Sub-chapter 46 - Stylist Mononoke]] }} ==Enemy== Bore Jr. is a glass cannon, with relatively low health but an extremely damaging attack, and the ability to spam [[Mini-Wave]]s if he isn't killed in time. At 100% strength magnification, his Mini-Waves deal 4,700 damage each, shredding your cats quickly. ==Strategy== Bore Jr.'s mediocre health makes him vulnerable to similarly hard-hitting units, like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]], who can one-shot him before he gets a single hit in, or [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bullet Train Cat]]. Alternatively, many units stacked can quickly kill this enemy, but only if there isn't anything in front that allows Bore Jr. to start unleashing Mini-Waves or if there is a [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shield]]. Needless to say, the use of [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Cat]] or [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Green Shell Cat]] is not recommended without the support of Wave Shields. Much like how [[Berserkory (Red)|Berserkory]] works with [[Manic Island Cat (Enemy Unit)|Manic Island Cats]] in [[Ogre Island (Deadly)|Ogre Island]], however, note that any short-ranged Wave Shields will not consistently block his waves due to his high direct DPS. [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Teacher BearCat]] at level 43 or above can also one shot this enemy (at 100%) without assistance from [[Cat Combo]]s, and proves to be a good counter when it is isolated, as Teacher BearCat's foreswing is relatively short, allowing him to get a quick and devastating hit. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 538 |enemy category = Traitless |Enemy name = Bore Jr. |enemy_endesc1 = "No one's gonna dye THIS Bore" says this
young rebel before riding away on his motorbike.
Unbothered by the judgment of adult society,
all he cares about is travelling the open road. |image1 = Enemy icon 538.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 「何色にも染まりたくない」が口癖の
盗んだバイクを持て余す不良イノシシ。
大人たちのよどんだ目を憎みながら
自分の道を歩んでいる３５の夜。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = "I don't want to be dyed any color," is the catchphrase of this
delinquent boar who can't keep his stolen motorbike.
This is the night of 35, when he walks his own path
hating the stagnant eyes of adults. |Enemy name (JP) = ウリボーイ (Uribōi) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 40: [[Argentina (Aku Realm)|Argentina/Ibaraki]] (100%) *Stage 45: [[Las Vegas (Aku Realm)|Las Vegas/Akita]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 32-6: [[A Pile of Guts]] (100%) *Stage 33-4: [[Love Refinery]] (100%) *Stage 46-1: [[Stylist Mononoke]] (100%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Citadel#Traitless|Traitless Citadel]]: [[Citadel/Top Floor#Traitless|Top Floor]] (100%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 25|Floor 25]] (100%) *[[Divine Archangel Strikes]]: **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 11]] (100%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 12]] (106%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 13]] (112%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 14]] (118%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 15]] (124%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 16]] (130%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 17]] (136%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 18]] (142%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 19]] (148%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Blessing Lv. 20]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Bore Jr. |Health = 55,500 HP |Attack Power = 23,500 damage
(26,111 DPS) |Attack Range = 130
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 27f 0.9 seconds |Movement Speed = 20 |Knockback = 2 times |Ability = 100% chance to create a Lv.5 [[Special Abilities#Mini-Wave|Mini-Wave]] |Element = Traitless |Occurrence = 8f 0.27s
(13f 0.43s backswing) }} ==Gallery== BoreJrWhiteSpritesheet.png|Bore Jr.'s spritesheet IdleBoreJr.gif|Bore Jr.'s moving animation ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Uribōi, is a portmanteau of ''uribō'' (young wild boar) and ''bōi'' (boy). *His stolen motorbike and "the night of 35" in his Japanese description reference the song "[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yu88zx_--wE 15 no Yoru]" by [[wikipedia:Yutaka Ozaki|Yutaka Ozaki]]; one of the lyrics translates to "I race off on a stolen motorcycle..." *Ironically, his base attack power is higher than that of any other [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] variant. *He is the first enemy to have the [[Special Abilities#Mini-Wave|Mini-Wave]] ability. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/540.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Raynard''' (ごん兵衛, '''''Gonbei''''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemy that only appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Raynard |image = Redfox.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Cathode Influencer|Sub-chapter 33 - Cathode Influencer]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Breathtaking Waves|Sub-chapter 40 - Breathtaking Waves]] |money drop = 600¢ - 2,370¢ }} ==Enemy== Raynard is a white fox, wearing a red robe made from the hide of some poor [[Pigge (Red)|Pigge]]. Even though he looks like he'd be [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]], the Piggeskin makes him a Red enemy. This enemy is a very niche one, hiding behind frontliners and backliners alike with his huge range. He deals a bit more damage than a 100% [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]], but additionally creates a Lv.3 [[Surge Attack|Surge]] at a random spot within his massive attack area, effectively acting as a weaker [[Surge Base (Enemy Base)|Surge Base]]. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Rusher-class Cats|Rusher-class units]] are great at killing Raynard, most specifically level 40 [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]]— as with any Attack UP [[Cat Combo|Combo]] can one-shot Raynard with good timing. Even for a Long Distance enemy, his stats are weak. Unfortunately, they are amplified x4 with his Surge Attack giving him a noticeable 39.2k DPH/5,136 DPS. Individually and even more so when he's in groups, he acts similarly to the [[Surge Base (Enemy Base)|Surge Base]]. Alone one is unreliable and will rarely hit your units, being consistently inconsistent with passable RNG. However, once in groups, Raynards become a dangerous threat as all created Surges have 125 outward piercing range and 250 inner range, and with the number there may be this is enough to decimate stacks, a valid threat which should be rushed as previously mentioned. The few frames of blue vapor indicate the end of his telegraph for his attack, so manage your cash carefully before he or his posse hits. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 541 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Raynard |enemy_endesc1 = Learning Surge Attack from an online course,
this fox accidentally hit Pigge with a wave while
illegally practicing in the park. Now in disguise
to avoid getting spotted by the cops... |image1 = Enemy icon 541.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = オンライン授業で烈波を修得中のキツネ。
法律で禁じられている屋外練習中に
烈波がブタヤロウを直撃。証拠隠滅のため
服に仕立て上げて着ている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This fox is learning Intense Waves from an online course.
Accidentally got a direct hit on Bastard Pig [Pigge] with an
Intense Wave while illegally practicing outdoors.
To hide the evidence, he made it into clothes and wears it. |Enemy name (JP) = ごん兵衛 (Gonbei) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 33-6: [[Cathode Influencer]] *Stage 34-3: [[Kuala Lum-Pool]] *Stage 35-3: [[Organic Chromosomes]] *Stage 36-4: [[Canopy Altar]] *Stage 40-2: [[Breathtaking Waves]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Raynard |Health = 98,000 HP |Attack Power = 9,800 damage

[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 300~1,700) }} ==Gallery== 541 e.png|Raynard's spritesheet Raynard.gif|Raynard's attack animation IdleRaytard.gif|Raynard's walking animation ==Trivia== *This enemy is a reference to [[wikipedia:Reynard the Fox|Reynard the Fox]]. **Additionally, the name Raynard quite literally means "fox" in French. *His Japanese name, Gonbei, is a portmanteau of "Gon", as in [[wikipedia:Gon, the Little Fox|''Gon, the Little Fox'']], and "Donbei", as in [https://www.nissinfoods.com.hk/eng/products/nissin-donbei/nissin-donbei-kitsune-udon Nissin Donbei Kitsune Udon] (''kitsune'' means "fox"). ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/543.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Mr. Mer''' (マーさん ''Mā-san'', '''Mr. Mer''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Mr. Mer |image = Kumanchu enemy.PNG |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Alaska (Aku Realm)|Alaska/Hokkaido]]
'''UL''': [[Fish-Legged Beauty|Sub-chapter 34 - Fish-Legged Beauty]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Stylist Mononoke|Sub-chapter 46 - Stylist Mononoke]] |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ }} ==Enemy== Slow but sturdy like most Traitless [[:Category:Wave Attack Enemies|Wave Attacker]]s, Mr. Mer has above-average range, deals decent damage, and has a 100% chance to create a Lv.3 [[Mini-Wave]]. At 100% strength magnification, his Mini-Waves deal 3,200 damage. ==Strategy== Use [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] if possible, otherwise you'll need tanky meatshields and [[:Category:Cats with Wave Immunity|Wave-Immune Units]] to take him out. Since it is difficult to hold him back with power alone, certain units, notably [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Macho Crystal Cat]], can help a lot against him. Beware of his range; while not overly high, it's more than enough for him to hit some commonplace units such as [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]], [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] and [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 547 |enemy category = White |Enemy name = Mr. Mer |enemy_endesc1 = Dropped the Lion part of his name.
...but why? Researchers tried asking
him but he quickly gets angry and
lashes out with a Mini-Wave attack. |image1 = Enemy icon 547.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = マーライオンのマーって何？を
テーマに探究の旅を続ける石像。
攻撃する時に必ず小波動を
放ってくるあぶないやつ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A stone statue on a journey
to find out, "What is the 'mer' in Merlion?"
He is a dangerous guy who always
creates Mini-Waves when attacking. |Enemy name (JP) = マーさん (Mā-san, Mr. Mer) }} ==Variant== {{Variant |Medu-san |An [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of Mr. Mer that has lower overall stats and creates Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]]s instead of Mini-Waves. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 47: [[Alaska (Aku Realm)|Alaska/Hokkaido]] (100%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 34-6: [[Fish-Legged Beauty]] (100%) *Stage 35-5: [[Cloned Farmers]] (100%) *Stage 37-2: [[Disaster Cycle]] (100%) *Stage 43-1: [[Fountain of Memories]] (100%) *Stage 46-1: [[Stylist Mononoke]] (100%) ===[[Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 28|Floor 28]] (100%) *[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20|Divine Archangel Strikes]]: **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.11]] (100%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.12]] (106%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.13]] (112%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.14]] (118%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.15]] (124%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.16]] (130%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.17]] (136%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.18]] (142%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.19]] (148%) **[[Divine Archangel Strikes/Blessing Lv.1~20#Blessing 11~20|Blessing Lv.20]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Mr. Mer |Health = 1,250,000 HP |Attack Power = 16,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Ragin' Gory''' (怒りのブラッゴリ ''Ikari no Buraggori'', '''Raging Black Gory''') is a [[:Category:Black Enemies|Black]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of [[Gory]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Ragin' Gory |image = Furiousgory.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Gene Salesmen|Sub-chapter 35 - Gene Salesmen]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Rest Stop Sacrifice|Sub-chapter 45 - Rest Stop Sacrifice]] |money drop = 1,359¢ - 2,192¢ }} ==Enemy== Ragin' Gory is comparable to a buffed [[Gory Black (Black)|Gory Black]], with whom he shares about all features. The core difference is that Ragin' Gory has [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|immunity to freeze]], which makes [[Flower Cat (Special Cat)|Bombercat]], [[Oda Nobunaga (Uber Rare Cat)|Oda Nobunaga]] and the [[Ototo Development Team|Thunderbolt Cannon]] useless against him. He also has slightly higher range as well as much higher health, and 2 less knockbacks. ==Strategy== Since he still keeps a somewhat high KB count, a stack of mid-ranged attackers such as [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]] can demolish him. Although Bombercat cannot be used against him, [[Cat Gunslinger (Rare Cat)|Rodeo Cat]] can work as a [[:Category:Crowd-Controller-class Cats|crowd-controller]] to slow him, just be wary of his [[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 549 |enemy category = Black |Enemy name = Ragin' Gory |enemy_endesc1 = Corporate warrior sworn to an evil
multinational. His eyes are bloodshot after
days of overtime, and seeing the new guy
leave after 5PM has driven him berserk. |image1 = Enemy icon 549.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 理不尽なブラック企業に勤める企業戦士。
充血した目をこすり連日徹夜で残業。
毎日定時で退社する新人ゴリラへの怒りを
トリガーに覚醒を果たしたブラッゴリ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A corporate warrior who works for an unreasonable black company.
Works overtime all night every day, rubbing his bloodshot eyes.
His awakening was triggered by his anger at the
new gorilla who leaves the office on time every day. |Enemy name (JP) = 怒りのブラッゴリ (Ikari no Buraggori, Raging Black Gory) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 49: [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon]] ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 35-6: [[Gene Salesmen]] *Stage 36-1: [[The Ivy-Sealed Door]] *Stage 36-6: [[The Face of God]] *Stage 42-2: [[Lamps Aloft]] *Stage 45-5: [[Rest Stop Sacrifice]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[The Proving Grounds]]: [[Last Round: Dawn (Merciless)]] *[[Dark Descent Stages#Cover of Darkness|Cover of Darkness]]: [[Final Battleground]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Ragin' Gory |Health = 321,234 HP |Attack Power = 11,234 damage

(10f 0.33s backswing) |Element = Black/Behemoth }} ==Gallery== 549 e.png|Ragin' Gory's spritesheet Ragin' Gory.gif|Ragin' Gory's attack animation IdleRagin'Gory.gif|Ragin' Gory's walking animation ==Trivia== *Along with [[Ultima Beast Naala (Relic / Behemoth)|Ultima Beast Naala]] and [[Wild Doge (Behemoth)|Wild Doge]], Ragin' Gory was one of the three enemies that were updated to have the [[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] type in [[Version 11.5 Update|Version 11.5]]. **This makes him technically the first Behemoth enemy introduced, albeit retroactively. *He is the only Behemoth who doesn't reference ''Monster Hunter'' in any way. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/551.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article is about the enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Elder Mask Doron (Special Cat)]].}} '''Elder Flame Doron''' (古神炎ドロン ''Ko Kamien Doron'', '''Ancient God Flame Doron''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy introduced in [[The Face of God]], the final stage in [[Ancient Forest Labyrinth]]. He is the enemy version of [[Elder Mask Doron (Special Cat)|Elder Mask Doron]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Elder Flame Doron |image = 553.png |appearance = '''UL''': [[The Face of God|Sub-chapter 36 - The Face of God]] |money drop = 2,222¢ - 8,776¢ }} ==Enemy== A spectral being who cowers behind the visage of a fearsome deity. Too shy to be seen for long without the mask, he flees after attacking a Cat Unit, but has massive health and attack power, above-average standing range, and an [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] that reaches to -1,000~600 range, ensuring he'll always deliver devastation whenever he does appear. Along with that, he has a 100% chance to create Lv.8 [[Surge Attack]]s between 500 and 1,000 range, can [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] all Cat Units hit to 1% for 40 seconds, and immunity to many effects. Don't forget he is deployed numerous times throughout his stage, making it difficult to avoid ever contracting any of his negative status effects. ==Strategy== You can't prevent his attacks, but you can stay safe by spamming meatshields and fighting far from the [[Cat Base]]. If you fight close to your base, the Surge will brute force your units, allowing [[Ragin' Gory (Black / Behemoth)|Ragin' Gories]] and other enemies to attack your base. If he attacks in the middle of the field, the Surge won't do anything more than kill some of your frontline attackers. Using anything that could [[curse]] Elder Flame Doron could prevent him from weakening your cats' attack power to absolutely nothing, although all the available units with this ability against Relics are [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare Cats]], outside of well, [[Ototo Development Team|Curseblast]]. If this does not suffice, using [[:Category:Cats with Surge Immunity|Surge-immune cats]] is equally effective, as they are immune to the weaken effect by proxy since the surge will not hit them. However, be wary of his initial attack; in this case, [[:Category:Cats with Weaken Immunity|Cats with Weaken Immunity]] are still ideal. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 551 |enemy category = Relic |Enemy name = Elder Flame Doron |enemy_endesc1 = Deep within the Ancient Forest, the
Doron tribe lives hidden behind masks
blessed by the gods. Breaking the mask
releases a lethal blast of divine power. |image1 = Enemy icon 551.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 森の奥深くに暮らす内気なドロン族。
部族に受け継がれている古代神の力を
宿したお面を被ることで真のパワーを
発揮し、必殺の一撃を繰り出す。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The ever-shy Doron tribe dwells deep within the forest.
The tribe wields powers inherited from ancient gods via masks,
which they prove by dishing out lethal damage. |Enemy name (JP) = 古神炎ドロン (Ko Kamien Doron, Ancient God Flame Doron) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 36-6: [[The Face of God]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Elder Flame Doron |Health = 2,222,222 HP |Attack Power = 22,222 damage |Attack Range = 400
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = - |Movement Speed = 20 |Knockback = 1 time |Occurrence = 76f 2.53s
(56f 1.87s backswing) |Ability = Attacks once, then disappears from the battlefield;
100% chance to create a Lv.8 [[Surge Attack]] for 180f 6 seconds between 500 and 1,000 range
100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units to 1% for 1,200f 40 seconds
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -1,000~600)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Immune to Waves]], [[Evade Surge|Surges]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]] |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== Maskspritesheet.png|Elder Flame Doron's spritesheet Green fire circle.gif|Elder Flame Doron's animations ==Trivia== *''Doron'' (どろん) is the Japanese onomatopoeia for a person or creature vanishing, such as a ninja concealing themselves with a smoke screen. In this case, it literally refers to how Elder Flame Doron despawns after attacking, *His Japanese name (古神炎ドロン ''Ko Kamien Doron'') may contain a subtle pun: 神炎 ''kamien'' ("god-flame") sounds almost like 仮面 ''kamen'' (mask). *When unmasked, he looks fairly similar to a [[mariowiki:Boo|Boo]] from the ''Mario'' franchise. *He is currently the only [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy who doesn't inflict the curse effect. *He is currently the only self-destructive enemy to appear outside of [[Event Stages]]. *He is the first non-stationary enemy to be immune to Surges. *He has the highest Surge level and is tied with [[Freshman Cat Jobs (Super Rare Cat)|Freshman Cat Jobs]] for the strongest weaken of any character in the game, reducing unit damage to 1% of their original. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/553.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Aku Doge''' (デビルワン ''Debiruwan'', '''Devilwan''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Doge]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Aku Doge |image = devildoge.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Korea (Aku Realm)|Korea/Nagasaki]]
'''UL''': [[The Great Sufferer|Sub-chapter 38 - The Great Sufferer]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Titanic Steakhouse|Sub-chapter 46 - Titanic Steakhouse]] |money drop = 200¢ - 790¢ }} ==Enemy== Aku Doge has very high DPS, even more than [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriel]], but still has short range and single-target attacks like the original [[Doge]]. His only ability is a [[Shield]] that regenerates with 50% HP each time he gets knocked back; this Shield starts with the same amount of health as Aku Doge himself, so it effectively gives him 2.5x as much HP if you don't use any [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercers]]. Additionally, he has the range of a meatshield, so he can block your single-target Shield Piercers such as [[Talents|Talented]] [[Li'l Gross Cat (Special Cat)|Lil' Macho Legs]] and [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher]] from hitting more dangerous Shielded enemies like [[Fallen Bear (Aku)|Fallen Bear]]. ==Strategy== Use strong attackers like [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]] or [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area]] or otherwise, if there is only one Aku Doge. If there are multiple, use strong Area Attackers like [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Drama Cats]]. This will break the Aku Doge's [[Shield]], allowing you to knock him back. Then do the same thing again one more time. Another great way to dispose of single Aku Doges is to use [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Slime Cat]], as it can break the Shield with its initial attack and kill off the Doge with the wave. However the Aku Doge will always take down Slime Cat with it, which is great for stalling in stages like [[Seahorses Caught]]. Interestingly, [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] at level 20+90 can take three hits from a 600% Aku Doge, which is its currently Aku Doge's highest magnification, whereas [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]] can only take two. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 552 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Aku Doge |enemy_endesc1 = Weary of high-school life,
Doge's brother ran away to join the ranks of the Aku.
Though the clan considers him to be a traitor,
he still secretly pays for Doge's tuition. |image1 = Enemy icon 552.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 高校時代にグレて家を出て行き
悪魔の力を身に着けたわんこのお兄さん。
一族の中では裏切者と呼ばれているが
弟に受験料をこっそり仕送りしている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An elder brother of Doge's who left home in
high school and acquired the power of the Devil. He is
known as a traitor in his family, but he secretly sends
money to his younger brother to pay for his exams. |Enemy name (JP) = デビルワン (Debiruwan, Devilwan) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 1: [[Korea (Aku Realm)|Korea]] wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Sinner Snache''' (インフェルにょろ ''Inferunyoro'') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Snache]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Sinner Snache |image = Akusnache.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms:''' [[Mongolia (Aku Realm)|Mongolia/Saga]]
'''UL:''' [[Breathtaking Waves|Sub-chapter 40 - Breathtaking Waves]] |latest appearance = '''UL:''' [[Burning Crimson|Sub-chapter 41 - Burning Crimson]] |money drop = 120¢ - 474¢ }} ==Enemy== An average peon that almost any attacker can handle with relative ease. The actual danger posed by Sinner Snache is the potential [[Surge Attack#Aftermath|Aftermath]] of killing it: a level 1 [[Surge Attack|Surge]] deep in your lines, which can be problematic if this enemy is present in large quantities or buffed to an extent, and if your army doesn't have many anti-surge units. ==Strategy== Due to how its most dangerous feature is the Surge that spawns far in front of it upon death, it is recommended to try and kill hordes of Sinner Snaches long before they reach the enemy frontlines, making [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Sexy Legs Cat]], [[Talents|Talented]] [[Dom Cat (Special Cat)|Dark Lazer]] and [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] highly recommended against it. While countering this enemy should rarely, if ever, be your priority, this same strategy can prove beneficial against most Akus with the [[Surge Attack#Aftermath|Aftermath]] ability all the same. As mentioned before, [[:Category:Cats with Surge Immunity|Surge-immune]]/[[:Category:Resist Surge Cats|Surge-resistant Cats]] are also an option, considering the widespread prevalence of such abilities amongst Aku enemies. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 553 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Sinner Snache |enemy_endesc1 = Snache marked by a blue flame of Aku power.
Lashes out with a Surge at the moment of death.
Probably weak against water, but that information
really isn't useful at all in this game. |image1 = Enemy icon 553.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 青き炎を宿すヘビのような形をしたヘビ。
命が尽きる瞬間、たまに烈波を放つ習性がある。
水にもめっぽう弱いがこの情報はゲームに
関係無いので注意が必要である。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Snake shaped like a snake, with a blue flame. Occasionally
releases an Intense Wave at the moment of death.
Very weak against water, but this information has
nothing to do with the game, and caution is advised. |Enemy name (JP) = インフェルにょろ (Inferunyoro) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 2: [[Mongolia (Aku Realm)|Mongolia/Saga]] (100%) *Stage 3: [[China (Aku Realm)|China/Kagoshima]] (100%) *Stage 4: [[Thailand (Aku Realm)|Thailand/Kumamoto]] (100%) *Stage 6: [[Philippines (Aku Realm)|Philippines/Oita]] (100%) *Stage 8: [[Australia (Aku Realm)|Australia/Kochi]] (100%) *Stage 9: [[Singapore (Aku Realm)|Singapore/Ehime]] (100%) *Stage 10: [[Maldives (Aku Realm)|Maldives/Tokushima]] (100%) *Stage 11: [[India (Aku Realm)|India/Kagawa]] (100%) *Stage 13: [[Dubai (Aku Realm)|Dubai/Hiroshima]] (100%) *Stage 16: [[Madagascar (Aku Realm)|Shimatori]] (100%) *Stage 21: [[Turkey (Aku Realm)|Turkey/Nara]] (200%) *Stage 24: [[Italy (Aku Realm)|Italy/Fukui]] (200%) *Stage 27: [[France (Aku Realm)|France/Gifu]] (200%) *Stage 28: [[Germany (Aku Realm)|Germany/Toyama]] (200%) *Stage 34: [[Canada (Aku Realm)|Canada/Kanagawa]] (300%) *Stage 41: [[Machu Picchu (Aku Realm)|Machu Picchu/Fukushima]] (300%) *Stage 45: [[Las Vegas (Aku Realm)|Las Vegas/Akita]] (400%) *Stage 48: [[Hawaii (Aku Realm)|Hawaii/Okinawa]] (400%) *Stage 49: [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon/Iriomote]] (400%) ===[[Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 40-2: [[Breathtaking Waves]] (600%) *Stage 41-2: [[Burning Crimson]] (600%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Report 3]]: [[Aku Studies 301: Intro]] (500%) *[[Empress' Report 4]]: **[[Aku Studies 401: Intro]] (500%) **[[Aku Studies 401: Field Research]] (500%) *[[Empress' Report 5]]: [[Aku Studies 501: Methods]] (500%) *[[Growing Evil]]: [[Aku's Whisper (Merciless)]] (300%) *[[Infernal Tower]]: **[[Infernal Tower/Floor 30|Floor 30]] (600%) **[[Infernal Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] (600%) ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *[[Hunter's Map II]]: [[Purple Stone Forest 2]] (400%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Sinner Snache |Health = 8,200 HP |Attack Power = 2,800 damage
(2,270 DPS) |Attack Range = 120
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 37f (1.23 seconds) |Movement Speed = 12 |Knockback = 2 times |Ability = Upon death, may create a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] for 60f 2 seconds between 350 and 750 range (50%) |Element = Aku |Occurrence = 10f 0.3s
(6f 0.2s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 553 e.png|Sinner Snache's spritesheet Sinnersnache.gif|Sinner Snache's animations ==Trivia== *Its Japanese name, Inferunyoro, is a portmanteau of the word "inferno" and "Nyoro", [[Snache]]'s Japanese name. **''Nyoro'' is another name for a wave dash (〜) or tilde (~), which Snache and its variants are vaguely shaped like. *As with many of Snache's variants, Sinner Snache's description breaks the 4th wall, claiming water is its weakness while it has no actual ingame effect. *Since its [[Aftermath]] only has a 50% chance of activation, it can have two different death animations depending on whether Aftermath activates or not. *This enemy can be seen as [[The Battle Cats]] counterpart of Shield Penan (the [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] variant of [[w:c:gegegenokitaro:Penanggalan|Penanggalan]] in [[Yuru-i GeGeGe no Kitarou: Youkai Dotabata Daisensou|YuruGeGe]]); both are peons that are only threatening because of the damage they cause when slain. *It, [[Condemned Peng (Aku)|Condemned Peng]], [[Le'Behemoth (Aku)|Le'Behemoth]], [[Fallen Bear (Aku)|Fallen Bear]] and [[Wicked Face (Aku)|Wicked Face]] were added to the game files in [[Version 10.8 Update|Version 10.8]], but were unimplemented and used [[Doge]]'s stats and sprites as placeholders until [[Version 10.9 Update|Version 10.9]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/555.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/The '''Cerberus Kids''' (ケルベローズ ''Keruberōzu'', "'''Ker-Bros'''") are an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Those Guys]] that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]] and [[The Aku Realms]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Cerberus Kids |image = Devilguys.png |first appearance = [[Arcane Confluence]]
'''Aku Realms''': [[Thailand (Aku Realm)|Thailand/Kumamoto]]
'''UL''': [[Breakwater Blood Feud|Sub-chapter 40 - Breakwater Blood Feud]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 66¢ - 260¢ }} ==Enemy== Like [[Those Guys]], their main purpose is to get in the way, as they have low base stats but are usually spawned en masse. They have a chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] units they hit for 4 seconds, which can be a problem, as they can prevent powerful units from shaking them off (them and other, more damaging enemies) once reached. Even tanky cats such as [[Dioramos (Uber Rare Cat)|Dioramos]] may end up taking a knockback when reached despite their health, due to the inability to attack. ==Strategy== Treat them like a more annoying version of [[Those Guys]]. They are a simple peon that almost any attacker can defeat. Despite their high damage, the actual hazard they have is their 4-second [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]], though with a measly 120 range and single target it shouldn't matter too much. If you are worried about it, however, use [[:Category:Cats with Freeze Immunity|Cats with Freeze Immunity]]. As with most peons, [[Wave Attack|Waves]] are the best way to obliterate swarms of them. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 554 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Cerberus Kids |enemy_endesc1 = A trio of netdwellers who sold their souls by
clicking on an Aku spam recruitment email
Used to be low-level Red enemies, now
successful entrepreneurs investing in Evil. |image1 = Enemy icon 554.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 悪魔募集のネット広告をみてトリオで契約。
左からティアブロ、バール、メフィスト
を名乗るビジネス悪魔三兄弟。
三人とも上京前は赤い敵として活躍。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Saw an online ad for Devil recruitment and signed a contract
as a trio. Three Devil brothers who call themselves
from left to right: Tiablo, Baal and Mephisto. All three
were active as Red enemies before coming to Tokyo. |Enemy name (JP) = ケルベローズ (Keruberōzu, "Ker-Bros") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 4: [[Thailand (Aku ([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 52f 1.73 seconds |Movement Speed = 10 |Knockback = 1 time |Ability = 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|Freeze]] Cat Units for 120f 4 seconds |Element = Aku |Occurrence = 13f 0.43s
(16f 0.53s backswing) }} ==Gallery== DevilThoseGuysspsritesheet.png|Cerberus Kids' spritesheet blue witches kids.gif|Cerberus Kids' animations ==Trivia== *Their collective name comes from [[wikipedia:Cerberus|Cerberus]], the canine guardian of the underworld in Greek Mythology who has three heads like how these netdwellers come in groups of three. **Their collective name in Japanese, Ker-Bros, is a portmanteau of ''Kérberos'', another name for Cerberus, and ''bros''. *According to their Japanese description, these stickmen have names. From left to right, you have Tiablo (ティアブロ ''Tiaburo''), Baal (バール ''Bāru'') and Mephisto (メフィスト ''Mefisuto''). **Tiablo is one letter away from diablo, the Spanish word for 'Devil'. **Baal is another name for the Christian demon [[wikipedia:Bael (demon)|Bael]]. **Mephisto takes his name from [[wikipedia:Mephistopheles|Mephistopheles]], a Faustian demon. **They share their names with the three [[diablowiki:Prime Evil|Prime Evils]] from the ''[[wikipedia:Diablo (series)|Diablo]]'' franchise – with the exception of Tiablo, which is off by one letter. *The Cerberus Kids look somewhat like The Three Robbers from the picture book and [https://youtu.be/dcbaDAtjCN0 animation] of the same name, though with pointier hats and no other clothing. "Used to be low-level [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] enemies" could be referring to how the robbers' adopted children wear red versions of their foster parents' outfits. *They have the lowest health and money drop of all [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku Enemies]]. *They were technically an event enemy for a short time, as they were initially exclusive to the [[Empress' Research]] stages and [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)|The Great Diablo]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/556.html ----
