https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Condemned Peng''' (ギルティ・ペン ''Giruti Pen'', "'''Guilty Peng'''") is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Jackie Peng]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Condemned Peng |image = Akupeng.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Japan (Aku Realm)|Japan/Fukuoka]]
'''UL''': [[Dried Fish Market|Sub-chapter 40 - Dried Fish Market]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 420¢ - 1,659¢ }} ==Enemy== A mid-ranged Area Attack peon with stats between [[Aku Doge (Aku)|Aku Doge]] and [[Aku Gory (Aku)|Aku Gory]], and a 50% chance to slow units on hit. His range, although inferior to go-to units like [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cat]] [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Lizard Cat (Normal Cat)|Dragon Cat]], nevertheless enables him to slow and potentially kill many shorter-ranged attackers like [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Bird Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Commando Cat]] and [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Dancing Flasher Cat]]. What really makes him a nuisance, though, is the Lv.3 [[Surge Attack]] that spawns when he dies. One Condemned Peng's Surge is bad enough on its own, but in groups they can leave a massive gap in your defenses. ==Strategy== While fighting this enemy, make sure to spawn [[:Category:Meatshield-class Cats|meatshields]] consistently as he is usually used as support for stronger enemies like [[Le'Behemoth (Aku)|Le'Behemoth]] or [[Fallen Bear (Aku)|Fallen Bear]] and can destroy your line of defense when paired with the [[Aku Altar (Enemy Base)|Aku Altar]] making your meatshields have low health. The Surges they leave behind are usually deadlier than the Condemned Pengs themselves, so using [[Talents|Talented]] [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Gato Amigo]] and [[Actress Cat (Special Cat)|Beefcake Cat]] is recommended against groups of them. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 555 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Condemned Peng |enemy_endesc1 = Famed for starring in "The Sleepless Peng."
To stay on for the sequel, made an Aku pact
for a body that needs no rest. They even threw
in a beam that can be fired from his forehead. |image1 = Enemy icon 555.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 映画「眠れない海のペンギン」で有名になった俳優。
役作りのために眠らない体が欲しいと悪魔と契約し
初回契約キャンペーンでもらったポイントを使って
頭からビームも出せるようにしてもらった。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An actor famed for starring in the movie "Penguin of the Sleepless Sea".
To be more suitable for the role, he made a contract with the Devils to have a body that needs no rest.
Using the points received from the first contract campaign, he asked for a beam that he can fire from his head. |Enemy name (JP) = ギルティ・ペン (Giruti Pen, "Guilty Peng") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} His [[Savage Blow]] ability only has a 10% chance to activate, but it can be strong enough to cause a dent in your frontlines. ==Strategy== Treat him like you would any variant of Gory. Units with high DPS such as [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] can take care of him easily if stacked, but tanks are not recommended due to his extreme DPS. ([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 16f 0.53 seconds |Movement Speed = 18 |Knockback = 4 times |Ability = 10% chance to perform a [[Savage Blow]] which deals 3x damage |Element = Aku |Occurrence = 6f 0.2s
(10f 0.33s backswing) }} ==Gallery== DevilGoryspritesheet.png|Aku Gory's spritesheet blue gorilla.gif|Aku Gory's animations ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Hell Gorilla (ヘルゴリラー ''Herugorirā''), is likely a reference to the ''Dragon Quest'' monster [[w:c:dragonquest:Barbatos|Barbatos]], who is known as Hellbattler (ヘルバトラー ''Herubatorā'') in Japan. This is because "gorilla" spelled in katakana would normally just be ゴリラ, without the ー (''[[wikipedia:Chōonpu|chōonpu]]''); by adding the ー, it actually translates to '''Hell Gorilla'''. And, of course, there's the fact that both are bulky blue gargoyle-like demons. *His description confirms that he used to be an [[Angelic Gory (Angel)|Angelic Gory]] but got fired due to multiple mistakes. He can thus be considered a "Fallen Angel", which is the origin of [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satan Satan] in Catholicism. *His Japanese description saying he was fired for a dark business problem but came back as a video streamer seems to reference [[wikipedia:Hiroyuki Miyasako|Hiroyuki Miyasako]], who, along with several other comedians, temporarily lost his job soon after he was found to have been attending yakuza parties, but later resurfaced as a regular [https://youtube.com/channel/UCtubooLn_qgqoWsWS-UWuHw YouTuber]. This scandal has been dubbed (roughly translated) "[[wikipedia:ja:お笑い芸人による闇営業問題|the comedians' dark business problem]]". *He was technically an event enemy for a short time, as he was initially exclusive to the [[Empress' Research]] stages and [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)|The Great Diablo]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/558.html ----

https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For other uses, see [[Akuma (disambiguation)|Akuma]].}} '''Le'Behemoth''' (悪魔ベヒモッス ''Akuma Behimossu'', "'''Devil Behemoth'''") is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Le'boin]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Le'Behemoth |image = Akuelephant.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Germany (Aku Realm)|Germany/Toyama]]
'''UL''': [[Toy Boat Graveyard|Sub-chapter 40 - Toy Boat Graveyard]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Clay Pot Soul Food|Sub-chapter 45 - Clay Pot Soul Food]] |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ }} ==Enemy== Le'Behemoth stands at a shorter range than [[Le'boin]] (380 < 400) but has an Omni Strike of -100~410. Although not much, his piercing range, combined with the lack of backswing on his attacks, allows him to push way more easily than if he just had 410 range, making meatshields that get knocked back in one hit mostly ineffective. Apart from that and having an extra-durable [[Shield]], Le'Behemoth isn't terribly different from your average Le'boin variant. Untrue to its name, it is not a behemoth enemy. His Omni Strike gives him the same reach as [[Le'noir (Black)|Le'noir]]; he is just barely outranged by [[Crazed Lizard Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic King Dragon]]. ==Strategy== Tanky meatshields paired with [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing units]] are effective against him. If you don't have a Shield Piercing unit, you'll be fighting him with more than triple the health, so bringing them is highly recommended. Once his Shield is broken, certain long-ranged crowd-controllers, namely [[Sniper the Recruit (Super Rare Cat)|Sniper the Heavy]] and [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]], can mostly nullify the threat he poses. Due to his range, it is recommended to mostly use big and bulky units to damage him, such as [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]], [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun]] or many Uber Rares. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 557 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Le'Behemoth |enemy_endesc1 = Made a deal with the Aku: his soul for a
set of very hard to come by photos... no
further questions. Grew a shield to better
protect that priceless photographic collection. |image1 = Enemy icon 557.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = ムフフな生写真を譲り受ける対価として
悪魔に自分の魂を売ったよこしまな象。
欲望のままにかき集めたコレクションを
守るため堅いシールドで防御している。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A wicked elephant who sold his soul to the Devils
in exchange for some pleasurable photos.
Defends himself with a strong Shield to protect
his growing collection. |Enemy name (JP) = 悪魔ベヒモッス (Akuma Behimossu, Devil Behemoth) }} == Encounters == {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 28: [[Germany (Aku Realm)|Germany]] (100%) *Stage 31: [[Norway (Aku Realm)|Norway]] (100%) *Stage 34: [[Canada (Aku Realm)|Canada]] (100%) *Stage 38: [[Colombia (Aku Realm)|Colombia]] (100%) *Stage 41: [[Machu Picchu (Aku Realm)|Machu Picchu]] (200%) *Stage 42: [[Easter Island (Aku Realm)|Easter Island]] (200%) *Stage 46: [[Hollywood (Aku Realm)|Hollywood]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 40-1: [[Toy Boat Graveyard]] (200%) *Stage 41-6: [[Burning Sunset]] (200%) *Stage 45-3: [[Clay Pot Soul Food]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Le'Behemoth |Health = 380,000 HP |Attack Power = 13,600 damage

[[Shield]] (initial HP: 800,000; regenerates with 50%) |Element = Aku }} ==Gallery== 557 e.png|Le'Behemoth's spritesheet LeBehemoth.gif|Le'Behemoth's animations ==Trivia== *The pentagram on his head is a reference to the [[wikipedia:Sigil of Baphomet|Sigil of Baphomet]]. *He and [[Miz Devil (Aku)|Miz Devil]] are the only [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku Enemies]] whose [[Shield]]s can't regenerate, as they both have only one knockback. *He, [[Sinner Snache (Aku)|Sinner Snache]], [[Condemned Peng (Aku)|Condemned Peng]], [[Fallen Bear (Aku)|Fallen Bear]] and [[Wicked Face (Aku)|Wicked Face]] were added to the game files in [[Version 10.8 Update|Version 10.8]], but were unimplemented and used [[Doge]]'s stats and sprites as placeholders until [[Version 10.9 Update|Version 10.9]]. *Because his hitbox starts at his feet, his Shield ends up clipping into his tusks, and certain units with very low ranges end up stopping inside his trunk. *Despite his name, he is not a [[:Category: Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] enemy. This is a [[The Battle Cats|BCEN]]-specific discrepancy caused by poor localization: the Behemoth type's Japanese name is "Super Beast" (超獣 ''Chōjū''), which is distinct from Le'Behemoth. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/559.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For other uses, see [[Akuma (disambiguation)|Akuma]].}} '''Fallen Bear''' (アックマ閣下 ''Akkuma Kakka'', "'''His Excellency Akkuma'''") is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Teacher Bear]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Fallen Bear |image = Akubear.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Sahara (Aku Realm)|Sahara/Osaka]]
'''UL''': [[Fishermen On Strike|Sub-chapter 40 - Fishermen On Strike]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Chaotic Pulse|Sub-chapter 43 - Chaotic Pulse]] |money drop = 1200¢ - 4740¢ }} ==Enemy== Much like the original, this form attacks relatively fast from a medium distance, and what he lacks in health he more than makes up for in damage per hit—the equivalent of a [[Panic Tower|300%]] [[Cadaver Bear (Zombie)|Cadaver Bear]] when unbuffed—as well as bearing a decently strong [[Shield]] to cover his negligible health pool. As the icing on the cake, he has a 100% chance to create a level 1 [[Surge Attack]] when he dies, with a spawn area designed specifically to wipe out your most valuable backliners. The only silver lining is that he has slightly lower range than other bears, enough for [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Sexy Legs Cat]] and [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] to safely hit him. ==Strategy== There are two ways to greatly speed up Fallen Bear's downfall. One involves using a [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing Cat]] (e.g. [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher Cat]]), who will, therefore, remove a massive chunk of health that would otherwise need damage to be broken, thus having basically the same impact as a massively powerful attack. Another way involves the exploitation of this enemy's own, low health pool behind the Shield. This means you can realistically pierce the Shield, then hit Fallen Bear hard enough to kill him in one shot, or to, at least, skip a knockback, preventing him from gaining a massive health boost ([[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] can one-shot this enemy at 100%, for example). ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 558 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Fallen Bear |enemy_endesc1 = An elite ambassador of the Aku Realms.
With a firm handshake and a beaming smile,
his physical bargaining is beyond reproach.
If things go sour... an atomic drop also works. |image1 = Enemy icon 558.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 魔界で活躍するエリート外交官。
笑顔で交わされるパワフルな握手と
物理的交渉術はめっちゃ強い。
好きな相撲の決まり手は悪魔出し投げ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An elite diplomat who is active in the Devil World.
His powerful handshakes and physical bargaining techniques
exchanged with a smile are extremely potent.
The decisive factor in his favorite sumo wrestling is the Devil throwing. |Enemy name (JP) = アックマ閣下 (Akkuma Kakka, "His Excellency Akkuma") }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 19: [[Sahara (Aku Realm)|Sahara/Osaka]] (100%) *Stage 20: [[Egypt (Aku Realm)|Egypt/Kyoto]] (100%) *Stage 22: [[Russia (Aku Realm)|Russia/Mie]] (100%) *Stage 25: [[Monaco (Aku Realm)|Monaco/Ishikawa]] (100%) *Stage 27: [[France (Aku Realm)|France/Gifu]] (100%) *Stage 29: [[Denmark (Aku Realm)|Denmark/Shizuoka]] (100%) *Stage 30: [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji]] (150%) *Stage 35: [[New York (Aku Realm)|New York/Chiba]] (150%) *Stage 37: [[Jamaica (Aku Realm)|Jamaica/Saitama]] (150%) *Stage 39: [[Brazil (Aku Realm)|Brazil/Tochigi]] (150%) *Stage 43: [[Mexico (Aku Realm)|Mexico/Yamagata]] (150%) *Stage 47: [[Alaska (Aku Realm)|Alaska/Hokkaido]] (200%) *Stage 48: [[Hawaii (Aku Realm)|Hawaii/Okinawa]] (200%) *Stage 30-IN: [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)/Invasion|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji Invasion]] (200%) ===[[Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 40-5: [[Fishermen On Strike]] (200%) *Stage 41-6: [[Burning Sunset]] (200%) *Stage 43-2: [[Chaotic Pulse]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Growing Evil]]: [[Aku's Whisper (Merciless)]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Fallen Bear |Health = 75,000 HP |Attack Power = 15,000 damage
(6,522 DPS) |Attack Range = 345
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 69f 2.3 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 16f 0.53s
(10f 0.33s backswing) |Ability = [[Shield]] (initial HP: 250,000; regenerates with 50% HP)
Upon death, creates a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] for 60f 2 seconds between 450 and 1,050 range (100%) |Element = Aku }} ==Gallery== 558 e.png|Fallen Bear's spritesheet blue bear.gif|Fallen Bear's animations ==Trivia== *His Japanese name, Akkuma Kakka (アックマ閣下, "His Excellency Akkuma"), combines the name of his trait (called ''Akuma'', which means "Devil") with the word for bear (''kuma''). **It may also be a reference to the Japanese musician, songwriter, entertainer, journalist, sumo commentator, actor and voice actor [[wikipedia:Demon Kakka|Demon Kakka]]. This is supported by how his Japanese description mentions sumo wrestling and how it's specifically his head that is engulfed in darkness, which is similar to how Demon Kakka always wears face paint. And just like [[Teacher Bear]], Demon Kakka's real name is not known to the general public. *He is currently the only Aku enemy to have both an [[Surge Attack#Aftermath|Aftermath]] and a Shield. *He, [[Sinner Snache (Aku)|Sinner Snache]], [[Condemned Peng (Aku)|Condemned Peng]], [[Le'Behemoth (Aku)|Le'Behemoth]], and [[Wicked Face (Aku)|Wicked Face]] were added to the game files in [[Version 10.8 Update|Version 10.8]], but were unimplemented and used [[Doge]]'s stats and sprites as placeholders until [[Version 10.9 Update|Version 10.9]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/560.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Wicked Face''' (魔我王, ''Ma Gaō'') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[The Face (Floating)|The Face]] that appears in [[The Aku Realms]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Wicked Face |image = Akuface.png |first appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Italy (Aku Realm)|Italy/Fukui]]
'''UL''': [[Magma Pillar|Sub-chapter 41 - Magma Pillar]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Chaotic Pulse|Sub-chapter 43 - Chaotic Pulse]] |money drop = 2,300¢ - 9,085¢ }} ==Enemy== Wicked Face has much longer range than The Face (enough to hit [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]]), which is further increased by his guaranteed [[Mini-Wave]]s. His stats are nothing to sneeze at either, plus he has a 30% chance to [[freeze]] units that survive his attacks, though very briefly. Yet another problem he poses is his [[Shield]], which more than doubles his health unless a [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercer]] breaks it. Fortunately, his movement speed is only double that of The Face and he still has a relatively slow attack rate. ==Strategy== Because of his range and Mini-Waves, it is quite difficult to properly outrange him, but not impossible. Since both the damage and the freeze uptime are low, most units who outranges him can still do a fairly good job against him while being mildly threatened at worst, or while being protected by [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] at best, who can safely tank Wicked Face's damage, despite him not being a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy. Another valid strategy, which is faster in absence of interferences and arguably much more accessible involves bulky units getting up close and quickly dealing damage, all while realistically lasting for a long time while under fire. A [[Talents|Talented]] [[Li'l Titan Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Jamiera Cat]] especially, can be expected to greatly impact the fight by potentially piercing Wicked Face's Shield. A Talented [[Kai (Uber Rare Cat)|Kai]] is another option. Shield aside, little can be done by applying effects on this foe, so raw power, as is often customary with Aku enemies, is the way to go. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 559 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Wicked Face |enemy_endesc1 = No one dares approach this all-powerful Aku!
Is what he thinks, but its really that he has a
terrible personality and is carrier of a variety of
foul bacteria (Source: Aku Researcher) |image1 = Enemy icon 559.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 近づくことも許されない魔界最強の悪魔。
と本人が豪語する頭でっかちな嫌われ者。
悪魔研究家によると魔界に生息するばい菌
なのではないか、という調査報告もある。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = "No one can approach the most powerful Devil in the Devil World."
The person in question is a hated person with a big head who speaks highly of himself.
According to Devil Researcher, this might be because he is a bacterium who lives in the Devil World. |Enemy name (JP) = 魔我王 (Ma Gaō) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 24: [[Italy (Aku Realm)|Italy/Fukui]] (100%) *Stage 40: [[Argentina (Aku Realm)|Argentina/Ibaraki]] (150%) *Stage 48: [[Hawaii (Aku Realm)|Hawaii/Okinawa]] (200%) ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 41-1: [[Magma Pillar]] (200%) *Stage 43-2: [[Chaotic Pulse]] (200%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 37|Floor 37]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Wicked Face |Health = 452,000 HP |Attack Power = 10,200 damage
(1,901 DPS) |Attack Range = 460
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 161f 5.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 2 |Knockback = 2 times |Occurrence = 32f 1.07s
(11f 0.37s backswing) |Ability = 30% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 60f 2 seconds
100% chance to create a Lv.4 [[Wave Attack#Mini-Wave|Mini-Wave]]
[[Shield]] (initial HP: 322,000; regenerates with 100% HP) |Element = Aku }} ==Gallery== 559 e.png|Wicked Face's spritesheet blue face.gif|Wicked Face's animations ==Trivia== *Just like [[Sathankhamun VIII (Aku)|Sathankhamun VIII]], his design is most likely a reference to Big Ben and Little Ben, the demon-costumed bacteria seen in some of TOTO's [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wag1pjUya94 toilet commercials], as his Japanese description raises the possibility that he, too, is a form of bacterium. *The word Gaō in his Japanese name, Ma Gaō (魔我王), doesn't mean anything on its own and is just a pun on ''kao'' (顔), meaning "face", though it can rarely also be a person's name. It consists of the kanji for "ego" or "self-assertion" (我) and "king" (王). ''Ma'' (魔) just means demon, evil, evil spirit, etc. *He, [[Sinner Snache (Aku)|Sinner Snache]], [[Condemned Peng (Aku)|Condemned Peng]], [[Le'Behemoth (Aku)|Le'Behemoth]] and [[Fallen Bear (Aku)|Fallen Bear]] were added to the game files in [[Version 10.8 Update|Version 10.8]], but were unimplemented and used [[Doge]]'s stats and sprites as placeholders until [[Version 10.9 Update|Version 10.9]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/561.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Aku Cyclone''' (デビルサイクロン ''Debirusaikuron'', '''Devil Cyclone''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy introduced in [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)|The Great Diablo]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Aku Cyclone |image = Devilcyclone.png |appearance = [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)|The Great Diablo]] [[Infernal Tower/Floor 38|Infernal Tower - Floor 38]] |money drop = 6,666¢ - 26,330¢}} ==Enemy== Aku Cyclone moves slowly and deals relatively low damage per hit for a [[Cyclone]], but more than makes up for it with a 1,666,666 HP [[Shield]] that regenerates with 100% HP each time it gets knocked back. Since it has 1,666,666 HP itself and gets knocked back 4 times, this effectively ''quintuples'' its health if you don't have any [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing Cats]]. It certainly doesn't help that there are very few [[:Category:Anti-Aku Cats|anti-Aku Cats]] in the current version of the game, and fewer still that can help when its Shield is up. It is not a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy, despite appearing to float above the ground. ==Strategy== If one is to own a cat with [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercer]], Aku Cyclone's much easier to counter depending on its activation chance, as you will only have to deal with a somewhat weak Shieldless Cyclone that can be slowed down by [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]]. Otherwise, since 4/5 of Aku Cyclone's HP is in the form of a Shield with protects from status effects, the only other way to defeat this enemy is with pure damage. Thankfully, the stage where it is introduced has a chance to drop [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher]] on clear, so for any future encounters it should be much easier to handle. [[Matador Cat (Rare Cat)|Bellydance Cat]] with the Target [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] [[Talents|Talent]] can be a great Meatshield against Aku Cyclone, as its debut stage only contains [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] and [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemies. The Cyclone itself doesn't do that much damage either, giving her many opportunities to dodge. If you don't have Bellydancer Cat, make sure your [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|dual]] [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Erasers]] are at a high enough level, as they can also stall this enemy to some extent. The Eraser Trio, (Normal, Manic, and [[Li'l Tank Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l]]) however, can permanently stall this enemy when it is by itself. Obviously use other attackers to deal with the support in the stage, some examples being [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]], [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] and [[Weightlifter Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Pizza Cat]]. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 560 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Aku Cyclone |enemy_endesc1 = A vast, all-consuming evil tempest. Souls
it draws inside are sent to the Aku realms
to join that land's wicked armies. Pierce
its shield and you might have a chance. |image1 = Enemy icon 560.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 悪魔的な吸引力ですべてを飲み込む大渦
飲み込まれた魂は悪魔の住む世界に
転生するという。破壊と再生を繰り返す
盾を打ち破れば勝機が見えるが… |enemy_jpdesc1 = A great vortex that swallows everything with its Devilish
suction power. It is said that the souls it consumes are
reborn in the world where the Devils live. If you can break its
Shield, repeatedly destroying and regenerating it, victory may be in sight... |Enemy name (JP) = デビルサイクロン (Debirusaikuron, Devil Cyclone)}} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *The Great Diablo: [[Wrath of Hell (Deadly)]] *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 38|Floor 38]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Aku Cyclone |Health = 1,666,666 HP |Attack Power = 6,666 damage
(33,330 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 6f 0.2 seconds |Movement Speed = 3 |Knockback = 4 times |Occurrence = 1f 0.03s
(5f 0.17s backswing) |Ability = [[Shield]] (initial HP: 1,666,666; regenerates with 100% HP) |Element = Aku }} ==Gallery== Medal 089.png|Aku Cyclone on the ''Storm of Evil'' [[Meow Medals|Meow Medal]] 560 e.png|Aku Cyclone's spritesheet shield monster.gif|Aku Cyclone's animations ==Trivia== *The text on its ring is upside-down katakana which translates as: "''Devil: Unbeaten by the rain, unbeaten by the wind, bested by neither seal nor summer heat.''" This is a parody of [[wikipedia:Kenji Miyazawa|Kenji Miyazawa]]'s famous poem ''[[wikipedia:Ame ni mo Makezu|Ame ni mo Makezu]]''. *Its blades resemble bat wings. *Its damage per hit and minimum money drop are both 6,666, referencing the [[wikipedia:Number of the beast|Number of the Beast]]. **It's health is also a 1 followed by 666,666 **It's attack frequency is 6f, unlike most other cyclones' 5f ***The other exceptions are Perfect Cyclone and Primeval Cyclone, which also have an attack frequency of 6f ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/562.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the stronger variant, see [[High Priest Mamon (Aku)]].}} '''Dark Priest Mamon''' (神官マモーン ''Shinkan Mamōn'', "'''Priest Mamon'''") is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy introduced in stage 30 of [[The Aku Realms]], [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Dark Priest Mamon |image = Akusorcerer1.png |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ |appearance = '''The Aku Realms:''' [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji]] }} ==Enemy== Dark Priest Mamon is a powerful enemy, with basically no shortcomings. High offensive and defensive capabilities, good range with added [[Hitbox#Subdivisions|piercing range]] and [[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]. His long attack animation is his only weakness. His stats may not seem threatening, but keep in mind that an [[Aku Altar (Enemy Base)|Aku Altar]] will be more than enough to fix this issue when he is first encountered. ==Strategy== Dark Priest Mamon isn't too hard to stall, so units who can outrange him and take out his support, if paired with fast meatshields, can overcome the challenges he poses. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 570 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Dark Priest Mamon |enemy_endesc1 = Evil priest with a wicked dream to rule all the
Aku Realms. Built Altars to seal away the power
of his enemies and drain them of their lifeforce
to be used to fulfill his own dark ambitions. |image1 = Enemy icon 570.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 魔界征服の野望を持つ邪教の神官。
各地にレベル封印を行う城を建造し
かつて英雄により封じ込められた破壊神を
自分の野望に利用しようと企んでいる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = An evil priest with ambitions to conquer the Devil World.
Built level-sealing fortresses across the lands,
and plans to use the god of destruction, once
sealed away by heroes, for his own ambitions. |Enemy name (JP) = 神官マモーン (Shinkan Mamon, "Priest Mamon") }} ==Variant== {{Variant |High Priest Mamon |A stronger variant of Dark Priest Mamon, with better stats, range, [[Shield]] and a [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] effect that takes off 15% of Cat Units' maximum health. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 30: [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Dark Priest Mamon |Health = 680,000 HP |Attack Power = 20,999 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|For the weaker boss that must be defeated first, see [[Dark Priest Mamon (Aku)]].}} '''High Priest Mamon''' (大神官マモーン ''Dai Shinkan Mamōn'', '''Great Priest Mamon''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy introduced in the 49th stage of [[The Aku Realms]], [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon/Iriomote]]. {{Enemy Info |name = High Priest Mamon |image = Akusorcerer2.png |appearance = '''Aku Realms''': [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon/Iriomote]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== High Priest Mamon is a force to be reckoned with. His attacks are devastating, with almost no way to avoid them or interrupt him. While he attacks non-stop, Cats are expected to break a massively powerful [[Shield]], then deal with his massive health, which is no easy task. His long foreswing gives cats a chance to get in his range, but the attack, both [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] and damaging, which also hits outside of his maximum range, is pretty much guaranteed to require a new batch of units for the next attack. Luckily, his speed and lack of downtime when attacking mean he will not move much if there are Cats ready to enter his range, meaning he has to rely on other enemies keeping cats off his range after he attacks. ==Strategy== Stalling this enemy isn't that hard and you must drain his limited support while keeping him at bay. Then, slowly but surely, he will go down. For this to happen, you need to make sure that you have the proper units for whoever supports it, as to prevent them from getting in the way, but you also need fast meatshields, such as [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Mohawk Cat]], [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]] or [[Talents|Talented]] [[Pogo Cat (Rare Cat)|Jiangshi Cat]]. Once you are sure that he won't have many opportunities to move, add one or more [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing Cats]] to hopefully get rid of his shield. [[Aku Researcher (Rare Cat)|Aku Researcher]] works fine. Once the Shield is down, you can take advantage of the situation to knock High Priest Mamon back a bunch or keep attacking until he takes enough damage, then repeat until he dies, and obliterate the enemy base. ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 571 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = High Priest Mamon |enemy_endesc1 = A mighty mage who steals life energy to use in
the resurrection ritual of the Lord of Ruin.
Will the perfect world he dreams of come to
pass, or will there be unexpected costs...? |image1 = Enemy icon 571.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 我が身の破滅をもかえりみず破壊神復活の
儀式を遂行しようとする大神官。
その先の世界に果たして己が本当に
望む世界が訪れるのか、それとも… |enemy_jpdesc1 = The High Priest is determined to carry out
the ritual of the resurrection of the God of Destruction.
Will the world beyond truly be the one
that he desires, or… |Enemy name (JP) = 大神官マモーン (Dai Shinkan Mamon, Great Priest Mamon) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 49: [[Moon (Aku Realm)|Moon/Iriomote]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = High Priest Mamon |Health = 1,620,000 HP |Attack Power = 32,200 damage
(4,805 DPS) |Attack Range = 400
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 201f 6.7 seconds |Movement Speed = 5 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 105f 3.5s
(96f 3.2s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]](Effective Range: -300~500)
100% chance for a [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] attack (takes 15% of Cats' health)
[[Shield]] (initial HP: 1,800,000; regenerates with 100% HP) |Element = Aku }} ==Gallery== 571 e.png|High Priest Mamon's spritesheet IdleHighBoi.gif|High Priest Mamon's moving animation File:Manon KB.gif|The image of Manon's Knockback, showing an extra finger ==Trivia== *He is more than likely a reference to the ''[[wikipedia:Dragon Quest|Dragon Quest]]'' character [[w:c:dragonquest:Hargon|Hargon]], as besides having similar designs, both are evil priests who aim to summon skull-wearing demonic gods of destruction ([[w:c:dragonquest:Malroth|Malroth]] in Hargon's case, [[Lord of Ruin Jagando (Aku)|Lord of Ruin Jagando]] in High Priest Mamon's). *His name is one letter away from [[wikipedia:Mammon|Mammon]], which has often been used as a name for a patron demon of greed. *Mamon sounds dangerously close to the Spanish insult ''Mamón'', so the Spanish translation renames him to Babón. *When Mamon is knocked back, his left hand temporarily gains an extra finger. *He is tied with Lord of Ruin Jagando for the highest [[Shield]] health of all [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/573.html ----

"'''Destruction God Jagando'''") is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] enemy found in an [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)/Invasion|invasion]] which appears in [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji]] after clearing all stages in [[The Aku Realms]]. Once defeated, his [[:Category:Legend Cats|Legend Cat]] counterpart [[Jagando Jr. (Special Cat)|Jagando Jr.]] will be unlocked. {{Enemy Info |name = Lord of Ruin Jagando |image = Akubeast.png |appearance = '''Aku Realm:''' [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)/Invasion|Mount Aku/Mount Fuji Invasion]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 19,750¢ }} ==Enemy== At a glance, Lord of Ruin Jagando may not seem that dangerous, as he only has 300 range and the first two hits of his attack total to just 12,000 damage, with the third taking much longer to execute. These major weaknesses are completely offset by an [[Omni Strike]] that extends Jagando's reach to 450, removing any chance of him missing his third hit and allowing him to reach the majority of non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rare Cats]], including [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercers]] that could help cut down his effective health pool of 5,600,000. If that weren't enough, the third hit also carries a wildly inconsistent [[Surge Attack]] that has a 30% chance to spawn and could wipe out everything or nothing depending on when and where it appears; so don't expect to beat him and his support on your first try. ==Strategy== :''See [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)/Invasion]].'' ==Description== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 572 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Lord of Ruin Jagando |enemy_endesc1 = The evil god of destruction, once sealed away

but brought back into this world by the Great Priest's resurrection ritual. The nightmare of the great
calamity is back in the minds of the people... |Enemy name (JP) = 破壊神ジャガンドー (Hakai-shin Jagandō, Destruction God Jagando) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[The Aku Realms]]=== *Stage 30-IN: [[Mount Aku (Aku Realm)/Invasion|Mount Aku Invasion]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Lord of Ruin Jagando |Health = 2,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 36,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Medu-san''' (マデューさん ''Madū-san'') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Mr. Mer]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Medu-san |image = Aku mr mer.png |money drop = 1,000¢ - 3,950¢ |first appearance = [[Aku Studies 401: Inquiry]] '''UL''': [[Breathtaking Waves|Sub-chapter 40 - Breathtaking Waves]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Hell's Crater|Sub-chapter 41 - Hell's Crater]] }} ==Enemy== In terms of health, damage and range, Medu-san is actually weaker than her [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] counterpart. Even her Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] doesn't allow her to reach any farther than Mr. Mer with his [[Mini-Wave]]s. ==Strategy== She has 20 less range than Mr. Mer, leaving her open to being frozen by a [[Talents|Talented]] [[Gardener Cat (Rare Cat)|Weedwacker Cat]], though you may additionally have to unlock Resist Surge for him to stand a chance against her. Other options include fully [[:Category:Cats with Surge Immunity|Surge-immune Cats]] such as Talented [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Gato Amigo]] as a meatshield and Talented [[Actress Cat (Special Cat)|Beefcake Cat]] as an attacker. Even Cats that can outrange Medu-san's regular attacks can still potentially get hit by a Surge depending on where it spawns. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 583 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Medu-san |enemy_endesc1 = Aku suffering an identity crisis. "Am I a
snake, lion or fish?" she asks each traveler,
and turns them to stone if they answer wrong.
Extremely dangerous, with Surge attacks. |image1 = Enemy icon 583.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 自分はヘビなのかライオンなのか
それとも魚なのか？を旅人に問いかけては
何を答えても石像にする悪魔。
烈波も繰り出すあぶないやつ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = "Am I a snake, a lion or a fish?"
That's what this Devil asks travelers before turning
them into stone statues no matter what they say.
A dangerous guy who also creates Intense Waves. |Enemy name (JP) = マデューさん (Madū-san) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 40-2: [[Breathtaking Waves]] (150%) *Stage 41-4: [[Hell's Crater]] (150%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Aku Studies 401: Inquiry]] (100%) *[[Aku Studies 501: Field Research]] (150%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Medu-san |Health = 788,000 HP |Attack Power = 8,800 damage
(2,839 DPS) |Attack Range = 240
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 93f 3.1 seconds |Movement Speed = 6 |Knockback = 1 time |Ability = 100% chance to create a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] for 20f 0.67 seconds between 150 and 750 range |Element = Aku |Occurrence = 6f 0.2s
(11f 0.37s backswing) }} ==Gallery== 583 e.png|Medu-san's spritesheet IdleMedusan.gif|Medu-san's moving animation ==Trivia== *Her snakes look the same as [[Medusa Cat (Rare Cat)|Medusa Cat]]'s, only black with yellow eyes. *Her name is a portmanteau of ''[[wikipedia:Medusa|Medusa]]'', the most famous gorgon of Greek mythology; and ''-san'', a Japanese honorific roughly equivalent to English "Mr.", "Ms". or "Mrs". **Her Japanese name, Madū-san, also incorporates the word ''ma'', meaning "demon" or "evil spirit". **Her description may also be a reference to the Japanese spirit [[wikipedia:Kuchisake-onna|Kuchisake-onna]] who asks someone if she is pretty, either killing or injuring them depending on their answer. *She and [[Kunio-kun (Uber Rare Cat)|Kunio-kun]] are the only characters whose English names contain Japanese honorifics. *Her Japanese description is the opposite of [[Mr. Mer]]'s. Where Mr. Mer is a travelling stone statue that is alive, Medu-san claims the lives of travelers by turning them into stone statues. *She was technically an event enemy for a short time, as her only appearance at first was in [[Empress' Report 4]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/585.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Miz Devil''' (シスターデビル ''Shisutādebiru'', '''Sister Devil''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Mr. Angel (Angel)|Mr. Angel]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Miz Devil |image = Aku mr angel.png |money drop = 75¢ - 296¢ |first appearance = [[Empress' Report 3]]
'''UL''': [[Toy Boat Graveyard|Sub-chapter 40 - Toy Boat Graveyard]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] }} ==Enemy== Miz Devil is overall quite similar to her [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angelic]] brother, but can push more easily thanks to her shorter range, only gets knocked back once, and has most of her health pool converted into a one-time [[Shield]]. By herself she isn't a problem, but swarms of Miz Devils can be a real pain if you aren't quick enough to break their Shields. While her base stats are quite low, she is buffed to 300% in almost all of her appearances. ==Strategy== Despite being an Aku, Miz Devil works more like a [[:Category:Metal Enemies|Metal]] enemy in that even the weakest [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing]] attack will spell instant doom for her, otherwise many hits tend to be required. Of course, she isn't actually Metal, so delivering high damage also works. Although not too dangerous, it can be difficult to keep up the needed DPS, so groups of her can cause a problem to the feline frontline. On the other hand, her unusual resilience and short range make her an ideal stepping stone for [[:Category:Wave Attack Cats|Wave Attackers]], [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] in particular. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 584 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Miz Devil |enemy_endesc1 = Malicious romance "expert" who takes every
chance to give bad love advice and cause
heartbreak. Often found downtown, ruining
any promising first date she happens upon. |image1 = Enemy icon 584.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 恋に悩む者たちへ勝手なアドバイスを
押し付けてくる悪の恋愛コンシェルジュ。
街行くカップルを見つけては邪魔に入り
無理やり苦難を乗り越えさせ成就させる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = She is an evil concierge who gives selfish advice to

This time, however, it is a ''great'' demon king that is mentioned. In the English version, this great demon king is known as the Great Aku. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/587.html ----

(ミッドナイトナカイ ''Middonaito Nakai'', '''Midnight Nakai''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Rain D.]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Midnite D. |image = E 588.png |money drop = 800¢ - 3,160¢ |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Fire Kingdom Dynamite|Sub-chapter 41 - Fire Kingdom Dynamite]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] }} ==Enemy== Rain D. may have been annoying with all his knockbacks, but Midnite D. makes those knockbacks terrifying, with a [[Shield]] that regenerates for each and every one of them. The Shield is relatively weak when compared to others, but the effect builds up due to how many times it could potentially regenerate, each time possibly blocking a devastating hit that would have marked his demise, or stopping a negative effect from being applied, or allowing Midnite D. to attack without being interrupted. Otherwise, he behaves in much the same way as Rain D. ==Strategy== Normally, [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercing Cats]] would be the best answer to a Shield, but for him you're better off brute-forcing him. Skipping knockbacks can also greatly reduce his effective health. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 586 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Midnite D. |enemy_endesc1 = A cousin of Rain, with jet-black antlers.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Ackey''' (デビルカツヤ ''Debiru Katsuya'', '''Devil Katsuya''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]] variant of [[Tackey (Black)|Tackey]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Ackey |image = E 589.png |first appearance = [[Aku Studies 501: Inquiry]]
'''UL''': [[Seahorses Caught|Sub-chapter 40 - Seahorses Caught]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Titanic Steakhouse|Sub-chapter 46 - Titanic Steakhouse]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,172¢ }} ==Enemy== Like Tackey and [[Hackey (Red)|Hackey]] before him, Ackey's attacks can only hit behind his target, resulting in the ability to hit your backliners by using your frontliners as stepping stones. His health is quite low, but he has a [[Shield]] that can tank almost nine times as much, thus resulting in very high survivability. The problems don't end here, as Ackey's attack is split into three hits that get progressively weaker but can occasionally freeze your cats in place. Due to the multi-hit, he approximately has a 66% chance of freezing any cats he hits. ==Strategy== Depending on the stage in which Ackey appears, it may be worth trying to get a powerful attacker in his range by having said attacker be approached by Ackey while the meatshield line is dangerously close to said attacker. This isn't easy to achieve, but if [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Bahamut Cat]] or an Uber with similar features could make it into his blind spot, Ackey's days would be counted. A much less risky way to deal with him is to use short-ranged cats, as anything with less than 200 range will easily reach his blind spot, if they can get past the attack. Short-ranged [[:Category:Shield Piercing Cats|Shield Piercers]] such as [[Talents|Talented]] [[Li'l Titan Cat (Special Cat)|Li'l Jamiera Cat]] are particularly effective in dealing with this enemy. Once Ackey's Shield breaks, it is important to finish the job in as few hits as possible, as failing to skip a knockback basically means having to start over. For this reason, it is recommended to time Awakened Bahamut Cat to finish him, or only using cats with more damage than he has health. If Ackey's Shield regenerates, then you will have to repeat that entire process again or depend on another lucky Shield-Pierce. Thankfully, Ackey's shield can only ever regenerate once. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 587 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Ackey |enemy_endesc1 = A cold-hearted high-school baseball ace
who sold his twin brother's soul to the Aku
for a tournament victory. A five-tool player
who's being scouted by the Major League.|image1 = Enemy icon 587.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 双子の兄の魂を悪魔に売り払い
全国大会まで勝ち進んだ心なき高校球児。
投手と打者と監督の三刀流スタイルは
メジャーリーグからも注目を集めている。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A heartless high-school baseball player who made it to
the national tournament by selling his twin brother's soul
to a Devil. His three-bladed style of pitcher, hitter
and manager has also been getting attention from the Major League. |Enemy name (JP) = デビルカツヤ (Debiru Katsuya, Devil Katsuya) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 40-6: [[Seahorses Caught]] *Stage 41-3: [[Boiling Blood]] *Stage 46-5: [[Titanic Steakhouse]] ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Report 5]]: [[Aku Studies 501: Inquiry]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Ackey |Health = 53,000 HP |Attack Power = 30,000 damage

But where Tatsuya's brother died in a traffic accident, Ackey's twin's death was purely his own doing. **Devil Katsuya may also be a reference to ''Tekken'' antagonist [[w:c:Tekken:Devil Kazuya|Devil Kazuya]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/589.html ----

His damage per hit is also much higher than Kory's or [[Berserkory (Red)|Berserkory]]'s but in exchange, he has a slower attack rate and half of Berserkory's [[Wave Attack|Wave]] length. ==Strategy== Deathkory's Waves are the main threat; [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] such as [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] are usually recommended to keep these waves at bay, although he outranges Octopus Cat and has the damage to kill it in two hits. Shield Piercing Cats are also recommended to trim his health pool, as without them you'll be fighting a koala with greater resilience than [[Relic Bun-Bun (Relic)|Relic Bun-Bun]]. Alternatively, you can rely on many wave immune units. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 588 |enemy category = Aku |Enemy name = Deathkory |enemy_endesc1 = An anarchic Kory fronting a deathcore

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Red EnerG''' (レッド・エナG ''Reddo Ena G'', '''Red Ena-G''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]] variant of [[H. Nah]] that appears in [[Legend Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Red EnerG |image = E 594.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Burning Sunset|Sub-chapter 41 - Burning Sunset]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Infinity Ridge|Sub-chapter 47 - Infinity Ridge]] |money drop = 1,313¢ - 5,186¢ }} ==Enemy== Red EnerG is one heck of a support enemy, boasting 370 range, at least 680k health in Uncanny Legends and only 3 knockbacks. At that point, he has slightly over 3 times of H. Nah's health with less damage per hit (18303 vs 13580), but his 100% chance to create a Lv.2 [[Surge Attack]] more than makes up for that. His knockback ability can synergize with the Surge to create a near-impenetrable wall that essentially counters rushers like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]]. On top of that, the Surge extends his attacks to a maximum of 475 range, meaning most non-[[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber]] Cats will never be completely safe. ==Strategy== The Surge mostly invalidates the sync + Awakened Bahamut strategy usually used on H. Nah, so [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]] is your best bet to chain this monstrosity with its Surge-Immunity. You can bait out Red EnerG's initial attack with fast units such as Bullet Train Cat to allow Idi:N2 to safely land a hit. It is ideal to chain Red EnerG with both Awakened Bahamut and Idi:N2 to quickly end the fight against him. Take note that while Cutter Cat is not very reliable against this foe due to a lack of Surge-Immunity, it is still wise to bring him for his Atk Up Combo with Li'l Brave Cat, and any damage you deal to Red EnerG is invaluable either way. When accompanied with other frontliners such as Lord Gravey, you can duke it out with Red EnerG from safety with Long-Distance units such as Awakened Mina. This is your safest method to slowly kill this enemy without the risk of your cats walking into Red EnerG's dangerous surges. Li'l Nyandam can also work due to standing outside its maximum Surge distance. Courier Cat is fast enough to hit Red EnerG before dying as a quick and cheap burst of damage. Luxury Bath Cat can be used in a desperate situation as he can strike Red EnerG once before getting hit if no units are in the way, although he is helpless against his surges. [[Boogie Cat (Special Cat)|Gato Amigo]], with his Surge-Immunity talent, is highly effective at stalling this foe, and their slow speeds help to clog up the battlefield against Red EnerG's favor. Meatshields with the Dodge ability can also halt Red EnerG's progress for a good while, primarily Bondage Cat with Talents and Bellydancer Cat. It should be noted that Bellydancer Cat with the Anti-Aku talent works especially well on Red EnerG's debut stage, Burning Sunset. Riceball Cat may seem appealing due to its Knockback-Immunity, but bear in mind that Red EnerG's surges can whittle down his health extremely quickly when considering his high cost for a meatshield. Notably, you can get iCat to freeze Red EnerG if it has a minimum Speed Talent level of 5 by catching him after the surge ends. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 592 |enemy category = Red |Enemy name = Red EnerG |enemy_endesc1 = H. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Archangel Exiel''' (大天使エクスエル ''Daitenshi Ekusueru'', "'''Archangel Exiel'''") is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of [[Mr. Angel (Angel)|Mr. Angel]] unique to the [[Divine Archangel Strikes]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Archangel Exiel |image = E 595.png |appearance = [[Divine Archangel Strikes]] |money drop = 750¢ - 2,962¢ }} ==Enemy== Archangel Exiel appears to be a gigantic [[Mr. Angel (Angel)|Mr. Angel]] with the black orb attached to the other Colossi embedded in his robe. His speed, attack rate, and abilities are like Mr. Angel's, but his health and range are magnified to where he becomes the main threat of his stages. Not only does he have 50 piercing range and three times the weaken duration, but he also warps units far back on every hit, making him a truly fearsome opponent when supported by [[Aku Gory (Aku)|Aku Gory]], [[Shadow Boxer K (Black)|Shadow Boxer K]] and [[Dark Otter (Black)|Dark Otter]] at the beginning and [[Capy (Red)|Capies]], [[Bore Jr.|Bore Jrs]] and [[Mr. Mer|Mr. Mers]] at the end. Like most Angel enemies, Archangel Exiel does not possess the [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] attribute despite his apearance. To keep him and his peons from pushing incredibly hard, [[:Category:Warp Blocker Cats|Warp Blockers]] are recommended to hold the front lines, though these Warp Blockers should be bulky enough to survive the barrage of attacks normally. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 593 |enemy category = Angel/Colossal |Enemy name = Archangel Exiel |enemy_endesc1 = A secret lab used unethical genome editing to

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Big Peng Z''' (ビッグペンZ, ''Biggu Pen Z'', "'''Big Peng Z'''") is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of [[Zackie Peng (Zombie)|Zackie Peng]] unique to the [[Big Peng Z Strikes]] event. {{Enemy Info |name = Big Peng Z |image = E 596.png |appearance = [[Big Peng Z Strikes]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== While a standing range of 150 may be quite low, Big Peng Z makes it work with an effective range of 500, thus leading to a terrifying piercing range of 350. To make things worse, despite his relatively low attack power Big Peng Z has the [[Special Abilities#Toxic|Toxic]] ability that can remove 50% of any Cat's HP, assuming that they aren't [[:Category:Cats with Toxic Immunity|immune]] or [[:Category:Resist Toxic Cats|resistant to Toxic]]. Without these, Big Peng Z's attacks have a guaranteed chance of eliminating any Cat Units in 2 hits regardless of his strength magnification, assuming that they aren't immediately taken out. For this reason, Toxic-immune Cats are essential. Additionally, as a Zombie, Big Peng Z can revive infinitely after just 1 second of being taken out, though with only 10% HP each revival. [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]] are highly recommended, as even a single extra attack can do serious damage. Any [[:Category:Cats with Curse ability|unit who can Curse]] Zombies (or [[Ototo Development Team|Curseblast]]) can temporarily eliminate the Toxic threat. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 594 |enemy category = Zombie/Colossal |Enemy name = Big Peng Z |enemy_endesc1 = A secret lab used unethical genome editing

For the Cat Unit, see [[Elder Beast Naala (Special Cat)]].}} '''Ultima Beast Naala''' (超古獣ナーラ, ''Chō Kojū Nāra'', '''Super Ancient Beast Naala''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] enemy introduced in [[Immortal Zenith]], the final stage in [[Behemoth's Peak]]. It is the enemy version of [[Elder Beast Naala (Special Cat)|Elder Beast Naala]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Ultima Beast Naala |image = E 601.png |appearance = '''UL''': [[Immortal Zenith|Sub-chapter 43 - Immortal Zenith]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Ultima Beast Naala stands at 400 range and has a multi-hit attack that covers three separate 200px areas in front of it, reaching up to 600 range on the last hit. The second and third hits deal half as much damage, so long-ranged units may not be punished as harshly as those in the frontlines, but all will be frozen and cursed regardless. Besides that, it has a massive health pool and is immune to [[Surge Attack|Surges]]. This would all make for a truly fearsome opponent if its support had any pushing power; the only real threats in its stage are the [[Angelic Gory (Angel)|Angelic Gories]] that come out every minute or so, making it very easy to stall for most of the battle. ==Strategy== :''See [[Immortal Zenith]].'' ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 599 |enemy category = Relic/Behemoth |Enemy name = Ultima Beast Naala |enemy_endesc1 = A sacred primordial being, known as the

共に生きる強さがあるか見定めるという。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A legendary beast that has lived for an eternity.

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Zapy''' (トロリンチョ ''Tororincho'') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]] variant of [[Capy (Red)|Capy]] that appears in [[Cats of the Cosmos]]' [[Zombie Outbreaks]] and [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Zapy |image = E 602.png |first appearance = '''CotC''': [[Zombie Outbreaks]]
'''UL''': [[Don't Rush Love|Sub-chapter 44 - Don't Rush Love]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Retreat of the Living Dead|Sub-chapter 46 - Retreat of the Living Dead]] |money drop = 550¢ - 2,172¢ }} ==Enemy== Capy is no longer weighed down by muscle! Becoming a fetid mass of decomposing sludge has its perks: her gains have plummeted and her stats are overall weaker, but she now has a faster attack rate, moves at more than double the speed and warps units far back instead of doing [[Critical Hit|Criticals]]. She revives once with 50% HP like many other zombies, but fortunately cannot burrow. Furthermore, she is immune to [[Surge Attack|Surges]] as well as [[Wave Attack|Waves]]. ==Strategy== Normally, Zapy wouldn't be too big of a problem due to her single target, but can become a huge issue if she's either in groups or is paired with support that can punch through your meatshields - especially with the Max # of Deployable Cats restrictions in Cats of the Cosmos' Zombie Outbreaks. [[Ototo Development Team|Holy Blast]] is a great option for damaging and freezing Zapy, but otherwise you could try and time a [[Ototo Development Team|Thunderbolt Cannon]] with [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] to either knockback or kill Zapy's support, before rushing the Zapy/Zapies down with [[:Category:Zombie Killer Cats|Zombie Killers]]. [[Wushu Cat (Rare Cat)|Sifu Cat]] can tank a hit from this enemy if at a high enough level. Additionally, the lack of Criticals means that [[Metal Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Metal Macho]] works quite well in some cases, though that depends on the enemies supporting Zapy. However, both Sifu and Metal Macho are at risk of being warped away. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 600 |enemy category = Zombie |Enemy name = Zapy |enemy_endesc1 = Capy was having a wonderful hot spring
holiday... until she unexpectedly died.
A real jerk who protects her corner of the
bath by Warping other visitors far away. |image1 = Enemy icon 600.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 温泉地獄めぐりを楽しんでいたら
いつの間にか死んでいたカピバラ。
湯船に入ってくる客に嚙みついては
遠くにワープさせてしまう迷惑なヤツ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This capybara was enjoying a tour of the hot spring hells
and before she knew it she was dead.
An annoying guy who bites anyone who comes into the bathtub

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Wild Doge''' (野生のわんこ ''Yasei no Wanko'', '''Wild Doggy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages]] and [[Enigma Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Wild Doge |image = E 605.png |first appearance = [[Archaeology 101: Planning]]
'''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 299¢ - 1,181¢ }} ==Enemy== The Traitless and Behemoth equivalent of [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]] or [[Gabriel (Angel)|Gabriel]], Wild Doge is slower than either but has even higher DPS, Area Attack, survives one lethal strike, is immune to [[Surge Attack]]s and has almost no backswing, making him one of the strongest [[Doge]] variants when it comes to pushing. In odd contrast to the bulk of Doge's other variants, he also has slightly longer range than most meatshields rather than being outranged himself (this includes units such as [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Slime Cat]] and [[Teacher BearCat (Rare Cat)|Teacher BearCat]], so timing may be required). Note that Behemoth isn't considered a trait, meaning that Cats whose abilities affect "all traited enemies" (e.g., [[Shining Amaterasu (Uber Rare Cat)|Shining Amaterasu]], [[Baby Gao (Uber Rare Cat)|Baby Gao]], [[Wafer Cat (Special Cat)|Wafer Cat]]) will not be any more effective against Wild Doge, although the anti-behemoth and traitless abilities still work. ==Strategy== Being immune to Surges changes little unless you rely heavily on [[:Category:Surge Attack Cats|Surge Attackers]] to win stages; the real problem comes from his ability to survive an attack from [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] or other hard-hitting units and then land a hit on them. Otherwise, treat Wild Doge like you would any of Doge's stronger variants, but with longer range and no trait. Since there aren't many [[:Category:Anti-Traitless Cats|anti-Traitless Cats]], the best strategy is to wear him down with [[:Category:Area Attack Cats|Area Attackers]] like [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Paris Cat]] and [[Crazed Bird Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed UFO Cat]]. [[Ururun Wolf (Special Cat)|Ururun Cat]] could be especially good for controlling hordes of them. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 603 |enemy category = [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] |Enemy name = Wild Doge |enemy_endesc1 = While trekking through the tropics, this Doge
has heard the call of the wild. They have now
quit their job, leaving behind a twin brother for
a life spent in pursuit of the ultimate wave. |image1 = Enemy icon 603.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 旅行で南国の大自然を訪れた時に見た
「野生の底力」に魅せられ、会社を辞めて
自然と生きる決意をしたわんこの双子の弟。
波乗りと泡盛で野生の生活を勤しんでいる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Doge's twin brother was so fascinated by the
"power of the wild" he saw on a trip to the tropical wilderness
that he decided to quit his job and live with nature.
He lives a wild life of surfing and awamori. |Enemy name (JP) = 野生のわんこ (Yasei no Wanko, Wild Doggy) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Casaurian Ahirujo''' (超鳥獣アヒルジョー, ''Chō Chōjū Ahirujō'', '''Super Bird-Beast Ahirujō''') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of [[Duche]] that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]] and [[Enigma Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Casaurian Ahirujo |image = E 606.png |appearance = [[Empress' Excavation 2]] [[Empress' Excavation 3]]
[[Hidden Forest of Gapra]]
[[Ashvini Desert]]
[[Jinfore Volcano]]
[[Hunter's Map I]]
[[Hunter's Map II]]
[[Hunter's Map III]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== A strong, hard-hitting enemy that has range on par with [[Mer-Cat (Rare Cat)|Cameraman Cat]] but gains hits progressively farther with each of the three hits of its attack, reaching [[Gross Cat (Normal Cat)|Gross Cat]] levels on the third hit. Make sure you have units that can tank its attacks, because its potential pushing power is immense. [[Apple Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Apple Cat]], [[Evil Cat (Rare Cat)|Evil Cat]], [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cats]] and the like are rendered useless by its immunities to freeze and slow. Casaurian Ahirujo is most dangerous when it has strong peons in front of it, allowing it to chip away at your frontline while not taking too much damage itself. ==Strategy== Though they may have wildly different attack ranges and styles, strategy-wise, think of Casaurian Ahirujo as a [[Bore (Red)|Bore]] that can't be frozen or slowed. [[Fish Cat (Normal Cat)|Whale Cat]], [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Fish Cat]] and optionally [[Dom Cat (Special Cat)|Dark Lazer]] can tank and bring down a lone Ahirujo just as well as against Bore, while [[Sushi Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fried Shrimp Cat]] can do double-duty tanking and weakening. Use [[Cat Combo]]s to further improve the efficacy of these units. Meatshields are important, but [[Tank Cat (Normal Cat)|Eraser Cat]] and [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]] have to be at very high levels (20+43 and 31 respectively) to endure all three hits from a 100% Ahirujo, so for early players, cheaper options like [[Cat (Normal Cat)|Macho Cat]], [[Crazed Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Macho Cat]] and [[Kyubey Cat (Rare Cat)|Kyubey Cat]] are preferred unless the Erasers are needed to survive hits from other enemies in the stage. Melee rushers like [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] are not effective due to its very strong attack and multi-hit, which will cause them to die before significant damage can be done. [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] is catered specifically to counter Casaurian Ahirujo: his Massive Damage and Behemoth Slayer abilities stack against Ahirujo's dual typing, adding up to '''33k''' DPS at level 30 with all [[Blood Fruit]]s! His only weak point is that he stands at the same range as Ahirujo, necessitating use of a "stepping stone" for him to be safe. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 604 |enemy category = [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] |Enemy name = Casaurian Ahirujo |enemy_endesc1 = A duck that fled back to nature and narrowly
avoided becoming foie gras. It violently rustles
its crests and can gore enemies with its giant
beak. A feral beast among feral beasts. |image1 = Enemy icon 604.png |Enemy name (JP) = 超鳥獣アヒルジョー (Chō Chōjū Ahirujō, Super Bird-Beast Ahirujō) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = フォアグラにされかけていた所を間一髪で
逃げ出し、野生の世界へ飛び込んだアヒル。
耳のようなトサカを振り乱し、巨大化した
クチバシから渾身の一撃を放つ凶暴性あり。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = This duck was about to become foie gras, but
escaped just in the nick of time by fleeing into the wild.
It rustles its gigantic ear-like crest,
unleashing its full strength from its enlarged beak. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Excavation 2]]: [[Archaeology 201: Methods]] *[[Empress' Excavation 3]]: [[Archaeology 301: Analysis]] *[[Hidden Forest of Gapra]]: **[[Woodlands Area 4]] **[[Deep Jungle Area 6]] **[[Deep Jungle Area 8]] **[[Deep Jungle Area 9]] *[[Ashvini Desert]]: **[[Badlands Area 2]] **[[Badlands Area 3]] **[[Burning Sands Area 5]] **[[Burning Sands Area 8]] **[[Burning Sands Area 9]] *[[Jinfore Volcano]]: **[[Magma Tunnel Area 1]] **[[Lava Caves Area 7]] ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *[[Hunter's Map I]]: **[[Purple Stone Forest 1]] **[[Red Stone Forest 1]] *[[Hunter's Map II]]: **[[Purple Stone Forest 2]] **[[Red Stone Forest 2]] **[[Green Stone Desert 2]] *[[Hunter's Map III]]: **[[Purple Stone Forest 3]] **[[Red Stone Forest 3]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Casaurian Ahirujo |Health = 1,200,000 HP |Attack Power = 19,500 damage
(8,863.64 DPS) |Attack Range = 250
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 66f 2.2 seconds |Movement Speed = 15 |Knockback = 5 times |Occurrence = 10f 0.33s
(34f 1.13s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (6,500 at 10f 0.33s, 6,500 at 21f 0.7s, 6,500 at 32f 1.07s)
[[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (1~251 on 1st hit, 1~301 on 2nd hit, 1~351 on 3rd hit)
5% chance to perform a [[Special Abilities#Savage Blow|Savage Blow]] for 3x damage
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Immune to Freeze]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Slow|Slow]] and [[Special Abilities#Evade Surge|Surge]] |Element = Red/Behemoth }} ==Gallery== 604 e.png|Casaurian Ahirujo's spritesheet 606.gif|Casaurian Ahirujo's attack animation Idle606.gif|Casaurian Ahirujo's moving animation ==Trivia== *Casaurian Ahirujo makes two different ''Monster Hunter'' references: **Its frills, beak shape, legs, coloration and attack animation draw heavily from [[w:c:monsterhunter:Yian Kut-Ku|Yian Kut-Ku]]. **Its name is a portmanteau of ''ahiru'', the Japanese word for duck, and ''Ibirujō'', the Japanese name of [[w:c:monsterhunter:Deviljho|Deviljho]]. *[[wikipedia:Foie gras|Foie gras]] is a French "delicacy" made from the fattened liver of a duck or goose. Due to the sheer cruelty of force-feeding and then slaughtering the birds, this dish is banned in many places. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/606.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Pterowl Hazuku''' (超竜獣オウルハズク, ''Chō Ryūjū Ōruhazuku'', '''Super Dragon-Beast Owlhazuku''') is a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of [[Owlbrow (Floating)|Owlbrow]] that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]] and [[Enigma Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Pterowl Hazuku |image = E 607.png |appearance = [[Empress' Excavation 3]]
[[Jinfore Volcano]]
[[Hunter's Map III]] |money drop = 2,500¢ - 9,875¢ }} ==Enemy== Even at 79 years old, this chimera of owl and dragon doesn't go down without a fight. Combining highly inconsistent [[Surge Attack|Surges]] with stats on par with an [[:Category:Advent Bosses|Advent Boss]], be prepared for anything too slow or long-ranged to enter Pterowl Hazuku's blind spot - which, ironically, is about the size of the regular Owlbrow's range - to suffer over 36k damage every 5~ seconds. ==Strategy== Luckily, in all of its appearances it barely has support or takes a long time to spawn, making getting into its blind spot or rushing the enemies the best options. For getting into its blind spot your best choices are [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fishman Cat]], [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]] (with speed up talent), [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]], [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] and similar units. [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] can also provide good support and [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] helps a lot due to its Behemoth Slayer ability crippling both Pterowl Hazuku and any [[Wild Doge (Behemoth)|Wild Doges]] accompanying it. Radical Cat is great against him as well, due to its decent health, surge immunity, Behemoth Slayer, and being strong against Floating enemies. Likewise, [[:Category:Uber Rare Cats|Uber Rares]] specializing in melee and with enough speed also have no trouble getting within the small blindspot. Its surge immunity matters little, as most surge attackers are completely unusable against it anyways. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 605 |enemy category = [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] |Enemy name = Pterowl Hazuku |enemy_endesc1 = An [[Owlbrow (Floating)|Owlbrow]] that awakened to its wild side at
age 79. An elder that descends onto a volcano
and unleashes years of pent-up anger as a
ball of light. Might release Surge attack. |image1 = Enemy icon 605.png |Enemy name (JP) = 超竜獣オウルハズク (Chō Ryūjū Ōruhazuku, Super Dragon-Beast Owlhazuku) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 79歳にして野生に目覚めたまゆげどり。
火山に君臨する長老となり
長年蓄積してきたうっぷんを強力な光弾に
変えて吐き出す。まれに烈波も出す。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = [[Owlbrow (Floating)|Mayu-ge Dori]] awakened to the wild at 79 years old.
Now the elder ruler of a volcano, it releases the
frustration it's built up over the years as powerful light bullets.
On rare occasions, it also fires an Intense Wave. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Excavation 3]]: [[Archaeology 301: Analysis]] *[[Jinfore Volcano]]: **[[Magma Tunnel Area 4]] **[[Lava Caves Area 7]] **[[Lava Caves Area 10]] ===[[Enigma Stages]]=== *[[Hunter's Map III]]: [[Yellow Stone Volcano 3]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Pterowl Hazuku |Health = 1,850,000 HP |Attack Power = 36,600 damage
(6,905.66 DPS) |Attack Range = 480
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 159f 5.3 seconds |Movement Speed = 8 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 50f 1.67s
(57f 1.9s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] (Effective Range: 330~1,060)
20% chance to create a Lv.1 [[Surge Attack]] between 400 and 1,200 range
[[Special Abilities#Evade Surge|Immune to Surge]] |Element = Floating/Behemoth }} ==Gallery== Idle607.gif|Pterowl Hazuku's moving animation 607.gif|Pterowl Hazuku's attack animation 605 e.png|Pterowl Hazuku's spritesheet ==Trivia== *''Pterowl'' is a portmanteau of ''pterosaur'', a type of flying reptile from the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods, and ''owl''. *Pterowl Hazuku makes two different ''Monster Hunter'' references. **Its design is somewhat similar to [[w:c:monsterhunter:Nightcloak Malfestio|Nightcloak Malfestio]], a monstrous owl with draconic wings. **It attacks by spitting a blue fireball born from anger, which [[w:c:monsterhunter:Silver Rathalos|Silver Rathalos]] is also known to do when enraged. *[[Owlbrow (Floating)|Owlbrow]] is stated to be 78 years old, while Pterowl Hazuku is 79. **It can be inferred that its "years of pent-up anger" are from constantly being treated as a [[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] enemy despite only walking. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/607.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''J.J. Jackrabbit''' (オオウサ銀, ''Ōusagin'') is a [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] variant of [[B.B.Bunny (Red)|B.B.Bunny]] that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]] and [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = J.J. Jackrabbit |image = E 609.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Ancient Sea Blues|Sub-chapter 44 - Ancient Sea Blues]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Inn-Dependence Day|Sub-chapter 46 - Inn-Dependence Day]] |money drop = 200¢ - 790¢ }} ==Enemy== A B.B.Bunny with bigger ears, bigger range, and a slightly bigger money drop. At 200% strength magnification, it has 130k HP and about 12.5k DPS, which is delivered through two consecutive hits that deal 9k damage each. Interestingly enough, the second hit also adds 100 piercing range, meaning units with under 150 range will suffer double damage. With their piercing range and 30% chance to knockback cats, groups of J.J. Jackrabbits can push at an alarming rate. ==Strategy== His strengths are defined by his piercing [[Special Abilities#Long Distance|Long Distance]] attacks and swift multi-hits. Units like [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bullet Train Cat]], [[Bath Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Luxury Bath Cat]], and [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] are recommended to take it out, or you could use [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] if there are no meatshields are in the way. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 607 |enemy category = [[:Category:Red Enemies|Red]]/[[:Category:Colossal Enemies|Colossal]] |Enemy name = J.J. wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Li'l Doge''' (ちびわんこ, ''Chibi Wanko'', '''Little Doggy''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Li'l Doge |image = E 610.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Tear-Soaked Puppy|Sub-chapter 44 - Tear-Soaked Puppy]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Neverending Footsteps|Sub-chapter 47 - Neverending Footsteps]] |money drop = 30¢ - 118¢ }} ==Enemy== [[Doge]]'s time-travelling grandchild possesses negligible health and damage like its grandfather. However, it has a relatively high movement speed, akin to [[Doge Dark (Black)|Doge Dark]]. Combined with a 20% chance of dodging your cat's attacks, it could lock the battleground and prevent said units from progressing, especially when spawned en masse. ==Strategy== Just like many other doge variants and your dodge-only meatshields, Li'l Doge abuses weak hits from your units (I.E. meatshields) to his advantage. While many units can one-shot him, things will quickly turn awry if he does dodge as it will effectively stall them (unless they have abilities allowing them to hit beyond their range) in a fashion similar to Stone Cat. Due the rarity of the curse ability, especially against traitless (anti-traitless curse options are all Uber Rare Cats), you may have to rely on the Curseblast cannon for a window of opportunity before you could wipe the field clean of them. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 608 |enemy category = [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]] |Enemy name = Li'l Doge |enemy_endesc1 = Grandchild of Doge. Came from the future to
alter the past where its Grandpa failed a test.
The questions on the entry exam are so
different they're having trouble affecting change. |image1 = Enemy icon 608.png |Enemy name (JP) = ちびわんこ (Chibi Wanko, Li'l Doge) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = わんこの孫。爺ちゃんが受験失敗した
過去を変えるために未来からやってきた。
自分のいた時代と入試問題が違いすぎて
未来を変えることに苦戦している。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Doge's grandchild. Its grandfather failed the exam.
Came from the future to change the past.
The entrance exam questions are too different from the
time that it came from, and now it's struggling to change the future. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 44-4: [[Tear-Soaked Puppy]] (500%) *Stage 44-6: [[Ancient Sea Blues]] (500%) *Stage 45-2: [[Local Harvest Forecast]] (500%) *Stage 47-6: [[Neverending Footsteps]] (500%) ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Bug Sumo Stages#Bug Sumo Preliminaries|Bug Sumo Preliminaries]]: [[Match: Jonokuchi]] (100%) *[[Bug Sumo Stages#Bug Sumo Finals|Bug Sumo Finals]]: [[Match: Yokozuna]] (500%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Li'l Doge |Health = 2,000 HP |Attack Power = 100 damage
(63.83 DPS) |Attack Range = 100
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 47f 1.57 seconds |Movement Speed = 20 |Knockback = 3 times |Occurrence = 8f 0.27s
(24f 0.8s backswing) |Ability = 20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Dodge Attack|dodge attacks]] from Cat Units, persists for 30f 1 second |Element = Traitless }} ==Gallery== Lil Doge.gif|Li'l Doge's attack animation 608 e.png|Li'l Doge's spritesheet ==Trivia== *Li'l Doge's description may be a reference to the overall plot of ''Doraemon'', in which [[w:c:Doraemon:Sewashi Nobi|Sewashi]] alters the past by assisting his failure of a great-great-grandfather [[w:c:Doraemon:Nobita Nobi|Nobita]]; the main difference is that Li'l Doge is implied to help [[Doge]] directly, rather than giving him a [[w:c:Doraemon:Doraemon (character)|robotic cat]], and hence unlike Sewashi, Li'l Doge is struggling to alter the future. All are also known for their poor academic skills, Nobita and Doge especially when it comes to exams. *Li'l Doge is the first non-collab enemy and the second enemy overall to have the Dodge Attack ability, the first being [[MikuDoge (Enemy)|MikuDoge]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/610.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Golem Sunfish''' (古兵器マンボロス, ''Koheiki Manbōrosu'', '''Ancient Weapon Manboroth''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] variant of [[Sunfish Jones (Angel)|Sunfish Jones]] that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Golem Sunfish |image = E 611.png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Ancient Sea Blues|Sub-chapter 44 - Ancient Sea Blues]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 3,333¢ - 13,165¢ }} ==Enemy== Golem Sunfish works like a weaker [[Ultima Beast Naala (Relic / Behemoth)|Ultima Beast Naala]], cursing and briefly freezing cats with a three-part ranged attack. Although the three hits add up to cover a massive area of 1,300 range, most of the damage is concentrated into the first hit, which lacks piercing range and has a blind spot that includes most meatshields. ==Strategy== [[Elder Mask Doron (Special Cat)|Cat Mask Doron]] is a valuable unit to use against Golem Sunfish, being able to freeze it for 5 seconds and thus buying more time for units such as [[Swimmer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fishman Cat]], [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]], [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Bullet Train Cat]] and [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]] to chip down its health. Likewise, Octopus Cat can also tank it with the curse immunity talent. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 609 |enemy category = [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]]/[[:Category:Floating Enemies|Floating]] |Enemy name = Golem Sunfish |enemy_endesc1 = A destructive weapon constructed by ancients.

近年、海底から浮上してきているとの噂。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = A fearsome weapon of destruction created by the ancients.
It is said that it could destroy the world with its beams of light. Sealed in the deep sea by a legendary sage, but
