wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''THE FOLIVOREAN''' (超棘獣ナマケモルガ, ''Chō Togejū Namakemoruga'', '''Super Thorn-Beast Namakemoruga''') is an [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] enemy that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = THE FOLIVOREAN |image = E 612.png |appearance = [[Empress' Excavation 2]]
[[Empress' Excavation 3]]
[[The Strongest Behemoth]]
[[Two Great Shadows]] |money drop = 2,000¢ - 7,900¢ }} ==Enemy== Surprisingly fast for a sloth, with speed somehow surpassing [[Elder Sloth (Alien)|Elder Sloth]]. A weak [[Shield]] offers it a moment's protection, immunity to [[Wave Attack|Waves]] guards it from [[Crazed Gross Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Crazed Sexy Legs Cat]] and [[Slime Cat (Rare Cat)|Jellycat]], and quills from its tail hit three times and occasionally freeze Cats for a few seconds. Its multi-hits are fired in a rapid succession, with decreasing coverage that reaches up to 500px; the third hit has a range of 350~500, so units within that area will suffer the most damage unless knocked back. ==Strategy== Most of the time, it acts as a backliner like its [[THE SLOTH|other]] [[Elder Sloth (Alien)|variants]], but you can't snipe it that much due to its HP and Wave immunity. [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] is a great unit to use, as it can chip it down or destroy it if unprotected. It's also able to tank two hits at a high enough level or one hit from a 200% one. If you own [[Nymph Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fiend Cat]], he can also help with his Long Distance knockbacks, as well as being able to tank hits with his resist talent. Most tanky low ranged units like [[Hip Hop Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Can Can Cat]] and [[Crazed Fish Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Island Cat]] still work, but that's only if it's unprotected. Above everything, do NOT let it reach your [[Cat Base]], as all the three hits will connect and deal huge damage, resulting in its destruction if you can't knockback THE FOLIVOREAN away fast enough. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 610 |enemy category = [[:Category:Aku Enemies|Aku]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] |Enemy name = THE FOLIVOREAN |enemy_endesc1 = A powerful Behemoth that became demonic as a
result of losing its home. It does not enjoy the
trees of the jungle it finds itself in. Can fire
spikes from its tail that Freeze all movement. |image1 = Enemy icon 610.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 森林破壊によって帰る場所を失い悪魔化した
最強の猛獣。行き着いたジャングルでは
木の好みが合わず、暴れまわっている。
尾のトゲを射出して動きを止めてくる。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = The strongest and most ferocious of the beasts became a Devil after its place of refuge fell victim to deforestation.
In the jungle where it has ended up, it can't find any trees
suited to its liking, and is now on a violent rampage.
It ejects spikes from its tail to stop others' movement. |Enemy name (JP) = 超棘獣ナマケモルガ (Chō Togejū Namakemoruga, Super Thorn-Beast Namakemoruga) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Excavation 2]]: [[Archaeology 201: Results]] (100%) *[[Empress' Excavation 3]]: [[Archaeology 301: Results]] (200%) *Affliction in the Forest: [[The Strongest Behemoth]] (100%) *Peril in the Volcano: [[Two Great Shadows]] (200%) *[[Hidden Forest of Gapra]]: **[[Deep Jungle Area 5]] (100%) **[[Deep Jungle Area 7]] (100%) **[[Deep Jungle Area 9]] (100%) **[[Deep Jungle Area 10]] (100%) *[[Jinfore Volcano]]: [[Lava Caves Area 6]] (200%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = THE FOLIVOREAN |Health = 1,000,000 HP |Attack Power = 51,000 damage

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/{{Disambig|This article is about the enemy. For the Cat Unit, see [[Ancient Egg N001 (Special Cat)]].}} '''Haniwanwan''' (ハニワンワン, '''Haniwanwan''') is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemy that appears in [[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Haniwanwan |image = E 614 (1).png |first appearance = '''UL''': [[Outta This Village|Sub-chapter 45 - Outta This Village]] |latest appearance = '''UL''': [[Eternal Ancient Woods|Sub-chapter 47 - Eternal Ancient Woods]] |money drop = 300¢ - 1,185¢ }} ==Enemy== A wall-type enemy similar to [[Chocolate Wall Doge (Event Enemy)|Chocolate Wall Doge]]. Its attacks are single-target but deal surprisingly high damage, 20,000 + 4,000 from a long-reaching [[Wave Attack#Mini-Wave|Mini-Wave]]; and can randomly inflict a variety of effects including knockback, freeze, slow, weaken and curse, albeit only for 2 seconds each. ==Strategy== [[:Category:Wave Shield Cats|Wave Shields]] are best advised against this foe: as Haniwanwan is single-target, this negates most of the threat it poses. [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] is probably your best bet. [[Calligraphy Cat (Rare Cat)|Teamaster Cat]] also stands out as one of the few [[:Category:Anti-Relic Cats|anti-Relics]] to be immune to its Mini-Waves. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 612 |enemy category = [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] |Enemy name = Haniwanwan |enemy_endesc1 = A dog created from clay to guard houses.
It has a suite of interference and jamming
functionality to prevent anyone from reaching
the house. Best feature: resembles its owner. |image1 = Enemy icon 612.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 家の番をするために製造された番犬埴輪。
空き巣対策として様々な妨害能力を持ち
なんぴとたりとも家には近づけない。
飼い主に顔が似る機能も標準装備。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Watchdog haniwa manufactured to guard a house.
Comes with a variety of obstructive abilities to keep
burglars from approaching the house at all.
It is also equipped with a function to resemble its owner's face. |Enemy name (JP) = ハニワンワン (Haniwanwan) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Legend Stages#Uncanny Legends|Uncanny Legends]]=== *Stage 45-6: [[Outta This Village]] *Stage 46-1: [[Stylist Mononoke]] *Stage 46-3: [[Aven-Jazz Cafe]] *Stage 47-3: [[Warning of the Setting Sun]] *Stage 47-5: [[Eternal Ancient Woods]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Haniwanwan |Health = 300,000 HP |Attack Power = 20,000 damage
(8,333.33 DPS) |Attack Range = 120
([[Special Abilities#Single Target|Single Target]]) |Time between attacks = 72f 2.4 seconds |Movement Speed = 4 |Knockback = 1 times |Occurrence = 25f 0.83s
(14f 0.47s backswing) |Ability = 20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Knockback|knockback]] Cat Units
20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Freeze|freeze]] Cat Units for 60f 2 seconds
20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Slow|slow]] Cat Units for 60f 2 seconds
20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Weaken|weaken]] Cat Units to 50% for 60f 2 seconds
20% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 60f 2 seconds
100% chance to create a Lv.4 [[Wave Attack#Mini-Wave|Mini-Wave]] |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== 612 e.png|Haniwanwan's spritesheet green statue thing.gif|Haniwanwan's animations ==Trivia== *Haniwanwan is based on a ''[[wikipedia:Haniwa|haniwa]]'', which were clay statues that were buried with the dead. ''Wan'' is the Japanese onomatopoeia for a dog's bark. **Since it attacks by spinning, it could also be a reference to the ''haniwa''-like [https://nookipedia.com/wiki/Gyroid gyroids] from the ''Animal Crossing'' series; the name "Gyroid" is derived from the word ''gyrate'', meaning "rotate". **Another possible reference is to the ''Final Fantasy'' series' [[w:c:finalfantasy:Cactuar|cactaur]], a green cactus with its arms in the same exact stance as Haniwanwan's. The cactuar resemblance would be greater if Haniwanwan had the face of an actual ''haniwa'' statue instead of a Doge. *Visually, Haniwanwan is an enemy version of [[Ancient Egg N001 (Special Cat)|Haniwa Cat]]. *[[Relic Doge (Relic)|Relic Doge]] and Haniwanwan are the only [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemies whose [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] abilities do not have a 100% chance to activate. *It and [[Sir Rel (Relic)|Sir Rel]] are the only [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] enemies to have a single-target attack. *It is tied with [[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]] for the lowest curse duration of all Relic enemies. **It is also one of the four cursing enemies whose curse duration is lower than its attack rate, the others being [[Urs & Fenrir (Relic)|Urs & Fenrir]], [[Othom (Relic/Floating)|Othom]] and [[Golem Sunfish (Relic, Floating)|Golem Sunfish]]. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/614.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Angelic Beast Rajakong''' (超天獣ラジャコング ''Chō Tenjū Rajakongu'', '''Super Heavenly Beast Rajakong''') is an [[:Category:Angel Enemies|Angel]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of [[Gory]] that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Angelic Beast Rajakong |image = E 613.png |appearance = [[Empress' Excavation 2]] |money drop = 4,500¢ - 17,775¢ }} ==Enemy== Angelic Beast Rajakong looks like a combination of [[Angelic Gory (Angel)|Angelic Gory]] and [[Ragin' Gory (Black / Behemoth)|Ragin' Gory]], but has more than 3 times as much health as both of them combined. It's immune to both [[Wave Attack|Waves]] and [[Surge Attack|Surges]], has 50 piercing range and a 10% chance for a Lv. 2 Wave on every hit, dealing double damage at close quarters and hurting an area of 667.5 range. ==Strategy== You absolutely want [[Rocker Cat (Rare Cat)|Artist/Ramen Cat]] as your meatshield at minimum due to Rajakong's insane pushing power and speed. Only bring [[Crazed Tank Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Manic Eraser Cat]] if necessary as some of his debut stages come with a nasty 15 Cat-Limit restriction. Be attentive in battle and look out for incoming enemies that may quickly whittle down Ramen Cat and allow Rajakong to suddenly push. As such, [[Curling Cat (Rare Cat)|Zamboney Cat]] serves as great protection for your existing stack in times of need, along with the [[Ototo Development Team|Slow Beam]] and [[Express Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Maglev Cat]]. [[Nymph Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Fiend Cat]] with Tough Vs and Target Angel [[Talents]] can help to push him back, especially if he can also hinder supporting enemies greatly. Though whenever Rajakong is left vulnerable to attacks, it is advisable to not use Fiend Cat during such times and to instead maximize damage dealt onto him. [[Onmyoji Cat (Rare Cat)|Thaumaturge Cat]] with Wave Immunity Talent unlocked can cripple him, but she can tend to miss often due to Rajakong's high knockback count, depending on the given stage and your lineup. Talented [[Stilts Cat (Rare Cat)|Acrobat Cats]] are unfortunately hindered by Rajakong's Surge Immunity and thus are not recommended, especially when there are other peons in front of him. For damage, either [[:Category:Cats with Wave Immunity|Wave-immune cats]] or low knockback-count units should be used due to Rajakong's frequent Wave Attacks and range. Talented [[Kung Fu Cat (Special Cat)|Dancer Cat]] is one of your best options, especially when you get a stack of them going off. [[Miyamoku Musashi (Special Cat)|Awakened Musashi]] is another viable option with good range, along with 3 Knockbacks for sufficient survivability. Whenever there are numerous peons, especially [[Wild Doge (Behemoth)|Wild Doges]], [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] is a very accessible option to deal significant damage with a stepping stone to get away from Rajakong's extended range. [[Fencer Cat (Super Rare Cat)|The Kitty of Liberty]] is a decent option due to its singular knockback and relatively cheap cost for its damage. While it is possible for [[Elder Beast Naala (Special Cat)|Storm Beast Naala]] to deal considerable damage in a pinch, be wary that its range and speed lead to a tendency of Naala walking right into Rajakong's attacks, significantly reducing is likelihood of long-term survival. If you have [[Ancient Egg: N106 (Rare Cat)|Mushroom Cat]], it can be useful in heavily damaging Rajakong due to its Behemoth Slayer, Massive Damage to Angels and wave immunity. In tight situations, [[Bahamut Cat (Special Cat)|Awakened Bahamut Cat]] is a great backup option to chip off sizeable amounts of health, but it can be inconsistent due to Rajakong's Waves. When building your lineup, you should only consider [[Kotatsu Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Octopus Cat]] if it consists of a substantial number of units that can turn the tides of battle yet are vulnerable to Ragakong's Wave attacks (like Awakened Bahamut Cat), as Rajakong can quickly shred through casual usage of Octopus Cat. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 613 |enemy category = Angel/Behemoth |Enemy name = Angelic Beast Rajakong |enemy_endesc1 = Ruler of nature itself with a frightful face that
belies his kind heart and desire to protect the
environment. With Waves, surges, and his holy
fist, beats down evil poachers. |image1 = Enemy icon 613.png |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 怖い顔の奥に秘められた優しい心で
地球環境を守ろうとする大自然の王
波動や烈波をもろともせず、聖なる拳で
悪しき密猟者をボコボコに叩きのめす |enemy_jpdesc1 = King of nature who just wants to protect the global environment,
with a gentle heart hidden behind a scary face.
Unimpeded by Waves or Intense Waves,
he beats evil poachers to a pulp with his holy fists. |Enemy name (JP) = 超天獣ラジャコング (Chō Tenjū Rajakongu, Super Heavenly Beast Rajakong) }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 100% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Empress' Excavation 2]]: **[[Archaeology 201: Planning]] **[[Archaeology 201: Methods]] **[[Archaeology 201: Results]] **[[Archaeology 201: Analysis]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Angelic Beast Rajakong |Health = 1,855,200 HP |Attack Power = 12,500 damage
(23,438 DPS) |Attack Range = 200
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 16f 0.53 seconds |Movement Speed = 36 |Knockback = 24 times |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -50~250)
10% chance to create a Lv.2 [[Wave Attack]]
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Waves|Immune to Waves]] and [[Special Abilities#Evade Surge|Surges]] |Occurrence = 6f 0.2s
(10f 0.33s backswing) |Element = Angel/Behemoth }} ==Gallery== 613 e.png|Angelic Beast Rajakong's spritesheet E 615.gif|Angelic Beast Rajakong's attack animation ==Trivia== *Angelic Beast Rajakong's name, design (specifically the horns) and electrical attack reference ''Monster Hunter'''s [[w:c:monsterhunter:Rajang|Rajang]]. *Angelic Beast Rajakong's English description appears to have been mistranslated: it's phrased as though he can ''use'' both [[Wave Attack|Waves]] and [[Surge Attack|Surges]], when in actuality he is immune to both but can only use Waves. The original Japanese description only mentions that he is immune to waves & surges. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/615.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Formicidaean Ariant''' (超爆獣アリアント, ''Chō Bakujū Arianto'', '''Super Explosive Beast Ariant''') is a [[:Category:Zombie Enemies|Zombie]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] enemy that appears in [[Behemoth Culling]] stages. {{Enemy Info |name = Formicidaean Ariant |image = E 614.png |appearance = [[Jinfore Volcano]]
[[Empress' Excavation 3]] |money drop = 280¢ - 1,106¢ }} ==Enemy== Only appearing at 200% strength magnification, Formicidaean Ariant steadily inches towards the [[Cat Base]] with its swollen abdomen. After a short burrow, it turns its rear towards the first cat it reaches and waits for its abdomen to further swell up like a balloon until it pops, dealing an enormous amount of damage three times in quick succession; this attack covers a wider area on each hit, reaching -390~390 on the third hit. Once it blows up, its abdomen immediately regrows, yet it still has to wait for some time before it can attack again. ==Strategy== At 200% strength magnification, any unit caught in Formicidaean Ariant's blast will suffer 90,000 damage just for one hit; the damage adds up to a maximum of 270,000, meaning most units - let alone the [[Cat Base]] - can't even withstand one abdominal assault from this miscre''ant''. It's also immune to freeze, weaken and knockback, so all in all, the best way to stop it is to kill it outright before it can blow up. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 614 |enemy category = Zombie/Behemoth |Enemy name = Formicidaean Ariant |enemy_endesc1 = Ant that worked very hard to gather food for
the winter only to overeat and find itself
wandering the line between life and death.
Its stomach explodes if it gets nervous. |image1 = Enemy icon 614.png |Enemy name (JP) = 超爆獣アリアント (Chō Bakujū Arianto, Super Explosive Beast Ariant) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 真面目にコツコツと働いて貯めたエサを
冬が来る前に我慢できずドカ食いしてしまい
お腹を壊して生死をさまよい続けるアリ。
緊張するとお腹を爆発させる危ないヤツ。 |enemy_jpdesc1 = Works hard and earnestly to hoard food for winter
Couldn't handle waiting and ended up gorging itself
Even after damaging its stomach, this ant continues to wander, living yet dead.
A dangerous guy who blows up its stomach when nervous. }} ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} This enemy has always appeared at 200% strength magnification. ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Jinfore Volcano]]: **[[Lava Caves Area 8]] **[[Lava Caves Area 10]] *[[Empress' Excavation 3]]: [[Archaeology 301: Methods]] ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Formicidaean Ariant |Health = 75,000 HP |Attack Power = 135,000 damage
(9,396.75 DPS) |Attack Range = 100
([[Special Abilities#Area Attack|Area Attack]]) |Time between attacks = 431f 14.37 seconds |Movement Speed = 7 |Knockback = 1 times |Occurrence = 160f 5.33s
(47f 5.57s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Multi-Hit|Multi-Hit]] (45,000 at 160f 5.33s, 45,000 at 162f 5.4s, 45,000 at 164f 5.47s)
[[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Ranges: -130~130 on 1st hit, -260~260 on 2nd hit, -390~390 on 3rd hit)
[[Special Abilities#Burrow|Burrows]] underground 500 after a Cat enters its range (1 time)
[[Special Abilities#Revive|Revives]] with 100% HP after being dead for 720f 24 seconds (1 time)
[[Special Abilities#Immune to Knockback|Immune to Knockback]], [[Special Abilities#Immune to Freeze|Freeze]] and [[Special Abilities#Immune to Weaken|Weaken]] |Element = Zombie/Behemoth }} ==Gallery== 614 e.png|Formicidaean Ariant's spritesheet 614 attack.gif|Formicidaean Ariant's attack animation ==Trivia== *The word ''ari'' in Formicidaean Ariant's Japanese name, Ariant, is the Japanese word for ant, so its name literally means "Antant". **Ariant is also one letter away from Aiant, the Japanese name of the ant Pokémon [[bulbapedia:Durant (Pokémon)|Durant]]. ***This makes it the only [[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] to potentially reference another franchise besides ''Monster Hunter''. *Formicidaean Ariant is specifically a [[wikipedia:Honeypot ant|honeypot ant]], whose workers get so gorged with food that their abdomens swell up like Formicidaean Ariant's. *The way it attacks could be inspired by the [[wikipedia:Colobopsis saundersi|Colobopsis saundersi]], a type of ant that can rupture its gaster as a defence mechanism. *Since all Behemoths besides [[Ragin' Gory (Black / Behemoth)|Ragin' Gory]] are ''Monster Hunter'' references, it can be assumed that Formicidaean Ariant is intended to parallel [[w:c:monsterhunter:Altaroth|Altaroth]], insectoid monsters with the abdomen-swelling characteristic shared by honeypot ants and Formicidaean Ariant. *Formicidaean Ariant's trait may be an indirect reference to [[wikipedia:Ophiocordyceps unilateralis|''ophiocordyceps unilateralis'']] (zombie-ant fungus) and its [https://youtu.be/vijGdWn5-h8 hosts]. *Unlike real ants, Formicidaean Ariant has no mandibles and four limbs instead of six; though, as a decomposing corpse, it's possible that they already rotted away. *The pattern on Formicidaean Ariant's abdomen looks somewhat like a screaming face with two eyes, two small nostrils, and a mouth gaping wide open. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/616.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Spiritual Yulala''' (ネコ神面のウララー, ''Nekoshinmen no Urarā'', "'''Cat God-Mask Urara'''" or "'''Divine Cat Mask Urara'''") is a [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relic]] variant of [[Mystic Mask Yulala (Enemy Unit)|Mystic Mask Yulala]] that appears on the [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40|40th floor]] of the [[Infernal Tower]], which unlocks him as [[Masked Yulala (Special Cat)|Masked Yulala]]'s [[True Form]] when completed. {{Enemy Info |name = Spiritual Yulala |image = E 616.png |appearance = [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40|Infernal Tower - Floor 40]] |money drop = 3,000¢ - 11,850¢ }} ==Enemy== Spiritual Yulala is largely the same as the original Mystic Mask Yulala, just with higher health and damage, one less knockback, a trait and a 5-second curse as a supplement to his warp ability. While having a trait prevents you from using [[Glass Cat (Rare Cat)|Macho Crystal Cat]] or [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Tourist Cat]] to stall him, it's now possible to take off massive chunks of his health pool with [[Idi:N (Special Cat)|Idi:N2]] and freeze him with [[Elder Mask Doron (Special Cat)|Elder Mask Doron]]. Like with [[Masked Grandmaster Cat (Enemy Unit)|Masked Grandmaster Cat]], the real change in his fight lies in his support. [[Croconator (Metal)|Croconators]], [[Miz Devil (Aku)|Miz Devils]] and [[Relic Doge (Relic)|Relic Doges]] can prove even worse than [[Heavenly Tower]] [[Heavenly Tower/Floor 40|Floor 40]]'s peons, and that is to say nothing of the [[Lowkey (Relic/Floating)|Lowkey]] that appears after 70 seconds. ==Strategy== :''See [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40]].'' ==Encounters== {{Collapsible}} ===[[Special Events|Event Stages]]=== *[[Infernal Tower]]: [[Infernal Tower/Floor 40|Floor 40]] (100%) ==Stats== {{EnemyCharacter Stats |Enemy = Spiritual Yulala |Health = 3,250,000 HP |Attack Power = 30,000 damage

(22f 0.73s backswing) |Ability = [[Special Abilities#Omni Strike|Omni Strike]] (Effective Range: -400~400)

100% chance to [[Special Abilities#Curse|curse]] Cat Units for 150f 5 seconds |Element = Relic }} ==Gallery== 616 e.png|Spiritual Yulala's spritesheet green yulala.gif|Spiritual Yulala's animations ==Trivia== *Spiritual Yulala and [[Masked Grandmaster Cat (Enemy Unit)|Masked Grandmaster Cat]] are currently the only [[:Category:Relic Enemies|Relics]] without Enemy Guide entries. ==Reference== *https://battlecats-db.com/enemy/618.html ----

wikiLink:
https://battle-cats.fandom.com/wiki/'''Cumulus Gallus''' (超翼獣ピヨルーツ, ''Chō Yokujū Piyorūtsu'', '''Super Winged Beast Piyoroot''') is a [[:Category:Traitless Enemies|Traitless]]/[[:Category:Behemoth Enemies|Behemoth]] variant of [[Chickful A (Angel)|Chickful A]] that appears in [[Special Events|Event Stages]]. {{Enemy Info |name = Cumulus Gallus |image = E 624.png |appearance = [[Empress' Excavation 3]] |money drop = 1,500¢ - 5,925¢ }} ==Enemy== This chick is another Traitless variant of Chickful A with 320 range. It now has more draconic wings and red eyes and attacks by causing a bolt of lightning to strike down onto its target. It is much less of a threat than Chickful A herself due to lowered range and lack of an ability, though it does gain strengthen to counteract this. ==Strategy== This dangerous chicken resides in even more dangerous levels. [[Nerd Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Cyberpunk Cat]] or [[Otaku Geek Cat (Super Rare Cat)|Hacker Geek Cat]] are unable to counter it due to its Slow and Weaken Immunity. However, it can still be Frozen using cats like [[Lone Cat and Kitten (Rare Cat)|Tourist Cat]] and [[Sweet Love Mekako (Uber Rare Cat)|Sweet Love Mekako]]. As for meatshields, [[Ancient Egg N001 (Special Cat)|Haniwa Cat]] is able to survive a Strengthened hit from this beast at a minimum of level 43, though fast meatshields such as [[Stone Cat (Rare Cat)|Stone Cat]] may be a better choice due to the [[Restriction Stage|Restrictions]] in its stages. [[Figure Skating Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Slapstick Cats]], [[Salon Cat (Rare Cat)|Cyborg Cat]], and [[Lifeguard Cats (Super Rare Cat)|Gelato Bro Cats]] are good choices for attackers, due to being able to outrange it. [[Ancient Egg: N101 (Rare Cat)|Courier Cat]] can be used, but it will usually die after just a hit or two. ==Dictionary== {{EnemyDescription |Enemy Unit Number = 624 |enemy category = Traitless/Behemoth |Enemy name = Cumulus Gallus |enemy_endesc1 = Ancestral bird cloaked in thunder that lives in

sight to behold, but hides a violent personality
that grows more fierce when cornered. |image1 = Enemy icon 624.png |Enemy name (JP) = 超翼獣ピヨルーツ (Chō Yokujū Piyorūtsu, Super Winged Beast Piyoroot) |enemy_jpscriptc1 = 天空の古塔で生息しているらしいヒナ鳥の祖
文献によると幻想的で美しい容姿とは裏腹に
気性が荒く異様な雷をまとっているという
弱っている時の危険度は計り知れないとか… |enemy_jpdesc1 = Ancestor of hatchlings from an ancient tower in the skies
